text: Love the new location...much more comfortable, and will be even more so when the summer heat gets here.  Tried the ribs and the chicken and both were awesome.  One star loss for the fries which were a little oily and limp, and the black beans which were a bit dry.  But the ribs and chicken were worth coming back for again and again.

I can't believe I use to walk by this place. I come to Vegas once a year for Interbike convention and stay nearby.  I am going back 2 nights in a row. Seriously, If you want something different away from the strip, something more authentic then your typical casino restaurant, try this place out.   Owner is very nice and will help you choose the right dish.
We were in Vegas for two days; we ate here twice. The food great, the service is efficient and accommodating. So glad we found it!

It was our family's first time having arepas and it was delicious!  Great value too!  The sauces were tasty as well.  My kids couldn't get enough of the fried plantains.  We will definitely be back next time we are in town.
A little more then just 1 $ but worth it. I'm getting lectured by the misses for putting a review and eating at the same time. Can't stop either of them. Try it you'll like it.

Sooooo good! This is definitely the place to go for delicious Arepas. I'm so happy that my friend insisted on going. I would have missed out for sure. My group ordered the Asada, chicken, and shrimp arepas. All were tasty. A must!

Don't let the neighborhood fool you.. This restaurant has never let me down. The staff is beyond friendly and accommodating! And the food is so fresh and always amazing. If you haven't been you need to go.

Favorite food in Vegas. Everytime I have a friend visit from out of town, or if my friends and I are deciding where to eat, this is our go to place. I haven't tried anything bad there yet. And so glad that they have many vegetarian options!

This was hands down the best dining experience I have ever had in LV. There aren't too many places where the owner takes your order, gives his recommendations and serves you your food. The food was delicious and very inexpensive. We were stuffed for just over $20 for two of us. I highly recommend this place you will not be disappointed.

Glad I found them on yelp..  The Arepas are  just spectacular. The place is clean and fresh.   Amazing customer service.  We just wanted to try everything.  Definitely going back when we visit Vegas this September.   I thought I could have left my wallet there and called them after about an hour we've left. Even though they didn't have found it and were busy he checked the camas for me. He told me every step I took and he hoped I found it.   I didn't left it there and found it hours later but since it was the last place we've been I had to make sure. But the service was amazing. =D

I've been to this place 3 times and it is amazing.  Super tasty street food that is priced right.  I've never had Venezualan food before, but on my third visit we talked to two venezualan guys who said that the food was very authentic.  We've tried the chicken and cheese, the pork butt and the garlic shrimp.  All of which were fresh and extremely flavorful.  The soursop juice is also quite tasty!  It's a great little local place, I'll definitely be back!
Delicious. Authentic arepas, they use "PAN" brand masarepa and the filling recipes are very much traditional Venezuelan style.
All sorts of awesome! The wood fire beef and chicken arepas are my favorites. Try the hot sauce, it's spicy without leaving your taste buds numb.

Omg! This place is delicious! Wood grilled chicken and ribs, mesquite wood to be exact. If you've never had bb cue smoked over mesquite coals, boy are you in for a treat!... you might actually ruin yourself for regular bbcue so be careful!  Very reasonably priced a half chicken with two sides is $9.99!  We came here yesterday after getting pedicures next door and we're back again today. Just a few short blocks down from the stratosphere... worth the drive from wherever you're staying in Vegas. The meat is lean and tasty! Venezuelan treat!
The Reina Pepiada and Shredded Beef A+++++++
Great fast food Venezuelan restaurant. It almost tastes like real Venezuelan food the way the make it in South America. I love the arepas and pabellon, the service it's fine.

Viva Las Arepas is an inexpensive Venezuelan fast food joint in the slump lord part of the strip behind the Stratosphere! Arepas r like a healthier version of a hamburger. I was glad I finally had the chance to experience this fine long standing famous LV establishment. Viva Las Vegas!
Que arepas tan deliciosas! Pura calidad y sabor. Me encanto este lugar. Tostones y empanadas ni se diga, con una rica agua de guanabana.
Every time I am in town will visit this restaurant. Second time and it was as good as the first. Arepas with chicken and guacamole is fantastic. Looking forward for my next visit
Very clean establishment, the staff is very polite and the food is delicious.  Highly recommend if you are in the area.

I think this was the best decision I made while in Vegas. No, I know it was.  PLEASE IF YOU ARE VISITING, LEAVE THE STRIP TO COME HERE. It is so worth it. So cheese, delicious, filling, and very affordable. I had the black bean and cheese and threw a fried egg on it. It was AMAZING.  Unlike many arepas I've had before, these held their form, not crumbling away once filled.

I'd never had arepas before, so this was an exciting new experience for me. I had the beans and cheese and the cold chicken in mayo and they were delicious! The service was great, extremely friendly.  As others have noted, this is a stand by the side of the road, so don't expect a fancy dining experience. Do expect some of the best food and certainly some of the most friendly service you've ever encountered though.  If/when I'm ever back in Las Vegas I'll be sure to return to Viva Las Arepas. This is by far the best value for your money in town.

This was my first time trying Arepas and they were great! The ambiance and the food were really good for this meat eater. My vegetarian wife did not fare as well. Although there were several options for her the food was just not that good.  The meat eater was very happy, the vegetarian not so much.
While outside appearances can be deceiving, the Carne Asada was quite good. Came across this location on a late Sunday evening. Was tender in some places, seasoned very well and had a hint of smoke.

The most perfect arepas I have ever eaten. Imagine: the wrapper bursting at the top with tender, gloriously seasoned meat, the crinkly paper made translucent and sticky by meat juices and oil... your mouth floods with saliva after taking that first bite. Each one is filling and delicious; I was full after one and a half, and for $5 a pop, that's a fantastic bargain for a fantastic dinner. If I could only go back again!   After eating here for dinner, I went back for breakfast: I didn't need to try any more restaurants in Vegas after finding this one.

This place is where you want to go if you love Arepas, tostones, and empanadas! Everything is cooked and seasoned perfectly! Loved everything we've tried so far! Would like to try everything on the menu. I definitely will be coming back again.

I'm in town on business and didn't want to deal with the crowds and smoke at the casino restaurants.  I found Viva Las Arepas nearby.... and it's now my "go to" place for the next 3 months while I'm here.  I live in SoCal... and I thought King Taco was good.  This place rocks!!!!  OUTSTANDING food, great location, easy to find, and it's off the main strip away from all the traffic.  I'll be back tomorrow and the next day...and the next...
Pricey but Hella delicious. You got to try these awesome food.  They are truly the bomb.

Totally overrated at five stars. Sorry people. It's only okay.  My cousin ate there a few nights ago and was totally wowed by it. He said it was amazing.   I, along with three other friends went there yesterday to check it out. Our togo order was totally f'd up and not in our favor. First of all the guy behind the counter said, don't worry, everything will be marked. Absolutely nothing was marked and we had to try and figure out what our orders were since they were all thrown together. Secondly, one of the sandwiches we ordered was missing...so we had to share what we had because it was too much of a pain in the ass to drive all the way back to make a stink.   On top of that, I personally thought that the food was a bit greasy. I didn't love it. My other three friends did like the food, but didn't really get enough to eat. Everyone was a bit disappointed. They're willing to try again and give them another chance. I will if I'm dragged along.  Overall, I would say there's a lot of unwarranted hype about this dirty little stand.

Went here today. Ordered one hot( bean and cheese w/avocado) and one cold( chicken, avocado, mayo and peas) both were pretty good.  Everything seemed clean and fresh.  Overall, I wasnt super impressed but what do you expect from a small kiosk.  Not bad if you need a quick bite to eat.
Amazeballs. Wouldn't expect such good food to come out this area of town. They have a nice little patio also

If there's one thing that makes me seriously consider moving back to Vegas, it's this place. Seriously. I'm obsessed. It's probably unhealthy how much I think about these arepas.  I found out about this place about a month before I moved out of Vegas and my one regret is not trying this place sooner. It's in a sketchy area, but it is SO GOOD. Everything is perfect. Every time I go home, I have to make a stop here and get way too many items and eat until I feel sick.  Sometimes, it can be a bit salty, but the arepa itself is pretty bland, so it's a good balance. Their yucca fries are heavenly, and so are their fried plantains. The wood-fire chicken is so smokey and tender, the pork was nice and juicy, the avocado sauce is perfectly creamy, ugh. So good. They give you two sauces; one's a spicier one and the other is a creamy cilantro I believe. I like to mix them and drown my arepas in them.   If you decide to go here, which I highly recommend and will be extremely envious about, be ready to waddle out the door. If you're anything like me, it'll be nearly impossible to choose one arepa to try and you'll end up getting 2 and an empanada (which is also delicious) and yucca fries. If you are able to have room for dessert afterwards (which I highly doubt), go next door to Art of Flavors. Another hidden gem that I'm obsessed with.

I had arepas from the food truck a couple weeks ago and I thought this place was the same as the truck, but I found out they are not one and the same. Either way, I was excited to try the food.  On a Sunday lunch, it was empty and we got our food pretty quickly. I thought the arepas were okay. The food tasted pretty good, but they were a bit soggy. I'd probably try this place again, but I will look for the food truck first.
I wish I could put 20 stars on this place best food las Vegas have.  The people that work there are the best too.  Thanks guys
I eat here once a week...best Venezuela restaurant in town!!!! I love eating their wood fire beef and I really love that they are not expensive

Went here for lunch and I got the shrimp arepa, mango drink, and a taco dessert with cheese (not sure what it's called). It's located downtown, in a not so safe area. Surprisingly, the place is quite popular, despite being in that area.   I'm not sure why they would run out of warm shrimps but the cashier told me... "Is it ok. We don't have any warm shrimps left?" I guess their arepas are premade or something.  Anyways, my order came with two spicy green sauce (not sure what it's called) and two cucumber sauces. The arepa, contrary to what I assumed, especially with the price, was quite small. It had a good amount of shrimp filling (but it was the smaller kind of shrimps). It was, however, really tasty. I just don't really understand why they couldn't make my food warm.   Anyhow... I'm giving it three stars because I think it was too expensive. The arepa was $7 and it wasn't filling at all.

Awesome place. Growing up in Miami, I took eating arepas for granted since they were all over with street vendors, in Costco, and some restaurants. Since moving to LA years ago, this was my first west coast experience while visiting Vegas and LOVED it. They're so much better than the plain cheese ones I used to get growing up. There's a lot of vegetarian flavor options and yummy side dishes to add. The staff was cracking up at my excitement seeing the menu and was really great helping my friends choose what to eat. I'm adding this place to my regular stops when I visit Vegas every few months. :)
The wood fired beef arepas are aaaamazing!! I can't eat gluten- these are gluten free little sandwiches. Nice staff too.

A great place to have lunch in Downtown.  Don't let the corner location deter you...it's really, really, ridiculously good food.  I love the #7 (Reina Pepiada), which combines avocado and cilantro, two of my favorite food ingredients.  The patty is always so soft and warm, the filling well-seasoned and plentiful.  My friend says the pork-butt is also delicious.    We usually get the food to go, but it looks like they are building an actual restaurant on the corner of Las Vegas Blvd and Wyoming or Oakley.  Otherwise, there's a table (or two) on the corner of Las Vegas Blvd, and a couple of stools at the counter.  It can feel a little random, but also provides a good forum for people watching.  (Like who is ordering food at the Chinese food/donut shop across the street?)  The arepas are cheap, and I only need to order one because they're big!  Also, if you have an order of $10 or less, there's a 0.50 cent charge to use a debit or credit card.

place is neat and clean. Arepas were good and the grilled chicken is got to be one of the best deals in town! not sure about the ribs...go to Lucilles for those. the drinks were amazing! i was told that they are opening a gelato place soon next door. About time for some good gelato place
So glad there is a west side location now! We've been loyal customers since they started outside Dino's
this place its trule a must have in las vegas  thanks you guys are always great
A must try!!! I sometimes just get a plain Arepa to munch on.

We've been in Vegas for a week and have driven by several times. We decided to stop in for breakfast and weren't disappointed. I had the wood fire chicken with egg and avocado added. He had the perico with cheese added. Both of our arepas were amazing!! It was fast, hot, and simply delicious. There were NO crumbs left over. It wasn't overly expensive either. I'm all for trying new foods that are affordable. Our two arepas plus two coffees was just under $20. I wish we had stopped sooner in our trip so we could've gone again.

I didn't like the corn bread (arepa), which is served with all sandwiches (I found later). We ordered 3 arepas: Reina Pepiada (chicken, avocado, mayo, cilantro), Garlic Shrimp, and Wood-fired Beef. Shrimp was bad, beef was a-ok. I only liked Reina Pepiada (which also happens to be their most popular item), but would have been better with a different bread. We also had fried plantain, which came SOAKED in oil. I've had it before elsewhere, it should not be.  Kudos to the cleanliness and the prices! Just not my cup-a-tea taste-wise.

VIva Las Arepas is super tasty! I was in heaven when I first tried their signature arepa. It's a little greasy, but that's to be expected. if you haven't tried the Venezualan soda, Frescolita, I highly recommend it - tastes like bubblegum. And it's the only place in Vegas you can find it. Buen provecho!
excellent food!!!!!  So fresh and so delicious!!!  I am hooked and am now a regular!

This place is very authentic! I feel in love with the sandwiches. The employees are also great, they offer you excellent guidance. It's also a great way to fill the whole family on great quality food for cheap

I have been here twice. The food is good. I recommend the grilled meats over the arepas. The grilled meats come with two sides and are a far better deal for the money. The black bean side is very flavorful and good. The grilled meat has a nice bite and good flavor. The salad is just okay and mostly iceberg lettuce. It is worth a stop in for a quick lunch if you are near downtown.

Oh. My. God.   I ordered the vegetarian arepas.  So fricken good! The "bread" was amazing! So much flavor and awesome texture.  Avocado, fresh. Black beans, flavorful and cannot be straight from a can!   The two sauces they give you...USE IT!   Every time I go to Vegas this will my FIRST stop.  Screw the buffets and everything else.  This is the place to be!

Best arepas I have ever tasted. Went with the pulled pork and cheese and the beef and cheese. It was incredible. Very juicy meats and moist, tasty, corn cakes that had the essential griddle crunch on the outside. 4.50 or so per arepa-- take advantage of it. Cachapas were also very flavorful and slightly sweet.
Nice little place girth of the strip. If u go there ask them to deep fry ur order... Wow!

This was my first experience being in and eating out in Vegas and I want to go back just to have one more arepa. They were absolutely amazing and I can't wait to visit Vegas again just to have one of these. The staff was also ridiculously nice. They were super patient with us tourists considering it took us forever to even make a decision on what to eat. I have to say best service I've ever gotten at a food truck/kiosk.
First time eating arepa. It was absolutely amazing. I had the number 7. Reina with plantains on the side. Really really good!

We just rolled into Vegas starving. If you've never had an arepa, you've got to try one here, with plantains inside it, or on the side. It is delicious!  And you don't have to wait in line. Open till midnight. Off the Strip

I was with a large group so we tried a lot of different things. There was not a single thing that was not good!  I read all of the reviews before going into the restaurant and I knew it looked good; however I was thinking it might be good food, but on the greasy side. Let me tell you, it was not at all! Everything was so flavorful and the nice guy that took our order was able to recommend some of the top meals. Thank you!

Wow the arepas were good at this place. Flavorful & freshly prepared, these were just fantastic. At the cashier's suggestion, I got the Pabellon (Shredded beef, black beans, plantain, & cheese). Just fantastic, and the spicy green tomatillo sauce adds to it even more.   Also at the cashier's suggestion, I got the Soursop to drink. It is mildly sweet and not sour at all.  Overall fantastic food & great service. I will be back.
Great food. I love the Arepas, they are all good. Go get some. Now. Seriously right now go eat! You'll love them.
Kinda in a scary part of town but let me tell you take the risk! Some of the best food in Las Vegas.

I came here for lunch with the fiance. First time having Venezuelan food or Arepas.   The food was excellent! I got a wood-fired beef Arepa with cheese and avocado. I ordered avocado, but the cashier must not of heard me. When I got my order I noticed there wasn't avocado. I went up to the cashier and he let me know he didn't charge me for it. I was content with not having it, but he insisted he correct it no charge. They promptly fixed it and brought it to my table.   I also got the home-cut fries and the sugar cane with lime drink. The fries were seasoned well and cooked great. The drink was good, a different taste, but still good.  My fiance got the wood-fired chicken Arepa and it was equally as good. She tried the mango juice drink they have and it was amazing! Definitely wished I got that over the sugar cane.   All-in-all, definitely would like to go back and try other options. Excellent food and great service.

We visited Viva las Arepas on our recent trip to Vegas. I'm very familiar with Venezuelan food, my husband is Venezuelan so I have tried Venezuelan food  on my trips to Venezuela over the years , and learned to cook Venezuelan food myself. This place is pretty authentic in terms of the food they serve, staff is very friendly and the place was packed when we visited.We tried arepas with carne mechada, ham and cheese, tequeños and empanadas, also passion fruit juice. My favorite was the tequeños,fried cheese surrounded by crispy dough. The arepas are good, generous in the fillings,  but unfortunately, I was dissapointed  with the carne mechada, it was lacking that authentic flavor I'm used to, to me it was lacking in flavor, maybe  it needs some more cumin, garlic, and red peppers and onions, it didn't have any visible strips of onions and peppers that is traditional in venezuelan carne mechada. Also the cheese in the arepas looked like mozzarella, not the traditional queso fresco. Overall, I think this place is good and I would go back to try some of the other things they offer.

From New Jersey visiting Las Vegas and our friend whom lives locally took us to Viva Las Arepas.....unbelievable authentic arepas and empanadas!!!! #12 Pabellon Arepa AMAZINGGGGGG!!!! Mix grill is excellent, smoked flavor is out of his world. If wanting to eat something and willing to get off of the strip well worth it!! Keep up the authentic flavors...DELICIOSO

Wow.  If you can get here and you're from out of town, GO!  If you're from Vegas and haven't been here, why not?  Wood fired chicken...check.  Fresh ingredients...check.  Local & not a chain...check.  Great service...check.
The absolutely tastiest food I've ever had! Everything they serve here is incredible! I will bring all my friends n family here. 5 star service and food :)
Hella good food. It gets crowded and it's a small joint but for the cost and quality ratio... It's a good choice!

Excellent Latin American food, great variety for all tastes, the steak over the mesquite wood is unique and Flavorfull,  Toni and his crew are pleasant and diligent, clean and family friendly place with authentic Venezuelan Flavor, we will be back for sure!

Gluten Free Goodness!! They make their arepas and empanadas with corn four and they are so good. I had the roasted pork butt and I highly recommend it. I also tried the reina pepiada, and vegetarian arepas. They were also good. I love their sauces.   The place was clean and the staff was friendly.

I came for lunch today with my little brother SUPER excited that they finally opened a location near us! I used to get some stuff from them when they parked outside of Tenaya Creek a couple years back and haven't eaten there since because of the distance to the downtown location.   We showed up and were starving so I got two arepas (ham and cheese and shredded beef + cheese) and a cheese empanada (I remember this from the food truck). My brother got himself a beef arepa with plantains, cheese, and beans. Everything was amazing! Super fresh and the accompanying salsa and cilantro mayo they give you took it to a whole different level. Yummmm. Needless to say, I could only eat half of each arepa and split the empanada with my brother so he could taste the amazing-ness. I still have leftovers in the fridge and I cannot wait to eat them. Most importantly, the service was incredible. So nice and attentive. I appreciate that very much. Can't wait to come back!

I like a good walk for comfort food. This place came up high on the list when I Yelped "best cheap eats".  3 mile walk from my hotel?  Hey, I needed the exercise.   The place is clean and spacious. Kinda Chipotlesque with the stainless steel countertops and serving trays.   The menu is clear and simple to navigate. Plenty of very tasty sounding items. I ordered a wood fired chicken arepas and a beef/black bean/plantain/cheese arepas.  And a cup of water.   The friendly folks called my name when it was ready. They serve it up with two squeeze bottles of their special sauces. One mostly white (garlic) and one kinda orangish (spicy).  As served, the arepas are not terribly big looking, but they are well-wrapped in paper and, as I would soon find out, surprisingly filling.    First thing I noticed--the damn things are HOT.  As in temperature. Not only could I not take a bite out of them--I couldn't even hold them. So...I let them cool a bit.   Finally (recall I just walked three miles to get there) I took my first bite. The corn masa (or whatever they make the arepas out of) was tender and moist. The chicken was shredded and juicy. The beef/bean/plantain/cheese was just the same--both really good. I loved the white sauce on both of them. This Venezuelan food reminds me a little of Cuban food--which I love.   A few quibbles... - no fountain sodas. And they charged me for WATER.  I get Las Vegas is running desperately low on the stuff, but most restaurants aren't that stingy. - no forks.  The arepas are messy after about three bites.  - kinda not cheap. Both my arepas and my water were $12 and change. That's not exactly "cheap eats" in my book.   That being said, I enjoyed the food and look forward to going back again. Even if I have to walk three miles. I appreciate the exercise.

Having lunch here with my family and in-laws. Reasonable prices and tasty food. Love the arepas and the pabellon plate. The mixed grilled platter is also one of my favorites because of the mesquite flavor from the grill.

This was simply outstanding!  I don't think either of us have ever had Venezualan food, but this was incredible despite our lack of knowledge of the cuisine.  The actual owner of the restaurant took the order.  This is a very small operation with great service!  This is my first time writing a review, but this place is a hidden gem and needs the review!
First time eating Arepas and it was very good. I go to Vegas every year and I finally was able to make the trek down there.  Awsome.

The food is a weak attempt at recreating authentic Venezuelan food . The Empanadas and Tequños are badly made and the Arepas aren't much better. The staff is also quite rude to each other which doesn't help the atmosphere of the place. Absolutely would not recommend, even out of curiosity.  El sabor de la comida no es bueno !

The food was okay. The cachapas were good. Never really had arepas before but it wasn't all that great. My arepas came with black beans, but it was so packed with canned black beans as if they were trying to get rid of whatever extra they had. Great customer service though!

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!  FOOD/QUALITY: The food is amazing here! Although the may be famous for their Arepas, try the Cachapa con Queso! It only comes with cheese but you can ask to add beef, steak, chicken, or shrimp. TRY IT!   SERVICE: Very fast. The owner is extremely friendly.

Amo este lugar! Venezolano que se respete extraña las arepas, las empanadas y el jugo de parchita, y aquí tienen todo eso y más. Siempre lo recomiendo a todo el mundo. Gracias por existir en Las Vegas! :)

This place is definitely worth visiting!!!! The food is  amazing!!  We ordered the reina pepiada, arepa with cheese, and cachapa.  We also enjoyed the soursop drink and malta!!! You have to try the green and white sauce it is delicious. We are so glad we visited for lunch!!!

The food is fresh, filling, and delicious. This is my second stop and I had the #1 and #7. Great recommendations from the owner. I also had the pineapple and mango mix. For dessert, I loved the pastelitos of guava and cheese. I recommend it.

Get out of your hotel and try this gem for home-cooked, filling, and often gluten-free Latino food. Ride the monorail to the north end, take a taxi one mile north and you are there! Feed a crowd for cheap. Held back in the fifth star cuz we didn't eat the meats from the grill...yet!!

Outstanding. Delicious. Amazeballs. The arepas are all gluten free! We enjoyed the pulled chicken the best, but the wood fired beef arepa was awesome too. The fried plantains were so tasty too. Yum yum. Highly recommend.

Great Venezuelan fast food - one arepa is not enough two is too much. Chicken and beef arepas are awesome but need added avocado (1,50) and cheese (.50). I like this place but it lacks some typical American main stays like fountain drinks and variety - but who cares!?

Growing up one of my good friends parents' were from Venezuela and his mom used to make us arepas. It had been many years since I had had one of these great meals because I didn't know where to find them, so when I discovered this place I was elated. I usually get the chicken as well as the bean, add avocado, you wont be disappointed!

Even being someone that is not familiar with Venezuelan food, I have always been amazed by Viva Las Arepas. The price is amazing and the food is exotic. The location is probably the best part about this place too being very central to Vegas but not flooding and after you eat you cannot pass up Art of Flavors next door.
Truly amazing stuff!! Had the shredded beef and the yucca fries. This place is a must-go-to whenever I'll be visiting Vegas from now on!

After passing by this place a couple times, I've asked my co-workers if they've been here, and said it was nothing really special. Then I've checked yelp, with all the positive reviews I saw, I was sure my co-workers were wrong.   I decided to stop by the place 20 mins before closing, tried the chicken & the beef, I really wanted the empanadas, but they said the fryer was down, but i doubt that, seems like they wanted to get a head start on closing. Got the chicken & beef arepas. It was a small portion, but really stuffed with the meat, seems a bit overpriced for $3.50  I only ate half of each, it did have flavor, but it felt rather bland, it tasted like a mix of a packet of taco seasoning with some enchilada sauce.   After all the rave reviews here, I am quite dissatisfied with the food and the service, and the co-workers were definitely right about this place. I have to agree with the previous yelper review, place is totally over rated!

I was born and raised in Caracas, Venezuela. I have lived in the states for over 20 years now and grew up eating Venezuelan Foods every day. Its been a few years since I have been able to go to Venezuela So when I hear of a Venezuelan Restaurant I always jump at the opportunity to try it.   I went to Vegas to visit my best friend who lives there and she took me here. I cried when I saw the Frescolita on the menu... no joke.... tears in my eyes... I LOVE Frescolita! I grew up on that!!   Their Arepas are great, their Pabellon was also great! Their Platanos are AMAZING and of course..... Frescolita. The only thing missing is the Candy - Pingpong, Pirullin, Ovolmantina.   The Cachapa was amazing! So good!! I wish they had Cachitos- but you cant win them all!   Really Truly Great Venezuelan food- From a Venezuelan......  Quick mention too: GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE. Read a couple of reviews on here about bad customer service. People can be WAY to picky! They say hello, they take your order, they bring it to you and they thank you. What more do you need? Didnt realize people needed their hand held to order food....
We stopped in Las Vegas specifically looking for this place.  I was very pleased with my arepa! Prices aren't low, but the quality of the meal we ate spoke for them.  Would def recommend :)
Excellent service and authentic Venezuelan food. I had pabellón arepa and an empanada , both delicious. There's parking as well A must when visiting vegas !

Excellent food and friendly staff. My first experience eating arepas. Had the pork butt with tomatoes and cheese. Mmmmm....and don't forget to try a guava and cheese fried thingy (can't remember the exact name) but boy was it good.

Great service, our first time here, the guy at the counter was super helpful, gave us some suggestions! I had the the #7 chicken, avocado sauce! It was very tasty, the bread is a white corn meal type, the meat was all white meat and very tasty! My buddy had the beef, it looked great and he said it was definitely something he would get again! The place was busy, clean and comfortable! We shared the deep fried pork and yucca root fries, not bad especially with the spicey jalapeño sauce! We will be back!

Great food! We had several empanadas, the reina pepiada arepas, and friend plantains. Delicious! Totally hit the spot and some great real fruit drinks to wash it down. The whole sugar cane with lime was the bomb. Awesome joint near the OG....
Great food, wonderful friendly staff, and price are reasonable. Amazing place gor locals and visitors alike with a easy downtown access.

Been coming here for years! No matter what I order, I'm always satisfied. A must for me is their fried platains, all time favorite! Also their agua frescas are amazing. Good way to cool off in this summer heat!!
If you've never had Arepas this is the place to go! Staff was informative about everything on the menu and even suggested the best side to order. Great food, definitely didn't disappoint.

I finally made it here and I'm glad I did! Considering that it looks like a small place from the outside, it's pretty open with plenty of seating, inside and out, and pretty clean. Service was fast, the food came even faster, we ordered a little of everything, and it was all excellent, but what stood out for me the most were the empanadas, pipping hot and a nice variety of fillings. I definitely will be back to try more items! Thumbs up!!! I give you a perfect 10!
So glad I found this place on yelp!! The food is amazing and different than what any nearby restaurants offer. The best part is it's CHEAP
I stayed in vegas for 4 nights and this was the best food I ate in my entire trip. I had dined in Aria, Bellagio and Monte Carlo and nothing came close. Keep it up!

Had to stop in after seeing the Woof Fired Grill sign out front.  Had the half chicken with rice and beans.  Fantastic meal.  Chicken was cooked perectly and the smoke flavoring was something new for me.  Ate the entore serving of chicken.  The rice and beans reminded me Cuban black beans and rice.  Arepas rice included some veggies, I belive fava beans and green bean, nice addition.

I have been to Las Vegas Blvd Location a few times but i find out the Rainbow Location  I love Arepas the Reina Pepiada and my Huband loves the carne azada Arepa and the shredded beef empanadas   The service was great and the guy behind the counter was extremely nice will definitely be  returning
Felicitaciones. Disfrute cada pedacito de mi Venezuela y una helada frescolita. Les recomiendo absolutamente todo

One of my number one spots to eat in vegas...viva las arepas never let u down.  Woodfire is the best has such a smoky delicious flavor and the sauces they have available on the side compliment the sandwiches so nicely.  Will definitely be a go to spot for me and my friends for a long time!
My first time there ... Really good , portions are filling and delicious !!! It feels authentic .

This place hardly needs another review, however, I just spent 4 days in Las Vegas eating at pretentious, overpriced restaurants on the strip. Right before heading for the airport we caught a quick lunch at this place and I have to say . . . It was the most delicious meal I had in Las Vegas!
This place has quickly become one of our neighborhood favorites. Great food, courteous staff, and the restaurant is clean and modern.

What can I say about Viva Las Arepas? One word: AMAZING!   The food is fresh and delicious. I have never ordered anything here that has not made my taste buds dance. I've been here about 10 times since they opened. Felix(the owner) is personable and friendly. Everything on the menu is below 5.00. One arepa will fill you up. But I will warn once you go here you'll keep coming back.

My husband and I try to eat here as often as possible. We also invite all of our unadventurous non-foodie friends to try this place and make them believers in Venezuelan cuisine!  We usually order way too much food because it's so good and we stuff ourselves to eat it all. A half grilled chicken with black beans and rice, an arepa pepiada, yuca fries, empenadas and pasteles... seriously, anything you order will satisfy your hunger.   Go before lunch and beat the rush! Customer service is always on point. Everyone that works there is so friendly and willing to explain the menu.

I had the pork butt and the black bean and cheese arepas, my wife had the shredded beef. Pork butt: Thee best of the bunch, salty in a  good way. Shredded beef: Very good flavor, sauce and juicy. Black bean and cheese: Not good at all, beans were all right but the type of sliced cheese they use did not complement the bean consistency. Agua de Mango: So delicious.  I will return because I want another pork butt arepa and to try the rest.

If you're coming to Vegas, make a special point of seeking this place out. It is in an old neighborhood by the Stratosphere so make the detour to the spot the locals love. The food is exceptional! I had the pork ribs and my wife had empanadas and arepnas. The rub they used was a bit saltier than I'd use but the meat was so tender you could suck it off the bone. Excellent! We finished off with pastelitos for desert. Best food value we've had in Vegas.

Gone twice now to both locations now and all I can say is wow. I love the food. The Pabellon is a must. Meat sweet plantains black beans all good stuff. Order a side of the yuka fries and pork rinds. Make sure to grab the bottle green sauce and hot sauce they have behind the counter.
More food than you can eat.  The ribs are melt in your mouth and tasty.  The bottled sauces bring a welcome new flavor.  I will be back with friends.

This place is so amazing!!! I cannot describe there food amazing staff and food. I got there at least once a month I've brought man family members I would recommend this place to anyone :) trust me I was scared to try it at first as well but now it's like a addiction I cannot wait they are opening a closer location to me!!!

My newest addiction! Arepas are so good. It's like a taco but instead of a flour or corn tortilla it's a better pita like shell. I recommend the carne asada but there chicken is good as well, I'm sure the others are too, but not tried them all yet..lol. If I could afford it, I'd eat it everyday..haha. I also like there chicharron and fritas, but not all will like if you are unfamiliar. Oh I also like there fried plantains, done right!

This place is amazing. Everything I've tried so far has been delicious and my kids love the chicken empenadas and their tasty fries. Pernil Arepas is what I would suggest...that's gotta be my favorite. Also the owners and staff take pride in their work and it shows. Friendly service and good food :)
Mix both sauces together. Pernil arepas. Passion fruit drinks. Chicken empenadas. Do it.

Went to this place for a quick lunch on my way out of Vegas. The plaza isn't very inviting. But the place is clean and bright inside, which was encouraging.  I stepped up to the counter and the cashier spent a full 3 seconds staring at my boobs before asking for my order.   MINUS ONE STAR  We ordered one beef and one shredded chicken arepa. The beef one was more flavorful, tasted like sloppy joes almost. The chicken was a little bit dry but that special green sauce fixed that. We also ordered one beef and one chicken empanada. The empanadas felt too doughy and barely had any meat. They were like plain, less meaty versions of the arepas.   Fried plaintains were good though. Oily, hot and satisfying. Also had their sugar cane juice with lime. I didn't like that at all.  Minus another star for skimpy meat filled empanadas and the sour drink.
Best arenas I've ever had. Highly recommend coming here. One of my favorite place in Vegas to go. If your a local or a visitor this is one place to come check out.
This was my first time at the restaurant, I had their food few years ago from the food truck.  It was really good I will definitely go back to try different things from the menu.

Fantastic little place for a taste of Venezuela! I had been a frequent flyer at their stand just down the street and love what they have done with the new restaurant. The menu has expanded but includes all of the old favorites. Definitely try the Arepas with wood fired beef as well as the roasted pork butt. Chicken is also a good standby. My wife is a fan of the bean and cheese empanadas. You can't go wrong ordering anything from their menu. The servings are a good size with plenty of meat, but the star of the show is the Arepa shell. Made from cornmeal, the shell is cooked crisp and cut open for stuffing. They are crunchy on the outside and very tender on the inside. Delish! All items are served with a cilantro sauce and a spicy sauce for those who like a little heat.
It was my first time trying Venezuelan food and it was amazeballz. The chicken arepas are so delish and filling. I give this place 5 totes yummers!

We visited Viva Las Arepas for the 2nd time ever and it was just as good as the first. I tried the carne asada arepa, hubby had frijoles con queso, and my mom had the pollo. My mother is one of the pickiest eaters I've ever met and she loved it! She actually said she loved the arepas more than a gordita or a pupusa, which is saying a lot. I like the pollo arepa more than the asada, but I am not much of a beef eater to begin with.  The meat has a smokey taste, great seasoning, and the arepa masa is amazing. I also tried the passionfruit juice which was delicious! The next time you are in Vegas, this place is a must! You will not be disappointed.

So, I'm a guy who will always recommend the pork or the beef. Never the chicken.  Here, though, you should get the chicken. Empanadas, specifically. So you know the chicken is for real. Wood-fired and smoky. It's really, really good.  This is on my best-of-Vegas list. Amazingly flavorful little Venezuelan sandwiches, super friendly guys working, they let you bring beer from White Cross market across the street, and occasionally you get weird stuff happening: last time a woman was loitering outside and ended up flashing us all for no apparent reason. No one wanted to see that, but it's a good story.  Super cheap, super delicious. Highly recommend.

Read some good things online about this little place and it certainly is very authentic stuff! Great food, good prices, solid service. Not the greatest location and off the Strip close to the Stratosphere, but that's part of the charm.   We tried the standard beef and chicken arepas with a side of plantains. Definitely hit the spot! Make the trek north of the main casinos, and enjoy delicious, fresh, made-to-order, authentic South American food - you will be glad you did. And if you're into that sort of thing, drive just a little farther north and visit the Pawn Shop from the TV show "Pawn Stars," and on your way back to the Strip hit up the Bonanza Gift Shop, which touts itself as the world's largest gift shop.

We were meeting some friends at the Stratosphere and decided to stop by here since it was literally across the street.  The parking lot was tiny and somewhere you don't want to be walking around alone in at night, but the small sit down restaurant was simple and clean. We ordered the grilled chicken arepas and black bean and cheese empanadas.  The food took almost 20 minutes to come out and it wasn't that busy around 5:30 pm on a Friday evening. The arepas look kind of small, but they were much bigger and stuffed so we really didn't need the empanadas!  The cornmeal breading was so yummy and the grilled chicken, lettuce, tomato and cheese was really good. They served their hot sauce and another sauce with cilantro/mayo on the side which were good complements but not necessary with the arepas.  The empanadas were greasy and only half filled on the inside, but tasty.  Didn't have any room for the guava/cheese pastelito, but would love to try it next time!
I've been here twice and it's quickly become one of my favorite spots in Vegas. Very clean, friendly staff, and amazing food. The meat has a delicious smokey flavor and the Arepas are tremendous.
Food was delicious! We had the carne asada arepas and it was so filling. The green sauce is also very good. It adds a little kick to the carne asada. Can't wait to go there for lunch again!

This is the place you would walk in hungry expecting something exotic and you won't be disappointed when you walk out.. you walk out with a great experience and a mouthful of great flavor. Not only is the food of great quality the service is equivalent. The guy across the counter took the time to explain what Arepas actually are and how they are made. Extremely humble and courteous person. I would certainly come back...

Ordered vegetarian arepas, black bean and cheese empanada  We also got beef arepas and 3 piece chicken    Arepa was really good so was the black bean empanada   I wish they had a red sauce  They had a creamy cilantro sauce and a green sauce.   Chicken was good and so was the beef arepas.    All that with a can of sprite came to about $25

We stopped for a quick bite before a meeting nearby. I had been meaning to try this place for a couple of years. Am sorry I waited so long!  I had the shredded pork arepa and it was totally awesome,  juicy and very tasty. My friend had the wood fired beef and and she enjoyed that. Definitely plan on going back.

We order one each of the house-recommended arepas.  While some of the combinations were a little exotic for my kids, I found everything to be delicious.  Definitely a must for those who want to try something a little unusual.  There were a number of other things on the menu that I would have like to have tried.  The service was very friendly.  Definitely in a seedier area of downtown, so we parked where we could see the car.  A great value for great and unusual food.

Delicious arepas! Great find! Highly recommend the steak arepas and the bean and cheese. The price is very affordable. The service is excellent. The restaurant is clean. I will definitely be coming back to try other arepas here while I'm in Vegas.

I just have a few words about this business, "GREAT SERVICE, AWESOME FOOD, CLEAN ESTABLISHMENT." This all I have to say about this place. If you don't believe, then go see for yourself. Oh, I should tell you the food was freshly made with a neat oven. The food that I had was freshly smoked and just amazing!

So thankful for the bloggers and helpers that suggested this glorious establishment. I had a vegetarian arepa, with cheese, no tomato, and enjoyed every savory bite. I am already mentally planning my next visit or two before I leave town in a few days. The staff were also very friendly and the place super clean.

This place is a real GEM!  Super authentic Venezuelan/Colombian arepas and empanadas.   Very reasonable priced.    I had lunch AND dinner there yesterday.  I will be returning now very time I'm in town.   WE NEED VIVA LAS AREPAS IN LOS ANGELES, PLEASE!!

Good food, wonderful customer service!  The food is delicious. The roasted pork butt, the plantains & the green sauce... delicious! The food is also really filling so one arepa will probably fill you up. Arepas range from $4-$7. Oh and their guava drink! Sooo good.   It's just a few minutes off the main strip between the strip & downtown. The parking lot is a bit small, but luckily when we went, there were available parking spots. It's a little hard to find and the lot is really small, but just look for the big orange AREPAS sign. If you're tired of the buffets, give this a try! It's definitely worth it!

Awesome !!  I had the vegetarian option and then added beef on top :-)  I also had the lime cane sugar drink.    It was Delicious!!  with the salsa and all those veggies on it...  the little arepas must have weighed well over a pound.  good food with everything arepas, drink, tip it was about $10 well worth it I was full and satisfied !1 I have to go back and try more things..FOR SURE!

I love this place. The guy that takes the orders is always nice, pleasant, professional. Excellent customer service.  The arepas are tasty. The beef and chicken got this wood grilled smoky taste. So good. I also ordered the grilled chicken thighs. Once again, the smoky flavor is amazing. Add the pesto sauce and I'm in heaven. To top it off, the Cachapas is to die for. Corn bread with cheese. Oh my goodness. Glutinous.  Finally, the prices were definitely on the low side for a shop located on the blvd and down the street from the Strat. I think for the four of us we spent under $40 and we were very satisfied.  Great place Viva Las Arepas.

Awesome! Very friendly and helpful staff. Food was superb! We tried a few of the suggestions from the owner including the yuca fries. Everything was excellent. The fruit drinks were very good as well.

Must come back here again.  Arepas, yuka fries, fried pork, cheese sticks - ALL FRESH. really good!! Best Venezuelan food ever ate so far. SourSap Juice - was ehhh. skip.  Will definitely drop by every time I visit Vegas again!
I'm from Venezuela and is a good place your arepas are very good but definitely aren't Venezuelan traditional arepas, are different but still been good.!!
im venezuelan and this is the best arepas i have ever try in my life!! highly recomend it

I have been reading about this place for quite some time. I've been wanting to drop by, but it's in a part of town I almost never find myself in. So last Thursday I got off work a little early and I asked the wife if she would like to try the place out.  Now let me preface what I am about to say by letting you know that I used to live in Venezuela, birth place of the wonderful arepa. I ate arepas every single day I lived there. Breakfast, lunch, dinner. Mid-afternoon snack. I've had them cooked on a griddle(traditional), deep-fried, and baked. And I loved them all. I cannot ever remember getting one I didn't like. My favorites order was "Dos arepas de pollo y un pepsi (pronounced peksi down there)" from La Areparia Diecinueve De Abril in Cumana. I'd stop there at least once a day.  That said, it was to my ginormous disappointment that last Thursday I had my first bad arepa.  Sorry folks, a  precooked arepa that's been sitting in a heating tray only to be tossed on the griddle at the last minute to be reheated is bad from the word go. Add to that mushy, bland pollo mechada(shredded chicken), and things don't get much better. The carne mechada (shredded beef) wasn't much better, or should I say not as bad. The jugo de parchita was watered down to the point of being almost indiscernible as passion fruit juice.  I promise, I really had high hopes for this place. Being the only Venezuelan restaurant in Las Vegas I was excited to try it. But as much as it pains me to say, Viva Las Arepas, I know arepas, and you are no arepa.

This was my first shot at Venezuelan cuisine and I loved it. We ordered Reina Pepiada, chicken empanadas, fried bananas and Guava Pastelitos (this one is sweet like a dessert). The Arepas looked small but  were quite filling for me. We enjoyed all items we ordered except fried bananas (they were very oily and mushy different from what I was expecting).  The service was also good. The person taking our order explained what the dishes were so we could make an informed order. If you are into trying different cuisines this one is definitely worth trying :D

This place is amazing. The staff is super friendly. I've read some reviews that it's located in a super sketchy place. It's not  it's right next to the stratosphere. It's really nice and calm. But the food is just out of this world. I got a number 1 and 2. The beef and chicken, a order of fries and a mango water. Trust me the arepas look small but they are packed. I got full with one, the mango water is a agua fresca made with fresh mangos. This is a must. Will be going back real soon with my family.

Chicarron & Yuca Frita (4 stars); Usually were good but the chicarron tasted different (in a bad way) the last time he had it, hopefully it's just a fluke. The yuca frita (fried yucca root) is the star though.   Mixed grill (4 stars);  Huge portion, need 3 persons to finish it. Taste good, especially the sausage. Looove the sausage.  Arepas - pork butt and garlic shrimp (5 stars); You can have the garlic shrimp served cold or hot. I've tried both but personally like hot better.   Place is clean, so is the restroom. Staff are always nice and polite.

We went to this place because of the high review.  Ordered the pork butt Arepas and the Shrimp garlic Arepas. Also some plantains.  Also one of those lemonade drink.  I have to say the pork butt one is better. Shrimp garlic one is actually served cold. I was quite surprised. Food is a bit on the salty side. Again, I don't think the food is excellent.  Plantains are good. Lemonade, however, is not that great.  Another thing to keep in mind is that this is in the ghetto neighborhood of Vegas.  We went there for lunch and felt a bit off when we got there.  And we had to leave quickly after some weirdo came into the restaurant, sat across my wife and kept on staring at her.

The food is good.  First time here and was invited by a friend and I like it.  The beef or chicken empanadas are amazing.  The Cachapa was out of this world.  Great win and great find.  The reason I gave it a four stars refers to the drink selection.  Authentic food but no so much with the drinks. Water downed and not very good for my taste.

Most amazing Venezuelan food I've had in a really long time. i am Venezuelan and highly recommend this place. I would go back to Vegas just for their empanadas. Visited and had arepa de pabellon, empanadas and tequenos. Everything was amazing!!

First time there and the cashier was extremely helpful and attentive. He knew I was lost so he took the time to ask a few questions and then make suggestions. The portion if the arepas may be deceiving though. They come small but they pack a heavy punch. 1 will fill you, 2 Will stuff you.   I must suggest the plantains! They were cooked perfectly with just the right amount if sweetness.   One con would be the parking. I would suggest parking in the back of the building if you are not alone.

This was my very first arepa and it was delicious! Fast, friendly service, convenient parking, and inexpensive, but delicious food. I tried the carne asada this time and took the cashier's advice and added avocado; good recommendation! I'll definitely be back!

Delicious food. I had a chicken empanada and  reina peplada arepa also Try the French fries with the green and aji sauce and some pepper. Pleasant place. Inside is clean and enjoyable. Awesome customer service! Can't wait to go back again

I've been meaning to check this place out for a long time, so glad my husband and I finally made it there!   First off, the staff is great and the cashier was very helpful. I had the wood fired chicken #2 (arepa) and it was very good. My husband had the beef with plantains #12, and he was in heaven.   From living in the Caribbean I'm obsessed with fried plantains and these didn't disappoint. I will go pick up $3 plantains any day!   We also had fried yuca, but I didn't love it. Yuca has never been a favorite though.   Each arepa is around $5... Totally worth the price.   4 stars because of the location and we has to park across at the pharmacy, but We will definitely be back when we head downtown.
Best grilled chicken in town and their black beans are soooo good.  I recommend the pork butt and shrimp arepas!

The cashier was very friendly. She asked me if it was my first time and recommended me the most popular options. There was no disappointment there. I love the chicken in an avocado cilantro sauce. So delicious and the greem sauce was perfectly spicy!!! She also recommended I try the parchita drink. Soooooo good and refreshing!!!! The arepas are also made to order
Always good. One of my favorite places to eat. Reina Pepiada Arepas = chicken salad style....highly recommend.

This place is. So. Good. Go there.   My husband and I went downtown for date night and stopped in here to get dinner. I had the arepa with avacado on it and the plantains and he had the pork arepa. All of it was perfect. I usually don't eat bread, but made an exception after reading reviews of this place and I'm glad that I did. The cornbread rolls they make the sandwiches with are so delicious. The ingredients tasted so fresh and the service was super friendly; now my husband mentions this place every date night.

I wanted to really love this place. Saw the good reviews. Went there for lunch and had to wait over 45 mins. Owner kept saying a couple workers called in sick. Got our food and it was ok. I couldn't taste any seasonings. We had the Reina Pepiada and Pabellon.  May try this place again
Amazing food and service. Food delivered in a timely manner. Very clean place. I recommend the Arepa de Pollo.

I've been hearing raving reviews of this place for a long time now and finally had the chance to try it out last weekend. I've never had Venezuelan food or arepas before, and I am now a big fan!  My friend and I tried the fire wood beef, shredded chicken, and pork butt arepas, and they were all delicious. My favorite is the fire wood beef one, the beef was super tender and flavorful! Make sure you try them with the two sauces (not sure what they are called), the creamy green one is very good! And definitely try the fried plantains, I love the little bit of char on them, so sweet and delicious!
You need to pig out here! Delicious economical and with a great staff will be back here tomorrow! Phenomenal food! Try the chicken thighs and of course arepas
Wow! These arepas are stuffed with so much meat, I made the mistake of ordering 2 and could only eat half of each, one chicken the other beef. Good flavor and worth the price.

After wanting to try this place for so many years, we finally stopped in and the inside looks 100 times better than the outside! Very cozy and nice indoor setting.  The food however could have been better.  Way too americanized and not enough culture in the food.  I was also tipsy so if it's not on point after a few drinks, i don't think it's worth a try when sober.

First time trying an arepa, and it was delicious! I tries the pork butt and it was moist and tender. The arepa was packed with pork. The bread was a little greasy, but I loved how it was crispy.   I think this is the only place I have come across selling passion fruit (besides a boba shop), guava, soursop, and sugar cane juice.   I will definetely be back again. Fyi, credit cards are accepted if your purchase is more than $10, otherwise it's a $0.50 fee.

The arepas taste Just as I remember the original place in the middle of a parking lot, chowing doen in the hot vegas heat for a cheap and delicious meal. I'm glad the recipes are exactly the same and the owner has stayed true to his food and has done well enough to expand!  The pork butt is still my favorite with super soft and tender pulled pork sandwiched between delicious masa. Add avocado for a mind blowing experience.

The food was DELICIOUS! First time having an arepa and now its one of my favorites. The staff is super warm, friendly, and extremely helpful. Highly recommend the Pabellon! We'll definitely be back....adding this spot to our Vegas go-to list.

Fantastic! We ate here 4 times in 3 days. #2 Chicken Arepas with their cream sauce. Great staff and service! Wish we had one where we live! Highly recommend heading North from the strip to enjoy this place. The Monorail stop at SLS is about 1/3 mile from restaurant. $5 per Arepa and one is plenty. They are filling. The mango and passion fruit drinks are great too.

Delicious and authentic Venezuelan fare.  I highly recommend the various stuffed arepas, the catchapa and the fried yucca. The atmosphere is that of a fast food type joint but the food makes up for it and then some. Great service as well.

Its an orgasm in your mouth, in the parking lot of Dinos. In a totally legal way. I hit this place up at least every other night and usually drag suburban friends along too, to show them how we roll in downtown. The Arepas are fuggin amazing! Felix the boss man is the friendliest guy will meet downtown too! You can have 2 of these sandwiches and you'll be totally stuffed. Sitting outside of the little Arepas shop is the perfect place to "people stare". You can watch the escorts,homeless,drunk tourists,out of country tourists,rich people and crazy people all walk by while you sit and stare. Once done you can walk 20 steps to either Dinos for Karaoke and the strongest and cheapest drinks in Vegas or across the street to Olympic Gardens to get your "perv" on tipping the ladies. If you are ever around the Stratosphere or downtown, definitely make the very short trip to the corner of Wyoming and Las Vegas blvd. You WON'T be dissapointed

Kind of sad~ Loved what Felix did at the stand, but when he got into the real B&M, seems like it's more about the hype than the food~ (It's foreign, so it's awesome!) No, it's not~ It's Dry chicken, Dry pork, and Dry beef~ F'ing Dry~ What a D'bag to serve such poorly prepared food~ Sad~ In a third world roll~ I'm so cool because I love it! No, I'm not~ Dry protein in a third world tube roll is worse than a TV Dinner~ Because you paid for it, and told your friends how good it was~ Oh, and the Gelato shop next door?  He owns that too~ But not a feature of VLA~ Do your self a favor and check Luv-It around the corner~ It may appeal more to an honest palate~ And skip the overcooked third world sammich shop~ Lot's of good, honest food in Vegas, even in that neighborhood~ Just makes me sad I spent my money there~ Just think, "Dry"~

I'm glad this local business is thriving, but I was disappointed with my experience. I found the wood fired chicken and shredded beef lacking in any discernible flavor other than salt. And the salt ruined the food for me. I enjoyed the sauce/additions on both, but when I am eating meat, I don't want to feel like a dish NEEDS the sauce. These arepas did. In addition, the texture of both was also very....mushy. Based on the overwhelmingly positive reviews, I will give them another chance and hope that I caught them on a bad day.  I ate arepas made by hand years ago and they were outstanding. So I know I like arepas.  I realize it is not fair to compare homemade preparation with a fast food preparation, but I really wanted (and expected) to love the product at Viva Las Arepas. I didn't expect it to taste like homemade, but I did expect better than what they delivered. It remains to be seen if this was a bad day, or just not the business for me. I will go back and try the vegetarian option to find out.   I'm not giving up on you, VLA!
Nice change from the usual fare. My husband had a beef Arepas and I had the beef epanada. We were not disappointed at our choices.

Tried out Viva Las Arepas in Las Vegas since I read good things about it.  And next door is Art of Flavor a gelato place so I wanted to try both.  Since we weren't too hungry we got 1 arepa to share.  Roasted pork butt w/ tomato slices $5 - meat was very salty and dry to me, tomato slices I only saw one tiny slice no flavor.  Put the green sauce which is the spicy one!  Yummy sauce.  Arepa itself was grilled and tasty.    Colita soda - Venezuelan soda smelled and tasted like bubblegum - skip it.  I want to go back to try Black beans & cheese $5 or Vegetarian $5.
Wood fire beef arepa was tasty!  Make sure to drench it with the two types of sauces.

Every time I visit Las Vegas I come to eat to Viva Las Arepas a jewel at the end of the strip. The Pabellon arepas were delicious according to my friend. I had the Pork Smoke Arepa and it was also very tasty. I had tried  La Rena Pepiada before and it's still one of my favorites. The cashier and all the staff are very nice, smile all the time, and help you with suggeations.

Phenomenal food... Nice getaway from the strip... The arepa sandwiches were flavorful and super filling... The yucca fries weren't too shabby either... They also serve sauces with their meals, one spicy and another some sort of cilantro cream sauce, both amazing! Do not leave vegas without a stop here!
The food is delicious, definitely a must have if youre in the area. But the seating isnt so great and the location is sketchy. Nonetheless, the food will bring me back!
Arepas - wood fire beef and empanadas with chinken were delicious. Good food for good price served by nice staff !!! :)

Now that was delish!  The arepas, Venezuelan-style sandwiches, I got was packed with nicely shredded and flavored pork although it was a tad dry. I'm looking forward to trying the many other ones they have. What I really loved was the beef empanada. It was also packed with juicy, shredded beef. All their food came out piping hot the way I like it. They brought it to my table fairly quickly with two sauces. I especially liked the light green one. The only downside is that it's pricey for small arepas.

I went to a function last night and needed a quick dish to take. I never knew this place was here but WOW!!! The manager Tony introduced me to cachapa. Its corn and cheese grilled and glazed. Sooo good and what a hit it was on the buffet. The place is tucked away in a corner but don't miss it. I am going back very soon. Super friendly staff.

It was a good "sandwich" rather arepa. But to me it was really not all that special for $6. The arepa was rather small for what you pay for and didn't really think it was worth it. It was tasty though. I ordered the reina  pepiada. It had a lot of mayo and it reminded me of a chicken salad sandwich so it wasn't really too special.

This place is amazing! Such good food, and such nice people, the arepas de pabellon is amazing, and the tequenos are my favorite! I am a venezuelan from los angeles and this really hit close to home, such good food!
Solid arepas at an above-average price, but since it's Vegas it probably gets another star.

Hit I LUV AREPAS for a quick lunch snack - I think it's actually smaller than a food truck !  I originally thought it replaced the Naked City Sammie space but not true - a stand alone shack on Dino's  parking lot ( maybe it uses the NC space for prep work ... not sure )   Had the pollo arepas ( $3 ) and the carne ( $3.50 )   Comes with a side of spicy and mild sauce - damned if I know what's in them  the spicy had a smokiness to it, the Mild a cream base - both very good.  The arepas ??  I actually like the pollo more but both were very good.  They basically take a corn based thick pancake,  cut in 1/2 and stuff with meat - no frills - simple food with great flavor .  I wanted a bacon dog ($2.25 ) but not ready yet - next time because there will be many next times  crappy pics added

Best Breakfast!!! They open at 8am daily. Inexpensive, filling and DELICIOUS!!! Makes your belly feel all warm and fuzzy inside! Check it out!....and that cilantro lime sauce....I just wanted to squirt the whole bottle in my mouth!

Amazing Venezuelan food!!  I love the arepa de cachapa and these are probably better than the Colombian (arepa de chocolo) ones I've had.  The service was great and it's not far from the Vegas strip.  The prices are more than fair but I had to place a second order because I knew I wouldn't find Arepas like these back home.  I would highly recommend if you enjoy Latin food!!

I Love Arepas!!!! Ate the Lingua, bacalao, and ham n cheese, all were delicious.   THe owner is super cool, and let us try one of his new creations, which was like a fresh ground corn cake filled with  cheese, awesome!  This is straight forward, no frills, or BS food.  I'm craving their arepas writing about them right now!

Went here for lunch with the family, service was great staff was friendly and the food was very authentic. Surprised at how good the chicken wings were. The Arepas were crisp, tender with lots of Filling
All I can say it AWESOME!! AWESOME everything about this place. It's clean, food it delicious,  and the customer service was outstanding!!

When I think of a dive, this is everything I picture. The location isn't the best, the decor isn't anything that makes you want to stick around, but the food is rockstar.   I ordered the chicken arepa and the plantains. The chicken is dripping from all of the juices. It's super flavorful and super messy. The sauce that they serve with it isn't necessary, but it's definitely great! The sauce kicks up the heat a bit, which I appreciate.  The plantains were about as addictive as potato chips. They were nice and salty and just the right texture.   The prices are pretty spot on. I only needed one arepa and the plantains. For $10, you can get plenty of food.  Check it out for something different.

This was my first time trying arepas and I wasn't quite sure what to expect. It had a meat heavy taco style filling in a small cornmeal pita shaped pocket. The fillings were definitely tasty and they give you sauces to put on top, but the pocket tasted a little bland to me

This is a lovely little place for some flavorful south American food. Several varieties with different spice levels. Salsas and sauces available to complement your meal. I somehow landed at this place while driving and am so glad I did.

Love this place!! The garlic shrimp arepa and fried plantains are sooo good!! The ribeye steak was a very generous portion for the price!   Will definitely be back soon and recommend it to my friends!

Love this place so much! It's been a longtime since their "shack" location and very happy to see they're doing well. The restaurant is always clean, the employees are very friendly ad the owner is super nice, too.   My husband is a vegetarian so it has something for both of us. We've never had anything on their menu we haven't liked. My go-to is the shredded beef because the meat is seasoned so well and it's a super tasty bite. Even their rice is good! Try it, you'll love it!
Wonderful! The owner is super nice and happy to make suggestions. Food is ridiculously good.

WOW! The Arepas came out piping hot and were really yummy. We tried both the Chicken and Veggie Arepas. They were really good. We like this place so much we went there on a 2 day visit to Las Vegas.  The only problem with this place is the location. The location is a bit dicey.

Really delicious food. We got a mixed grill meat platter, yuca fries, and a cachapa. The cachapa was amazing - you can really taste the corn and the combination with cheese is great. The meat was just right - not too dry, not too fatty. Smother that stuff in the green (cilantro?) sauce that comes with every meal.

O.M.G!!! Have been recommended by so many to come here and I finally made it. It was way above and beyond expectation, so delicious that if I lived in Vegas I would probably eat there every day. We tried 4 different arepas and they were all scrumptious even though the consensus was that the chicken with avocado was a snap above. I can't wait to come back and try the rest! Absolutely lovely service as well. Please open a place in LA, there is such a market for this here.

Usually get the number 3 Arepas at the other location. The number 3 here actually tasted better than the other location I'd say. The "bun" was a harder texture here. My girlfriend got a beef empanadas and it was also pretty good. Service was fast and decent

Ok this is definitely a gem even for the locals.  Great food here.  Everything I have tried has been awesome.  Tropical flavors. Fresh fruit juices to order.  Wife loved the great Vegetarian options available.  When you are done walk next door for fresh Gelato another gem...  Thank you Viva Las Arepas
So good! Can't wait to go back the next time I'm in Las Vegas. The food is tasty and the service is terrific.

The best food for your soul : arepas! Had arepas and empanadas last night and they were delicious! The staff was nice. They had a comfortable outside patio, just incase you want to bring your pooch along. I'll be glad to say I was a little fatty and ate a rather large portion of empanadas. No regrets!!!!!!
Amazing Venezuelan food! Arepas, cachapas, tequeños and they even have frescolita! Very consistent food and super friendly service.
Nothing like the excellent tasty arepas i used to get in Puerto Ordaz.  Disappointed.  No way a four star place

Arepas here are delish!  It is located near downtown LV but don't let that stop you from coming. The food is great at very reasonable prices!  The place is extremely clean with very friendly people working there!  We will definitely be making this place a regular spot when we are in Vegas!

Came across Viva Arepas, 2 years ago, while it was still in its previous address - a shack about half a block up from their current location.  Viva Arepas is a Venezuelan restaurant that specializes in Authentic Venezuelan food. The Arepas are phenomenal!! They are small "sandwiches" filled with choices like: shredded beef with peppers and onions, garlic shrimp, bean and cheese - to name e a few choice. They also have wood fired chicken that comes with a choice of sides.  The drinks are also authentic to Venezuela - all being natural and refreshing.
The food was amazing! The service was great! Definitely authentic! Everything was prepared as if homemade and we left satisfied!

So, our buddy Drew picks us up from our hotel to hang out for the day. "What would you guys like to eat?" he asks. We were somewhere between zombified and comatose due to lack of sleep and too much booze still pumping through our blood streams. Between the three of us visitors all we could manage was some kind of grunt, "Grughhh". Fed up with our antics, Drew took charge and brought us here.....and I still thank him. I ordered the Reina Pepiada: Chicken, Avocado, Mayo and Cilantro. So Damn Good! I was lucky enough to have ordered a Coke because I kept trying to drown my Arepa in their delicious yet very spicy hot sauce. Careful, it catches up to you.  I will now be searching my hometown or counting the days till I can make it back to Vegas to have another round at Viva Las Arepas.

Aaaah about average with or without the sauces..  Seriously it doesn't taste that good and its over priced.  We can go up the street and have rolled tacos that taste 100% better.... Walking thru the front door your hit up for money from the less fortunate, earth peeps....  No return visit for us we will hang out with Mexican's - J K KUHL...

Really good! I've tried both the Pulled Chicken and the Pork Butt - and loved them both. Smother them both in the creamy/spicy sauce that comes with. Awesome!  The plantains are also about the best you can get. Order them "Con Crema" (with creme). It is somewhere between cream cheese and sour creme. It is fantastic with the sweetness of the cooked plantains.  Yeah, it's in a slightly sketchy part of town - but the upside is that the people-watching is fantastic. Perfectly safe during the day. Standard urban-awareness practices at night.   ...and as others have mentioned, it's just across the street from Luv-It frozen custard - a Las Vegas institution that somehow the tourists seem to miss entirely.   Definitely a great place to go if you're in this part of town - and worth a drive here if you're looking for something tasty and different.

Ok, like seriously, if you have never consumed an arepa, leave now, find the closest one, and eat a bunch. They are so amazingly good, and this place does them perfectly.  We were visiting in Vegas, looking for something awesome, but cheap to eat for lunch. Good old yelp, shows me Viva Las Arepas. We went on a mission and walked about 2 miles to get here from our hotel, but it was worth it. It's not in the nicest areas of town, actually it's not nice at all lol. But the place is very clean and has plenty of seating.   I ended up ordering the pork butt with avocado and tomato and it did not disappoint. It was soo good and only 5 bucks! My friend ordered the yuca fries and the plantains, and both were very tasty as well.   I can't get over how cheap and how good this place is. Awesome snack or lunch spot. Go get some!
Excelente sabor autentico de mi patria! Las cachapas estan buenisimas, las arepas estan divinas!

I cannot recommend this place enough. Went for the first time for lunch.  Prices may seem a bit high (for a single arepa) but the portions are huge. The plaintains and platanos and rotisserie-style chicken were all tasty. The sauces are wonderful and really round out the meal.  We'll be back again (and again). My new favorite lunch spot!!!!

Omg this place is so good!! And when I say good, I mean awesome!! I haven't had one thing on the menu that hasn't been delicious!! Absolutely go here!! Friendly service, good prices, amazing food. What more could you want?

Getting down to the nitty gritty, gotta order everything on this menu.    Yo! You have got to try this place out.  If you're looking for a quick fix or craving for some straight up authentic food this is the spot.   I got the #1 carne asada aka Wood grill beef arepas, #7 chicken arepas, #12 shredded beef with plantain arepas, and cheese empanadas.  Took one bite and said "whooo whoo whoo!!" It's like a sope and taco in one. A little greasy but can't get authentic without a little grease. Made my day. Chillen with food coma.  Interior is clean. Service was nice and pleasant.

OH MY GOD ! What can I say about this whole in the wall . First let's go with the establishment super cute and clean I loved the vibrant colors . The  kitchen is set up with a window display ; which I love because I'm always curious with other cultures food delicacies and want to see how it's being prepared . I ordered a shredded chicken firewood arepa that arepa right there is the reason I'm typing this yelp review . everything we ordered was amazing but that arepa right there is why you receive 5 stars ; but don't get me wrong that's not it's only thumps up great staff and the guy was super patient with us ; if I have to change my review it's because I obviously tried something better and I want to inform you guys of what other great things they have . Best believe I'll be back

Stopped by here today...  food was bland for me. I liked the Cachapa and their sauces. The ham and cheese arepa was decent. The shredded beef empanadas were good but a bit greasy for my liking. The Tostones weren't the best but to be honest I've only ever had a few that I've liked.  Venezuelan food just may not be for me.   The service was great and the gentleman behind the counter was extremely nice.

I can official say that I (really do) Love Arepas. Like Paolo D. I had the lengua and tasted the tripe arepas. Highly recommend both.  For those unfamiliar, here's a quick description lifted from wikipedia (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arepas): "Arepa is a native sort of bread made of ground corn, water, and salt which is fried into a pancake-like bread. It is either topped or filled with meat, eggs, tomatoes, salad, cheese, shrimp, or fish."  Paolo D. and I came here on a recommendation from Nelson Q. Best recommendation ever. I've had arepas before and they were usually overly greasy or their filling was under-seasoned, but this place hit the spot. Maybe I got lucky and ordered two fillings that I really enjoyed, but I was one happy camper after having an arepa.   The one downside is that there's absolutely nowhere to sit (this place is in a kiosk-like location in a parking lot in downtown -- think food truck without the wheels).
