Also I was really confused about how the ordering/paying worked because the guy working the cashbox really didn't seem to know what he was doing.

I've never had a bad experience here. The service is quick and the staff is always friendly. I love getting the empanadas because they are the perfect snack if you're not too hungry. The reina pepiada is always a great choice! I just tried the coconut pastelito recently and it's my new favorite treat! A great place to go any time of day.
Good service, good food, relatively expensive for the type of food they serve

This place is the bomb for cheap arepas and empanadas. Their sauces are so delicious, I ask for extra green salsa it's spicy and yummy. Close by our hotel which is the stratosphere so very easy to get a late nite bite in Vegas!

Viva las.......Vegas. As for the arepas, well there's always pupusas.   I've tried the arepas once before when they were selling them from the little shack on Dino's parking lot and they were kinda good but nothing I would really get addicted to, so when I found myself in the shady neighborhood looking for other kind of addictions I decided to give arepas another try. Service is good, they were friendly and very patient with me while I read both menus one in English and the other one in Spanish, the one disadvantage of being bilingual, (or drunk) you read everything twice.  The new location is nice, spacious and clean, but the booths are kind of small you can literally take a bite off the persons arepa seating in front of you which could be good thing depending on who you're with, so if you're not interested at all in counting your companion cavities pick a table for more personal space. There's also a long communal table along the window with a view to a beautiful 7-11 and other independent entrepreneurs working around the area. you can eat and do some window shopping at the same time.   For the food I ordered the garlic shrimp and the pork butt arepas, the shrimp arepa was very good but the garlic flavor was very intense,(still present 5 hours later) and the pork butt was a little too salty and there's nothing I hate more than salty butt.  Still,  this is a very popular place and most people find the food here tasty and palatable, as for me I don't see myself waking up in the middle of the night craving arepas so if you see me late at night around the neighborhood, arepas is not what I'm looking for.   #clean #good service #ok prices
My father is from Venezuela and the food here is better than the homemade. What an outstanding meal!  The Arepas are truly outstanding!  The Empanadas are just as good!!!

The food is mostly great though they might want to label which arepas are cold and which are hot so customers are aware.  I love the black bean and cheese arepa.  However the workers are the worst here. Twice now I have ordered online and when I come in they pretend like the way they do things is to make us when you get there...why have online ordering then?  So that is 2 stars off.    The last star is because the lack of eye contact, amiability and general customer service when dealing with the humans who operate this establishment. Also, they might need an Aesops fable to teach them that lying is bad.  Just an idea.  Thanks.  Ps the creamy green and dark green sauces are basically the drink of the gods!  Amazing!

A really unique find outside of the Vegas strip. We ordered the shredded beef, woodsmoked carne asada, and grilled chicken arepas, and also a few of their empanadas. Portions are good even though they look small. All were small in size but were packed with a ton of meat and are pretty heavy. A few of us ordered 2 because the arepas looked smallish in size, but  could barely take a bite out of their second one.   Minus 1 star because the meats needed a little more flavor/seasoning/spices. We were glad that they had the two sauce options but both were incredibly mild and we really needed a spicy sauce to round out the arepas.
Four stars just because There is only one vegetarian option but was totally worth it! The plantain fry was amazing too!

I love arepas, but I have not found a place that satisfies me...until now- this place was no disappointment at all! The arepas are delicious and very authentic. I reccomend the Cachapa con queso, it is so flavorful  and is pretty big. The workers are extremely helpful and attentive. Pricing  is affordable and it's totally worth it. Wish they had one in Los Angeles!

Been here a few times and I have only eaten the supposedly vegan arepa.  It's bread, black beans and avocado.  Each time my husband and I have been here we have gotten a stomach ache. I'm pretty sure there is egg and/or dairy in that bread. (their was an arepa truck in town, they had a labeled vegan and when I asked they told me the ingredients!)   Anyway, I'm not really a fan of this oily greasy weird bread nor really any bread in general. I guess this just is not the place for me!  I have problems with businesses that seem whishy-washy when the actual owner can't spout off the ingredients off the top of his head and just says "get the vegetarian, get the vegetarian."   The two times we have been here the place is empty but the service is slow yet very frantic.  Can't say we didn't try.

There are more hidden treasures than you think in Vegas. If you want to get away from the gliz and glam of Vegas, and get good, cheap, hole-in-the-wall food, this is the spot!  Other than Tacos El Gordo, I didn't know of any other hole-in-the-wall places. This one is good!  The arepas were delicious. It's like tortilla but better and less doughy. They also have a good family size bbq platter to share.

I frequent Viva often on my lunch breaks. The food is always delicious. I've had the #7 which I like alot. Its super creamy and filled with flavor. #1 is good also its like carne asada with tomato, lettuce and onions... But I usually get mine without the tomato and lettuce. I like to add the two sauces to mine. There's a creamy sauce its almost like a creamy cilantro sauce and a hot sauce. I've also had the shredded beef empanadas.. they are small, soft and a little sweet. The prices are good you could probably get a Arepa and a drink for $10 or less.

I never had Venezualian food before but I enjoy a food adventure.  The arepas are a real treat.  I split 3 different ones with my friend and loved them all.  The woodfired beef and chicken had a slightly smoky flavor that complemented the arepas.  The sauces add more latin flavor.  I definitely will return!

First time coming to this place and it was delicious! Friendly people and helpful with deciding what to get , i got #12 on the cashiers recommendation she said its one of the most popular ones. There like a pocket sandwich or a gordita but they are really generous with there servings. Very clean and family place with alot of seating areas indoor and outdoor for the summer days. They have sodas and also fresh fruit waters, which are very good and not to sweet .I'll definitely be back to try different ones ,thanks again !!

Delicious food and great, friendly service. Clean, bright, and spacious environment.   Every meal I've tried from the menu stimulates my taste buds. A family favorite is the arepa de la reina pepiada. It's a must-try, but I would also deviate and try other options because everything I've tried so far is made to be bursting with seasoning and flavor.  The vegetarian option is good too
Awesome food, something different if you're more familiar with Mexican or Brazilian cuisine.  It's like having grilled Brazilian meat slices in a crispy Greek-style pita.

A quick word to the wise - this place might be a stand on the side of the road, but the food takes awhile to prepare.  The freshness is well worth the wait, but if you are pressed for time, don't expect to order and walk away quickly.  When we approached the window of this fantastic little food stand, we must've looked puzzled, because a woman quickly gave us the rundown on the whole menu.  She told us her favorites, ordered for herself, and then told us, "This place is really good.  I should know, I'm from Venezuela and I love the way they cook here."  Emboldened, we walked away with two arepas.  We had actually had arepas before, in Brooklyn - they are kind of similar to the dish some parts of Mexico call a quesadilla.  Thick masa is formed into a pita-type shape, or sandwich-style, around delicious fillings.  I think these might've been even better than the ones in NYC.  The masa was crunchy and chewy all at once; the fillings were boldly seasoned and complex.  My favorite was the Reina Pepiada.  It was a chicken salad with peas, and it was the bee's knees.   I followed one of my cardinal rules for unfamiliar Spanish-language foods - if the title isn't a direct translation, its probably a regional favorite, and it was.  Very excited that there's cheap and delicious food easily accessible from either Fremont or the Strip.  Highly recommended.
Every time we are at Vegas we have to stop here at least once.  One of the best Arepas I have ever tried!

I have been wanting to try this place for awhile So finally the other day I hit it. Not impressed. It wasn't bad really but it didn't rock as very authentic. I love street food and this looked so third world street food I was pretty excited. Wasn't very tasteful, It was okay but Chicken and Pork were average. Cant say I have been to VZ but didn't make me want to go for the food. It was okay but not anything to behold.
A lot food for the price. So delicious and amazing. Great flavor and quality of meat. The salsas were so good too. Love the service too! Can't wait to come back.

There are some places that are so good, and your eating something that is so good, that your brain turns off and you go into munching non-stop mode. I can't explain how much I love the food here. They got me on a 2x weekly stop. Cheap prices and excellent food in a food trailer/restaurant/takeout joint. I'm so hooked on this place that even writing this review thinking about the food again makes me want to stop writing, jump in my car, and get some arepas! And I might just do that. Keke. I'm not kidding, some of the BEST food in Vegas is here. OK, i'm going there right now screw it.

I love this place!!! First time trying Venezuelan food and I am hooked on this place. Loved the pulled pork sand.. and the OMG plantains!   I will be back and blogging on this place! One very happy customer!
Authentic Venezuelan arepas and empanadas!! Very tasty and crispy dough, if you go try out their malta polar, best malta ever. And of course, must try their cilantro sauce!!
I had the Pollo Asado Mechado with avacado and cheese this week and it was amazingly delicious. I'm back again to try another delicious meal. Great service and awesome food.

A-MAZE-ING! These arepas are so tasty- my sister and I went twice in three days (and we were only in town for four!) I'll be recommending this to any of my friends going to Vegas. If you're staying on the strip- it's worth the drive. Yum!

Delicious authentic Venezuelan food. I know, I am Venezuelan.  Cachapas were authentic, arepas with any of the fillings were flavorful.  I recommend the Pabellon, Reina Pepeada. Came once to try them and had to come back next day for more

This is the only place in Nevada and California that you will get to experience truly authentic Venezuelan food that actually taste to perfection!  Their tequeños are golden crispy on the outside and soft dough on the inside, and you can tell they use either imported cheese from Venezuela, and if is not, then it's a cheese that resembles it very well... YUM!  When it comes to the Arepas, it gets even better. Made with authentic corn mix "Harina Pan", they're soft, warm and very filling. Great for breakfast, lunch or dinner! My favorite one is the shredded beef Arepa; I like adding cheese and avocado to it.  If you want to drink something typical from Venezuela, I definitely recommend having your arepa with a whole sugar cane & lime juice; it tastes kind of like a very sweet and sour lemonade.  ¡Muchas gracias a todo el staff! Hasta la próxima... -Paella Girl-
Great place to eat if you visit Las Vegas and are looking for a nice and affordable place. The food is amazing, it will also fill you up fast.
Arepas were pretty small and boring. Overall below average even though the shredded meat was good.

Viva las Arepas! Absolutely. Everything here is yes. If you haven't been you must go. Beef arepa, beef empanada, mango water, and yucca fries. The pork butt is a hit a well. Such cute "sandwiches" packed with flavor. It will make so much sense in your mouth. You will be enlightened, my friend.
I love their chicken arepa. The sauce is fantastic too. The service is great. It was closing soon and we didn't feel rushed which was great.
The pabellon arepas with a fried egg and that cilantro sauce taste so delicious definitely going to have to come here every single time I'm in Vegas.
Never had Venezuelan food before, and this place was Delicious! Had the "Reina Pepiada" that's what I recommend

We've stopped in Vegas, enroute to other places, three times now just to eat here.  It's high quality, highly authentic Venezuelan food.  I love the Arepas Pabellon.  The plantanos hidden inside is an extra treat.  I always order the Parchita (passion fruit) juice.  It's fresh and delicious!  We also had Reina Pepiada Arepa and Tequeños.  My entire family can find something they love on the menu.
This place is amazing, The food is super tasty, service is great and very authentic food. Its been open for a week and I already visted twice.

So good and cheap! Super nice service open early at 8am until midnight. I would definitely come back here. We tried the chicken, vegetarian and shrimp arepas. The plantains are deep fried and sweet. A must try while your in Vegas!

This place is amazing!!! The meat is super tender and delicious, partly due to the mesquite wood smoking process they use. Quick service and polite staff. A must stop lunch stop for cheap but epic eats. I also recommend the brown sugar limeade for a different treat!

Clean interior. Off the strip but well worth a Lyft ride. They have a menu in English and Spanish and many options to choose from.   All Arepas are gluten-free, which is surprisingly non-existent at the major hotels on the strip.  My wife and I tried several of the Arepas plus coffee and a traditional lime and sugarcane drink.   Our favorites were the Reina Pepiada, which is chicken mixed with avocado, mayo and cilantro as well as Cachapa, which is corn and cheese. I tried an empanda as well, which was good but not on the same plane as the arepas. Each arepa is very big with generous amounts of filling.   They are made to order so you know it's fresh.  The gentleman who took our order (I think he was the owner) was very friendly and even gave us a few things for free because we ordered so many arepas (we have a hard time choosing)  Wish they had a location in Denver so I could eat there more often.   Definitely go and try when in Sin City.

Finally got a chance to try this place for a gigantic dinner. Recently visited Goodwich and Art of Flavors in the same plaza, and knew it wouldn't be long til I'd be downing arepas, too...  Scouted out the menu online, cross referencing it with reviews here, and ultimately decided on the #1: shredded beef and the #7: reina pepiada, plus a side of fried yucca. Total came to just over $15, which was a bit pricey IMO.  The arepas were unique and tasty, but fell a little short of my expectations. The shredded beef was a little on the dry side, but I perked it up with a bunch of the creamy cilantro sauce- that stuff is the bomb dot com. The reina pepiada arepa was tasty too, but the flavor simply got boring after a few bites.  Luckily, the yucca was there to save the day: crispy and chewy and garlicky, it's everything yucca is supposed to be! The $3 price tag was a bit steep for the 12 bits that I got, most of which were half-pieces. Would I get them again though? Resounding yes.  Service was okay: minimal but friendly, brought out my take out to me at a table and took my order efficiently. Decor in the restaurant is fairly typical for a taqueria, but with the added touch of local artwork on the right hand wall as you walk in, all available for purchase. Though the pieces were good and added to the ambiance of the restaurant itself, I'm again taken by the sticker shock- the two paintings closest to me were $110 and $380. For folks advertising inside of a restaurant, that seems a bit unrealistic, but what do I know.  Might come back and try a few different flavors, seems like the BF and I could share three- they look deceptively small but they're very filling. But I'll definitely be adding on the yucca.  Side note: though a lot of other reviews mention the lengua arepas, and they look AMAZING, they no longer carry lengua here. So sad about that! :(
Las mejores Arepas de las vegas, excelente sabor, atencion y el lugar limpio, The Best food

Once I found it, after going into their prep area since it also has a sign & is in a building, saw the little stand literally on the corner. After getting my lecture of "you've got me sitting outside in 100 degree heat & I don't even know what I'm eating" he took a bite. after the 2nd bite it turned into nods, smiles (his mouth was full) & upon swallowing "I'll have another one & 4 to go" before the 3rd bite.  Owner was great, even walked outside & around to personally hand me each of my vegan gluten-free arepas.  They named this place great because after trying it, we can each say "I love arepas"

Viva Las Arepas has it all.  I prefer restaurants with fresh ingredients, new and creative flavors, served by an attentive staff in a convenient location. This is Viva Las Arepas all the way!  I don't know how they do it, but everything I've ever had here is amazing. The only problem is that I struggle to order anything new since what I've had before is already so hard to choose from.   The fries and black beans are really great, and they offer generous portions of each for only $3, great for sharing.  The Arepas of course are the specialty, but I don't think I've seen an entree there that didn't look great.  Unfortunately, the location is a little bit sketchy for some, but I look at it as their loss. Yes, it's not the nicest area of Las Vegas, but it is right near downtown and a convenient stop before heading to any of the uber-trendy bars in the area.  Priced for lunch, Viva Las Arepas might be the best value for food in all of Las Vegas. I don't know anywhere else that offers so much fresh, amazing food for under $10.

Places with lots of gluten free options make me so happy. The staff was SO nice, the place is bright and clean. It was fast and everything we had was yummy. I would definitely go back and work my way through the menu.

Not bad. The mesquite gives the food a good flavor. The empanadas are good but not Argentinan good. I had the Reyna was ok. Would be better if it had avacado. This place is ok and would try it again. It's not ok

Delicious and authentic arepas.  The garlic shrimp and the #7 (grilled chicken with avocados, mayo, and cilantro) are must haves!  The empanadas are also very tasty along with the grilled chcicken thighs.  Can't wait to go back to try different flavors of arepas.

Ah, Viva Las Arepas, how you hit the spot!   Especially for gluten-free folks who crave a good sandwich (not one on dry bread that falls apart).  The cold chicken salad "Reina Pepiaea" arepa, black beans and rice with vegetables...  The Roasted Pork Butt arepa es muy delicioso!  And they even have vegetarian options.  I love this place!  It's always busy, too.

This place is a secret little slice of food heaven. Everything they make ia amazing. My love is for the Shrimp Arepa, then pork, then beef. My 5 stars should speak for themselves. So happy to see them grow from a tiny shack, across from the titty bar, to a legit building (took over the asian bbq on the corner, in the old tower records shoppibg center)They need a food truck. Hear me, Arepas? FOOD TRUCK!

The food is absolutely amazing! The staff was friendly, the owner took pride in the food he served! I will continue to recommend this place to people! AMAZING!  We had the wood fire chicken and the number 12. Also the passion fruit juice was legit!

I was in the area with a buddy when he made this recommendation for lunch.  I was and am normally for anything once.  We rolled in and parked, and upon entering I found the other customers where a cross section of those that are out and about on the strip.  I followed my buddies lead and ordered up an areas with roasted pork butt ($5.00) and a fried egg (.99).  For a beverage a passion fruit drink ($3.00) was ordered.  The meal was delicious and filling.  I thought I should have ordered more but the maize and it's contents contained within were divine.  The drink equally complimented.  Because I have nothing else to compare to...it's a 4 star for now.......for now.

This was first Venezuelan food and this place is great! The food was awesome and my food was ready in 10 minutes!I got that pabellon and wood fire pork ribs for my husband and chicharron &yucca for my son - great!!! Great!!! Love it that even my husband was speechless!!we will come back! :)
Never had traditional Venezuelan food before but this hit the spot!  Can't go wrong with any of the arepas offered here!  If you're near the strip, make a stop here!
We love the food here.  We always eat too much.  One arepas per person and one appetizer per four people trust me is enough The bbq mixto platter is amazing as well!

I liked it...I'm Venezuelan and I can tell you this place represent very well Venezuelan's street food...Arepas, tequeños, empanadas, pastelitos, pollo en brasas, yucca...Everything taste good, keep in mind this is not a gourmet place,  portions are good, service is fast and friendly, prices are super affordable for the portions.

My relationship with VLA has gone up and down over the years, but this new location really seems to be trying to do things right. The menu is affordably priced, whether you get an arepa ($5-8) or opt for a  whole grilled chicken meal (~$20, feeds a family).   I come for the arepas and there's one for every meal- the Perico is a favorite with a breakfast slant, filled with scrambled eggs, tomato, onion, and ham. Add on a squirt of salsa verde every few bites and it's amazing! My lunch picks are the Reina Pepiada (which is like a chicken salad with avocado and cilantro) or the shrimp salad (fresh, plentiful, cold, consider adding avocado). Though the stuffed hand-held pockets look small, they pack a pretty big portion. The black beans and fried yucca are good add-on options if you're a bottomless pit or have skipped a couple meals.  The same sweet older guy is always working when I stop in. He's always friendly and the food is out pretty quick. Check the posters by the register for off-menu specials, like wings (10/$8) and empanadas.

This place was really good! I got a cheese arepas and it tasted sweet and savory at the same time. My husband loved his wood fried beef. The server helped us decide what to eat, which was very helpful. Very delicious food!

This is my first time here And it did not disappoint.  All good items were jam packed with delish flavor!  The owner asked if I had been here before and I said no.  He than says "since u haven't been here before, how about I throw in some plantains on me?"  Heck yeah!!! Also very delish!  Talk about going above and beyond for the customer.  They were also crazy busy yet he went out of his way to make sure we had a good experience.  I would highly recommend this place to everyone and anyone.  I'm a sucker for free food! NOM!

It says a lot about a business when they offer the ingredients for sale because they know you're gonna come back for how they make it. With that said we ordered a variety of the arepas and with the suggestions of certain additions(fried egg, cheese and avocado) they were phenomenal. I say that because our table was completely silent as we ate. So obviously overwhelmed by the flavors that we were speechless. Combined with the fresh mango fruit juice I ordered. Made me forget that I also ordered a to-go order of their asada fries. I ate those at home after my kids went to bed and I don't feel guilty.

Buen lugar y buen servicio, les recomendaría hacer la reina papiada con papa, zanahoria y pollo, no de la forma en que lo hacen(como en salsa), Ponerle un toque de azúcar a la masa de la empanada para que le den gusto. De igual manera los felicito, buen lugar para recordar lo bueno de nuestra

YESSS...! I finally got to try this place out with the siblings yesterday afternoon!  We all ordered 1 arepas each... Sister had the Wood Fire Chicken Shredded, brother had the Wood Fire Beef, and I had the Carne Asada with avocado and cheese. We also had Fried Plaintains and Fries (LOL). One word: awesome. We pretty much devoured everything, and the mango juice I also had was cool and tasted fresh (ice was unnecessary).  It was pretty clean in there, but it wasn't busy either. Sister said the one Downtown gets overcrowded, so this is a nice change of pace and setting.
Wow great food great service great price get the chicken arepas more flavor then asada also the special is 3 chicken thighs and rice and beans can't beat the price $6.49
Food is good, prices are great, and the service is excellent. If in downtown Vegas, definitely worth going

I found this place on yelp. Very inexpensive and really good. I got the chicken arepa and my son got the beef arepa the green sauce is delicious wish was a little thicker. My hubby got the chiken special he liked it very much too. We will come back again
This is a good, inexpensive place not far from the Strip. The empanada was my favorite part of the meal. Plantains were also cooked to perfection. The gelato spot next door was perfect for dessert.

I bookmarked this place a while ago because I knew we'd be going to Vegas and I wanted to try a new place. I've never had Venezuelan food before so this was a bit of an adventure. The neighborhood around this place is dirty and sketchy, but inside the restaurant it was a lot nicer than I expected. I was expecting it to be a hole in the wall, but it was situated more like a modern fast food joint. I ordered the pork butt arepa with avocado, cheese and fried plantains with a soda. My Mom just got their sugar cane and lime drink, she was going to split my food with me. My Dad got the cold chicken with cilantro mayo arepa (I forgot what it was called) with fried yuca and chicharrones and a mango juice drink. We got the drinks first. The sugar lime drink was ok, it needed more lime and was kinda watered down. My Dad's mango drink was way better, one of the best things we had here. It wasn't too thick or sweet. It was almost creamy and had a mild mango flavor. I wish I had ordered it.   My arepa was ok, I expected the pork meat to be like carnitas, but it was more like average pulled pork. I tried my Dad's arepa and it was a lot better, I liked the cilantro mayo. The sauces they gave us were good, one was spicy and the other was a cilantro sauce. They enhanced the flavor of my arepa, made it better. Our sides were the best out of everything. The plantains were sweet and a little crispy. The yuca and chicharrones were great and even better with that cilantro sauce. The yuca was crispy and starchy. The chicharrones were a bit dry, but they were meaty and of course great with the cilantro sauce. I was just kinda disappointed in my arepa, I think next time I'll try their grilled meats instead, if I come again.

Having it for the first  time the review is factors in my state of shock, on how good this  was, but also because its the first time i have ever had an Arepa, as I inhaled the first one, I thought to myself why did it take me so long to find out about these.  I ordered the wood fired chicken and beef arepas. The lady at the counter said the chicken was their most popular. So I took that one, and a beef one. After having both, I have to say I was much more impressed with the beef. It was tender, juicy and that creamy cilantro sauce (or atleast that's what I think it was) was impressive. I think that would go great on anything.  I am going back for the roasted pork butt arepa, and I am not sure, but I know for a fact I will be going here often. The meats were juicy and great flavor, but the real star was the actual arepa, it was dense but not dry, and had a great soft texture on the inside, but crunchy on the outside. if you had a pupusa before, it has that similar taste.  Love the vibe of the place, everyone was friendly, and it's just a great place to go and grab a bite to eat.

Very delicious.  Had chicken arepas, rice and beans, and plantains.  Arepas and plantains were delicious.  The beans weren't quite as good as I expected - but I am most familiar with Cuban black beans, so maybe that accounts for the difference.  I would definitely return and think you should give them a try!  Oh, also, the LEFT menu is in English, the right in Spanish.  Don't stare at the wrong one for several minutes like a dumbass like me.  :-)

I have been to this food stand downtown several times over the last year and I have never been disappointed.  I always order at least two arepas, but that is always too much food for me because they are NOT stingy!  All of the drinks they offer are delicious, my favorites are the tamarindo and passion fruit.  The black bean and cheese and reina pepiada arepas are a must try.

My first time here was very good however they had just opened for business that evening so I think that may be the key. I actually am more into the Arepa than the filling in itself (haven't been wowed  by their fillings yet). But my second trip here was a little disappointing.   I ordered their menudo arepa and this time not even the arepa could save this extremely bad tasting menudo. The menudo was not seasoned enough and that's not something you want to do when serving menudo:(. The Arepa was very bland and dry like it was either left on the flat grill too long or it was reheated one to many times.   The setting is so unique and I do love that so I'm not giving up just yet and do plan to give this place a third try I just hope to be able to post a more positive update. I really do like the staff and they are always so pleasant.

This place started as a little stand right outside Dino's and he had so much business that he was able to get a bigger more proper place right across the street.  Needless to say, I've been going since it was the little stand and I had no idea what an "arepa" was.   It's magical Venezuelan goodness.   :)        The food is always great and the people watching can be very interesting at the intersection.  Lol  My favorites are the "pernil", tostones and fried yuca.     Oh.  And when they ask if you want cheese and avocado...  yes.   Yes you do.

What a great a great experience. This place definitely lives up to its hype. We had the beef arepas, shrimp arepas, and the pork but cheek arepas. Wow they all were delicious. Next time we're trying the chicken!

Vivas las arepas. Yum. I wish I lived here. I would eat you everyday. The white sauce in the bottle makes everything taste better. I swear they must put some of that Vegas crack in there.  It's freaking addicting. I seriously go through withdrawals when I go back home. For years now, this place has changed... They've grown and expanded. But two things remained consistent, service and food. Great service every time. Amazing food every time. That's all I ask, and Thank you for delivering! Not a bad thing on the menu. Check out their drinks as well, often overlooked. Weird. I never have enough of it.

A little late hopping onto the Viva Las Arepas but at least I did! First time trying arepas and boy was I blown away. I would pick arepas over tortillas any day. I am a lover of anything doughy and the texture and thickness of the arepa was just perfect for me. Add in some deliciously seasoned pork butt and beef and you have a heavenly combo! My favorite would definitely have to be the pork butt. It was perfectly seasoned and the meat just melted in your mouth. They also have a house cilantro-garlic sauce which was a perfect pairing. In addition to the arepas that I got, I also got an order of the pork rinds and yucca root. Pork rinds were delicious but the fried yucca root was the star. They tasted just like French fries! except much better because the outside was super crunchy and the inside was flaky. Yum-O.   ONLY downfall is that it is located downtown (which I am not a big fan of). Overall, this place is definitely worth the drive.

Really loved the food here even if I did find 2 shrimp shells in my garlic shrimp arepas. Also had the reina pepiada arepas which I thought was better than the garlic shrimp arepas (even if I wouldn't have found shells.) And finally had the tequenos which was great as well. 2 arepas are very filling though. My suggestion would be to have 1 & one of the sides unless you're a starin' marvin. Will definitely have to head back some other time to try some other items.
Very tasty!   I had #7 and 9 with plantains.  Best meal I have had in Vegas yet.  Believe the reviews.

Just like the sign says, "I Love Arepas." Although delicious Venezuelan food can be found in Miami, I was a little skeptical when it came to Las Vegas. However, this place holds up to the scrutiny. We wanted to give it a try and because the arepas were so cheap ($4-$6)  we ordered one of each...literally, one of each variety. Needless to say, I got full pretty quickly and ended up trying one bite of everything. DELICIOSO!  My favorites were: -black bean -shredded pork  The guys working in the stand/shack were super nice. I will definitely be back the next time I have an arepa craving.

Talk about value - tasty arepas for less than $5. Looks small but makes a good meal, and you need some room for gelato at Art of Flavors next door after that anyways. :)  I usually get Reina Pepiada or shredded beef, both of which are very good.  A big YES.

The food here is amazing from the bread to the meat. Everything I got melted in my mouth.  Never had Venezuelan before but I'm now a fan! Everything I had was extremely tasty.  Really affordable for what you're getting. It was clean and they were really quick. I can't wait for our next visit.
First time here we sampled a bit of everything this place is worth stopping for. Delicious corn arepas: pork butt, shredded beef, garlic shrimp, and chicken yum yum yum!!

Excelente servicio. Excelente la comida. Y domingo en la mañana me sentí sentada en la casa de mi mamá. Todo lo que pedía me lo ponían en la mesa y más. A dream come true. Los tequenos exquisitos. Los pastelitos recién hechos, las empanadas mundiales. El masato como hecho de mi abuela. Ni hablar. Una experiencia inolvidable. Félix you made my day.
This is my favorite place to eat when I go to Vegas.  The sandwich fillings are what make this place special along with the Arepa.  Also, this place is a great gluten-free option.

The pernil arepa (pork butt) was soo unbelievably salty that it was hard to finish. Too bad because I love arepas :( The fried plantains were really good. Bad location on the seedy side of the strip with a small, awkward parking lot. Good, friendly service though.

Great concept and great food! Everything in the restaurant is gluten free, so if you have a gluten intolerance or are celiac, this is a great spot for you. I've always loved arepa's and empanada'a. This place makes really good clean food with a smoky . roasted mean stuffing or cheese and ham. The Latin ladies that work in the kitchen add an extra not of authenticity to the crafting of the food. If you crave something different then you will love this place. It's more a take it to go kind of place than an eat in but the place is done up very nicely if you decide to stay for your meal.

Nice inexpensive option off the strip. Arepas were good and I had an order of plantains. I think the plantains could have been cooked a little more, they were still a little firm, and the crema tasted like straight up mayonnaise, which was odd. I would like to go back and try more things to get a better feel of the place. Service was friendly and food came out quickly.

Soy Venezolana! He viajado a muchos estados por trabajo y conozco muchísimo restaurante venezolanos vivo en California y por vacaciones nos vinimos a Las Vegas cuando estamos explorando me encuentro con un restaurante de mi país me emocione a mi máxima expresión .... Al llegar la persona que atiende ni habla español ni se sabe el menú bien, yo dije bueno no importa quizás es nuevo no importa que no hable español no importa estamos en USA ok no hay problema, pero que la comida que se espera por más de 20 minutos no te guste eso sí es verdad que no me parece. La verdad es la primera vez que escribo algo negativo para algún negocio que sea de mi país. Pero la calidad de la parrilla es mala la carne es muy mala súper dura y muy poca porción el pollo fue puro hueso y bueno ya no digo más.
My boyfriend is Venezuelan and I love eating Arepas when his mom makes them. But this beats any Arepas I have tried so far. Highly recommend

Hubby and I liked it! Fresh food, gluten free! Very friendly staff. We walked up to the counter and told him we had never been and he gave us great info. We had the beef, pork and garlic shrimp arepas; plantains; and fried yucca. Delish! I tried the sauces and enjoyed those too. We'll come again when we visit Vegas, for sure.

VIVA LAS AREPAAAAAASS!! great place to eat ! Just like in Venezuela cachapas,chicharron con yuca, malta Polar...cocosetes! Thank God for our original Venezuelan food being available in Las Vegas, great food, great service..... MADURO HIJO E PUTA !!

All the arepa trucks in Vegas have seemed to disappear so my bf and I decided to give this place a try. I'm glad we did because the arepas are just as good, and they have a great lost of options on their menu (like cachapa, yucca root with chicharon). My favorite was the reina pepiada arepa. Felix the owner is wonderful. Although the setting was like a fast food establishment, he came over to our table when it was slow and introduced himself and even gave us plantains on the house. We got to talk to him a bit and afterwards he even offered to throw away our trash when we were done! Great service and food.
This is some good eating all the way around. Sorta was bomb, and the coconut cheese thingy a must. F yea, grub
Insanely good, we had the Reina pepiada arepa, chef grade arepa. The flavor of the grill, i mean, oh my god this was crazy good  Que sigan así, hacen a un Venezolano orgulloso

This place has seriously great Arepas! Every time I'm on or near the Las Vegas strip I must stop and get one or two. They are extremely authentic. They taste just as good, if not better than the arepas I had in Columbia.   I highly recommend Viva Las Arepas! The stay is helpful and friendly.

This place blew my mind. My boyfriend were in Vegas a few weeks ago and I was trying to find an awesome place for us to eat off the beaten place. I went on yelp and found this. The pictures made me want to try everything.  We got the Yuca fries. Their signature chicken arepas with the cilantro sauce. INCREDIBLE. We also got the Carne Asada and Carnitas arepas. I love the fact that they grill the meat over an open fire.  It was so good and so fun to just try a little of everything. Can't wait for my next Vegas trip!

First time back here since they moved out of the little stand on the corner of Wyoming and Las Vegas Blvd (which is now a vacant taco stand) and into the former location of Harry O's BBQ.  There are many more items on the menu now, which we plan to come back and try (grilled meat plates looked really good).  But today we were here for arepas.  We ordered four: wood fired beef and chicken, plus shredded beef and roasted pork, plus an empenada to share.  It did take a while to get our food, but that tells you that it's prepared fresh to order.  The plan was to each of us to take two, eat half of each, and then swap them, so we could both sample all four.  Halfway through the first one I realized that one was going to be my limit.  I started with the roast pork; my wife had the wood fired chicken.  They were as delicious as I remember.  We ended up taking home the two beef arepas.  The person who helped us was very friendly, he wrapped up our two untouched arepas, boxed them, gave us little containers of sauce and bagged the whole thing.  Definitely plan to come back here soon.  This town has such a great selection of ethnic dining.  We're seasonal residents, who normally live in the SF Bay Area (which is a real melting pot itself with great ethnic dining) and we are constantly finding little hole in the wall restaurants with great ethnic food.  If your idea of dining out is Outback Steakhouse or Olive Garden, you are really missing out.

I loved the beautifully stacked wood out the back on the way to the bathroom. It showed how serious they are about wood fired meat. The wood fired chicken plate was fabulous, the arepa's were the same as everyone described them -tasty, good value, and freshly made. I LOVED the passionfruit drink, the soursop one was a bit weird, the lime and sugar cane drink was good.

Stopped here for a quick breakfast. I ordered the vegetarian dish, plantains and the passion fruit juice. The personnel is so sweet and welcoming, and the restaurant is spotless. Oh yeah and the food is SO GOOD! If you're in Las Vegas, and you are looking for cheap, quality food go here!!!

Omg! Delicious! I had their Papellon arepa and plantains with passion fruit juice and it was nothing short of an amazing meal. The service was friendly and fast. How I wish this place was in my hometown.
Aji sauce is the best I've had! I had the paballon arepa, mister had the pork one. We also got an order of yuca frita and tostones. Everything was delicious! Drank a maracuya which was good too!

Awesome, delicious Venezuelan food! (For the record, I'm of Venezuelan heritage on my mom's side.) I haven't eaten Venezuelan food in a long time, but Viva Las Arepas definitely walks away with a home run!  All the food is made fresh to order; typical on their menu are arepas (cornmeal griddle cakes either baked or cooked on a griddle, then split  and filled with various fillings from cheese to 'reina pepiada' - chicken salad with avocado and cheese. Other dishes include pabellon (shredded  beef, plantains, rice and black beans) and carne asada (beef, chicken or pork) barbecued on mesquite wood. If you have a sweet tooth and feel adventurous they have a selection of Venezuelan chocolates and candies, as well as pastries.  Small indoor and outdoor seating areas; parking is available in the rear of the building. Service was very courteous and arrived quickly (you order and pick up at the counter). While they do not deliver you can order from Uber Eats and they will pick up and deliver to you.  I don't get to Vegas often but this place is highly recommended and it has earned several local awards.

Having driven by but for some reason never making my way to eat there when it was a stand, I finally walked into their new corner location at Oakey and Las Vegas Blvd. last night.  Truth be told, I don't know how arepas or Venezuelan empanadas should be so I can't review on authenticity, just taste.  We ordered the garlic shrimp arepas and a few empanadas - cheese, cheese & bean, and cheese & guava - along with fried plantains and the Agua De Panela to drink. The taste of everything was fresh and simple, the multiple sauces, including a cilantro/mayo, a perfect addition. I was expecting the food to be heavy and greasy but it wasn't!  With items from $2-$4 and a bright, clean interior, you really can't go wrong. Felix, one of the owners, was very nice and obviously takes pride in his food.   I always enjoy a place were we can try something a little different that my six-year-old will like too. This fits the bill and it is within walking distance of my house!  If you want a quick, good bite to eat, forego the chains and drop by Viva Las Arepas.

I had to try it since it had so many rave reviews and I am left feeling disappointed.  We came in on a Friday night and I for one was super excited to go. I was game for trying something new and never had an arepa before. We ordered the shredded beef and pabellon per recommendation. The arepas were good and very flavorful. They give you two different sauces. One is extremely spicy. The other is some kind of cilantro mayo concoction, but it works and is super tasty!   The reason for the low rating is the poor customer service. No greeting and no smiles. I had a coupon from a book I got at Costco and as soon as I showed it, the cashier immediately turned it down. He was kind of rude and unapologetic about it. According to him, they "have been trying to get the company who produces the coupons to take them off their website for three years now." Sounds a little sketchy to me. That in itself ruined my meal and had me feeling kind of embarrassed like I was in the wrong. Not a good way to treat a customer. I take customer service very seriously and since they didn't make a good impression, I won't go back.

The food here is a great find for Las Vegas! It's affordable, with great service, and has authentic food.   5 stars - Arepa with black beans and cheese. I loved this dish! The beans were so flavorful and they do not skimp on the cheese here. Even the arepa itself was not heavy and held the beans and cheese really well, so it didn't get messy while eating it.  4 stars - Cachapa. It was like a folded over corn griddle cake with melted cheese inside. It had a sweet flavor from the corn and the savory of the cheese to balance out the flavor. I liked eating this with the squeeze of homemade green hot sauce they give you in a squeeze bottle. Spicy, but good!!  3 stars - Fried plantains. I'm a big fan of fried plantains and usually order them whenever they're on the menu. In this case, the fried plantains could have been more sweet by letting them ripen just another day or two before cooking them. The preparation was spot on, with a golden brown glow because it was fried. Just a bit sweeter and this would have been a five in my book.  Overall, they've got a great selection of items, a clean restaurant, and the staff is very friendly.

I've been to the Las Vegas Blvd location several times and enjoyed it. This location holds up to flavor!! The staff is really great and helpful. The gentleman at the counter recommended I get the  Reina Pepiada (chicken breast w/ avocado, mayo and cilantro sauce)and he was on point with that suggestion! I nearly scarfed the whole thing down without taking a pic. Ha ha. I also ordered the Pabellon (beef, black beans, plantain and cheese) for a different flavor profile. I'm not normally much on beef but it's shredded and marinated very well. Also delicious is the sugar can and lime water. A good compliment to the arepas. I am definitely making this a work lunch spot from now on. Along with staff being friendly and helpful the place itself is very clean and air conditioned (we all know that's a summer necessity)

Delicious arepas! Meat was juicy and tender, with the arepa dough a perfect texture. By the end it was falling apart due to all the juices, but delectable nonetheless :) Although it didn't look that large, it was filling and had more meat than expected! On the other hand, it was a little on the heavier side for food.  I got the pork butt arepa (forgot to add cheese), and also a shredded beef empanada. Both were great.  Reasonable prices, ample seating, and delicious food will have me adding it to my list of go-to spots while in Vegas.

As we rolled into Vegas after 8 hours of driving, my sister insisted that our first stop be at Viva Las Arepas. If you decide to get hitched after lunch, come here because it's next to a hair salon, wedding dress store, and ghetto wedding chapel.  Reina Pepiada. Yes. Anything is better when you add avocado, but with chicken salad? I can't even.   We ordered a bunch of stuff to share including the Reina Pepiada arepa, shredded beef arepa, pork butt arepa, garlic shrimp arepa, chicken and beef empanadas, chicharones, and yucca fries.   I wasn't a fan of the shredded beef, it reminded me of frozen burritos. Everything else was really good. Don't forget to drench your food in the cilantro mayo, it's amazing!

Flavorful experience!  I've had this place on my mind for several months and finally made our way over to it for a late lunch on a weekend. It was a beautiful day and wanted to enjoy our food outside since they have a cute little corner space.   We ordered - a chicken arepa with avocado and a pork butt one with cheese. Next came a beef empanada, fried plantains and a sugar cane drink with lime. The chicken arepa had some type of sauce on it and it was way too wet for my taste. I loved the pork butt and it was my favorite part of the meal, especially with the delicious creamy cilantro sauce over it! The beef empanada was ok, expected more flavor. The plantains were fantastic and the perfect way to end the meal. I would skip the sugar cane with lime drink as it was very sour.   Here's the rest of the story and why I couldn't give it a higher rating. As I mentioned above we chose to sit outside because the weather was perfect. A homeless man came over and sat next to our table and began staring at me. It was nearly impossible to enjoy my food and we ended up buying him food. He chose to sit next to us and eat it as he continued to stare me down. Then came over a couple who were high as kites and the male wanted to show us his junk. He was committed to this and with every passing minute was also screaming at his female friend. I wanted to crawl under the table.   So next time I'm siting inside no matter how beautiful it is outside!
The garlic shrimp and vegetarian arepas were excellent. My friends loved the ribs and plantains.

My boyfriend is Venezuelan, so we had to try this place. The reviews say it all: delicious. The taste is pretty close to the authentic arepas from Venezuela.  We ordered the Pabellón and the Pernil Arepas, the cheese and carne mechada empanadas,  and the guava and cheese pastelito. Everything tasted great!   The pabellón arepa comes with shredded beef, black beans,  plantar and cheese.  The Pernil arepa comes with pulled pork and cheese, I added avocado too. If you're in las vegas and looking for great Venezuelan food, I recommend this place.
Well, the arepas were very hearty and the meat both chicken and beef were very tasty.  Just not sure how healthy they are.  Wish the white bread would be some other type of bread.   Good service.

I love the chicken arenas! We drove from the other end of the strip, two days in a row, to eat there. The yucca fries are really good too!   We did try some of the other meats, but it was just okay.  Once, my husband bring it back to LA! Still good. Love the sauce!
Love this Place!!!! Food is soooo good. Quality with great service. I swear the shredded chicken arepa is perfect.
I love the wood smoke flavor in their meats, and this restaurant sets the standard for me in Las Vegas.
I loved this place and can't wait to go back! I recommend the wood fired chicken arepa
Wow!!! These arepas are legitimate! Been to a few Venezuelan places and this top 3 in my books! Highly recommend to anyone wanting to try something new. #so good #money

I sincerely enjoyed this place. We were passing through and we wanted to try something a little different. It has been forever since I've had a good arepa and this place did not disappoint.   I suggest the pork butt aretha and the shredded beef empanada. You can't go wrong at under $10! We got a couple and things and split it all like tapas.   That's good the people here are amazing, super friendly and you can tell they put a lotta love and what they do. It's really rare to find in a place like Las Vegas.  I have a gluten sensitivity and usually I have to pay a premium for gluten free comfort food but here everything was less than six bucks each and it was all delicious.  They have parking, accept credit cards, and there is plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. This is now our new go-to spot.

We eat here regularly and do not eat very many places repeatedly.  The pabellon platter is our regular item, along with the chicken wings often on special and the best plantains you've ever eaten in your life. Been regulars probably 4 years or so.  Not long after opening.

LOVED my arepa #Pabellon and the steak arepa too. The passion fruit nectar was excellent and the service was fast and friendly. We all loved the food. Not 5 stars because the rice was subpar. Overall, it was all good.

The place is cute and clean but my 1st disappointment was at the moment we walked in.  The owner, yes the owner himself, was everything but nice......very serious, not warm or kind at all, almost rude.  I thought it was very strange that an owner handled customers like this.   Then when we got out order, my arepa was the blandest I have ever tried! - even with all the filings!.  I ordered the wood fired chicken with cheese arepa, but honestly, it was not good at all.  The dough had no taste, the chicken didn't taste like wood fired chicken but like boiled black meat chiken, and only only one slice of cheese not even melted. This is the second time I go, and wanted to give it a chance bc I didn't like it the first time either, but I got convinced:  this is another of what I like to call a mediocre restaurant. Colombian arepas are a trillion times better! And Business Owner! - be more friendly! or don't deal with face to face customer service because it looked to me you have no social skills!, which is fine.....but then don't do it!

Hidden Gem Hole in the wall Small crappy looking shack that serves delicious grub  All three of these phrases perfectly describe Viva Las Arepas, but I like the third one the best!  Located at the end of the strip, on Las Vegas Blvd, just a few blocks past the Stratosphere Hotel, sits a small, ugly white shack in a deserted parking lot that serves up some of the tastiest little snacks in all of Las Vegas.   Viva Las Arepas serves up some of the best tasting Arepas I've ever eaten. For those of you who aren't familiar with Arepas, they're pretty much small, fried cornmeal pockets stuffed with meats, cheese, veggies, sauce, etc, etc. Viva also makes empanadas, a few hot dogs, aguas frescas, and a few sweet treats like flan and more. They also have these two amazing shack-made sauces. One is a lime green color that's mild but has an amazing flavor and the other is a spicy red sauce. Since my wife and I were going to have a big dinner the same day we visited Viva, we decided to just get a few items to try. This is what we purchased;  Lengua Arepa W/ White Cheese & Avocado Slices http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/EnCIojgP5KTr1leaysFE3A?select=8lN2NE_nQzG-VFNGfeR1hA Ground Beef & Shredded Cheese Arepa  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/EnCIojgP5KTr1leaysFE3A?select=-dY7b8L5QpT1MPtSHG34ug Black Bean & Cheese Empanada http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/EnCIojgP5KTr1leaysFE3A?select=D_dkKgnCHti4moXUxO85vQ  All three items were incredibly delicious. The cornmeal pockets were perfectly fried yet still had a soft center. The Lengua, which was shredded and cooked in a delicious sauce, was my fave of the two. It was savory, sweet and slightly spicy all at the same time. The ground beef Arepa reminded me of a Taco Bell Chalupa, but obviously much better. The black bean and cheese empanada was also very good.   To wash down our yummy snacks we had a large Passion Fruit aguas frescas. It was super sweet and super refreshing. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/EnCIojgP5KTr1leaysFE3A?select=Wz0vow2OgM5E5N6lMQP07Q   The prices for each Arepa are about $3 or $4 bucks a piece, which isn't too bad considering how delicious they are. The guys who were working in the shack were all friendly and got our food out to us quickly.   If you're in LV and feel like something quick, tasty and cheap, don't go to some crappy chain place like McDonald's, head on down to Viva Las Arepas and treat yourself to some phenomenal Arepas. Trust ME.
My 1st time here was a nice experience. The food is good. You have to try the Plantains. The staff really treated us special. The food was good. and we will be back next time we are in Vegas.

I was driving around Vegas one evening looking for something interesting to eat, and I Love Arepas jumped out and grabbed my eyeballs. I immediately pulling into the parking lot to investigate.  I love shacks, and I Love Arepas is a shack. When I saw the word Venezuelan, I knew I was off on an adventure. The menu is a bit intimidating for a newbie, but the guy who work there are extraordinarily helpful and patient about explaining the offerings.  I completely enjoyed the cold shrimp item I had. While I was eating, they inquired to see if I was enjoying the food. This sort of service is more like a 1st class joint than a shack in a parking lot.  People were constantly showing up, but there was never a line. The food has to be prepared, so while it's not fast, it still gets to you fairly promptly.   I brought my wife on a return visit a couple of days later and had the same excellent and enjoyable experience. A must-stop from now on when I'm in Vegas.

Located just north of the stratosphere,  this place is super inviting with the aroma of smoked meat luring you in from the lot.    We ordered two arepas each so we could try some different flavors.  They are like tiny sandwiches but made with cornmeal. And by tiny I mean actually medium-size. We each could have done with only one I ended up leaving half of each sandwich that I picked because I was so full. We also got the passion fruit juice and that was superb, perfectly complimented the arepas. The creamy green sauce was the bomb! It's like a mix of creamy avocado and salsa verde. I kind of want to put that sauce on everything in my life.

We kind of happened upon Arepas by accident, but it turned out to be a very great experience! Located just off the main strip, this is a delightful place to try some Venezuelan cuisine!  The restaurant is very clean and spacious. There is a lot of outdoor seating as well as indoor. There are also pictures of the menu items throughout the dining area, which was very helpful when you are as clueless as I was. The employees were all really nice and quick with everything too.   I went with the shredded chicken arepa with cheese (#2). It was very very good. It was a lot like eating a soft shell taco that was wrapped with a thick, sweet tortilla. It was all very authentic and made right then for us. There was also a sauce that was some sort of sour cream creation that made it even more delicious. It was a great first taste of Venezuela!

Always stop by Viva Las Arepas anytime my wife and I are in Vegas.  My wife grew up in Venezuela and swears everything here is as authentic you can get.   I recommend the following: - Arepas: Shredded Beef, Roasted Pork Butt  - Fried Yucca - Passion Fruit Juice (Parchita/Maracuya) - Shredded Beef Empanada (note these are fried not baked like Argentinian/Cuban empanadas) - Green sauce (Guasacaca) on EVERYTHING - Cachapas (for sweet tooths)  After your meal, save room for Gelato next door (same owners).  Wait can be a little long.  Do phone-in orders to save time as area can have a bit of traffic.

My family is of Venezuelan heritage so I was pretty excited when I found Viva Las Arepas on Yelp. After reading tons of great reviews, my best friend and I decided to head over to Viva Las Arepas for lunch one day. Upon arrival we noticed that the restaurant was extremely clean, just like some of the reviews said. We each ordered one pork butt arepa and I got a wood fire chicken arepa as well. My best friend also ordered the beef arepa since he's just loves beef. The chicken arepa was good, the pork butt was better but the bites my friend gave me from his wood fire beef arepa were the absolute best. Everything was flavorful and tasty. We will definitely be back to Viva Las Arepas whenever we are in the mood to have some delicious Venezuelan eats.

I normally don't review but I just had to as I was so pleasantly surprised. Didn't look like much from the outside, don't let that fool you...Some of the best chicken I have ever tried! Half a chicken with 2 sides for 10 bucks, crazy good value for money. Cooked with mesquite wood, so it was smokey and crisp on the outside and moist inside. Tried the arepas with chicken, avocado and cilantro mayo. Didn't know what to expect but very pleasantly surprised. It's like a pita in shape but the bread is glucose free and softer. Filling and full of fresh flavor!

I heard about this place through other Phoenix foodies, and they really delivered! We've only had arepas once before, but I continue to crave them because of this place.  We swung by Viva Las Arepas for a late Saturday lunch. My husband got three arepas: shredded chicken, the reina pepiada and the beef with tomato plus a side of fried plantains. I got the vegetarian arepa and a guava pastry. We loved our arepas. I usually hate plain food, but I would be very happy eating a plain arepa because the masa is so delicious. My husband said the reina pepiada was similar to a chicken salad as the filling was cold. We couldn't get enough of the spicy and cilantro sauces. The fried plantains were pretty good, but the guava pastry was a disappointment. I keep comparing the last two items to what I've had in Miami so I have high expectations.   We always drive when we go to Vegas so the location doesn't bother us. I'm sure we'll be back when we're in town to get these unique dishes.

Strange beginning to my debut here. The owner had stepped out when i arrived around 1pm on a Sunday, so i was left trying to order from the cook who doesn't know a lick of english (hello border patrol). He didn't understand "#1 and #2 to go, but he did say "let me call my boss" so he calls his boss who didn't answer the phone. Five awkward minutes later, i yell out "uno y dos and adios" and the cooking got underway finally. Oddly enough, he asked in English if I wanted cheese. Both the shredded chicken and beef were tasty, but the edge goes to the beef, although both needed more peppers and onions and the promised garlic wasn't too prevalent. The chicken was kind of mushy too. The cornmeal pancakes were the best part, so i will probably focus more on veggie stuffings which would let those shine through more. The hot green sauce had much more flavor than other green buttermilky stuff, but gotta use that lightly. The cheese was a good addition for 50 cents.

I have eaten at this fine restaurant a number of times over the past 3 years, and visited again in late 2013. In the time since I was last here, back in October of 2012, they have moved from the small mobile/portable building in Dino's parking lot to their own storefront in the strip mall on the next block to the south, on the same side of Las Vegas Blvd. Their shop is the southernmost storefront in the small strip mall (yes, there is off-the-street parking in the strip mall).  The food here is amazing. The selection of Venezualan food, and the quality, is simply great! Their new shop is brightly lit and colorfully decorated, and the food is just as good as it was when they were in their old location just north of here.  I particularly love their arepas, but then again I am an admited arepa addict.  The service is also very good; the staff is uniformly friendly and helpful. The prices are very reasonable, and the portion sizes are very generous. I can only assume that when various organized religions talk about the possibility of going to heaven after one dies, that they must be talking about going to this restaurant on a permanent basis, for there is nothing finer on earth!  It is no wonder that this restaurant has won several local awards for best of class/type, including the Best of Las Vegas (aka Best of Vegas) award for the Latin restaurant category!   Whenever I am in Las Vegas, I always visit this fine restaurant 2 or 3 times per week and stock up on arepas to stuff into the fridge in my hotel room!

Food is delicious and very flavorful.  First time at this joint and it really did not disappoint. It's a very down to earth place and the staff is very friendly and welcoming. The place is very clean and the aroma of the food is what welcomes you as you enter. The gentleman who took our orders gave us great recommendations for first time patrons & he was patient with us as we asked tons of questions about each of his suggestions.  It's a place that I will recommend to everyone, local or out of towners, both to visit. Two thumbs up!!!
As the reviews show it's great. Come for some great food and service! Definitely will come back. Carne asada could use a litgle more flavor but still very good.

Yum, yum, yum, yummm!!! During my 4-day vacation in Las Vegas I ate at this establishment 2 times. Both days I ate the vegetarian arepa which includes, beans, tomatoes, avocado, onions, and green peppers. I also had the white rice with black beans and sweet plantains. It is located in a sketchy part of the strip but the food was delicious!!

Came here on my lunch break and the food was absolutely AMAZING! I got the Roasted Pork Butt Arepa with tomatoes on the side and it went really well with the Cilantro sauce they had. I also got the cheese empanada and mango juice which was just as equally as good! I can't wait to come back again and try the other things on the menu. Staff is really nice and attentive as well!

First impressions, A small, modest sized establishment for such a well known, and raved about place.  To order you must get in line and wait your for your turn at the counter. The worker we had help us with our order was a man wearing black ( assuming his the main guy in the place )  He was v gracious with us and even went as far to describe the flavors of the different coconut drinks they had there for us! Haha   The food we got were orders #1, #7, and #13 along with many many other dishes from off the menu...  But I'll just stick with the ones that wowed me the most lmao  Or yeah  The arepas..  WOWOWOWO WOWOWOWO SO F GOOD   The outer part, reminiscent of a pupusa ( I think! ), was so delicious    I serious could have just eaten that haha, but with the cilantro and avocado chicken thing I had with it  WOW  I also had tried some of the #13 and it reminds me a lot of a sweet corn tamale except with cheese  YUMMMM

Well this is my second time here  Both times come sway with the same impression.   While the food generally is fresh and very tasty the portions are child-sized at best.  If you're hungry you need to double down on what you order so don't FORGET that.    A small but good chicken sandwich with avocado costs $7.07. If I wanted to get filled up sufficiently, I'd need two of these puppies. That brings the cost for lunch up to over 14 bucks!  Not so good from the value perspective.

Very cheap, delicious Venezuelan food. Has vegetarian options which I was very happy with! The meat is good quality and has an amazing smokey flavor! Not fatty at all. The empanadas and arepas were amazing. They brought special sauces to your table with your meal. The avocado sauce was one of the best I've ever had.   Definitely recommend for anyone not looking to spend a lot of money and wanting to stay away from all the strip craziness!

Stop in every time I'm in Vegas! Smoked pork butt arepa and wood roasted chicken and I'm fed! Good fast service and affordable for any budget. Take the time to venture off center strip to pay this place a visit, you won't be disappointed!

This place was great, I ordered the carne asada, reina chicken arepa and yuca/chicharrón appetizer. All were fresh and full of flavor, the restaurant was nice and clean and you can smell the smoke flavor being infused into the meats.
Great Argentinian (authentic) food at such great prices.  I wish I had this available close to home (OC).  Every time I go back to Vegas....I'm there!
The best place in Nevada to eat... The food taste really great. The service is really good. I recommend this place 100%. Viva Venezuela.

I had this place bookmarked for  while, and finally my husband and I were on the right side of town and decided to give it a try. We liked it so much, we came back two days later!!! I've only had arepas a handful of times, but I liked this place! The food was made fresh to order and very tastey. They have helpful photos of the food for those of you who are also arepa rookies. I definitely recommend giving it a try if you are looking for an alternative Latin American cuisine to Mexican.
This food was disgusting! I would rather have eaten at MCDONALDS!  Bad combination of ingredients! I have no idea why this place has 4.5 stars!

I am feeling rather stupid that I didn't get the pun in the name of the place until now, two months since I visited. Durr. Love it. Simply put, these are delicious. There is a whole world of South American cuisine that I didn't know existed up until recently. The Venezuelans and their affinity for this scrumptious maize dough have brought a smile to my face and taste buds. You know, if taste buds had faces. That would actually be kind of creepy if they did.   We came in a wandering from one World Famous Gold and Silver Pawn Shop, on our way to the Stratosphere, hungry for a snack. Arepas are perfect for a light lunch meal or snack, but only if you limit yourself to one. You'll be sorely tempted to have more. This eatery is marginally clean; there's a nice lady that comes around asking if she can wipe your tables or buss your trash. I wish water was available for self-serve. I was parched after walking in stupid shoes and would have liked snappier water refills.   All in all, this is a delicious stop just north of the Stratosphere, especially if you're looking for a more unique ethnic choice without all the flare and overdone nonsense of the Strip.

Good arepas and great service. My favourite is the shrimp; the chicken and avocado mix is my second. The passion fruit drink is always a must for me. For cheap and good eats near the strip, this is definitely a good place to go.

i love this place! best food in vegas. The empenadas, arepas, and everything else I've tried there are so delicious. If you like Latino food this authentic Venezuelan restaurant is the place to go. You won't be disappointed!
Delicious food! Green sauce is delicious addition to the arepas which are generously stuffed with all things good food is made of. Also, the passion fruit drink is the best, definitely give it a try!

Its hard to find arepas in Los Angeles, so I was estatic when a friend found this little joint for me (Thanks Nich!)  I Love Arepas was only on its 3rd day of being open, so of course there is always room for improvement.   Felix was very accomidating to our needs.  He said the best arepa to try was the reina pepiada which is shredded chicken, pieces of hot dogs tossed in mayo, cheese and avocado. It was light but wasnt my cup of tea. I wouldnt order this again.   Next, we had the carne mechada, which was way better!  Last, we were going to order the chicken but decided to get the pernil (pork butt). Felix wanted to make us happy so we told him if he could add black beans and salted cheese. This one was my fav! The arepas itself was very moist and not very heavy at all as opposed to Caracas in New York.  As for a place just starting out,  Felix knows he has to make some changes to the menu and the venue (adding chairs, tv outside), which i commend him for listening to his customers, as he took note of our suggestions.  The arepas are great, but there needs to be a variety of components instead of just a meat filling.   Will def be back to see the improvements that will be made.

This place was ok/good. I expected it to be better because it got 4 1/2 stars. Overall it was fine, but not something I would make a point to go back to. I ordered the shredded pork butt and beef arepa, and the fried plantains. The arepa bread itself was a bit mushy. The outside shell was crispier and better. For those who have never had an arepa, it is a lot like a gordita. I'm not talking about the gorditas they serve at Taco Bell, I'm talking about the authentic ones.   Beef arepa: good, but a bit greasy  Pork butt arepa: the pork was tasty  Fried plantains: nice and warm, but a bit greasy  While I'm not looking for healthy foods here, it could have been a little less greasy.  Pros:  -good hours (open from 8 a.m. to midnight, daily) -the guy was super helpful and friendly when I told him it was my first time.  -the food was fine, but not super good.  Cons: -a bit greasy -hot sauce weren't so good -the arepa bread, a bit mushy -small parking lot

Amazing! Not too busy. Food came quickly. I really enjoyed the cheese arepa. We sat outside and took in the sights. Found a parking spot right in the same mini mall the restaurant was located. Right beside a gelato place and nail salon.

In A Nutshell:  -So you're in Vegas & fiendin' for a taste of Latin cuisine, Viva Las Arepas got you. -Specifically, Venezuelan food is served here. -Empanadas to arepas (commonly found in Columbia too) are sooo good here. -You can order a few of their items & the prices are nice. -I really like the location (not the crazy Strip). -I also love the windows that let in that natural sunlight, which is the key to foodporn success.  Overall, I bookmarked this spot after eating here and so should you.

Seriously, coming here is the best part of coming to Vegas. Friendly service and honestly the most delicious food in the world. Everything is so fresh and the salsas bring tears to my eyes... they are so delicious and add so much to the arepas without overpowering it. I could not have better words to say about this place. You MUST come here if you're in town!!! Love from Michigan
The food is quite delicious,  but I wouldn't go back if I had a big appetite.  It's a very small portion, which left me still very hungry.  I recommend it if you are looking to try something new.
Good food. Reminded me of the arepas my Venezuelan friends made when I lived abroad. I liked the more simple combinations like the carne asada. Pretty filling.
Fantastic food. Haven't had anything in Vegas that compares. Everything on the menu is delicious and the prices are pretty good for what you get

This was super close to where we were staying on the north-end of the strip.  We ordered a few veggie items and thought the food was ok.  Don't think we'd make it a point to visit next time we're in town!  I'm sure it's way better for the meat-eaters! :)
Nice break from all the over priced and unauthentic food in Vegas.

This place was amazing. My friends and I tried a few different arepas and each was delicious. One is probably enough. Get have everyone get a different one so you can try a variety. Definitely going back.

This is Viva Las Arepas 2nd location and it did not disappoint. Loved this location as you dont have to deal with traffic and pedestrians on Las Vegas Blvd. Everyone was really friendly and we food was great as usual. I had the Pollo Asada Arepa and it was delicious. All there meats are cooked with wood so they have a nice Smokey flavor.  This location was super clean. What a step up from the original food cart.  Keep up the good work Viva Las Arepas.

What a great find!  We were driving in from hiking all day and it was late but we were starving for something gluten-free but not too heavy.   We ended up at Viva Las Arepas.  Honestly, I'd never had an arepa or knew what one was but the pictures and descriptions were awesome.  It's all corn-based so no gluten.  We ended up with Pollo and Garlic Shrimp arepas supplemented with an order of plantanos.  I tried the Guanabana drink and man that was great.  You can also get an order of just plain arepas which I did to munch on for a very lite meal.   Recommended.

I love this place! they have a vegetarian option and the Arepas are delicious and good price. the special sauces are delicious and it's a chill spot. it's a little hot inside but that's anywhere in Vegas in the summer. the service is exceptional and they have fresh juice :)
One of my favorite  dive places in vegas. Arepas are the best. I normally order the pork butt and the #12. Plantains are amazing.

Off the beaten Las Vegas strip, located in old Vegas, er kinda seedy neighborhood Las Vegas. After snagging the last parking space in the strip mall, we walked in and checked out the large menu board. My husband asked me, which menu do we order off of?  I told him 'The Spanish one if you can read it'....he let out a sigh of relief when I pointed out the menu board in English on the left.  We got the chef special arepas, he got the wood fired shredded beef and I got the shredded chicken with avocado. These things are big, one will stuff you, and I got a side of rice and black beans and plantains -oink!  Those arepas are the bomb, chicken is shredded tender and smok-d-lish, is that a word?  Mesquite grilled and so good, corn meal pita or whatever it's called is fresh and chewy, holds all that filling. Two salsas, a creamy green garlic aioli and a fresh green salsa, both are habit forming. Plantains were sweet and tender black beans and rice so plentiful, we couldn't finish. Place got the lunch crowd going out the door.  Great place.

Yumm! Although they have good food I need to try other menu items to really give them a better rating. The Pork Butt Aprepas that I was dying to try was a little too slaty and a little bit soggy. So unfortunately that really was a disappointment.  The guava cheese pastry sounds so good on the menu but all it really was was guava jam with half melted weird cheeses deep fried in a pills berry type dough kindda good just couldn't get use to the cheese and the jam had a weird fragrant unguavay flavor.  My favorite out of the meal I got was the deep fried yucca with pork belly nuggets sooo good but it looked weird. I would recommend trying it because it's trendy and the yucca was bomb but expect to pay and arm and a leg those 3 small items cost me $18 or so!
This place was truly delicious, it left the vegan and meat eaters of my family fully satisfied!

Found this place on yelp while looking for somewhere  to eat while on vacation. So glad we decided to come here. The arepas are amazing and like nothing I have ever had. Will definitely come here every time I am in town.
Number 4 and number 12 .  Number 4 is good but 12 is amazing.  Mango drink also good.

Go here. The food is amazing at any price but happens to be really cheap. The staff were all really friendly, and helpful. They answered all of my many questions and helped me choose what to get. Had a beef arepas, a chicken arepas, and some black bean and cheese thing. It was all stupidly good. They had a weird cucumber sauce I loved too.

AAAAAAAAAAAAAAA-MAZING!!!!!  love everything about it...well, almost....the only thing I don't like it the price of each arepa, BUT the taste is worth it, so I'll dish out the cash.... I will mention that I come from a community (outside of Las Vegas) where I used to get arepas and other Latin@ delicacies for under $3...for Vegas, I LOVE AREPAS is perfect!  Maybe they should offer a "Locals" deal :-)  Just a thought...
