Red tile flooring. Small parking lot out front. I would definetly go back, take friends and tell everyone I know about this place. It is that good for what it is they do. AREPAS!

The food here is always so delicious and fresh. I got the beef arepa and a chicken with cheese and salsa. Devoured them both and was full as a tick. Staff was nice and pleasant. Remembers repeat customers which always a plus.

I have been to Vegas for the past 15-20 years and never noticed this place. Due to my Peruvian heritage of course I thought I wouldn't like any of their food.   Empanadas have always been my favorite breakfast food, which in Peru, they are a breakfast food/pastry so I was totally skeptical about the fried empanadas.   The empanadas were amazing even though it was weird for me to eat them fried and for lunch.   We also ordered the cheese & bean arepas and it was amazing. Imagine a pancake of sweet corn with cheese and beans in the middle then another sweet corn pancake on top. It was amazing.   Anyone visiting Las Vegas should come here. You won't be disappointed. I wish they had a location in Virginia!!!!!  The staff was also very friendly and they have menus in English as well Spanish.   Awesome, awesome food & service!!!

I had the #7 Chicken Arepa chef recommendation. Deliciously prepared and seasoned chicken with cilantro-avocado dressing. Yes, I got it with cheese. Washed it down with guava juice. Restaurant was easy to find being right on Las Vegas Blvd & Oakey.  Clean and tastefully decorated dining area; as well as the restroom. I was tempted to order more...but this order actually filled me up. I'm definitely going back. Take a look around the dining area for the different pictures of the meals offered on the menu. My friend had the fries too, which I took a couple, while he wasn't looking. Fries are just so-so. I'll order the fried plantains next time for a side. They looked a lot tastier. Overall, it's a fresh flavor Venezuelan restaurant offering great flavor and variety. I recommend it highly.
Absolutely loved this place and can't wait to go back to Vegas just so I can eat here again!!!! Way better than all that buffet food !!!
All I can say is wow oh wow! Great authentic Venezuela food, Iam so glad I found it on Yelp and yelpers giving good feed back! All the food is great. Clean place, good Service

Viva Las Arepas is my favorite restaurant.  Every time I visit Las Vegas, I stop by here. Grilled meats and arepas taste great! Especially I love Pork Spare Rib and Chicken BBQ.  Another tasty dish is Pork Fried Rinds & Fried Yucca  Root. This restaurant doesn't have a liquor license, but they let the customers buy and bring bottles of alcohols from nearby stores.  I am looking forward to visiting here next time.
Great food from Venezuela love love love the arrows with chicken. Great for lunch or even breakfast

For my Cuisine and Culture class I had to write about a cuisine I had not tried yet so I chose Viva Las Arepas.   Viva Las Arepas serves authentic Venezuelan food in a fast food like environment.   I came here with two of my classmates and we almost sampled every item on the menu. I personally ordered the garlic shrimp arepa; tequenes pastelitos; fried plantains; cheese empanada; and a mango beverage. The tequenes was the worst of them all; which contained an uncooked cheese stick in the middle. The arepa contained baby sized shrimp and was too fishy for my taste. The cheese empanada was tasty and the cheese was actually melted; mango beverage way too sweet; and the plantains while having a nice flavor were extremely greasy. The overall consensus on the food was that everything was too greasy.   I wish I was more a fan of the food here because it's right around the corner from my house and the owner Felix is a good man.

Ever since eating at Caracas arepa Bar in. NYC I've been on te hunt for good arepas in and surrounding Los Angeles. I'm very happy to say I've found another spot I know deem worthy in Las Vegas.  I was even happier to discover this is the same establishment that was once a small stand outside the neighboring bar Dino's.   You've come a long way and do not disappoint. The arepas are delicious and filling! Good sauce too. The decor isn't anything amazing, but this isn't the kind of place where it really matters. The restaurant was packed with what I'm assuming was mostly a local crowd since its a little off the main strip.   All I can say is there is now a quick and easy place for me to grab a bite that will compete with my outstanding craving for Capriottis.   Good job guys! I can't wait to come back.

This place doesn't look like much but its worth stopping. I came with a few friends which I'm very happy about since I was able to taste a few arepas. I tried the shredded beef, shredded chicken, tongue, pernil (roasted pork) and the reina pepiada (chicken and avocado mix)  I can't say which one was my favorite since they were all amazing. Each one is about $5 and I was pretty full after eating just one.  If you are in the area this is a must stop.

Ordered the wood fired chicken arepas, tequenos, the beef empanadas, pork rinds, and the spare ribs. Everything was delicious. Ribs were full of a smokey flavor. Beef empanadas were probably my favorite, followed closely by the tequenos. Tequenos were like fried cheese sticks. There was only one to an order, but it was plenty with all the other food we ordered.

Tasty.... but I feel there could be improvement. Maybe a bit more bang in the flavor.  I'll have to come back again sometime and then update my review. I've only been here once, so I don't want to give it 5 stars on my rating so far.
Great Venezuelan food. Best place to watch traffic on the strip.

I don't know why we haven't stumbled upon this place sooner! Everything we had, from the empanadas to the arepas, to the carne asada fries were bomb! I need to bring more people here in order to sample more things! Between my husband and I, we ordered way too many items - chorizo and potato empanada, two #3 arepas, a #12 and a #13 (the sweet corn and cheese one), and carne asada fries. We loved how smoky the meat was. It adds a whole other dimension of flavor to the experience.   Another one to add to our ever-growing list of great eats in Vegas!

I don't know why yelp isn't updated but this place moved from a stand to a shop and the prices went way way up. Everything is from $6 and up including tax! That's double the prices the pictures are saying so you've been warned!   When you double your prices you got to do something different. Bigger sandwiches, something. These arepas are very good and a nice change from the usual Mexican food in LA, but it's not a good value. I would be perfectly happy paying $3, not the $6 I paid. The bread was clearly made fresh and it was good. The beef was very well seasoned. Unfortunately I wasn't satisfied. I would have been fine buying two for $6 but not 2 for $12. To be full you need 2 which makes the cost of these ridiculous!   No wonder why this very highly rated place had nobody in it. It seems as if they've passed on their added costs to the customers but that price hike scared everyone away. Amazing food or not I will not be back!!

Right price, awesome food. I ordered the roasted pork butt arepa and the tostones (which are fried green plaintains). All was gluten-free, which is a major plus for me. The only downside was the section of town it was in. I actually decided to pass on by at first and not eat there...but just knew I would regret it. It was very good...don't let the location scare you. The inside is very clean.

If you're down in Vegas you need to try this its a little past stratosphere and crazy good. I got the carne asada arepa and added avocado and cheese. delicious, I will definately be coming back here when im in the area

The area in which this restaurant is located is very sketchy. But, if you're not bothered by that or are an adventure seeker, by all means, go! Their food is authentic and great. The service is great also. The restaurant itself is spotlessly clean. We ordered some Empanadas (beef) and some Arepas (shredded chicken and black bean) and a few drinks. There are two bottles of sauce that are offered up with your food. The first is a reddish color and spicy and the second is an off-white sauce that is a blend of mayo, cilantro, garlic and lime juice that is absolutely delicious! I could put that on everything I eat and be very happy about it. So, we asked the recipe and she gave us the basic ingredients and my wifey made it at home recently. SOOOO good. This place is a solid choice for a tasty lunch. Go see them.

What a cap to an incredible weekend. A welcomed break from Vegas Strip food and our first real experience of off strip Vegas.  Darling customer service and most importantly...bomb arepas. And I don't tap into my 90s vocabulary often. It's just this is the only fair description. Your mouth and stomach will thank you.
Very tasty and filling. before leaving vegas thast weekend I just needed one more for the road sadly they were closed on sunday.  but will definitley be back on my next vegas trip.

a meetup group met here for dinner one evening. It was pretty cool because we all tried different items and we shared them. I have never had this type of food before so I don't really know how to compare it. But I can say that we had fun we enjoy ourself and we tried lots of new foods.

For arepas (corn flour sandwiches), Viva Las Arepas is definitely one of the best places in town. I came here the third day it was open, when it was still called I Love Arepas and when signage wasn't as visible and impressive. I met Felix, the owner. He really prides himself on his recipe for his corn masa bread. He has the bread ready and preps everyday. He has trays of the bread and when you order, he heats up the bread for you right in front of you for you to see. What you might not know is that his back is aching just so you can see what he is doing because he set the grill up lower, so whenever he cooks, he really has to bend over and strain his neck for you to see how he's cooking everything in the trailer.  The trailer is where all the business and eating is done. His storage is right next to Dino's Neighborhood Bar. If you ever ask him, he might show you. His storage is filled with Corn Flour. His arepas are Venezuelan. Arepas are also really popular in Colombia. Anyway, he uses the freshest ingredients. His aguas (juices) are from concentrate and blended with filtered water. He has guanabana (soursop), guayaba (guava), parchita (passion fruit) and mango (mango, lol).   My favorite sandwich is the  Reina Pepiada: Fresh chicken with avocado cream sauce, great textures and came out piping hot, so it was really delicious.   I have tried many of the other sandwiches. They're all really delicious. The empanadas are filled with fresh meats. Their dessert, quesillo, was really delicious. Even though Felix doesn't like it being compared with a cheese flan, I felt that would be how I would describe quesillo to anyone.   This might look like a fast food joint to you, but he really takes the time to care about and cook his food. He enjoys telling people about the process of making his food. I enjoy listening to chefs talk about how they make their food.    I had a great experience all five times that I went to this place. I think that everybody in town should try to hit up this spot at least once. It's really a gem.

AREPAS OF ALL SORTS!  I don't believe I have ever tried Venezuelan food... but I was definately wanting to try this place for a while. Small corner place in a tiny little plaza on Las Vegas Blvd in the down town area. Booths on the sides of the restaraunt & tables in the center.   You order your food & then you pick up your food when they call your name. There are two different digital menus.. one in English & one in Spanish.  CARNE ASADA AREPAS $5.50 - comes w/ lettuce & tomato... we also added avocado for $0.99 more. The meat was very tender & the maize dough was soft yet grainy... it was definitely new for me but good. Reminds me of a tamale made differently. Ahhahaaa   CHICKEN EMPANADA $3 - hot & good like a chicken dumpling deed fried w/ dough shell rather than wonton shell  BEEF EMPANADA $3   GUAVA PASTELITOS $3 - this was like an empanada shaped differently & it was filled w/ guava chunks & cheese. Very interesting combination but it worked  COCONUT PASTELITOS $3 - wasn't too fond of this since I'm not a big fan of shredded coconuts that is used for desserts because it gets wayyy to fake kinda sweet taste, but this also had cheese in it so it wasn't toooo sweet.
Very good.  I enjoyed the passion fruit drink along with my areapa.  Shady are but that was a plus in my book.  Good value

Everything here is great!  The arepas are amazing...especially with the spicy sauce or cilantro mayo which come in squirt bottles so you can add as much or as little as you'd like.  If you haven't had an arepa before... it's a small fried dough pocket stuffed with your favorite filling...and the filings here are spectacular!    My personal favorites are the pork or the shredded chicken with cilantro mayo.  So delicious!  The wood fired chicken is also amazing here. So much flavor in both the meat and the skin.  I like to have mine accompanied with fried yucca and plantains.    Stop by for a quick, delicious, cheap lunch!  Any time I'm north strip...viva las arepas is always a consideration!
Simply great place to visit. Great food, really good prices, and fast service. The is always friendly. Highly recommend them.

This review is based on our very first visit to this delightful cafe as we hurried to grab a lunch before sitting for the afternoon at City Of The World Art Gallery on Casino Center Drive.  First, the staff are attentive, quick, and knowledgeable. The chef himself kept assuring us we were getting our food rapidly after we stepped away from the counter.  The place was hopping!!  I zeroed in on the wood fired chicken arepas. These are chunky big servings and very tasty! My husband got the ribs with black beans and rice- and he was quiet for a long time, chowing down with pleasure. The seasoning is great!  I, a plantain fanatic, only saw the plantains after I ordered. Next time, for we shall return!!!

We love Viva on Las Vegas Boulevard and now we are so fortunate to live in between both locations!! We sat in and chowed down just now on the best Pabellon platter: shredded seasoned beef, black beans, rice and plantains, a half chicken with the greatest fries, and of course, as though I would starve ( no you cannot measure my midriff!! ) without take home food, we added enchiladas for tonight, and more plantains and flans. I think I have to just move next door. You get the same warm welcome and very helpful staff as you find on Las Vegas Boulevard, but a newer place and a great parking lot... You will love the people as much as the food!!!

Me and the boyfriend stopped in finally... he got the chicken arepa and empanada... he loved them! I got the beef arepa and fried plantains... we both got avocado and cheese on the arepas...  they tender, flaky, flavorful, and juciy. The cilantro sauce only enhanced the flavor. The staff were friendly and courteous. We will be back for sure.

Amazing food! Not the best area of town and not sure I'd want to go with the family after dark, but this place is a foodies dream! Everything is made fresh, the staff is super friendly and helpful (especially since I'd never tried Venezuelan food before). Prices are also very reasonable and portions are very filling.
I'm only giving it a 4 star because I've tried better, but these arepas were really really good still.

OH MY GOD!!!!! What an amazing place. I am soooo thrilled to have found this on yelp and tried it! This is a must for anyone visiting Vegas PERIOD! I had the Reina Pepiada arepa.. and almost died!!! I also tried the pork, beef balck bean and cheese and they were all astonishingly good. I wanted to try it all. In the week that I was there I found this place the last couple of days before leaving and managed to go three more times! I also hadall  the pastelitos and my favorite was the cheese and coconut. Read the inspirational story behind the chef and owners story it was heart warming. PLUS you must go the the sister Gelatto store next door.. also break taking desserts!
Food is ok although a little over-priced. Service leaves a lot to be desired. Ordered the two piece chicken and side. Think it was the smallest chicken ever. $6-7 for an arepa is highway robbery.

Viva Las Vegas? Nah, Viva Las Arepas!  A couple of buddies told me about this place and how they have cheap yet satisfying food. My cousin and I took a trip on a Tuesday afternoon for some grub. The restaurant is located on the left when going north on Las Vegas Blvd on Wyoming. The place is quite clean and large with tables and booths.    There are pictures of their food items posted all over the restaurant. Those helped with familiarizing myself with their food items but didn't help in the sense for me to choose what I wanted since they all looked so delicious!   After reading Yelp reviews and getting a recommendation from the girl behind the counter, my cousin and I decided to get the Reina Pepiada. In between two warm cornbread slices, there was shredded chicken breast with avocado, mayo, cilantro and green peas. The consistency was almost like a chicken salad. I was a little thrown off with how warm the cornbread slices were and how cold the chicken concoction was. But I got past this in a hot minute and chowed down happily.   We were given a red bottle (spicy hot sauce) and a yellow bottle (mild hot sauce) to have with our arepas. A little sprinkle of some hot sauce (I like the spicy but the mild is good, too) with each bite is key to elevate flavors. And a side note, don't be fooled by the "small" size of the arepa. This little baby fills you up. I walked out of there overly stuffed.   To wash it all down, we each ordered a fruit juice. What's cool is that they let you try samples before you buy one. My cousin ordered the guava juice and I ordered the mango. I expected the juices to be a little thick, but they weren't. Very refreshing and not too sweet. Doesn't taste artificial. I think I will end up craving their mango juice during the hot Vegas summer months.  If you find a silly Asian girl chanting "long live the arepa!" here, that's me. If you find a female Asian bum on the corner of Las Vegas Blvd and Wyoming with a sign that says "will work for arepas," that's me, too. That being said, you all get the point. Go get some arepas!

Almost missed this place driving by, but found our way in.  There was a short wait which is always a good sign.  I had the shredded beef empenada and the chicken, avocado, mayo, cilantro arepa.  The portions appear to be small, but they fill you up!  I could barely finish both.  The food is delicious and definitely a menu that I want try all of.  The service is also quick and friendly.  Even though we ordered at the counter someone came to our table to make sure everything was ok.  Will be back for more.

*BEST IN TOWN*  You want to do Vegas right? You come here. It's a local gem that's evolved from a food truck to a full on restaurant. Their meat is succulent and it's an authentic grub spot for South Americans and Latin food lovers.  Recommendations : Add cheese and avocado to any arepa. Their wood fire chicken is amazing. Have their soursop or maracuya (Passion fruit) juice.  Great spot for your hang over needs.  I LOVE AREPAS! VIVA LAS AREPAS!
I come here for lunch today and this is a Authentic Venezuela. Before I thinking is soso but when I test it. Omg it's nice and good for first time.

Arepas looks like larger English muffin slices, heavier than crunchy corn taco shell.  Filled with oozing tastiness.  I got the Reina Pepiada.  Look at the pic!  I didn't consume it right away since the empanada was easier to eat while driving.  Mistake - should never wait to eat it later cuz it tastes so much better hot and freshly made.  Kinda thinking Arepas would taste awesome with some beer!  First time to try arepas and I see why they want arepas to live long.  Or it could be cuz we're in Vegas and it rhymes with Viva Las Vegas!  Now pause... You hear Elvis singing?  But I wouldn't order the empanadas again.  I tasted a little sour in it like vinegar.  Could've been the filling... I dunno.  For sure would try another arepas.

Hmmmm.   So maybe this just isn't my kind of food but I wasn't crazy about this place.   It's REALLY CLEAN. And the employees were really friendly. But I didn't love the food.   I had the chicken and the shrimp arepas. I was not that impressed. It was just okay. I don't think I'll care enough to ever eat them again.   Not my favorite.

It's located in downtown. So when we first got there there was no customers. The place seems a little shady. But, we still went in and I am glad we did. The staff are friendly, the place is cleaned, they have the English menu on one side and Spanish menu on the other side. They have pictures of the food along the wall that help if you are a first timer. We ordered tons of food to tried. Tequeños is probably about 4-5 inches long. Pretty good size. It was very good. Arepas con carne mechada with cheese- the meat was very good and flavorful. Arepa con pollo with mayo and cilantro. Wow!!! That was fantastic. It's a must try. We also order cachapas too- very good. You will not go wrong with any of the item on the menu. Will definitely come back again if we are in Vegas.  The only thing is they don't have chicha- little disappointing.

I came here when they only had a little arepa stand.  I'm glad to see them expand to an actual sit down establishment.  Food and service is still excellent!!  I think the prices have been raised since the move, but it's so worth it.  About $5 per arepa.  I like the beef, chicken, pork, and chicken with avocado arepas.  Fried plantains are excellent, as well as their fresh juices.    Their hot sauce is killer!!!

Only been once and we tried 2 arepas, the prices are around $6 and you may think you can eat more than one, but I couldn't. The arepas are made fresh to order and they don't skimp on cheese or meat. They don't seem that big, but believe me, you will leave very happy.
I have tried the #1 and #7 on different occasions and both times were great experiences. Also a must try is the fried plantains...delicious! Would definitely recommend to anyone to try.
All tho the place is on the corner of las Vegas blvd. It's worth standing outside. The food taste so fresh and service was excellent.  price for what u get is a steal !!
Best Streaming twice. Friendly. Clean Not expensive. Will come back for more Quality food

This place is incredibly clean and comfortable. I got a wood-fired shredded chicken Arepa with just cheese, and they give you a spicy green salsa and creamy cilantro sauce on the side complimentary! The ground maize which serves as the "bread" has great texture and was incredibly filling, and the the chicken was so juicy and smokey. The fried plantains were rich and mildly sweet. If you're looking for something off the beaten path of tacos and burritos, check this place out!
Good food at a great price.  Nothing special, but a great find for Vegas fare. Would recommend.
Had the Reina Pepiada Aerepa and the Asada Arepa, the ingridients are fresh, the staff is friendly, I would definetly visit them again next time I'm in vegas
Amazing arepas! Vegetarian, shrimp and pabellon arepas were delicious. Empanadas are delicious. Staff is super nice and friendly.
Clean, service is great, very friendly staff, great for lunch. Oh! Food is amazing.  Fries crunchy. Fountains drinks and juice.

Let's talk about this. Do order an arepa. I recommend the vegetarian one with beans and avocado but that's just cuz I'm a vegetarian. Get cheese in it. Consider putting a damn egg in it. Do use all of the light green sauce they give you and maybe the dark green hotter one. This is all excellent. Excellent. But don't bother with getting the sides.  Stop rethinking this and just follow the directions I already gave you.
This place is amazing. Great food , prices and service. So much to choose from so the guy told us a little bit about the menu and gave us some suggestions.  Excellent is an understatement
I'm obsessed with this place, it's super good and the staff is very friendly! The Reina Pepiada is my fav!

I love this place and eat here regularly. My favorite items are the #12 Pabellon Arepa - the plantain makes it amazing. The #13 Cachapa - this is like a quesadilla made with a pancake. And both Guava/cheese and Coconut/cheese Pastelitos. These are like gourmet poptarts. The passion fruit juice is also very good way to wash it all down.

Great little place just north of the Stratosphere. All the arepas are good. I personally like the Reina Pepiada and the Garlic Shrimp. My wife and daughter always stick with the Black Beans and Rice and get a cheese empanada. Don't go for the ambience as you are sitting on the strip right across from OC - a gentleman's club. The area can seem sketchy but the food is cheap, tasty and a great alternative to fast food.

Alright, driving down the strip wondering what's a good place to grab a small bite to eat, to my best ability as a yelper- it lead me here... this place wasnt hard to fine.. On corner of Oakley*  The restaurant is big and tons of space to sit.. Wasnt busy when I came through.  I order the woods-fire chicken arepas with cheese and avocado and a side of fried yucca root and pork.  First time trying arepas but it tasted like tomale due to the fact they used corn as the bread... And came with shredded chicken.   Overall I was satisfied with the arepas but Its a bit pricy for just this.. 4.99 for a small bite with no side.  The yucca root and pork was good but hey fried yucca root taste like fries with a bit texture difference, and the fried pork was flavorful.  This is a good place to stop by for a small bite :D some come try it out :D

I have recently become an arepas fan. Only in the last year have even discovered them and since then I am on the look out for them when I travel. We came across this restaurant by chance searching for food on google. It's a little hole in the was with a relaxed and open atmosphere. People come in relaxed and leave happy. I ordered El Pabellion and Reina Pepida. Both were absolutely amazing! They also had fresh strawberry juice. This place is so good. I highly recommend a visit.

I LOVE THIS PLACE. It deserves a 4.5 because the parking lot sucks and the seating isn't so comfy. BUT OH THE AREPAS. I'm sorry I'm shouty in all caps but seriously, I'm from the east coast and I can't get arepas like this. I loved them and they were exactly like what I'd eaten when I lived in Venezuela. I wish they had an arepas place around here. I would destroy it on a daily basis. Highly recommend!

This was a fantastic sandwich. From the loads of meat inside to the potato shelling of the arepa, I was in a great place while eating. Both the chicken and beef were great but that beef was something else and had a full on sandwich feel with the inclusion of tomato and lettuce to make sure you fill up. I had two sandwiches which in hindsight is a lot because you really need 1 and a side or 1.5 for a nice meal, but I was just in a zone with the taste and couldn't stop. They have a few sauces to add on which could have been spicier but overall good selection of juices to add on. I would say service is a little slow as I went during an off hour and still had a 15 minute wait. Also, $5 might be a $1 high for this size of a sandwich but I'm willing to pay for quality. Just get 2 and a side and a you're set for the next couple days. Great choice if in the area and looking for a unique meal.

What a treat to have authentic Venezuelan arepas five minutes drive from north strip (Encore/Wynn).  Reina pepiada all day, everyday if it were near me. My husband and I are usually happy to split our dishes so we can try more things, but this one was not easy to give up half (wait you took the last bite already?!). The saucy chicken avocado cilantro mixture is oh so refreshing for a hot summer day. I would award the pork butt a distant second place, it was a good one to start with, I like to end with my favorite flavors :)   For the arepa newbie, just because they look small doesn't mean they aren't super filling... 2 is sufficient for a hungry person, 2.5 if you're slightly hungrier, and 3 you are willing to sacrifice stomach comfort for the experience of more flavors. Nom.
This is such a great place to grab a quick bite. The arepas are very flavorful and there are many varieties to choose from. If you're ever near hear do yourself a favor and eat here.

This is my 3rd time eating here in 3 days! Found this place under Gluten-free on yelp and had to give it a try. Their food is delicious and CHEAP! I've tried a few different items on the menu and always left satisfied. For breakfast, I ordered the vegetarian arepa with scrambled eggs. Ooh my, now that was a yummy meal! You can't go wrong eating here. Everything is fresh and flavorful.  Their fruity drinks are the best, they are so fresh, you can taste the pureness. This is definitely going to be a place I eat at every time I'm in Vegas!

The location is interesting. Very much downtown Las Vegas, in a strip mall, with somewhat sketchy looking surroundings, but plenty of well lit parking in front. The interior was very clean and they even have a bilingual menu with a wide assortment of options beyond just arepas.   The portions are large. Even with a healthy appetite I was only able to eat one of the two arepas I ordered. The bean and cheese arepa was delicious, but just a little on the bland side of flavor. The shredded beef arepa was more flavorful. They have a spicy green mole sauce and a tangy cilantro sauce which are served with your food, if you enjoy more flavor.  The service itself was attentive, well thought out, friendly and helpful.   All in all a good spot for great food, great service and an interesting experience. I would definitely recommend Viva Las Arepas to anyone who enjoys Latin flavors or more specifically, authentic Venezuelan cuisine.

Yummy!! Fresh ingredients and the prices are totally affordable! My husband and I initially tried to share an arepas (wood fired chicken) and an empanada (black bean & cheese)... We had to go back for seconds! Sooooo good! And their mango juice is super tasty too :)

Vegas goes Venezuelan.  These arepas and empanadas are the hottest things to come out of Venezuela since their women! While they lack a sultry accent and their physical appearance isn't as stunning, these bites are just as alluring as any Venezuelan vixen.  In pursuit of another worthy eating destination away from The Strip, I learned of Viva Las Arepas from a local. It is on S. Las Vegas Blvd at Oakey just north of The Stratosphere. Before they were here, they operated out of a food stand.  The shredded chicken empanada ($2.75) was warm and crispy. After taking the first bite to expose the inside, I recommend throwing some of their green sauce into that bad boy to kick up the spice.   My garlic shrimp arepa ($7) was piping hot (in temperature) so I had to wait for it to cool down. It was moist and slightly started falling apart on me as I ate it. They stuff it with plenty of juicy shrimp so it was satisfying despite the challenge of taking it in. All other arepas cost less than the shrimp one. The shredded beef/Mechada ($6) is often my go to arepa.  You can bet I'll be back to get some nice Venezuelan ass too (or "pork butt" as it's called on their menu).  This area isn't particularly desirable or Vegasy but I'll take some arepas and empanadas over uninspiring overpriced Strip food any day. For those that are on a mission to find quality authentic food, and couldn't care less about glitz and glamour, this is your place!   Plus, the highly acclaimed Art of Flavors (gelato) is right next door (update/edit: it really isn't anymore as the Chef now works at Gelatology).

OMG new spot to get some delicious Venezuelan arepas!  I have never had one before so I really can't compare arepa to arepa, but these little guys are so delicious for about $5 a pop!  Cheap delicious eats!  So happy that Anne L. introduced me to this place.  Here is what we tried: 1. Reina peplada: the most popular.  Chicken, avocado, mayo, and cilantro.  Served cold.  What is not to love??? 2. Pork butt: it is delicious with cheese added!  Soft pork, sorta like a pulled pork sandwich. 3. Woodfire beef: with tomato, lettuce, and onion.  Tender beef with all the veggies. 4. Garlic shrimp: fully loaded and can be served hot or cold.  5. Fried yucca and pork rinds: this was surprisingly delicious!  I was scared about eating pork rinds but they went well with the yucca!  It's like interesting fries :)  Some other notes: - bad area but nice restaurant. - right across the street from Luv-It's Frozen Custard! - the sauces are amazing - the bread is toasted and yummy  Can't wait to come back and eat everything here.  Haha.

Excellent Venezuelan fare. I say that with pride because I am Venezuelan and this food is just as close as it gets.   I love it all, there isn't one dish i don't like and i am sure you will agree. The food  however is a bit heavy and very filling, ordera few things to share.   Cachapa con queso or pabellon (corn pancake with cheese or pabellon style) Deliciously sweet and salty, moist and just made to order.  The empanadas are excellent too, deep fried and full of flavor. Get any of the meats with this.  The arepas are great too, our staple. The masa is thin and generously filled with the works. I like it with pabellon as well because that style has cheese, plantains, shredded beef and not too much of black beans cooked to a mush.   You can also get a side of fried plantains (sweet and browned). And the green sauces? put that $#!t on everything!  I had a passion fruit juice (parchita) which was just okay. You can't expect them to get the real fruit there, in the middle of the desert!I would go with a soda or malta. Or keep it light with some water, free.   Nothing in this place will let you down. This is Latino Food that not everybody gets to try but should.   Cheap, easy parking, fast service. A good break from the strip food.
Ordered: Fried plantains, pork butt arepa, ham&egg arepa, beef empanada and mango juice  Amazing  Best quick breakfast in vegas

This is such a great find!  Never have had Venezuelan food but simply amazing, simple and fresh. Neighborhood was questionable but inside is clean, cute and fast. I've had the arepes and empanadas only. Can't seem to order anything else Cuz I am hooked.   Salsa too hot for me but garlic sauce is so good on everything.  I get my lunch to go...but they have cute patio area if you are not in a rush.

I was excited about having fresh Christmas Venezuelan Hallacas instead I received some frozen garbage that looked like they came from the bottom of the freezer from two years ago! I'm going to enclose a pictures and I can tell you that the taste was terrible they all fell apart when you opened them and they didn't taste good! Don't throw your money away at this overpriced low-quality restaurant. They don't use gloves either everything is touched by their bare hands dirty establishment.

What a great introduction to Venezuelan food, outstandingly friendly cashier and delicious and reasonably priced.  The Arepa is their specialty. To me it was sort of the ingredients of a gourmet tamale in different proportions turned into a sandwich. Basically they make a  corn tortilla about 1/4" thick, grill it up, then add your choice of several delicious fillings. They give a couple of types of sauces that can be used with it, they also are outstanding: a pepper sauce and a creamy muted garlic sauce. And the cutie at the counter also implored us to get the yucca fries, and holy moley was she spot on- they blew us away.  And they're open until midnight and have easy parking right in front, steps away. Had our meal in my hands within 5 minutes.  I'm gonna be seeking out more Venezuelan food in my life, this was hands down some of the best "fast food" I've ever had.   Thanks, viva las Apepas!!

I guess you already know - this place has some delicious food.  I eat these arepas on an annual basis - and it's consistently awesome, even through the transition from the tiny walk-up stand/shack to its new restaurant location (on the next block over). I had never been to the physical location before, and decided to check it out this time. My friend and I got to the restaurant at like 11:58PM and they close at midnight (oops), but Felix welcomed us warmly and insisted we eat there as opposed to getting it to-go. We both wanted the reina pepiada arepa, but they only had enough for one so he gave us an extra beef arepa and the cachapas for FREE! After I ordered I asked what a 'pastelito' was, and when our food came out, he brought out an order of the guava pastelitos...for FREE. That man is so dang NICE.  -Wood-fire beef arepa ($5): Really good meat - I like the shredded beef better, but this wood-fire technique is apparently new? Good savory flavor but I personally like the shredded texture better - less meat falls out with each bite. -Reina pepiada arepa ($5): I normally dislike mayonnaise, but this is sooo good. The chicken+cilantro+flavors+avocado are like the best chicken salad you've ever had. -Cachapas ($5): Never had this before, we loved it! thick gooey cheese between SWEET corn pancake thingies. They weren't tortillas - more like thin cornmeal pancakes, and were sweet. Sweet and sorta salty from the cheese. So. Good. -Guava and cheese pastelito ($2): Reminded me of wontons but filled with guava jam and chunks of chewy cheese. Again great flavor - sweet from the guava but savory from the dough and cheese.  Everyone working there was so nice - we definitely were the last people in the dining room, and they didn't rush us at all even though Felix told us when we left he had to be back there at 7:30 the next morning! I felt so bad but the overall experience was seriously awesome. This is for sure on my list anytime I go to Vegas.
Good lunch spot.  #7 arepa (Reina Pepiada) is great!

Sooo good!  We stopped by on our way to fremont street from the strip. It was almost empty at the time (9:30 pm ish) but the place seemed clean and well kept. The lady that rang us up was super friendly and patient with us as we were not too familiar with the menu.  I got the carne asada and jamon y queso (ham & cheese) arepas with a guava and cheese pastelito for dessert and the passionfruit drink.  First off, these arepas are HUGE. I eat a lot, and 1 1/2 of these bad boys sure filled me up.  They're not skimpy on the fillings at all. It may not look like it at first glance, but these arepas are STUFFED to the brim. The carne asada was seasoned well, and there was this melty, gooey cheese literally spilling out of my ham and cheese arepa. My boyfriend gave me a bite of his Reina Pepiada and I really digged the avocado and cilantro sauce that it was cooked in.  I was a bit confused on the guava and cheese pastelito as they put a piece of actual cheese (think of almost like a squeaky mozarella cheese curd) needless to say, I was expecting cream cheese like they serve in Miami. But I'm familiar with cheese being dessert so it was interesting.  Whenever Im back in Vegas I will make sure to come back, so happy to have stumbled on this place!
Let me say it in simple terms...it's so tasty!!!!   If you're in Vegas this is a must try.   The Arepas are so delicious.

ZOMG.  After my friend (who also works as a chef in the Comme Ca in vegas) told me to come here, I decided to give this place a try after one drunken night of drinking a bit too much of Mrs.Belvedere (Grey goose ftw).    Buy anywayz, I was DEFINITELY blown out of the sky with their Shredded Beef arepa.  It was f'in money (substitude "f" for watever you want).  Although I've never had an arepa, I DO know what good food is all about.  This place just hits a sweet spot that's so sweet, that your sweetness will die of being sweet.  I would never imagine myself giving a little food stand 5 stars, but I have no choice.    If you are looking for some drunk food in vegas, look no further.  In fact, you don't even have to be drunk to enjoy this place.  Just come here and enjoy a fantastic Venezuelan arepa.  Oh, and I also had the chance to take a bite of the empanada...fried to perfection.  For hangover pre-medication, try the sugar cane juice with lime.  For $1.50, you can't go wrong.  I was a little confused on how to get here (drunk, but I wasn't driving fyi), but coming from Las Vegas Blvd, head past the Stratosphere and stay on your right as you come to a fork.  You'll see it a block ahead.  This place closed at 12am.

I loved the arepas! Local friends brought us here as we passed through on our way to California. Got the pork arepas and half a grilled chicken. Came with beans and rice and all was plenty for the two of us. Would come again for sure.

The best Venezuelan food I have ever had in 27 years on earth. I have been to Phoenix, Portland Michigan and California and nothing comes close. Not even a light year close. The sauce they give out is the best with the food. Just go there and try something and everything. It is in one of my favorite eateries to go to in Vegas. I only have a few.

Hands down freakin' awesome once you find it! The address given on Yelp doesn't take you anywhere near this place.   I lucked out and found a parking spot right out front. I was greeted upon entering and was quickly and easily able to make a selection. My go-to arepa is pork with cheese and avacado. The ones they serve up here do not dissapoint. I splurged and ordred plaintains, which we perfectly fried. Arepa, plaintains anddrink were around $12!   I could never go to Vegas and dine in a fancy schmancy restaurant knowing places like Viva Las Arepas exist! I would recommend this place to anyone in the area.

You guys food is bad your meat is bad and you got 2 of my family members wrong. You are crazy your nut. you guys are your food is way worse than raw eggs.  Food was bad but service was so terrible I'd rather let me 9 year old write a review he thought it was bad   Where to start we love the other location  They got our order wrong in so many ways  Called in a pick up and didn't start till we got there so I knew it was going to take a while so I asked the bald head guy that said he was the owner to put on the game and he said ok, just give me a sec. Ok....to go meal completely wrong sides  RAW chicken in my sons dish Completely wrong arepa got beef when my girl ordered chicken  Mind you the restaurant was slow the bald head owner still didn't put on the game   After waiting 25 minutes getting home to over less than mediocre food we called to get resolved just to be hung up on

Luckily, our family lives in the area near this place so we get it fairly regularly.  Had no clue what an arepa was before coming here but now I'm hooked.  My wife and I just need an excuse.  Highly recommend swinging by the gelato shop next door for desert as well.  Awesome stuff.

The reina pepiada arepa was amazing!  Great creamy garlicky chicken salad.  The arepa was warm and crispy!  The service was great and friendly and attentive.  My only criticism is no fountain soda.  Not a deal breaker but worth a mention.

I've tried this when it was still the stand outside and it was awesome. Decided to try this before going to Art of Flavors on a date night around town (Dinner and Dessert in the same lot! WINNER!). Upon going in I noticed it was a different menu. A bit of a bummer, but oh well. The guy behind to counter was very nice and helpful. He confirmed that they did indeed change the menu to give it a new feel. He also helped us out by telling us what was the most popular orders. We ended up just getting the pork butt arepa because we were a bit full. All I can say is they still got it! Still fresh, flavorful, and just delicious. I'll definitely be going back when I'm in the neighborhood.

WOW! I've had arepas a few times elsewhere, but the arepas here are massive and stuffed full of goodies!  There are a ton of arepas to choose from, and they are very filling plus not too expensive. I usually need two arepas or one arepa and a side to feel full, but I eat a lot. They have some grilled items if you are not feeling arepas, and various sides/beverages as well.   Place your order at the counter and give your name, and your name will be called for pickup when ready. Service is good but minimal, as this is a fast casual dining establishment.   There are a good number of seats inside, but the parking lot is not that big.   It's a simple looking eatery serving up some unique and tasty food!

Came here today and the owner was so nice. He replaced my drink with a different one for free when I didn't like the taste. I ordered a cuchapa and it was the most unique thing I've had all year. What a wonderful place
Great place the cheese empanadas are the best of the best also the staff is friendly, they definitely have a loyal customer here thank you VIVA LAS AREPAS
The best arepas in town! Try the pork butt or the reina pepiada, and make sure you order  the mango water to go with it. The employees are super friendly too

This is gluten free heaven! My friend introduced me to this place and I am always hesitant to try new foods when I am unfamiliar with the ingredients and when there is a possibility there could be a translation problem that I need to be wheat free! I checked out the menu online and saw I could order a plate, then I noticed gluten free on the website and I cheered, I can eat a sandwich!  I ordered the wood fired beef, plantains and the lime with cane sugar drink and it was absolutely delicious! They give you sauces to add to the sandwiches that was fabulous, the plantains were yummy as well as the drink it went perfect together. I look forward to trying the other meats they offer.  There is a patio outside however there are no misters so it could be a little warm during the day but for a summer night it will work! That area of the Strip is a little dicey but it is part of the charm!

While I was enjoying my lunch in this establishment, my purse tipped over and dumped several of my credit cards under the table. I didn't realize this until many hours later, and I called around to the places I had been hoping they had been turned in. I was delighted to discover that they had been found, and put in a safe place. The manager even called American Express and asked them to notify me that they had my cards.   So, the area is sketchy, but the staff here is honest and goes above and beyond to provide excellent customer service.

I've realized there's two ways you can give stars, you can give it based on how much you like it, or based on how good it is at what it's supposed to be. This for starts is the latter.  I've never had arepas before, but it's a weird mix between a taco and slider inside of a crumbly white corn bun. The bun to me is what really separates it from anything else. It's like cornbread, texture wise with not much taste. Wasn't exactly my favorite part of the meal. It did have a good crunch from them coming on the griddle though.   The filing is very similar to tacos. We got the wood fire beef (#1) which is like diced beef, pork belly (#4?), and chicken (#7). The best was the beef. The pork belly reminded me of frozen pre made pulled pork with heavy sauce. The chicken was way too over sauced and the sauce was just creamy, no flavor.  The food also came with two sauce, a spicy sauce, and the same sauce they used with the chicken arepa. The spicy sauce was very forgettable, hardly any spice. The cream sauce way actually decent and tasted better in smaller doses then flooded with chicken.   Overall this was not my favorite experience, but I realize it maybe more sure to my taste buds than anything they did.
Que sabrosas la arepas!I stopped in right after they closed but were kind enough to make me some arepas to go. So delicious and fresh ingredients. Looking forward to my next visit!

First time here today & I for sure know it won't be my last! I had the #7(forgot the name) but it was delicious. I also had a bean & cheese empanada. The food was very flavorful. Nothing overpowering and all the different ingredients complimented each other in this amazing meal. The passion fruit drink is great as well.  Definitely will recommend to everyone!

I had tried the chicken & spinach arepas, also the beef & it was so yummy!! The only con was the arepa itself is hard, I'm not sure if it was left out too long or just a bad batch but the fillings are so good & on point! The size is perfect for a snack or just a small bite to get you going. Their prices are not bad either! Will be coming back :)
Amazing Venezuelan food! Get #1, #7 (get the shrimp hot), and coconut or guava empanadas!

Absolutely fantastic food! I got three Arepo's the wood fired beef, the chicken, & the pulled pork. All three were magnificent! Each tasted completely different. Each sandwich is also gluten free. What really stood out was how incredible and fresh everything was. It was as if someone 's grandma had worked her magic to make everything so perfect. Each sandwich, or Arepo's cost $5. The shredded beef empanada was $3 and the dough was so fresh. The beef was moist and delicious. I had a hard time sharing. They also had a really interesting drink menu with passion fruit , coconut water, and soursop. If you are in Vegas , this place cannot be missed. Great for lunch!

Stopped to eat here after seeing so many reviews and stars. The food came and it was raw beef. The pictures are all zoomed in to make it look like its Huge. What a disappointing experience. And it was expensive.

Viva Las Arepas is great! Deliciousness, a great value and friendly service... can you go wrong?  They have lots of options for carnivores, herbivores, omnivores and everyone in between. The garlic shrimp is yummy and so is my basic stand-by, beans and cheese (with added avocado!). For side dishes, their fries are deliciously crisp and their fried plantains are awesome as well.  On our last visit I tried the cachapa for the first time, which was like a really yummy, salty-sweet, corn and cheese pancake or crepe. I am kind of craving one right now.  The only reason I am not giving 5 stars is because I once found a hair in my reina pepiada arepa, and that was gross. But everything else has been great and we have brought visitors here with great success. Viva las arepas!
My absolute favorite in town. The best place for some awesome food. Awesome service and definitely a must visit in town.

I've always drove pass this place whenever I'm down at the culinary pharmacy, but never thought to actually stop by and try it. I mean I've had Arepas before, but that was in Denver, at a food truck festival. So obviously they were bigger and expensive. So I finally gave in and told my bf and parents that we should go have lunch there. So we did!  We ordered 2 wood fire beef with cheese, 2 shredded beef with cheese, 1 order of fried plantains, 2 orders of cheese empanadas, a passion fruit juice and a pineapple juice. THEY WERE AMAZEBALLS!!!! Everything came out hot and fresh. They weren't as big as I thought they would be though, so it's definitely an awesome spot to have an afternoon bite!   Customer service is awesome and the place is clean! I was so glad we made it in literally 5mins before the lunch rush.  I would definitely go back again!

Amazing authentic arepas y empanadas. Would come back to Vegas for this place in a heart beat. We had a cachapa, arepas de pabellon, and the empanadas de carne, queso, y pollo. The prices were great and service was great as well. After we ate we got a second round to go. I came with a Venezuelan friend and she says--- una de las mejores arepas que me he comido fuera de Venezuela. Muy buena sazón, el queso riquísimo y la carne divina!! Súper recomendado este lugar!

I finally found a place with some culture and charm. It has that thing that's missing in Vegas; a place you can go to get one thing made very well. Viva Las Arepas is inexpensive, super delicious, and something you will crave once you try it.

Sooo happy I got to take the hubby to the place that introduced me to arepas years ago. Back then I'm pretty sure it was just a food truck or atleast they had a food truck cuz I remember I got it from one.  In anycase I am thrilled to return 6 years later to find they are not only still up and running but thriving!  There was literally a steady line the entire time we waited. From door to counter.  And this was 11:30 on a random Tuesday! We got the pernil arepa and added avocado. Perfection isn't even a good enuf word frankly!  Seriously if you aren't eating here you are missing out BIG TIME!!!

Let's start with the bad...  LOCATION: Does not appear to be the safest location (fyi), but it is closest conveniently close to the strip. A block or two away from the Stratosphere and also behind a neighbor filled with hipsters and retirees. It's cultured to say the least. Depending on when you go, the parking lot is not to spacious and there's always ongoing traffic... just be careful.  VENUE: Stands out with its bright yellow interior. It makes me feel mellow and happy to be inside &good memories every time I drive past. There's also Venezuelan gelato shop right next door which its it feel very authentic. Along with the yellow, the photos of the menu all around and make my mouth watery as I try to figure out what to order. Music is welcoming and the bathroom is clean and might I add, cozy. Find out for yourself, lol.  CUSTOMER SERVICE: Very accommodating, always friendly as well as fast.  FOOD: There are two sauces you have to try! I always get my garlic shrimp arepa along with an empanada or two.... along with some fries and rice if I'm really hungry. The first time I came with my vegan friend and she devoured as much as I did on her own terms, so I'd always like to think this place is vegan-friendly. I'm never disappointed with my order because the food is always consistent and more than anything else, delicious!  OVERALL: I've recommended this place numerous times to people. I've tried an arepa from a food truck and nothing compares to VIVA LAS AREPAS! I've been in love with this place since it was a small food stand and if you're craving something that you fill you up with warmth and carbs. THIS IS IT!

Trusting my friends judgement was once again a great thing. I had the carne asada arepa and cheese empanada, with a side of great service, a funny spanish lesson, and the delicious armor of meat cooked over wood-fire. Mouth-watering!   Delicious, and well worth the drive away from the Strip.   And the price of the food can't be beat.

OMG, my significant other has been keeping this place from me.  I love the No. 7 Reina Papaida but everything we tried was fabulous.  Felix is very friendly and the staff always happy to explain the menu items.  I don't know how they make their Arepas but they are soooo good.  I have now been about 4 times in just a month or so.  The price is great too, only 4-5 dollars for one arepas.  The first time I went I ordered what turned out to be a feast but now I know better and keep it simple 1 arepas, and an empanada.

MMmmmm!! Arepas! I would say these things are crossed between a tamale and a pita bread all in one.  But, much better than a tamale.. I usually don't like corn based stuff like corn tortillas, but these are the exception.  I always get the pork butt with cheese. It is a little salty but very tasty.  The light green sauce will balance out the saltiness though.  I am obsessed with that sauce by the way.  I believe it is cilantro based? I have yet to try the other kinds they offer.  On to the place... the place is located in a dingy area of Las Vegas.  Parking can be tricky as it is limited and awkward.  It is located in a triangular intersection off of Oakey and Las Vegas Blvd.  However, once inside, the place is pleasant and clean and the employees are very friendly.  It seemed like they just upgraded their menu displays to flat screens.  I like how they have it in Spanish and English.  Anyways, I would say get your butt over there and try the pork butt!!!!  Happy Eating!
My favorite spot for lunch. The wood fire chicken plate with salad and beans always hits the spot for me. The arepas are great too. I come here at least 4 times a week

Straight up legit Best arepas, literally make excuses to come to Vegas just for them. Can't go wrong with a Reina pepiada. Staff is friendly and place is clean. Stop what you are doing and go. You're welcome!

This is a great place or friends took us too. The food is authentic and delicious. I highly suggest trying the yuca fries and both the tostones and a sweet plantains. They staff was very helpful and didn't mind us bringing our own beer. This is one place you want to try is your in town and our visiting.

Yes! I finally made it here. I had it book marked for the longest time and was reluctant to come to downtown. Anyways, found a spot to park at the back side of the building. They have outdoor seatings as well but the area at night creeps me out a little bit, LOL!  The food is very unique, and it's important to point out I learned that this restaurant is gluten free. I love the simplicity of ingredients focused on quality.   Imo, the meat is special because they are cooked with a traditional grill using wood which is a layer of flavor that is very distinct.  I ordered some take out: Asada Arepas, Empanada with beans & cheese and for deserts-Guava and cheese Pastelito.  Each arepa on the menu is only around $5-7 depending on what's inside it. You can add extra toppings like cheese, avocado, fried egg for .50 - $1.00.   The sauces were also excellent, not too salty, watery or too thick.  The lady at the cashier was very friendly and gave me suggestions on what to order.  Very reasonably priced, will be back when I am in the area.

Go off the beaten path and visit Las Arepas on your next Vegas trip. It's not on the strip, but rather in between the convention center and downtown. Totally worth a stop on your way to night out downtown! Arepas were perfection! The shredded beef is a must try. The service was absolutely fabulous, too. The owner, Felix, went above and beyond and made a very nice impression on us.

Loved the food! The staff was very curteous and helpful :)...they do not offer military discount however the owner granted the 10%off my entire purchase which was not just for myself but my family as well...im definitely coming back here!
This is one of the best Arepas I have everrrrrr had!!! If you are in the area, you should definitelyyyyyy check out this cute little place!! A must try!!

Sort of a let down for me - especially since arepas are my new found love. I think we got the reina pepiada arepa - the filling was good but the flat bread was sort of dry and lacks the soft chewey texture I prefer. It's not as good as the arepas I can get here in OC at Mil Jugos.

I've seen their other location on Las Vegas Blvd but have never had the opportunity to visit that location. This location is nestled in a quiet corner. I'm glad I stumbled upon this location because their food is really good. The staff is incredibly friendly, I told the woman who helped me that this was my first time here and she offered me a sample of the shredded beef (which is incredibly tender and flavorful). I took the suggestion of the woman who offered me the sample. I ordered the Arepas #12, it's pretty good. I misunderstood her description of it and thought the plantains came on the side but instead they're layered on the bun. If I could order again, I'd probably go with the Plato Pabellon which has all of the items separated from each other. I do like this arepas and would definitely order it again. The meat is tender, the plantains add a little bit of sweetness and the black beans fill you up. There's just the perfect amount of all the ingredients. Make sure you try their green chili and cremè sauce...it's so good!!
Bomb as hell!!!!!! So good I want to marry the yucca fries, the arepas... and so much more.

My friend located this restaurant on Yelp while we  were spending a week in Vegas for Rollercon. Really wish we had found this place earlier in the week. Bright and clean establishment with an easy to read menu.  Very pleasantly surprised.  I had the bean and avocado arepa.  Loved the homemade corn "bread" that filling was held between.  Really liked the two sauces that were served with the arepas.  One was like a watery ranch dressing and the other a watery avocado dressing.  Watery only describes the consistency.  Both dressings had a nice light flavor to them.  After eating I decided I wanted something  more and had one of their mango drinks which was quite refreshing and not too sweet.

We were staying at SLS for work and decided we needed to branch out and see what Vegas offered. Our first stop was Viva las Arepas where the signature arepas are available in a variety of flavor combinations. We loved what we ordered and returned several times during our stay.
I don't care if you don't know what Venezuelan food is. This place has amazing arepas. Don't know what an arepa is? Find out here! You will not be disappointed!

First time trying this restaurant and first time trying "authentic Venezuelan" food. I really liked it. I got a arepas reina pepiada (chicken breast, avocado and cilantro). They smoke their meat with hickory chips and you can taste it.  I say give this place a try!

Good arepas especially for all the mexican chefs. Usually my paisano chefs cook other latino food like mexican food but here they do a good job preserving the Venezuelan style :) I love that they have a shrimp arepa, not even in Miami do they have that :)  Todo es rico aquí. Me encanta que tengan una arepa de camarón. Me puedo comer como 5 de esas jaja. Proxima ida a las vegas de seguro regresare.

what a little gem of a place! I stopped there after shopping at the outlets for a late lunch. We had the Roasted Pork Butt, the Garlic Shrimp and a shredded beef empanada. The pork was mouth watering and full of flavor. My favorite was the garlic shrimp. Plenty of shrimp and garlic flavors bursting in your mouth! Can't wait to hit this place up again!

Oh arepas!!! I do love thee!!! Warning, if you are on a diet that requires you to neglect the decadent foods in life.. Don't come here, unless you want to be a rebel. I like rebels!!!  I had been here in the past, so I'm very well acquainted with the reina pipiada  arepa (stuffed with chicken salad avocado mix) which is one of my favorites, chicharron arepa, and steak arepa.. All favorites. I wanted something different, so I opted for the smoked pork ribs with a side of rice and beans and a cachapa. Oh lord.. Here it goes!  Smoked pork ribs- so tender it fell off the bones. The flavor was robust and a touch smokey, but not overwhelming. Just plain delicious. Black beans- almost tasted like chili beans... I ate them all. Rice- was yummy and like that it's mixed with corn and peas. Cachapa- I can eat these all day everyday. It's a sweet and savory corn pancake stuffed with ooey gooey mozzarella cheese. This dish alone will ruin any plans of obtaining that coveted 6pack. Stay away for it is HIGHLY addictive.   I fell in love with the food, but most importantly, with the friendly staff. They were also quite perceptive because as our server was ready to deliver the food, he noticed the table was wobbly, so he immediately bent down to adjust it. He came by a few times to check on us and made sure we were completely satisfied. I sure was.   Viva las arepas is a no brainer, and I will most certainly return until I have conquered every dish they have. Thank god pool season is over.

YELP 365 CHALLENGE 2014-(149/365) "How About a Pabellon Cachapa?"  Long awaited update, and first time in the brick and mortar location. Glad to see that they offer more than just Arepas now, and are open 24 hours on weekends.  Perusing the menu, a couple of things caught my attention-Pabellon, and Cachapa. Too bad they didn't have the two combined, because I've been searching for that killer combination after having it at Pica Pica Maize Kitchen in Napa. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/pica-pica-napa-2?select=D2QDnqVaFYS7EpRd-4XTqQ#Eo2CTtCtgsNwu0ZAaFIeiQ  Having already tried a few of the Arepas, we ordered both the Cachapa and Pabellon to share as well as their tasty Soursop Drink. These were both pretty good, but I wished they would offer more ways to have the cachapa than just cheese.fillings, or even a pabellon cachapa? (hint, hint!) maybe like any of the arepas  The Arepas are okay, but I just am not much of a fan of that masa pocket that holds all the fillings together, kinda like a Mexican Gordita which I'm also not really a fan of.  If worse comes to worse, I might even just order a cachapa and ask them to add the meat and plantains inside and charge me extra...that is, if and when a craving hits, because we're almost always next door anyway!  ALOHA!!!  Shaka Meter  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \u  3.25

one word: AMAZING! .......OK But I have to tell you why its amazing:   -Time: everything seems to be made to order! so it takes a little patience and its well worth it, I cant emphasize enough "its well Worth the wait" they are fast in overall, everything is fresh FRESH...F R E S H !!!! like home made cooking from remote places....  -TASTE: wow where do I start! this "Arepas" are like a small thick pita bread but made with corn and are delicious on their own, they slice them on the edge and stuff them with a shredded CHICKEN mix....that was great, I also had the ROASTED PORK BUTT, also freshly made, I had the REINA PEPIADA (chicken salad style) a bit too much mayo for my taste but never the less they are tasty, I also had the TONGUE and the TRIPE and my favorite was the EMPANADA also made with corn and extremely delicious made fresh stuffed with just enough beans and cheese for taste......My least favorite was the ALLACAS, which resemble a OaxacanTamale from southern Mexico wrapped in a banana leaf stuffed with chicken with green olives raisins and spices, the dough part of the ALLACA was soft and it melted in your mouth....my friends loved it.  -TO DRINK: They have REAL R E A L "RRREEEEAAALLLL"!!!! (comprende?) real juice of MANGO or TAMARIND or SUGARCANE or GUAVA or GUANABANA.....they were all excellent, thirst quenchers ....and yes I tried all of this in the same visit......it is simply good.   -CLEANLINESS: Well its a little 10x20 kitchen with tables on the parking lot....I took a peak inside the kitchen from several angles and its clean, almost as if it was new, people that work around that area kept coming and going for to go orders, the parking is old but clean.   -THE RUNDOWN: Just go, eat and behold grandmas cooking! and if you never had a grandma just adopt the cooks.  simply good food.
First time trying this place will definitely be back!!  Loved the wood fired chicken arepa!!  So tender and flavorful.

Este lugar es buenisimoooo tengo varios días aquí en Las Vegas y he venido casi todos los días les recomiendo todas sus comidas tienes buena sazón.... 5 estrellas para ellos, lo mejor de todo tiene wifi

Great food!  First time trying arepas and was very satisfied. I ordered the #5 Pernil (roasted pork butt)and it was great!! Taste just like grandma would have made them... if I was Venezuelan of course. I also ordered a coconut & cheese Pastelito. Very good too.

The arepas are very good and everything tasted so fresh.  Yes, it was kinda pricey, about $35 for two of us, but my eyes were too big for my stomach and I ordered two arepas when one was plenty.  I had the Reina Pepiada (chicken,  avocado,  mayo, cilantro) and ordered the Carne Asada but was too full to try.  Will give to my son.  My friend had the Garlic Shrimp (amazing!) and the Vegetarian and he was in Heaven!  We also had the chicharron and fried yuca, also delicious.

Really clean and inviting atmosphere, service was nice and happy to answer questions and offer good suggestions. We got a few of the arepas, wood fire chicken, shredded beef, reina pepiada. all of the arepas were great, want to try more next time. Had chicken and beef empanadas. we enjoyed all of the food we ordered, really filling. Can't wait to go back again and try more of the arepas.

Awesome food! The wood fired meat is amazing. The sauces they offer to put on them, especially the cilantro sauce, makes it something worth driving to. I recommend it to anyone coming in town to visit, or any local who is lucky enough to be repeat visitors.

If you're considering this place just go ahead and do it! It is sooooooo amazing. My bf and I HAVE to stop here every time we are in Vegas!! I wish I could bring this place home with me. My favorite thing is the beef Arapa!

I go to vegas once a year and I love this place...its my first stop when I am in town!! the chicken and avocado arepa has been my favorite for the past few years.. my daughter loves the grill cheese and grilled chicken. I cant wait to head back and have another....

After seeing the fabulous reviews on most review sites I thought I'd give it a try. I made it a mission to come here the first night I spent in Vegas. I'll start off by saying that the staff was friendly and the prices were very cheap and affordable (5 stars for that) however, the food was a let down.   We ordered a few dishes to share since it all looked good and we figured it's cheap enough not to break the bank. Can't say we were all that impressed by what we got. The meat dishes were quite bland and dry. Even the drinks didn't have much flavour. The only thing I enjoyed were the beans, rice, and plantains. Definitely not worth the $20 cab ride there and back. Perhaps I had set my expectations too high because of the reviews. I wouldn't tell anyone not to eat here but I will say don't set the bar too high.

Had the cheese tequeno. Yummy. Had the pabellon arepa (minus the meat) and this was delish!  Also had the guava and cheese pastry. This place is located off the strip, but not too far. Easily accessible by uber or a cab. Very nice people working there. Food came out fast. Ample seating indoor and outdoor. Green salsa was a great zing!
If you want fresh arepas, this is the place to go to when you're tired of the other Vegas food! Great price for your buck and stomach!

So Gosh darn good!  It's conveniently close to my office so huge shame on me for not visiting this place sooner.  I ordered the shredded beef arepa and a shredded chicken empanada.  I'm kicking myself though for not trying the beef tongue arepa.  That's when you know a place is really authentic.  When it offers body parts that turn people off when they see them in the menu, you know you've found something good.  Next time I'll try that arepa and see how it tastes.    For now though, I greatly enjoyed it, the chicken and beef were delicious and the sauces they came with on the side were perfect!  No ketchup needed, and just the right amount of spice.  Looks like I found a new downtown lunchspot for those days when I can't stomach the nearby cafes.

Food stand selling meat across a strip club selling a different kinda meat --- SO FUNNY and SO VEGAS!  I've heard so many things about this place, especially since my co-worker is Venezuelan. So after work, we decided to trek on over to (almost) DTLV.  Three friends and I split: beef tongue arepas, roasted pork butt arepas, shrimp arepas, and ham and cheese arepas. WOW, it's for sure what Misty said: HOT POCKETS BUT, WAY BETTER!!!!!! There was so much flavor in the meat. It was marinated well and dripping in juices or sauces.  Also, tried the gyobano (sp?) drink and a coconut dessert similar to an empanada. That drink tasted exactly like the fruit which is funny cuz I haven't had that fruit since I was a kid in Hawaii.  Service was cool and they had 2 for 1 arepas. It's, also, kinda fun to just eat on the streets of Vegas. Not those fancy schmancy restaurants on the strip.

Very clean. This business keeps their store immaculate and that is comforting. It's bright and seems like you are going to get some fast food quality but it's far better than any chain fast food.  The service is patient, kind, and helpful, Ask questions..you can see right into the kitchen. I was looking for empanadas because I was thinking about some delicious ones I had before in South America.  The arepas are amazing and so are the empanadas. There Are lots to choose from and if you are confused they have photographs all over the store to display what you are choosing.  There is this corn cheese pancake thing that is a must have. Come on an empty stomach and order everything! You will want to try it.  Love this place, I think the have a food truck too.  I would ask them please make empanadas de choclo? Corn and cheese...without the sweet

This Venezuelan food is authentically delicious! I highly recommend you try them if you're in Vegas. They have a location on & off the strip. Beautiful, delicious, authentic food ! Definitely coming back to try their other Arepas & fried Yucca next time we're in Vegas! My only regret is that they don't have any locations in California.

They moved about a block down the street to a larger establishment with plenty of indoor and outdoor tables. You could walk there from Dino's Lounge. I think they're even better now than the first time I tried them. The portion is generous and the pork butt arepa has so much flavor!
Great service tequeños aré wonderfull i eat some azada empanadas  great choice im coming back next time im in Vegas. High recomended

Comfortable indoor, outdoor dining in the heart of Las Vegas. My faves are the BBQ pork Ribs, fried yucca, passion fruit juice and the wood fired chicken is delicious as well. Friendly personal service.

I tried Viva Las Arepas when in Vegas at the recommendation of a friend and I was not disappointed. It's in a sketchy area on Rainbow Blvd near a lot of wedding chapels, but when you get inside, everyone is really friendly and nice. It is not a sit down restaurant, you go up to the cash register and order (kind of like at a mall fast food joint) and they give you your food on a tray with a bottle of sauce. I ordered the reina pepiada arepa, which was a chicken arepa with cilantro and avocado... it was delicious! There are tvs to watch while eating your food and several tables to dine at. They make some really good arepas!

Next time I'm in Vega I'll certainly be stopping here again. I was in my hotel room searching for a cure to my hunger pains when I ran across rave reviews for their pork butt arepa. I dragged my friend here so I could try it out, she ended up trying to the chicken. I was so greedy I had to try 2.   The pork butt and the chicken/mayo/avocado arepa were on my list to try. The pork butt hands down was my favorite. The other was very fresh and creamy a very good just not what I wanted after scarfing down the delicious pork arepa.   The service was also great. The guy running the register took his time to answer all my questions and even make recommendations as to the best sellers. I'll be looking for an imitation in LA to hold me over until I return.

On Las Vegas Blvd half between the Strip and Downtown this little gem of a place has great food at a price you won;t find anywhere else in Las Vegas. I went two days in a row and I will be back again. I want to try everything...
#2 arepa with avocado. So good! I was questioning this place at first, admittedly judging a book by its cover. But such a great little find.

So, they're basically like tortas, but the "bread" part is less like your typical starchy bread. The bread is like an english muffin (in this case I'm going to make it up and say it's more like a Venezuelan muffin than an english muffin) with a soft corn tortilla texture or flavor (because that is what it probably is).  I ordered the WOOD FIRED CHICKEN, PORK BUTT, CARNE ASADA arepa. You know they hold true to their word when they say wood fired when you can see the wood that they cook the meat in stacked in an area where you can see. Also, you can taste that delicious smoky, wood fired flavor in your meats. I'm no wood connoisseur so unfortunately I can't tell you what type of wood they used based on the flavor of the meats. I also don't eat wood on a regular (insert laughing emoji here).  You get the option of adding cheese ($0.50) and avocado ($0.99) for an extra charge. Based on experience, unless you're really lactose intolerant, I suggest you DEFINITELY get cheese. If you're feeling adventurous, add that avocado (and then pat yourself on the back for being so damn awesome). Also, add that green sauce. It'll take your mouth on a journey it has never been before. Put all that together, and what do you call that? A fiesta.  If you're on a date (like I was), I would say, pick THREE different arepas, or if you're the type who can eat food the size of a water buffalo, I would pick one of everything, and then...SHARE!   REASONS WHY YOU SHOULD SHARE:  1.) It makes more strategic sense to be able to conquer every food item on the menu in one shot 2.) Sharing is caring (DUH!) 3.) It makes a perfect talking point during your date ("What's your favorite?" "Oh, I like the wood fired chicken." "Oh I like the wood fired chicken too.")  4.) Diversifying is important 5.) Again, variety people. VARIETY! 6.) It's fun  #YoureWelcome

Definitely a fan of this place! Located on the corner of LV Blvd & Oakey, Viva Las Arepas is smack dab in the middle of what I'd consider a downtown hot spot, neighboring other local favorites - Vickie's (formerly Tiffany's) Diner, Art of Flavors, Dino's, Albo Pizza, Olympic Gardens, and that little shack that was once Goodwich.  They have a decent-sized menu with plenty of affordable combo options. I usually order the 3 chicken breasts + rice + beans for $6.99, along with a can of Coke for another $1.25, which is a pretty sweet deal to me since I'm always leaving with leftovers I can enjoy the next day. Their arepas are pretty tasty too, of course! And you can stuff 'em with whatever meats, cheeses, etc., you desire.  I especially love the layout of the restaurant. It's always very clean and cool indoors, and the patio area is great.
Consistently Delicious! My favorite is the number 4 with cheese! Great customer service too!

All the food here was incredible. We ordered a few arepas, wood fired beef, chicharrones and yuca, and we simply loved all of it.      We enjoyed the chicharrones with fried yuca, since they were tasty and not overly dry. They made a really nice side dish. Now the arepas. I was initially afraid that they might be small for the price ($5-$6), but they were fairly large and packed with meat. The arepa dough itself was perfect: crispy on the outside and moist/mushy underneath. The garlic shrimp arepa was delicious and I like how they served it cold. It held a good number of plump shrimp and tons of great garlic flavor.      While the shrimp was good, the best thing I ate was the wood fired chicken arepa. The chicken was amazingly good. Very tender and wonderful smoky flavor. The wood fired beef was delicious as well, as it too was tender and smoky.
