I was quite impressed when I saw employees wheeling in wooden logs through the back to the smoker. You wouldn't expect a restaurant like this to have a smoker dedicated to smoking the meat, but Viva Las Arepas does, and this becomes clearly evident when you taste the meat.     Overall, this instantly became one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas, and I'd love to come back. The food is cheap and delicious.

I come every time I'm in Las Vegas, sometimes more than once. I dint have a favorite area because they're all so good, but you can't go wrong with any of their favorited ones on the menu.   They also have great service, and I sometimes like to believe it's because they remember from my last visit. :)

My tastebuds are doing backflips from how delicious this food is. First time here and the arepas just melt in your mouth. Well cooked and prepared. The empanadas are simply perfect. Outside slightly sweet like a donut but the inside has the most savory taste. I would recommended this to anyone. I will be coming back to attempt to eat everything off the menu.

WOW! got the asada Arepa with avocado and cheese. Very flavorful with a bold Smokey taste. The texture of the bread was slightly crispy on the outside but the bite is so soft and melts in your mouth! I also tried the chicken empanada. Probably the most satisfying empanada i've ever had. The chicken itself Had a very rich flavor of different spices and the shell is not hard. also, a soft melt in your mouth texture. I would definitely recommend to families and friends especially from out of town visiting. I will be coming back to try more of what the menu has to offer! Great customer service clean and affordable place to dine in  they also provide different kinds of dinner entres if u are interested. Note that Arepas have a hearty stuff and they are 5.50ea. excluding add ons. (Cheese, avo, etc.) ENJOY!
The food was amazing! I'm not big on trying new food or cuisines I've never had but the staff wad friendly and helpful and the food was delicious.

Never had an Arepa until I went to this place.  I'm hooked!  I've been back at least 4-5 times since.  Not only are the Arepas perfect, they have bbq chicken with rice that has a insanely delicious Smokey flavor.  Their cilantro creamy sauce is a must!  Service is great also.
Really good food! I haven't have Venezuelan food in a long time and it was just what I need it!

Service was extremely helpful. They had a very kind staff and the arepas were legendary! So much deliciousness in the arepas! I wish i had more room to try all the different types of arepas but I definitely would recommend this place to anyone looking for good Venezuelan food!

Marinated chicken or shredded beef inside fluffy flatbread buns , made fresh ! Empanadas also light fluffy and bigger than the usual size you see in the supermarket.  Great with mango or soursop drink!

Omg this place is amazing. My husband usually has a BIG appetite, but we were both full after one. This stuff is seriously delicious and I was thankful that half of the menu was in English! Juicy meat, flavorful condiments, and it tasted like nothing else I've had before. So glad that I found this in Vegas!   Gotta try the pork belly arepa and the tostones!

1st time eating Arepas and they were excellent!!!  We had puerco y carne Asada and they were both great.  Salsas especially the white one were really good.  We had the grilled chicks also.  It was good but was not right off the grill so it could have been better fresh.  Will come back next time in town.

I got the carne asada arepa with cheese. It was pretty good but I probably wouldn't get it again. My friend got the reina pepiada which was pretty good. The fried plantains were bomb! And their passion fruit drink was really good too! My friends also liked the empanadas.

This is a great alternative to going to downtowns hipster, potentially expensive restaurants. Two people can have a filling, delicious, and different meal. It's close to an awesome custard place also!

Saw this spot while at Luv-It custard one night so looked it up and decided to try it.  Tried the marinated pork (# 5) and the shredded chicken w/avacado (#7) Both were very good and had great flavor. They also had a squeeze bottle with a tomatillo and jalapeno sauce in it that added some kick to it which I loved. Food was very good and so was the service. Spoke with the owner for a while and he let me try some juices and my wife try the #7 meat before we bought as she is not a fan of mayo but she really dug it.  This place is also open late and is priced pretty reasonably. the portions are perfectly sized and around 3.50 each and IMO a good deal.   This is a great little spot and I will be back for sure...anyone complaining or hatin on this place is prob a whiny fu*^%n bi&*h and used to eatin taco bell and should prob head back there. If you want to try some new food and support a non chain type place hit it up..you will at least be glad you tried it.  Yelp on Yelpers
Probably the best thing I ate this whole trip. I had the #7 and passionfruit juice. It was delicious. It was my first time having arepas. Would definitely come back again. Nice staff and good food.

Awesome, awesome, awesome!!! Loveeee this place! The food is delicious, served quickly and the restaurant is clean. Sometimes we want some plantains and some of their amazing Arepas, late at night! Love that it's open late, and the fact that you don't have to wait long for a plate of delicious goodness!!
Our favorite place! The food here is so good. I am stuck on #7. My husband tries new things all the time and has loved everything he's tried. Very clean restaurant. Staff is friendly.

I loved this place when they were in the lil hut up the street..Got my favorite the pepiadas arepas..its like a lil chicken salad guacy mayo combo loved it..everytime,,and the sliced pork butt with tomatoes and add cheese is just as good.Even liked the corn cheese quesadilla tasting one .Havent ventured too far off in menu even though I want to try the chicken...So glad these guys came up with this new restaurant because they seem friendly and all look like this arepas place is working as it's always crowded...Definatly TRY IT...

Really wanted to like this place :( 3 stars just for the fried yuca. The meat in my arepa tasted like steamed dog food, had a really gamey flavor. We literally took the rest of our arepas home and gave it to our dog

I've been to this place at least 8 times in the last two months. You can have a meal for under 10 dollars, that will blow your mind. The Arepas are sandwiches made with corn-cake patties for buns, with perfectly marinated meats. I've tried the vegetarian and omnivore versions of the Arepas, and both are out-of-this-world delicious. I've brought colleagues and friends here, and have had a 10 for 10 success in happy faces after the meal. The guava and cheese pastries I get every time to share, and everyone loves those, too. The cachapas (sort of like a quesadilla with corn cake breading) I have to have every time, too, that are salty-sweet unexpected wonderfulness. You can't go wrong with the menu. Everything is good.
The best arepas and cachapas in Las Vegas. Well recommended. Every time when I come to Las Vegas I always make a stop here.
So tasty! This is my second time here and my husband's first. After we were done eating our Arepas and Fried yucca root, he decided to order more. I ordered the Arepas Pabellon. To die for.
Always trying to find new places to eat in Vegas. This is a place I'm definitely letting my.friends know about! Good food, good service!
Best last minute decision! First time trying aprepas and it was delicious. The costumer service was great, the cashier recommend items on the menu and was very helpful. I will be coming back soon.

Big selection of arepas, tried the pork butt and shredded beef. Service was a bit slow as the cashier chatted with guest in front of me for 5 or 10 minutes since they couldn't decide what they wanted. Food came out quickly after I placed my order though. The pork arepa was pretty salty but had a good flavor. The shredded beef had a sauce on it that was super tasty - wish I asked for some more on the side to dip in. Fried plantains were good, but a little oily. All in all I would return or suggest to anyone who enjoys Latin style food.

This was my first time here, but I'll definitely be back every time I'm in Vegas. The service is friendly, there's plenty of seating and the food is great. I had the fried plantains, tostones, empanada and an arepa. Everything was delicious. The smoked meat is very tasty. With the sides, I was filled with one arepa and one empanada. Two or three empanadas could be enough to satisfy anyone. They are about twice as big as an Argentinian empanada, which tend to be a little smaller. Restrooms were clean, and there was parking both in front of the building and on the street behind the restaurant.
Im town on vacation from Arizona. This is my favorite place to eat in Vegas, hands down. Forget the buffet's and the fancy restaurants, this place is far better. We need you to come Arizona please!!!

There isn't much to say but this place is down right delicious.   If you've had and liked an arepa then you've got to come here, if you haven't hen you've got to come here. Enough said.   The decor and area of town is a little off putting, and parking can be somewhat odd. Nevertheless, you can definitely taste the love in this food.   They also have vegetarian and vegan options as well. The bean empanadas, and veg arepa are great options for veg and vegans.

Great start to our first visit here with our greeting from Tony. He gave us the breakdown on the menu & recommendations. We tried #1, 12, 13 & a side of yuca. Everything was delicious! And the yuca really did taste like fries! Incredible service & food! Can't wait to come back & try other menu items!

This place had hit my top ten places to eat at! Simple, but very flavorful. I ordered the Arepas (#1 and 12) and it was so scrumptious, and it's a place to drag all my friends to. Their sauces are on point as well. They definitely have gluten free options for the health conscious. Love love this place

If you are gluten free and tired of all the same options (crappy gluten free pizza and salads) this is definitely a place you want to hit up! I had no idea Arepas were gluten free until I came here! I am also pescatarian and they have vegan and vegetarian options to choose from. I ended up making my own combination of avocado, cheese, beans and plantains stuffed in my Arepa. It was to die for and one was definitely more than enough! I left full and more than satisfied.   Side note: They also offer Apple play

Viva Las Arepas, how I love thee!   I love their food, especially the: pork butt arepas, grilled steak special, plantains, cheese cachapa (seriously, worthy of being a "one last meal") , guava and cheese pastelitos, fried yucca root, passion fruit drink, wood fired mixed grill, and so much more! The creamy cilantro sauce is amazing - I put it on everything.   The first time we went there it was just a little cart on the corner in front of Dino's - they have done so well and reinvested their profits into a lovely little restaurant with an outdoor seating area, and a really comfortable and nice atmosphere. They always remember us when we come in and are so friendly. It is so nice to see good people doing well!   Oh ya, did I mention, the food is amazing? Consistently fresh, hot, and delicious. If their mission was to make me a customer for life - mission accomplished.

Thank you Yelp, and all the reviewers!, for helping us find Viva Las Arepas.  This was an awesome experience.  We will be back every time we visit, or even pass by, Vegas.  What a gem.  Everything was delicious.

This places is really awesome I got the black bean and beef arepa wast really in the mood for it but was pretty tasty was really good jus wish Venezuelan food came with hot sauce lol ... but was super awesome looking forward to going back to try there grilled chicken arepas and empanadas as well I hear really good things...

The arepas are out of this world! I definitely recommend any local and tourist to try this!   Went here for an office lunch outing. (We are located in summerlin) had the wood fired steak arepa and the chicken and peas one. They looked small at first when I saw them hand make them I front of you, they are a bit larger than the palm of your hand. but I could barely finish the second one! We also shared the wood fired chicken, yuka fries, cheese sticks ( forgot what it was called) all delicious! I will def bring people visiting me to this place.

This was my first experience with Venezuelan food and I am not disappointed. Awesome combinations of flavor, in particular the #7. The only recommendation I can give is a more expansive drink list, I'm not too sure how diverse Venezuelan drink orders are.

My husband and I love this place! This was our very first stop on our Vegas trip and regretted not stopping by before we left! We had the Roasted pork butt and Reina Pepiada with an order of their cheese empanadas. The meat was tender and juicy while the chicken/mayo/cliantro combination was bursting with flavor and their cheese empanadas as a hit as well!

The best Arepas i've had so far!. Great value too. The bread is crunch on the outside and soft inside. It had fresh corn flavor.   Shredded beef & Tongue were very flavorful. These are mine favorite!  Reina Pepiada - a little too creamy for my taste but my friend loved it.   Roasted Pork Butt - good but too salty.   Soursop drink - refreshing!
So good affordable and filling in all the right places!  Need to stop by for a quick bite its completely worth it!

I ordered the cheese arepa and the ham and cheese arepa. Both came with mountain of cheese! So Yum! I also ordered the half chicken with side of rice, beans and sweet plantains. The chicken has wonderful mesquite smokey flavor and the sides r perfect too! Makes me miss Miami so much. The side sauces r bomb too!

Did not not know arepas came in so may varieties.  They were delicious.  My wife had a tropical smoothie and said it was really good also.  Friendly staff too.  I will definitely visit this place every time I come to Vegas

I promise you that Viva Las Arepas is a little piece of heaven just on the outskirts of the city where you allow all your sins run free. In addition to mindless betting, grandeur casinos, and endless shopping boutiques, Las Vegas is about good eating, and there is a lot of it. I was feeling a little disinterested from fine dining everyday during my little Vegas weekend getaway so my date wanted me to try his cherished best kept secret in Las Vegas which is now one of my treasured eateries that I look forward to trying again upon my next visit.  Located just outside of The Strip near The Stratosphere, Viva Las Arepas wouldn't be noted to be in the prettiest part of the neighborhood. As well as the establishment is not the most elegant, the food was spectacular.  Without knowing exactly what an arepa was, I ordered the Reina Pepiada, a cold chicken salad covered in avocado and mayonnaise dressing whilst my date ordered a wood-fired chicken arepa. We added an additional cheese empanada for me, and a beef empanada for him since I have never had an empanada either.  Once our order was ready, my Reina Pepiada arepa reminded me of an overstuffed torta, but better! and once I tasted my arepa I knew this place was a special gem. The avocado mayonnaise sauce is really something that distinctively brought out the flavours. They also provide two bottles of their signature sauces; reach for the lighter green + garlic one, it is pure heaven, I wasn't shy to spread it all over my food.  The cheese empanada was still warm with gooey cheese. For just 3 dollars, this was delish! They also threw in a little extra extra for us; a sweet guava + cheese pastry, mm!  I cannot stop noting about Viva Las Arepas to my friends and other fellow Yelpers, this is one place not to be missed. I mean, if it wasn't for the cheese empanada order with the surprise sweet treat, I would order two of these on my next return x

First time visit.. Clean establishment & restrooms were clean. Good impression so far. Along the wall you see pictures of their dishes which All look delicious. I ordered the reina & the boyfriend ordered the shredded beef Arepa & 2 black bean & cheese empanadas. They both were good but the shredded beef had more flavor and it was hot, the reina was more like chicken salad so it was cold. I didn't know. Had I not been biting into chicken bones with the reina, I would have given it 5 stars.    Will be coming back and ordering something else off the menu. Nice and tasty place!
Got severe food poisoning from eating here. It's been 9 years since I throw up, and I eat here and I'm throwing up all night
I had never had an arepa before but these are pretty tasty. Would eat here more often if I was in this part of town. Hot and delicious with some softness in the middle still.

I've eaten here a total of 2 times and the first time I wasn't sure on what to order so I had the shredded beef Arepa, I wasn't very impressed because It was nothing special. My friends felt the same way too and were so underwhelmed that we wondered why they have such awesome reviews from everyone else. Well I gave them another chance and I read Melissa Y.'s review before I ordered and she had suggested an Arepa that has a grilled meat. Well since I sometimes try to be on that healthy grind I had the grilled chicken Arepa and boy was she right it was sure tasty. There's 2 sauces they have on the side 1 that comes in a clear bottle and the other in a red bottle. The one in the clear is like a creamy herb sauce similar to Cafe Rio's ranch sauce but less creamy and more "herby," I like it and gives the Arepa more flavor. I wasn't too sure about the red bottle, but my friends liked it as well and said the heat is good and slowly builds on you. Initially people are a little confused on how to describe what exactly an Arepa is. I was sort of describing it as a Taco bell Chalupa or Indian bread sandwiched together, however I was way off because my friend described it as an English Muffin made with corn meal, which is exactly what it is! The inside of this palce is very clean and depending on how busy it is will determine how long it will take  for your food. I was there last night and they served my friends within 5 minutes, but another time they took awhile like 10 to 15 minutes if I remember correctly. I also like the fact they are open late and next to Art of Flavors. There is plenty of indoor seating and this place has a good amount of people eating at night.

If there was one hole-in-the-wall I could take visitors to in Vegas, this would be it. I accidentally stumbled upon this place on a random Sunday after work when the original noodle joint we were going to was closed. Prior to this, I can't say I've ever tried an arepa, but from that day on, I was hooked.   An arepa is a grilled, round, cornmeal patty, which is then stuffed with your choice of meat or filling. The most popular is the reina pepiada, which is filled with grilled chicken, avocado, mayo, and cilantro. It's pretty much a Venezuelan chicken salad sandwich. I also tried the wood fire beef with lettuce, tomatoes, onions, and cheese. You can't go wrong with your choices, but my favorite is the reina pepiada for the avocado and cilantro. Also, try the spicy salsa verde with everything! I'm less of a fan of the white sauce.  Although the serving size is perfect, for only $5, you'll be salivating for more. I also always get a side of the fried yucca root, which I prefer over french fries. If you're craving something sweet, the fried plantains are nice too.   Everything is so tasty here that I can forgive the fact that they charge 50 cents for a cup of water. Viva Las Arepas!

Wanted to go somewhere that wasn't an outright tourist trap or cash grab on the Strip.  Extremely friendly staff, clean facility, great service.  The food was incredible, made to order, and is making my mouth water just thinking about it.  Venezuelan arepas are more like little sandwiches, but are surprisingly filling for their size.  Get plenty of napkins.  When I went I got 3 different arepas to share, and the fried plantains.

Location: The restaurant wasn't that hard to find. The parking lot was a little small, but it shouldn't be too bad to find a place to park if you decide to go on a weekend.   Atmosphere: The restaurant itself is pretty spacious. There was a pretty good amount of places for people to sit.  Service: The guy at the counter was really nice. He was helpful with some recommendations. It was kind of hard for us to hear what order they were calling. They give you two bottles, one red and one white, with your order. That was nice since you usually just go to a counter in other places for the sauces.  Food: I decided to get the chicken salad arepa and shredded beef. The chicken salad was really good. It was nice and saucy. The shredded beef was too hot to eat. I took a couple of bites, it was okay. I decided to save it for later. When I ate it a couple of hours later, I thought it tasted better. My friend decided to try the garlic shrimp. She said it was a little too saucy. At the end of the meal it was leaking and looked really hard to eat. She said it was good at first though.

Wow!  Something new to myself, never tried anything quite like this and I'm glad I had! This place has grew over the years to this new massive location and I can see why, Viva las Arepas is consistently busy! Must be the lovely little handheld Arepa that keep attracting this crowd of gastro daredevils.  Looking at the huge menu it's hard to decide from all the tasty choices, and simple ask of what's popular to the cashier will leave you satisfied. By recommendation I got the wood-fired shredded beef arepa(with cheese *A must!*) and a shredded beef empanada while my guest decided to go for the chicken breast with avocado and cilantro arepa. Omg these savory little corn meal sandwiches are awesome! It has deep flavors that keep you wanting more, everything taste so fresh and homemade not any of that frozen precooked junk that gets passed off on the daily from something so widely known. They also have one of the best hot sauces that I've tasted in Vegas, the suttle spice and richness of the sauce reminded me of La Vic's orange sauce for all you Bay Area folk, and a creamy cilantro sauce to cut the spice if it's not for you!  I will definitely be back here, although for the actual size it could be kinda pricey $4-6 depending on filling and +.50-1.00 for avocado and cheese. Empanadas was $3 for a decent size, they usually have some sort of special going on just pay attention to the small signs near the register! Viva!

Authentic tasty food just like from Venezuela. There aren't too many of these types of eateries outside of Florida so take advantage & try it, I guarantee you it'll be worth your time & affordability. Arepa rellena de carne asada & las empanadas de carne desebrada was delicious. Oh and that garlic cream is to die for.
Love Viva Las Arepas!  Love arepas in general.  They have many delicious choices to choose from.  Also like that they are downtown north of the Stratosphere.  Returning soon ;-)

Eat here if you want good grub and a good price! I've had arepas before and these were probably one of the best I've had!  I had the #4 with cheese, my friend had the #3 and my husband had the #12 and a side of plantains.  We were not disappointed, the sauces were amazing also! I could have just drank them straight from the bottle.  They stuff the arepas full of meat and they are dripping with meaty goodness! People complaining about too much sauce or juices, don't know what they are talking about.  Who wants dried meat?  Not me!  If I wasn't bursting at the seams after my meal, I would have gotten more to go.  I considered driving by and getting some on my way to the airport because it probably could have helped my hangover.  I didn't think the neighborhood was that bad, but I'm not usually deterred by a few run down buildings or some graffiti.  I will be back and I'll be dreaming of it until I can have it again.

If you are looking for something just off the strip and is really good come here. The ribs were delicious and my wife had an arepas with chicken, avocado, mayo, and cilantro. My sons had ribs and pork rind with yuca.

Arepas have recently become my food obsession, but I had never had one in Las Vegas before. I remembered this place existed and then had a friend ask me if I've been there, so it was on my list to try.  Today I went to my boss's storage unit down the street, and I was pretty excited to find out I could order food directly on the Yelp mobile app. An arepa for $5? How is that even possible in the US? It was a damn tasty arepas, especially once I discovered the hot sauce. I literally cannot wait to go back and have more arepas.

This was my first Arepas experience and I am glad I chose VIVA LAS AREPAS for it.  We had the Smoked Beef Arepa $6. The meat was really smokey, excellently seasoned and marinated. It came with a slice of tomato and letucce.  Eat it with the creamy green sauce and your taste buds will thank you!   Even though I really enjoyed it I felt that $6 for an Arepa seemed a bit too much.  Extra for cheese $0.60, Avocado $.99, ...  I will come back when in town for a quick bite.  Cheers!
Having just spent 2 months in Venezuela eating arepas every day I can say that the flavors here are authentic and delicious.  The reina popiada is the bomb..you have to try it!!

one of the greatest food truck style place ever tasted in Las Vegas!  The price is great and the food is outstanding.  Love to get a mix of cold and hold mix.  the drink is also great.    Must visit this place when you come to Vegas!
Would you believe I keep wanting to get here and yet keep missing it?  I finally found where it was but had just eaten so we will have to wait till next time
This place is really good Venezuelan food. Had the chicken arepas, black beans, and fried plantains. The fried plantains was my favorite. All was really good!
It's just ok. Worth trying but not sure I'd return. Very fresh food and great customer service.

Perfection... Every time. When the man asks if you want cheese on your arepa, you say YES! When you get your arepa and they give you sauce YOU PUT THAT SAUCE ON YOUR AREPA. It is just so so good. You'll be eating it and thanking that anonymous yelper that said go for it

Sitting there after the food had arrived and having taken a couple of bites, we start to discuss how many stars we would give Viva Las Arepas. Factoring in the convenient location off the main strip, clean and bright interior, super friendly staff, and yummy, fresh comfort food. We both agreed that if this restaurant was in San Diego, we could see ourselves frequenting weekly. Hands down we agreed 5 stars! We ordered the Carne asada arepas, chicken empanada, and fried plantains. Prior to this I had never had an arepa or Venezuelan food so I didn't know what to expect. It had a familiarness that reminded me of Colombian food. And all I know is that it was delicious and an overall great experience that left me already wanting to come back.

I'm Chinese and I love Hispanic food! I will be the pickest water you will ever meet, and this restaurant is the only place in Las Vegas that has ever satisfied my standards. Every Hispanic restaurant lacks authenticity, quality, and passion.   The arepas, empanamdas, and drinks are so authentic that I feel like I'm in Salvador. My favorite are the roast pork butt arepas, as well as the wood fire beef arepas. And yes, they cook everything on  real wood.    The restaurant is so clean that you can eat off the floor. I'm not kidding. The floor is a well polished tile floor, with all wood furnishings and beautiful light fixtures. Honestly, you can find a restaurant like this in a high end resort.   The business owner, Felix takes incredible pride in his food. Everything is made in order, in house. All the beans, meats, and rice are made in house. Every other place uses refried beans and frozen meats. Never have I been to such a great restaurant where the employees love what they do, and the owner personally remembers you.   In all honestly. I name this restaurant the best Hispanic food in Las Vegas. More importantly I rate this restaurant as one of the best places I have ever eaten in. I want to personally thank Felix for providing such a authentic, and quality dining experience in my office.

Ordered the pork butt with avocado, tomato, and a side of their creamy cilantro dressing. Loved the crispy and flavorful maize flatbread, and the creamy dressing that elevated the pork. Make sure you take a friend and order over $10 worth of food, or get a $.50 service charge, if you plan on paying with credit card.

Found this place looking on Yelp for places to eat while I was in Las Vegas and I'm glad I found this place, this was my first time trying Venezuelan food so I didn't know what to order,so after looking at the menu for a while I decided on the Carne Asada Arepas and a side of black beans and rice, the Arepas are like little sandwiches,the buns are like cornbread and tortilla with good size chunks of wood cooked carne Asada 5 stars all the way. The black beans where real good too they had like a spicy taste to them. Will be back on my next trip to Las Vegas.

mmm mmm mmmmmmmm this is the only place where I have tried Venezuelan food and I loved it. My friend and I pig out and ordered everything and there wasn't one bad dish. I will definitely be back to try the other stuff on the menu. There were so many delicious options, I have to try everything!!

When I first looked into my beautiful wife's eyes I was immediately hypnotized! Today the Arepas was almost as memorable! My family and my Compadre Edgar's Familia are always looking for some good eats. I thought this place deserved some major props!!! The place is located in a very busy corner but once u enter the doors the service was spectacular and the lady behind the counter was very patient and willing to explain everything on the menu. Gracias Señora! My queen ordered a Reina Pepiada Arepa for herself, a Pabellon Arepa for myself & half a pollo for my handsome boys, and guess what we finished all our food and also my compadres' food the plantains he ordered were so sweet and good. Once u taste there sauce u cannot stop I found myself pouring it onto my palm and licking it off! YES!!! I considered drinking it straight from the bottle. We are from Califas and the next time we visit Vegas we will definitely eat here again. So why 4 stars I am a very picky eater as my primo Xavi says. I was still wanting more wish the Arepas were slightly bigger and my Pabellon was slightly salty but very tasty! Finalmente, Viva Las Arepas. Hasta Luego!

AMAZING!  This unassuming food stand really packs a punch. Having never tried venezuelan food before, I pulled up here one evening for some late night snacks. I tried the original, hot beef and cheese arepa. Out of this world. The little corncake that they stuff it all into is perfect- the consistency is amazing, and the taste is just out of this world. The meat filling is like the barbacoa at Chipotle- except 80 times more flavorful. Also, the guys who work there are super nice too!  If you're looking for something different and new for a great price, I highly recommend I Heart Arepas. Make this a place to visit on your next trip!
Recommended by a co worker and I wasn't disappointed.  I will definitely be back for the guava and cheese arepas.

Great small mom and pop style Venezuelan place  Arepas are awesome. Very tasty little Sandwiches. I want to try them ALL  Friend pork rinds + yucca root was very good.   Empenadas were excellent   I love the two bottles of salsa they give you.  Delicious  Great atmosphere   And the prices are extremely reasonable.  Especially in a town with ridiculously overpriced crappy restaurants  Viva this place!

I stopped here for lunch today after having my car serviced and I have to stick with my 5 star review from before.  The gentleman who took my order was really friendly and answered my questions about the drinks.    I ordered a Reina Pepiada, an arepa made with shredded chicken breast, avocado, mayo, and cilantro.  I also got a coconut and cheese pastelito for a dessert.  For my drink, I had asked the clerk about the Malta Polar, a Venezuelan soda, made with molasses instead of sugar.  He said he liked it and I gave it a try.  It was tasty--a bit strong--but it was curiously refreshing.  Wait, that one's taken!  It was very good and it was a good accompaniment for lunch.  When he brought my food, he also brought the three squeeze bottles of sauces.  The red bottle--this is a nice spicy sauce that gave the arepas some kick.  The yellow bottle had a spicy cilantro sauce and this too had a kick.  The white bottle had the mild sauce, but it was OK.  I tried it and then went back to the premium grades.  Coconut and cheese seemed an odd combination to me, but I love coconut, so I had to give this a go.  What a pleasant treat!  The cheese mixed with the coconut had a symbiotic relationship and they went well together.  I guess I'll just have to make it a more common experience to drive the few miles from my car dealership after service and have lunch here!  Viva Las Arepas and Viva Las Vegas!

First time having Venezuelan food and I had the BBQ ribs.  That was a mistake.  The ribs were good but they were not traditional cuisine for this place.  I should have gone with a more traditional Venezuelan meal.  The wife did and loved it, she had one of the sandwiches I think it was an Arepas.  She loved it!  I will say that they did smoke their ribs on site and used real wood to cook with.  Will go back here again and get something more traditional next time.

WOW! I have never had Venezuelan food, but my bf and I are always up for something new. Aside from the hilarious name of the restaurant, this place has some seriously good food! We never eat on the strip when in Vegas because it's overpriced and generally not very good. This place made it to the top of our search because of it's high ratings, and this time, Yelp did not let us down.   Arepas, for those that don't know, are maize (corn) dough stuffed with meat or other fillings and toppings. It's a Latin spin on a pita-like sandwich. Although I have nothing to compare this to, I was very impressed. The bread was hot and fluffy and sweet - everything you love about corn-based bread. We got the Wood Fire Beef and Reina Pepiada (a chicken salad with avocado, mayo, and cilantro). I liked that we got one with hot filling and one with cold filling. We also ordered fries, which were just standard frozen fries, but they were piping hot and crispy, so they were perfect.   Prices were reasonable, and the service was friendly. Will definitely stop by again the next time we're in town.

I've eaten authentic Venezuelan food before and this place is not bad.  My last visit I ordered the Wood Fire Mix Grill (for two people), consisting of chicken, beef, pork ribs and sausage with two sides for $22.99.  The ribs (which are large spare ribs) and the chicken were excellent; the beef was a little dry and it had a little bit too much spice.  I guess it was a brisket but over spiced and too dry.  The sausage was flavorful but I didn't care for the texture of it.  My sides were the fried Yucca plant and rice with vegetables, which were decent.  I also had the plantains, which were excellent.  They do serve nice size portions and it's right near the Strip with parking.  Overall, I would try it again for the chicken and spare ribs.

This place is delicious! I am going to be on a mission to find something similar to this in San Diego. We ordered the number 1 which is chicken and a number 7 which is shredded beef. Both were delicious! I definitely recommended trying this place when in Vegas!

"I Love Arepas" is not only the name of this food stand, it is also what you will be saying after you eat here!  Their specialty, of course, are the Venezualn corn cakes, or arepas. They are served warm and freshly cooked. I ordered a chicken (hot) and shrimp (cold) arepa along with a beef empenada. My favorite was the shrimp. The cold filling and the warm arepa made for a great combo. The shrimp was in a garlic, parsley sauce that was not too rich and very garlicky! It was delicious. The chicken, I was not so crazy about. I am not sure if it was deliberate or not, but there was a sourness to it that made it unappetizing. The beef in the empenada was only okay. It was a seasoned ground beef. I thought it would be more of a pulled or chopped beef.  The star throughout the meal was the corn cake: warm, nice texture, not too oily was great. Prices were decent, with the shrimp being the most expensive of my dishes at $5.   The location is a little sketchy and a little difficult to get to with all the one way streets everywhere, but definitely worth the effort.  Be aware, the stand is closed on Sundays!

This was my first time eating arepas so I didn't know what to expect, but I'm definitely a fan. It reminds me of a sandwich full of wood-fired meat stuffed between 2 flatbreads made of maize. The place is a bit off the strip and the area is a little sketchy (it's across from a stripclub called "OG"), but it's worth it if you want to grab a quick and cheap bite. The soursop juice here is also delicious.
Delicious! If you are debating about trying, stop and just go. You won't regret it!:) I highly recommend the vegetarian arepa and tostones!

Great customer service from whom I presume was the owner. He was attentive and even hooked us up with an empanada after a miscommunication when ordering. I didn't know that the Reina pepiada was a cold arepa which was a little dissapointing to me since the last time I had one, it was a hot arepa. Still great tasting, just off to me because of the cold/hot thing. A little pricey for arepas but this is on the strip so that's probably why. Small seating area but even if I had to take it to go I would !

The best Arepas I've ever had! Shhh, don't tell my mother in law (she's Venezuelan)  FOOD: Arepas cannot be accurately described by words. They must be experienced, and the best place to experience it is at Viva Las Arepas.    Reina Pepiada- Chicken Breast mixed with Avocado, Mayo & Cilantro. Such a great flavor profile.  Pabellón- Beef, Black Beans, Plantains & Cheese. This is my second favorite, the beef is cooked perfectly. The beans and plantains compliment the beef and we all know cheese makes everything better  The empenadas are also delicious, try them all. They're like a dollar, stop being so cheap and try all of them. You're welcome.   IN CONCLUSION:  This is usually the first place I go when I land in Vegas. There is a reason they have 8 million 5 star reviews. IT IS AMAZING. Stop reading this and book your ticket or get in you car and drive to vegas and feast at Viva Las Arepas!

The best arepas I've had outside of Venezuela and they're fairly priced (precios solidarios). The only arepas I've seen in San Francisco are $10.75. I used to eat here when it was a food stand. The owner Felix is a great guy, despite being an esqualido. Nobody is perfect. I'm very happy that he has a restaurant now. I wish him much success.

I really enjoyed this place! The service was so great! My family and I were helped through everything since it was our first time. We were given samples of their dishes and also all their different fruity beverages. The food was very tasty itself and filling! The meal we ordered came with a bunch of meat selections w/ two sides which we chose rice and black beans. It was all very good and filled us up perfectly! I would definitely come back to try more of the menu. This is a easy 5 stars for me!

I had to come here while on vacation in Vegas bc unfortunately there are no cachapas in Chicago! We were very happy with the arepas and their fresh fruit waters! The cashiers were very helpful and hospitable!  Please open a restaurant in Chicago!

I give it a solid 3 1/2 stars.  I've had Viva Las Arepas on my radar for a while.  I just never get to visit this part of town all that often.  Since we went for a last hurrah at the Art of Flavors next door, we figure why not get an arepa to go as well?  Off to Viva Las Arepas we were!  Décor is nice inside, very spacious with another large outdoor veranda area.  It wasn't too busy on a Saturday night, only a few patrons on several of their tables.  But I did notice that the take out business was steady.  Lots of folks going in and out.  I was never familiar with arepas, all I knew was that they were a type of Venezuelan street food.  Any kind of street food sounds tasty to me!  Our cashier was gracious and asked us if we had been to Viva Las Arepas before.  We told him no so he proceeded to let us know what an arepa is and some of their most popular flavor combinations.  Basically, an arepa is a round patty made of cornmeal, grilled, then stuffed with various meats and cheeses.  Sold!  Had to try one (or two).  We ordered to go:  -Wood Fire Beef Arepa -Reina Pepiada Arepa (chicken breast, avocado, mayo & cilantro) -Fried Plantains  Waiting wasn't long, and before I knew it we were ready to go.  But, all our food came in one tiny plastic bag.  I was like, "This all our order?  Salsa on the side too?"  Dude was, "Yep, you're all set.  Salsa in little containers, two each."  Really?  Bag wasn't that heavy at all.  Take it home and I'm already antsy for some grub 30 minutes later.  Open up the bag - one round Styrofoam container.  One long Styrofoam container.  Hmmm...am I missing an arepa?  Turns out, nope!  These arepa thingies are just a bit on the small side.  They really are.  Smaller than a sandwich, but bigger than a cookie.  What gives?  I felt like I was Godzilla with this little itty-bitty snack in my hand.  But, that morsel of arepa was pretty good!  I had the Reina Pepiada, arepa was still warm, crispy on the outside, but some good chew on the inside.  Chicken with avocado, mayo & cilantro made for a great filling.  Very tasty, and a good kick with their house green salsa.  Wifey liked the taste of her Wood Fire Beef arepa, goot hint of smoke with moist beef.  Fried plantains were good too, but that's really hard to mess up.  Overall, this was a good SNACK.  Guys my size would need two arepas to make a MEAL.  But, at around $5 a pop per arepa...for $10 you can go to the local Chinese buffet!  I liked Viva Las Arepas but not sure I would go out of my way that often to get it.  But the experience was good, and I would gladly have another arepa from there sometime down the line.  Perhaps they should have a food truck going around, too?  This is perfect food to sober up with!  Or down with a Corona!  How do you say "ole" in Venezuelan?  Good but pricey.

Short review!  (will include an update in a month)  Viva Las Arepas!!!  Oh Viva Las Arepas!  Located on an unseemly street corner (Believe it was LVB/just pass Charleston - be sure to be on the look out!)  sits a tiny little 10x12 shack of goodness!  This past Vegas trip was all about exploring the local food scene outside of the main strip, and boy did we experience some delicious treats such as these Arepas!  Since it was simply a tasting... our part of 4 decided to share on one arepa... Reina Pepidas!  Yes... 4 sharing one......  Reina Pepidas is this arepa (corn meal bun toasted with savory fillings) that is filled with shredded chicken mixed with cilantro, avocado, green peas, and mayo..... just think of it as a chicken salad sandwich on steroids!  Super delicious!!!!!  The flavor of the cilantro and avocado coupled with slightly crispy buns of the corn meal made this a super filling yet delicious treat before actual lunch!    Sauces comes with it too... I believe one of them is a delicious non-spicy cilantro sauce while another one is a spicy salsa that could potential knock your socks off!  Mixing all the flavors together will create a different yet awesome flavor that you surely don't want to miss.  Our party was looking at the pork butt arepa but since we were heading over for actual lunch, we decided to give it a try next time...  Is there a next time?  Hell ya!  They've done pretty well to a point that we noticed that an actual storefront is in the works just closely down the street... I bet it's going to be crowded when that completed...  But in the mean time, be sure to keep your eyes open for the little tiny shack that is on a street corner.... don't judge the book by it's covers.... you will be pretty amazed on what you find here at Viva Las Arepas!  Until next time Arepas!!!

None of us had ever had Venezuelan food before, so we were unsure of what to expect. We walked in, completely confused by the menu and what arepas were. The staff were so informative and also showed us what one looked like prior to ordering. I ordered the chicken arepas, with an avocado mayo and cilantro. The arepas itself was absolutely amazing. Full of flavor, paired by a delicious, warm rice or corn buns. Best part, they're naturally gluten free!!!

Excellent! I had the Pabellon with black beans, plantains and the shredded beef. Went rediculous with their special sauces!!! I look forward to coming back; their mesquite grilled chicken and Reina Pepiada look legit.

This is my second arepa stop this week, i wanted to show some love at the new location. This time I made an order mistake getting the pepiada. I asked for no mayonaise and was told it couldnt be removed as it was part of a chicken salad style prep. The guy insisted there was barely any used and that it was not noticeable- WRONG!  -1 star  Way too much mayo, which made the meal taste plain and overly rich- which led to a post consumption stomach ache and regret.   The wood grilled meats are superb and next time I will stick with those or the Pebellon.

1st time I had Arepas I have no idea what should I get. He recommend #7  He was so helpful to me and he show me some pictures on screen  But the food was so so... warm bread with cold chicken inside:( don't taste right ....  and my stomach feel so weird maybe because cream cheese?? But on menu don't show they put any cream ...  I had one bite and need to take home  I just never try the Arepas  I will try to come back and try maybe shrimp next time...
Short time in Vegas, tried a few things outside the casinos, came back here for seconds, Excellent! thank you!

My friend randomly said how he always passes by a place called "I Love Arepas" on his way to work.  After seeing Bobby Flay's Throwdown, I saw those two Venezuelan sisters and knew I needed to try those one day.  I took it as a sign and couldn't say no to going!   Drive there and find it is TINY! I want to say it's about 10 by 10 feet with a handful of bar type chairs by the window and a couple tables by the street. It's definitely not a restaurant. More of a food truck slash stand.  If you haven't guessed, it's kind of "ghetto" being on LV BLVD across the Olympic Gardens Gentlemen's Club haha.  We were the only ones there. I took it as a bad sign because the chef looked like he was in a bad mood and his up selling techniques made him seem a little unappreciative of having customers by his tone of voice.  The menu is small, everything is under $5.00 being a sort of tamale you can only order to go. The Arepas are about $3-$4 depending on the meat or style and are definitely worth the price. They aren't HUGE so don't expect something with huge portions, but the flavor and specialness of the item is there.   We ordered the #1 which was beef and added mozzarella for $0.50.  I asked for it to go and the chef suggested we eat it there and we'd enjoy it more.  It was DELICIOUS!  An arepa is a masa "patty" that gets grilled on both sides so they're crispy, and filled with different meats, veggies, sauces , ect.  The masa is crisp on the outside, soft on the inside, and the fillings are so good!  I described it as a cross between a tamale, a sopa, and a torta.  There are different hot or cold fillings.  They also have drinks, empanadas, and snacks.  After having it I ordered some to go for my friend and they loved it as well.  Overall love the place. Wish the Gentlemen working was nicer, but every one has those days. The food was great and that's all that matters.  Btw, they serve with two sauces, a creamy green and a spicy/sour red and are both SO GOOD. They also give you sauce to go.  Highly recommend!

Delicious, fairly priced and flavorful food.  Staff was super friendly.    I tried the Wood Fire Beef and the Reina Pepiada.  Both awesome, the beef had a nice smoked flavor while the pepiada was really refreshing.   Will come back during my next time in Vegas just to try the rest.

How was this my first time finally getting to Viva Las Arepas? After seeing all the great press, driving by it a million times, and bookmarking it 8 years ago (ish), I finally made it in. My 2nd visit will be much quicker! The vibe inside is friendly and clean, with a cool patio. It's not fancy, but it is definitely above Roberto's. Each arepa is about $5. Pair it with a side of beans or grilled veggies and a soda and you're about $10. Pretty affordable. Most important: the food is really good. Meats are excellent, the arepa itself is doughy, but with that corn texture. Yum. Good for lunch, dinner, kids, adults. Next door to the best gelato ever (except it's never open). They serve beer, too!

Dang. First time eating arepas and it was incredible. My girlfriend and I ordered everything with a star by the menu item (star indicating chef's recommendation). Each arepa is around $6 so it's not on the cheap side, but it was worth every penny.  Our favorite was the corn and cheese plate (not sure if it actually is an arepa) and the chicken and avocado mix one. We ordered 6 dishes in total and devoured everything.  One thing I wish they offered was a spicier sauce (I think I was in the King Taco mode) but honestly, the creamy and salsa-y sauce they offered were amazing.   Tacos el Gordo was always at the top of my book, but I think it was just topped by Viva Las Arepas.

Short Review: I'm a fan of Arepas. I'm just not a fan of the Arepas served at Viva Las Arepas.  I got their Beef Empanada and Beef Arepa.  Both were greasy and not worth the price. $5 for an Arepa the size of your fist??  I've had this place bookmarked. Now, bookmark checked! Time to move on.  Longer Review: Viva Las Arepas has been one of my bookmarks since I was introduced to their neighbor, the great Art of Flavors. Yes, Viva is located right next door in case you didn't know.  Upon entering, you're hit with nothing but orange and a menu with a decent selection.  At first, the prices looked pretty good until you get your food. I got the Beef Arepas and a Beef Empanada.  They both tasted "Just Ok" and were super oily. For a minute, I thought I was eating a beef chimichanga. Both were also so small that I was able to finish my Arepas in about 3 bites.  I know I can't mention names, but I have had better Arepas out here in Vegas. Better in regards to price, value, and most importantly, taste. All is not lost though.  Their plantains and the service were both excellent.  I may be back, but most likely for their plantains only.  See Ya' But not here...I'll be next door enjoying the best peanut butter gelato.

Like a lot of words, I can't really pronounce it, but I can eat an arepas like a boss!  I had a bite of my co-worker's pork butt (hehe) and it was tasty, but so far, I plan on sticking with the pollo mechada.  The cold shrimp (#6) arepas looked pretty great too when I picked up lunch for my office.  This place is that unique little find: great food at cheap prices.  Don't be scared by the sketchy location and vagrants you see hanging on the street.  This place is too legit to quit.

So me, J.V and Daniel met up at I Love Arepas after having a convo at work about Colombian food ( Daniel's family is Colombian).  I told them about I Love Arepas and we had decided to finally check it out, once we arrived, we realized its Venezuelan and not Colombian but Daniel said arepas is a Colombian dish also? Hmm okay...  Well, it was a very HOT day and since this place is just a stand with a few tables set up, we decided to sit at one of the tables and eat instead of in our cars.  We started with the fruit juices- sugar cane with lime for me, mango for Daniel and Tamarindo for JV.  We all thoroughly enjoyed our drinks, you can tell everything was freshly made. I thought my sugar cane/lime drink would be too sweet but it wasn't, it was PERFECT on this extremely hot day.  Food, we ordered almost everything on the menu..Arepas are like sandwiches with the patties made from cornmeal which is grilled then stuffed with meat, cheese and other delightful things...  Here's what we ordered: Roasted Pork Butt (Hot filling)- yummy! shredded pork similar to carnitas, had great flavor Shredded Chicken (Hot)- also very good, similar flavors to the pork butt Beef Tongue (Hot filling)- oh my, SO good, one of my favorites! tender, slightly spicy Honeycomb Tripe/Menudo (Hot)- another of my favorites in the hot filling category, this was the spiciest of all the arepas we tried. Again, full of flavor with the garlic and spices!  Cold fillings- Reina Pepiada- they said this was their most popular but I was not a fan.  There was just too much mayo going on with this one, I couldn't even eat it all.  It's similar to a chicken salad with avocado and green peas but umm, yeah, too much mayo... Garlic shrimp- this was BOMB, I mean seriously good. It was like having shrimp ceviche in a sandwich...this is a must have!  Empanadas- the guys loved the black bean and cheese, I got the shredded beef.  They loved it and said it tasted really fresh, mine was okay, seemed that my shredded beef had more filling than their black bean/cheese ones.  Hallacas- this alone would have me stopping by daily.  It's the most expensive item on their menu at $5 each but it's so worth it.  It's similar to a tamale with empanada filling wrapped in banana/plantain leaves and steamed.  For me, the cornmeal dough was SO yummy! It' reminded me of a Vietnamese dish very similar to it that's got ground pork and also steamed in banana leaf...this is a HELL yeah dish for me!  After we were done trying all the dishes, we were thirsty again so I ordered the Guava drink next and JV ordered the Guanabana (soursop).  Both drinks again were fresh and you could taste it!  This is a definite return for us, but next time, after the sun goes down or when the weather was cooler!

This place made me so happy to have met up with my cousin, a local. Would have never even noticed it but it was the first suggestion off her tongue. Speaking of tongue, that was what I picked (to my companions' chagrin) and it was delicious. Try both sauce bottles!

I work downtown and have been meaning to try this place for awhile.  Finally did and Viva Las Arepas did not disappoint.  Had a tough time deciding what I wanted since all of the Yelp comments recommend just about everything.  I settled on the reina pepiada and fried plantains...wow this was great. Looking forward to going back and trying the pork butt.

We came across this place from Yelp reviews and wanted something different but good off the strip. We were so glad we did!!  So good and filling. Our small family of four ordered the MIX plate which consisted of 3-4 different types of grilled meat. It was all very tasty and tender. Fall off the bone ribs, grilled steak, grilled chicken and sausage. That was pricey 23.99 but we all were able to indulge in the meat fest to our hearts content!   For the side I ordered salad and plantains. I have never really tried real authentic plantains and these were pretty good. A lil too sweet for the rest of the meal. We are about half of them. The salad it was a big plate of iceberg lettuce and tomatoes with a dressing. We didn't really care for that. We also ordered their carne asada arepa. Soooo good we couldn't get enough. A couple chicken and beef empanadas rounded out the meal for the kids. All in all we were so impressed we are def going back during our two week Vegas stay!!

Ok ok... this little shack has been seeing alot of action on yelp recently so i had to see what all the local yippers were talking about. The location is kind of en, i personally would have like to sit there and grub and people watch a little but there seemed to be more of the owners family and friends just sitting around on a Sunday afternoon taking up space then actual customers enjoying the food and relaxing in a chair. After we got the cook to actually get back into the shack and stop chit chatting with the family outside i was thinking maybe i might finally get to eat. $3.50-$4.50 was the average cost of an Arepa across the board but keep in mind when your asked if you want cheese that its an additional .50cents to your total. Ordering a chicken, beef arepa and a bean and cheese empanada. Got my food and it all fit into a medium sized styrofoam container, this was where i asked is this all of it? yup. Now ill say the stuff smelled good driving in my car trying to find a place to sit and eat. It tasted even better when i Nom Nommed on it in the 5 bites it took me to eat the entire thing. But it left me wanting something more to eat because it did not fill me up at all.   To those looking for a tasty bite/snack to hold you off before a dinner or a late night munchie after a little night life in Vegas sure this is the spot. But if your looking to be stuffed after having one $4 arepa id say only if you were a tiny 90ln chick. You need at least two of these to be a complete meal so keep that in mind when ordering. What id like to see is some better seating for the customers so i dont have to go 5 blocks down the road and park my car. And i think the use of maybe a complete meal package... like 2 arepas one chicken one beef and a little rice and beverage for lets say $10? i think this would not only have customers happy but also the owners would sell quite a few of these instead of many ordering just individual as i did when i sampled the offerings.

Man, I've been waiting for awhile to try this place out. It is always nice to find cheap food relatively close to the strip!  So first off, this place is North of the strip, in between Encore and the Stratosphere. The parking situation is a little lot or if that is filled, they have an empty lot in the back (super dingy at night). As for the decor, it is simple, nice, clean and spacious. The workers are friendly and they showed me the board with the arepas and the chef's recommendations. Each arepas is about the size of a small burger and they all cost about $7. We ended up getting:  Roasted Fire beef- Oh man, such a perfect blend. It's basically carne asada with a smoky flavor. Really good!  Chicken with avocado- A lot of people tend to order this so I gave it a try. The avocado, lime and cilantro blend very well together. It kind of makes it mushy to me. Overall, it was decent.  Roasted Fire chicken- The chicken was soft and tasty.  Passion Fruit juice- Yum! Sweet and tart! I love it!  Lastly, they take card and your food comes out pretty quick. Overall, my meal came out to $20 which is always nice in Vegas. I am a happy camper and I would love to come here again on my next trip.

Forever in my heart.  I discovered this place back in 2014 when I was visiting for Life is Beautiful festival 2014. I have been going to this place every single time when visiting Vegas since then. Most times it's been multiple visits here during every Vegas trip! Location is right between the new strip and the old strip - nearby the Stratosphere from what I can remember.  Other than the arepas, I've tried their empanadas, pastelitos, french fries, and their yucca root. All of them have been really good but nothing will top their arepas! I've had arepas at Bay Area music festivals but never like the ones they make here. Before this place, I've only had plain arepas. Never did I know that these babies can be served in a sandwich pocket-like form.  I'm a pescatarian so I could only speak for the non red meat items. Their chachapa (corn and cheese arepas) are on a sweeter side - definitely pretty tasty but it's pretty greasy to what I'm used to ordering here. When I'm here I usually order two arepas - both flavors differ each other. They are more than happy to custom your order.  The two sauces they offer with these arepas are also pretty good! I remember one is of a creamy consistency and the other one is just green sauce. I love their green sauce! It's got a bit a kick of spice to it.  My meat eater friends seem to love it as well. Not too sure on what they get but all of it looks delicious.   Service is great, the staff is very friendly and welcoming. The place itself is pretty spacious - tons of room to sit. The parking lot is a bit small.  I've been almost 4 months since I've last been here (the longest I've been without it :( ) and I'm suuuuuuuper missing this place.   I wish their hours went beyond midnight. There were too many times after a night out in Vegas when I wish I had arepas. They do delivery as well! Haven't tried that yet though.

The place was worth checking out and the food was decent. It is nice they have vegetarian options I wouldn't mind returning but I'm not itching to go back. I got a vegetarian arepa and thought the portion was a little small for the price.
Todo delicioso, y el servicio: excelente. Comimos arepas y pollo asado, lo cual da opcion para cualquier gusto.

This place bas delicious arepas that are almost as good as homemade! The price and serving sizes are just right and its a quick lunch or dinner spot. The guava cheese dessert is unusually delicious as well!

Amazing food. I got 2 empanadas and 2 shots of espresso with milk.  I honestly did not know empanadas can taste so delicious.  The coffee also did not disappoint, and I was expecting it to be bad since they really weren't a coffee joint.  My friend got the yucca fries... tasted like fresher sweet potato fries.. loved it with my soul.

tried to go today at lunchtime:  but didn't realize it doesn't open until 3:00pm...would have been nice had someone posted that critical bit of information...so I am - in the hopes that it saves someone else a trip and will be back another day...

I love coming here because the arepas are filled with flavor and the price is affordable!  It's definitely a place to try esp. if you haven't tried an arepa before. I love the sauces they give you too a spicy and non spicy sauce which is perfect to top your arepa!

In the past, it was always one and done with my gelato fix, but today, I finally made time to complete the Desert Companion's "Best Foodie One-Two Punch" of 2014: Viva Las Arepas followed by Art of Flavors.  I'm glad I tried this place. I went for the pork butt arepa ($4.50) and shredded beef arepa ($5.00), making the cheese upgrade ($0.50) for both. Fried corn filled with a decent quantity of meat is already a recipe for success, and you can add the cilantro sauce (in the yellow or one of the clear bottles) or the spicier red sauce that I sampled a bit of. I think the shredded beef actually had more flavor than the pork butt, but that means the pork butt is a better vehicle for the sauces.  I also tried my friend's fried plantain, which was about as mushy and brown as you'd expect if you just fried a plantain (or banana) on your own at home. It's not very sweet at all, so it's rightfully listed as a side and not a dessert.  The prices could be better given the relatively small portion sizes - I wasn't too full afterward - and the arepas do lack just a bit of the extra flavor oomph that would take it to the next level. However, I could see myself coming back here for future "one-two punch" trips.  P.S. Art of Flavors was solid, as usual.  (UPDATE: Downgrade from 4-stars to 3-stars. After having tried Rika Arepa Express, the other big game in town, I realized how lacking in flavor these arepas are. Oh, and Street Dogs also does arepas better.)

Everything was so good; I had the roasted pork butt arepa w avocado and cheese, he had the carne Asada, we shared fries and a cheese empanada.  The sauces were great, even the fries were the perfect fried-ness.  I first noticed I liked this place because it felt up to date w their tv screen menus and tablets for their point-of-sale system.  Look forward to coming back and trying a different arepas!

Where have Arepas been all my life?  If this is Venezuelan food then sign me up! I'm very glad I didn't immigrate to Venezuela as I would probably would have ended up being a 400lb whale on the beach snacking on Arepas all day.  Once again the Yelp community didn't steer me wrong. For weeks I've been seeing yelpers rave about this place, so I decided it was time.  Located on Las Vegas Blvd and East Oakey Blvd, Viva Las Arepas is a store down from the other favorite Art Of flavors. The parking is very limited, so be prepared to maybe park somewhere close by. Trust me the walk is worth it.  After going around their menu I decided why not the Pork and chicken Arepas. Served on a rectangular  dish, they were served pretty much hamburger style. With a hot sauce and what seemed like a tart sauce are served with your meal. Both dishes bursts with flavor. The breading I think was freshly made. Big credit. Very filling meal if your trying one or two.   To drink they have canned soft drink and bottled water. The real stuff is the juices they have on tap. I can not remember what juice I had but it was a suger cane drink of some sort. It complemented the meal quite well. Tell your friends, this place is bomb  Overall Service: 4-5 Drink: 4-5 Food: 5-5 Cleanliness: 4-5 Coming back: Yess

This is by far one of my favorite spots in Vegas, and I love bringing friends here who are visiting from out of town. Amazing Venezuelan food, and the sister gelato place next door is even better. Tip: The food is way more filling than it looks. Order slowly. And then go next door and try some lavendar gelato. LOVE IT!

Wonderful Experience + least likely to think of Venezuelan Food when traveling to Vegas. Love the concept! Arepas were so flavorful + they even offer wood fired meats.  Authentic, Considerate food served here. Love it!

tip:  get an arepa, then cross the street to get some frozen custard!  At around $4, it's somewhat pricey for a rather small but plenty tasty arepa.  Beef tongue arepas were very tender, but was cooked through so much that you won't know its beef tongue or beef brisket. comes with green sauce which was fantastic.  also have sugar cane drinks (asians love that $h!t)

First let me say yummy! If you don't know what arepas are, don't be afraid to try them. This place has some really great food.  I tried the chicken and one with black beans, pork, plantains and cheese. They are about the size of a street taco but 4x as filling. They look like an empanada but they are fluffier. I can't forget to mention the sauces! They give you 3 bottles of sauces for the arepas and they are the perfect topping for these. My favorite was the avocado/cilantro/ranch sauce. I bought 2 and ate half of each and was pretty full. The prices are super reasonable 4-7$ per arepa. The restaurant was pretty big and seemed pretty busy even at the early lunch hour I was there. If you're in the downtown area and want to try something new, different and delicious, I highly recommend giving this place a visit, you won't be disappointed.
Good service, very nice place and convenient location. But very small portions. Snack size food and it's too pricey for what it is I'm sorry.
I'm writing this review as I'm eating my yuca fries with chicharrones. SOO GOOD. I also got the ground beef arepa. ALSO SOO GOOD. Definitely recommend for something low cost in Vegas!

This place is so small I mistakenly walked into Dino's bar instead!  This was my first time trying Arepas which are from Venezuela.   The menu is very simple and the place is a little shack. The outside temperature was near 115* and you can only dine outside on stools. I felt sorry for the cook BC it was too hot eating outside  so kudos to the chef inside over a hot grill without AC!   My order -1 lengua Arepas and 1 shredded beef Arepas. I was pleasantly surprised and enjoyed the Arepas. The outside pocket tasted similar to masa around a tamale. The inside filling of beef reminded me of a stew flavor and the tongue filing was minced up and not gamy but flavorful.  The green hot sauce they give you in a bottle gives the Arepas a nice spicy kick and was yummy.   I'm a new fan of this place but next time I'll return late night instead of mid day.

I was kidnapped and drug to this place. Then I thanked my assailent for introducing me to Arepas. This place is almost a must eat for me know. If I didn't have so many must eats while in Vegas this would definately make the list. The meat the put in the Arepas is great. I enjoyed my whole meal though I prob woudl not order the asada fries again. I would suggest you give this place a try while in Vegas if you like a new experience or love Venezouling food.
Great great great!!!!  The wood grilled chicken is delicious. The aioli sauce is the best and should be smothered on everything!

Pound for pound one of the greatest spots in all of Vegas. In the hallway that runs beside the kitchen is stacked wood that they use to grill the chicken, and when you taste the chicken you are instantly knocked out by that amazing smokey flavor. It's a marvel of simple, perfect, pure flavor. The arepas themselves are equally great, especially the pork and chicken (IMHO). Be careful though. You will think you need to order two or three because they are so cheap, but you won't be able to finish even a second. They are STUFFED with ingredients, and the masa-based dough is mighty heavy. These are gut bombs of the highest order. You'll be hard pressed to find a greater value anywhere. Food this impeccable should not be this cheap.

I really wanted to like this place, I'm Colombian and I love to support Latin Business, but I got treated like shit at this place like I was begging for food or something.  It was a bald man giving me attitude like he hated his job. Food was alright. There is better Venezuelan food like Rica Arepa Express!

Arepas are amazing, and Viva Las Arepas makes some delicious ones. I'm not sure there is much more to say about it. I've taken several groups of friends to Viva Las Arepas, and they have always enjoyed it. You can't go wrong.

I spotted this place on our way to Fremont Street and Yelpers sold me on it! The place is cozy and a nice break from the chaos of the strip. Pork, chicken, and beef were all so tender, juicy, and piled high. The arepas are amazing on their own but the sauces are pretty dang good. Friendly people, modest prices, and homemade flavors will be why we will definetly be back!
This place was awesome. Clean, not crazy busy, and the food really was quite authentic.
La reina pepiada is my all time fave I get this at least a couple times a month if not more, that green creamy sauce omgggg, I have a thing for sauces and salsa, this is one of my all time favorites.

My first Arepas and is was Viva Las Vegas good!  I had to try this place after reading Craig R's review.  I've never had an Arepas before so I was looking forward to trying it.  This place is a stand alone shack on the corner at the end of the north side of the strip.  Seriously its a shack, you cant miss it cuz it sticks out!!!  They have some tables set outside so there are places to for you to eat there.  Saw a few that just swung by and got it to go.     An Arepa is a flat, round and soft patty made out of cornmeal, which is grilled, making it crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, and then it can be stuffed with beef, chicken, ham, cheese, beans, shrimp, and many more. These delights are gluten-free, and wheat-free.  Aside from arepas (hot/cold) they also serve empanadas and hallacas which are like tamales.  SInce I was having a really late dinner I decided to try 2 and got a #5 and #7 with a mango drink to wash is down.  I sat down and waited about 10 min and the guy brought it out.   #5 Roasted Pork Butt  (Pernil) which is Slow Cooked Marinated Pork, Fresh Tomato Slices and cheese.  Damn this was tasty good.  Great flavored pork, tender and juicy.  The cornmeal was grilled perfectly with a crisp!  #7 Reina Pepiada which is Shredded Chicken Breast, Avocado,  Mayonnaise, Cilantro, Green Peas.  Was like a chicken salad as this was a cold version.  They look small but they are actually pretty big and was only able to eat half of this one as I was totally full.   The guy told me about the 2 homemade sauces they have on the table.  One is green and a milder version but with a really good flavor.  I would buy some of this good stuff.  The red was obviously spicy and so I didn't really use it but it was good.    This place may look questionable but let me tell you this is a great hole in the wall place to hit up when your in LV.  It's way off the strip so you wont have to deal with lines and strip prices.  They have great tasty food   Eyes ~ Ok its on the corner and the seats are pretty much on the sidewalk. Nose ~ Not much to smell when your outside and the wind whipping! Ear ~ Cars cars cars! Mouth ~ Damn tasty arepas! Tummy ~ Stop stuffing more food mouth, I'm freaking full yo!

Not really sure how to describe this place, as I had never ventured into a Venezuelan restaurant before.  The food is amazing, the service is amazing, the meal on day two (since day one was so good) was even better than day 1.    I am in love with the food here, and look forward to being back in a few days.  The roasted chicken - fyi - is so good you'll slap your momma!

My daughter and I try to come here at least once a month. If we lived closer we would come here more often. Our usual order... a wood fire chicken arepa with cheese & avocado and we share a side salad. Soooo yummy & addictive! :)  Ingredients are fresh & homemade, the restaurant is clean and spacious with indoor & outdoor seating and the owner and staff are always helpful & friendly.

This place is amazing!  If I had to pick one place to eat for the rest of my life or my last meal, this place would be it.  Authentic Venezuelan cuisine in a mom and pop shop atmosphere. Cheap food and some of the best service I've had.  You order at the counter. There's plenty of seating inside and there's also an outside patio.  Open until midnight every night. My favorite is the cachapas Arepas. If you love corn bread and cheese, this is something that will be right up your alley.
The food here was amazing. I had the beans, rice, chicken, plantains, and empanadas. Literally everything was amazing. I paid a total of 15 with tip for my meal.
These are best arepas I've had! Although these are hard to split/share, I'd recommend it because there wasn't an arepa I didn't like.

I would have enjoyed my first Venezuelan sammich more if I weren't so hungover.  Nonetheless, I still enjoyed the Turkey Pastrami & Cheese Arepa until the bread got soggy... and the view of the strip club across the street. I liked my friend's super loaded and savory Garlic Shrimp Arepa better though... I'll order that next time.   - Ideal for a quick snack or to-go, since this little shack really is a glorified food truck. - Plastic is accepted, but bring ca$h if you're only ordering one item, since all the arepas are between $3 - $5. - I guess the juices are made from fresh fruit (yay!), because guava wasn't in stock the day I went (boo!) - No clearly defined parking spaces - we parked right by the shack - Misters out front kept our skin hydrated in the scorching heat

We were cruising down Las Vegas Blvd wondering what to eat. We came across this gem of a restaurant. Never had Venezuelan food so we decided to try it.  The wood fire beef arepas was out of this world.  Prices are very reasonable too.  Will go there again
The food was amazing! Can't wait until the next time to explore the menu. The service was amazing, in addition to the authenticity of the Venezuelan culture.

I absolutely LOVE this place. I have been here several times after reading about it in las vegas weekly. the food is to perfection everytime! the prices are amazing for this type of quality of food. i LOVEEEE the sauce that they serve on the side of the arepas. they are to die for.

Excellent Venezuelan food. Randomly discovered while driving to get luv-it custard by the stratosphere a couple years ago. The price for each arepa is a little steep, especially if you add cheese and avocado, but it's well worth the price. The size is a good portion. My first time, I ate 2 and was too full. The carne asada and roasted pork butt are delicious. Extremely flavorful. The corn bun just melts in your mouth, while the meat is seasoned and juicy. The empanadas are great also. Nice hidden gem on the strip/yet off the strip.
better, more authentic venezuelan arepas than most i've had in the state.  mechado and pork butt were good.  my usual favorite, reinas pepiadas, had too much cilantro.

This place is such a great find. Delicious and authentic arepas and friendly staff. We loved the black bean and cheese, ham and cheese and cachapa arepa and finished it off with mango juice. Delicious !! Can't wait to come back next time we are in Vegas.

Great customer service!! The place is clean and nice. I had fried yucca,carne arepa,chicken, platanos,coconut pastry and a passion fruit drink. I loved everything.My husband is picky and he loved everything too.Can't wait to go back!!
Love this place. Colorful busy little place with great Venzuluan food. Newly opened, this place will be a hit. Can't wait to get back there. Try their pork butt with rice and black beans.
Excelente comida, muy sana, el lugar muy aseado, excelente atención, super recomendado chef Pedro.

Let just say my appetite was araped. But it was consensual so... that is just something to think about. I hope no one is offended by that... and if you are well... whatever.  So this place was really good. How often do I eat arepas you ask? never. This was my first time and they are really delicious... i wish i remember the ones I liked but... i tried every single one!! avoid the ones with tomatoes i remember not liking those... also I dont like long walks on the beach.  The meat flavoring is really delicious. All of the empanadas are good... but especially the bean one.... OMGG (double G). So i strongly recommend eating it. also buying 80 dollars worth of food get them to treat you really well... but that is buying everything on the menu.  It is a great place to try.   THE VERDICT: Well... let me think for a second... do you like venezuela... if you say no you are a racist so... go get some arepas or you are a racist. its science. I really enjoyed it, if you are in the area hit it up. Also its next to a bails bond thing so... if someone gets arrested... you got some yummy arepas and freedom.

This place is awesome!  It's been awhile since I have had an authentic arepa, and it was spot on!  I had the wood fire beef one and it was delicious.  Prices are reasonable too.  I'm definitely adding this place to my rotation while in Vegas.
