At the moment I'm going to rate 3-STARS only because not only is this my first visit to VIVA LAS AREPAS but my first AREPA.  "Don't judge me, I'm a AREPA VIRGIN"  Before the upgraded location I would pass the stand at least 4x's a week.  But it never called out to me: "c'mon dee, you know you want to try one, just one.  pull the car over dee, you won't be disappointed" Needless to say that conversation never happened.  So the other day I was watching Triple D and Guy Fieri was at a restaurant named VALENCIA LUNCHERIA and the chef made REINA PEPIADA.  I can't lie, it looked so delicious my mouth to started to water (stop laughing).  So I told myself that I will make a trip to VIVA LAS AREPAS.  I'm not quite sure about this, but I think they've been here in Las Vegas for at least 5yrs.  It's VEGAS, longevity does not come easy in this town.  OK, so enough of the introduction to this review, let's get to the REAL:  I order the REINA PEPIADA w/ a side order of handcut shortstrings.  I promise no disrespect to the Venezuelan culture, this reminds me of a TORTA. I didn't say it taste like a torta, its just reminiscent of a torta (its the san diegan in me)  FOOD:  AREPA shredded chicken breast w/ avocado and cilantro, accompanied w/ a creamy cilantro dressing and salsa.  the AREPA itself is grilled to a light brown, giving a nice crust w/ crunch.  the chicken breast is mixed together w/ the avocado and cilantro. (creamy chicken salad style)  super light and dense, nice crunch when you bite into it.  the chicken is not under/over cooked nor seasoned.  perfect amount of spice, topping the AREPA w/ the salsa is the KICKER.  OMG, the salsa by itself delicious, it has the kind of heat that does not hit you right away, the heat kicks in at the back of the throat.  Mmm, Mmm, Mmm that shizzy is FIRE!  the creamy cilantro dressing I did not dress my AREPA w/ it for the avocado covered that for me.   FRENCH FRIES i will pass on these, maybe because I got it to go my fries were soggy.....ok, no that's not going to work for me.  I'M JUST SAYING there is another well known establishment that offers handcut fries and they always make it to the house w/ crisp.   Arepas are reasonably priced, the most "expensive" arepa on the menu is $6.00 (Shrimp and Garlic arepa).  The fries are nothing fantastic, there are alternatives to the fries: fried plantains of fried yucca root.  There are other things that I would like to try on this menu, so I will be making a couple of more visit to experience the other Venezuelan delights on this menu.   SUN -THU: open til 10pm FRI-SAT: open til MIDNIGHT   TRY THEM OUT, I'M GOING BACK ;-)

Word is starting to spread about I Love Arepas and boy oh boy does it live up to all the buzz it's receiving. At a little less than $4 a pop, you're going to end up walking away from this food stand with a mouth full of smiles and belly full of happy.  If you asked me what an arepa was a few hours ago, I'd reply back with a blank stare and a scratch of the head. Ask me this in the present, and you'll find me blindingly reciting the Wikipedia description word-for-word, while dual-wielding an arepa in each hand.  The arepa is basically a fried flat cornmeal based sandwich filled generously with a meat of choice. Here, at I Love Arepas,  they have all of the usual meats that you'd find at a taco shop (beef, carne asada, shredded chicken/beef, tripe, lengua, etc.), along with their own unique concoctions.   Since it was my first visit I was recommended these two items: *#1 Carne Mechada - Shredded beef, bell pepper, onions, tomato, garlic *#7 Reina Pepiada - Shredded chicken breast, avocado, mayonnaise,  cilantro, green peas  I'd say that the #7 came out the winner in this one, but the carne mechada was at a close second due to how meaty it was (shredded beef lovers rejoice!). My mouth is flooding with drool now that I'm recalling what I ordered just a few minutes ago. I'm going to make it a mission to try every item on their menu. Before you know it, I'll be a stuffed, wobbling arepa machine by the time I'm through with it.  One downside about I Love Arepas is that it's located in Stabbytown, USA. The area isn't the greatest. If you've been to Luv It Frozen Custard (across the street), you'd know what I mean. If hobos don't scare you, give I Love Arepas a shot without hesitation. If the common-day bearded hobo does give you the willies, bring a friend along with you and share the love.

I have long avoided this place for two reasons: one, I despise the food truck trend. And two, my previous experience with arepas was limited to some mystery-meat-stuffed weirdness at a bus depot in the Venezuelan hinterlands.  But yesterday, as I was driving past the street corner where the Arepa boys do business...out of the corner of my eye I noticed that the proprietors were two hot Venezuelan dudes of childbearing age. Hell-O! I did a quick U-turn and pulled into the parking lot.   As mentioned, my previous experience with arepas left me skeptical...but the hotness of the staff, and the fact that it's not actually a food truck, but more of a dingy kiosk unadorned with Twitter and Facebook logos, convinced me to give 'em a second try. And now.......... I, too, Love Arepas!  I only had one -- the bean and cheese. But it was fantastic!! WAY better than the ones I had in Venezuela (they hate Americans down there, so they probably pissed in my arepa at that bus depot). At $3.50 it was a filling mini-meal...and actually stuck to my ribs through three cocktails, preventing me from getting wasted and doing embarrassing things down on Fremont St.  IMO this is hands down the best dining in all of Vegas -- cheap, unpretentious, delicious and al fresco. You can sit at the little tables in front of the arepa pod and enjoy the scenery of the neighborhood: a strip club, a dive bar and an all-night drugstore patronized by pimps and weirdos.   I will MOST DEFINITELY be coming here again and again and again -- and that's just with the hot proprietors. I'll come to the kiosk again, too :-)

This was the best meal I ate in Vegas during this last trip and the most affordable. The plantains were sweet and fabulous. Best plantains I have ever eaten. The pork butt arepa was delicious with the green sauce. Also the shrimp one was even better. I loved the fresh juices the most- so refreshing and not too sweet. I will definitely be back to try more next time.

I haven't been here since they moved out of the Dino's parking lot. It's a shame, because it is really good.   For my money, the carne asada arepa, with egg and cheese added, is the money order. I also had their fried plantains for the first time, which were definitely interesting. I enjoyed them, but could see how they might not be everyone's cup of tea.   There was about a 10 minute wait, but I didn't mind it all that much. It meant that everything was cooked fresh.   The arepas look small but they are deceivingly filling. They cost between $5.50 and $7 each, which is pretty decent for what you get.   Overall, great little unique dining experience.

I had been meaning to check out Viva las Arepas for a long time now. I read that they recently moved to a larger location so we decided to check it out.   Both my friend and I ordered an arepa de reina pepiada, a sort of chicken salad filling, with avocado mayo dressing and a meat empenada, since two arepas would've have been too much food. I also ordered a mango water, which was very refreshing and not too sweet. Both the arepa and the empanada were very tasty.  The foos in itself is merits a four star review, and although I am hsistant, I am giving them three stars becaus eboth my friend and I felt ill afterwards. I know a lot goes into getting sick from food, veryone's digestive system if different. With that said, I can eat anywhere and I've never gotten sick.  My friend seems to think it was the salsa they gave us on the side, she says it seemed a bit off, more vinegar-y than it should be.   Regardless, as I said the food was really good so I am definitely planning on coming back and letting the management know about the sauce. I am sure it was just a fluke.

Do yourself a favor and order the Reina Pepiada.   We came in on a Sunday before noon and the place was quiet. The staff took considerable time explaining the dishes including making recommendations regarding adding cheese or avocado. I found them both cheerful and helpful.  We tried the following... Arepas: Chicken Pork Reina Pepiada  Empanada: Guava (and mozzarella)  Drink: Soursop

Stopped here for lunch while running errands.  Ordered the carne asada arepa, shredded chicken empanada, and a taqueno(home made cheese stick).  The arepa was awesome.  The corn cake like outside was crispy and they stuff it with your choice of meat, lettuce, tomato, onion,  and cheese and avocado are extra.  The empanada was made of the same corn dough, the chicken on the inside was good.  The taqueno was the corn dough wrapped around a stick of mozzarella and then fried.    Everything was very good.  Will be back to try some different menu items like the chicharrons and yuca frites.

Bigger does not always mean better. Seriously, why did they have to change things when they moved to a larger space, down the street?  Before my husband gave it to me, he said "Do you want the good news or the bad news?" Not a nice opener. He followed it up with the owner saying the menu was changed. I was so looking forward to getting my chicken arepa yesterday for lunch while watching my game on tv. Well, the chicken was totally different- I get grossed out when I am pulling out pieces of cartilege, then I finally took off the chicken and just ate the corn part. My husband's beef arepa was super salty, good flavor, but dang the saltiness was really high. He likes salt but he didn't finish it, so I threw it out (I can't eat that).   On top of all this, the prices got higher. Such a disappointment. I don't know if anyone else feels the same.

Not a bad place. I can only eat one thing on the menu but it's very good. The veggie arepas without cheese. It's good, have to have it on my "cheat days" they charge 50 cents for a cup of water... Find that annoying. It's just like a fast food place. Order at the counter & pick up your food when it's ready. I would come back for the arepas.

first time trying this, my son had been here before. It was so good, I wish there was one closer to home. I had the #7 which was chicken, avocado and mayo cilantro. The BOMB....we also had their version of mozzarilla sticks, Tequeno Pastelito. The cachapa is really good, tastes like sweet cornbread tortilla filled with cheese. Chicken was grilled and flavored and the beef fries were tasty.  Place was clean, friendly staff

Viva Las Arepas has come far, starting off as a little shack in a strip mall or parking lot area of somewhere that I can't recall. It was back several years ago when they first opened that I tried their arepas and wasn't too impressed at that time.   I had the pork butt arepa this time along with the cachapa. Both were quite amazing. I'm not a huge fan of the exterior of the arepa in general, but the pork butt was marinated to perfection and with the green sauce it went well together.   The cachapa I got was a bit undercooked, but, I donated it to my coworkers and they were quite blown away, given that it was their first time they had tasted anything like it. I'll definitely be back to try several of their items again, as their menu is now vast with so many options!

This place is HEAVEN in a pocket! I LOVE Arepas #7! It is one of the best on the go meals I have ever had!   The Empanadas are delicious as well!  The sauces are addictive... I put that stuff on everything I order!   The staff is friendly and take pride in their work. The place is clean and cute!   I will go back there every chance I get and will tell everyone I know about it!   YUM! YUM! YUM!

Don't let the neighborhood scare you away! The place is a great place for a date. Cheap, fun, makes you seem like a true cultured foodie. I recommend getting the reina pepiada; however, I may be biased with my love for avocado. The yukka root tastes like french fries, but better. Eat them with the green and white sauce!  Water cups cost 50 cents! Parking lot is not very big.  End your date with a stop at the gelato place next door :)

4. Roasted pork butt 1. Wood fired shredded chicken. The pork is just pork with tomatoes. Extra 99 cents for avocado, but the pork is so well flavored I don't think it needs it.  Wood fired shredded chicken- comes with lettuce. Pay the 99 cents for avocado. It's not as flavored, but with the avocado it's just as good as the number 4.  Bigger, cleaner location than the Las Vegas blvd location. They have a huge table that can fit your 10+ group.  Order online and pick up! Don't forget to pick up sauce.. neither are spicy. The light green is my favorite!

As I was passing through Vegas, I needed something quick but also something different. I found this place on Yelp and it looked intriguing. Came here on a Sunday around 5 and it wasn't crowded. I decided to order an arepa with carne asada, tomatoes and lettuce (#1) and one with the shredded chicken and avocado (#7). I was not disappointed at all by my choices. The wood fire beef was cooked well and the meat was very flavorful. The chicken was also flavorful, moist, and creamy inside. I really liked that it was like a torta but the "bun" was made of corn. I was scared that buying only 2 of them wasn't going to be enough, but it fills you up fast. We also shared the chicharron with yucca fries and the fried plantains. The chicharron was fried well and fresh while the plantains were sweet but not overly oily. According to Yelp, everyone really likes the sauces here. They give you 2 bottles, one which is a creamy spicy sauce while the other one is a verde green sauce. The creamy sauce was great with all of them while the verde salsa was fairly typical of most Latino restaurants. Overall I thought the food was super good here. I would definitely come back here in a heart beat when going through Vegas. The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is because of the prices. I thought $5-$7 was a tad steep for what you're actually getting. Don't get me wrong, it was really good, but to get pretty full, you'll probably end up spending $10-$12, which isn't bad at all, just not as cheap as I thought it would be.

Great food and customer service!  We went for a late lunch on Sunday.  It was busy but there were plenty of available seats.  I ordered a beef and a Reina Pepiada arepa!  The Reina Pepiada was filled with a delicious cold chicken salad with a cilantro mayo dressing. The arepa was hot with a slightly crunchy crust - I devoured it.  The arepas were served with two bottles of sauce, one creamy cilantro and a super hot, make you sweat, sauce.  Luckily, I had a delicious Passion Fruit juice! And to the service - bravo!  The man behind the counter noticed me looking around (at my table) and asked me if I needed anything.  They promptly brought a fork to my table!  I was too full for the beef arepa so they packaged it to go - with two small sauces.  I have used that spicy sauce for two meals - YUMMY!  Can't wait to go back for the food and excellent friendly service!
So tasty so good can't describe the taste of it try it amazing Venezuela food. So gooooooooooooood!!!!

OMG! my food is delicious! I don't write reviews but I had to write this one. I had a chicken empanada and a chicken arepas . my boyfriend had the half chicken with black beans and rice all with wood grilled chicken. when I tell you it was all delicious I mean scrumptous. and the service was awesome. I definitely recommend it! I will come here everytime I visit. as a matter of fact we might make special trips...

Generously stuffed Arepas, unless you're really hungry, one should satisfy even the most hungry Las Vegas gambler.  Friendly service, a clean environment and air conditioning greeted our party of 4 on a hot July evening.  While there were not many patrons at the time, we knew we were in for a treat as Viva Las Arepas had been listed in the recent "Best of Las Vegas" article, it did not disappoint.

Woah. Number 4 without tomatoes, add avocado, with a side of fried plantains and a water. It was served with 2 sauces, one salsa verde and the other I don't remember but that verde is SPICY GOOD! The shredded, roasted pig butt was so flavorful with the avocado and corn exterior, my mouth is already watering for another one. The fried plantains are good too. I don't know what to try next but I can't wait!! A definite hotspot in Las Vegas!!

There's nothing I can yelp that hasn't already been yelped about Arepas. But alas I have to write a review if I want to add Arepas to a list (a few lists, really) of favorites.   I really haven't eaten a wide spectrum of arepas. I've had the veggie ($4) and camarones al ajillo ($5). The veggie is just meh, but the camarones with the side sauces is so good.   I guess it also helps that when I go, I'm normally hopped up on vodka and Danny G's karaoke from Dino's (shares a parking lot with Dino's). When I'm in that state, I have no discrimination filter and I love all food.   These tasty little pockets are yummy, but a little on the pricey side for the portion sizes. Though I've heard, but have no confirmation, that the corn meal is imported straight from Venezuela. Who knows. It sounds nice, though. So take your time and savor the taste and texture of the cornmeal pocket. So yummy.   You can also get tasty beverages like guanabana ($1.75)  to wash down your arepa. Wonderful.   Friendly staff.

- First time here was 2 years ago in 2014. Coming back this year, I was welcomed by the familiar owner of Viva Las Arepas  - Friendly server and owner. They enjoy chatting and are accommodating to your requests. We asked for some ice water to be refilled in our water bottles and our wishes were granted  - A wide variety of Arepas (Beef, Chicken, Pork, Seafood, Vegetarian, etc). Our personal recommendation is roasted beef
I came in here for a quick bite to eat after driving in from Reno and I have to say,  it was delicious,  I'll definitely be back again before I leave.
Staff was super friendly, and although my first time eating Arepas, it was extremly tasty.  Would recommend you give it a shot!

In my taste buds opinions this place rules the roost and Felix along with his staff are the best at cooking and being great people. My favorite thing to eat there is the #7 Reina Pepiada, which is a shredded chicken breast salad, made with avocado, mayo, cilantro and peas.It is definitely the star on the menu, but the carne mechada, pork butt (pernil) and the bean and cheese arepas are also great. But I've had 90% of the menu and have never  been disappointed.

This place is very small but packs a huge flavorful punch to your taste buds! Made me an instant fan! I had the #1 carne machado, beef empanada & the coconut with cheese pastelito. I also tried the guava & cheese pastelito, that thing was amazing! I loved every morsel of all the good food I was able to try.

I was visiting LV for a conference (stayed at the LVH) and wanted to eat away from the strip and downtown for a change. Luckily, I spotted this place from a taxi ride on the way to Fremont days earlier. So glad I did! I've sampled arepas made by Venezuelan friends, and the ones I got tasted exactly the same. The chicken with avocado and shredded beef...simple, wonderful. Next time, I'll skip the cheese on the chicken (cheese slice just sits there between warm corn arepa and cool filling, and for me, would have been better off without).  On top of the great food, the owner went above and beyond. He called a taxi for us and walked outside a few times to make sure we'd get the cab; what a nice, nice man. One of the best meals, and service, we received over the course of a 4 day work trip.

You have to try this place! Been to their two locations a couple times, and their food is amazingly good. They have very friendly customer service, they are pretty fast and inexpensive. I usually get one arepa, share an appetizer and this gets me satisfied. The carne asada, reina pepiada, meat empanadas, and arepa cachapa are my favorites!!!!!

Soooo good! Good portion size, very stuffed! Around 5$ each. The guy at the register was very nice and provided great customer service. We got a carne asada arepa, chicken and ham with cheese arepa. I need to go back and try different ones.

The food is really good. I eat here everytime I'm in Vegas. This time the owner Felix stopped me at the door and told me that I did not look like a "customer" and didn't want me there. I seriously thought I was on a hidden camera prank show. He said "you don't look like a customer" and "you people come in here and act a type of way". I was alone and thought he'd mistaken me for a previous patron. I asked him if he was joking about the "you people" and the "you don't look like a customer" comments. I told him that I dine there all the time. He said "you need to understand that I'm a business owner and I don't want certain people in here". Shocked, I went to the restroom to call my husband so he could hear what was happening. I then went to place my order and the same man now behind the counter said "what's your name"? I told him my name (still in shock and waiting for cameramen to jump out). I asked his name and he said "Felix and I'm the owner".  As he rang me up he said "sorry about earlier but you people really can be a type of way". I'd had enough at that point and said "had you not treated me with such a discriminatory tone I would have spend my money here". I walked out, still on the phone with my husband, and I went to the clothing store next door. After being in there for 5-8 mins Felix walked in and processed to harass me in the store next door!! I shit you not!! I have several witness. I seriously recommend that people who "don't look like customers" or fall into the category of "you people" to dine elsewhere. Horrible experience nonetheless I will continue to enjoy, just Arepas someplace else. Hey Felix..go Google the racist Starbucks incident. You may learn something. Anyone else who experience this type of harassment from this place to please message me.

We ate here on our last day in Vegas. We'd passed the I heart Arepas sign every time we made our way up and down the strip. After we returned from our Hoover Dam tour we marched here from the old strip. It was delicious. We had the shrimp and chicken arepas, with a few drinks. What a great treat in the middle of the desert.

If you are looking for one hell of an arepa, I can't recommend this place enough. They were very good, very cheesy and tasty. Not the healthiest of options but I highly recommend if you are treating yourself.

Electrolytes are important when one is in Las Vegas. All that boozing and partying will zap the essential vitamins and minerals from your body.  The arepas that this joint makes will have lots of electrolytes because they are overloaded with salt; and it looks like the heavy salt hand was not a one time incident as other fellow Yelpers also mention the non phenomenon.  Arepa was extra doughy on the inside and not in a good way. Cooking a proper arepa takes a very long time, 15-20 minutes. I prefer my arepas to be fully cooked, through and through.   Bummed that these Arepas were inedible. The smokey flavor of the mesquite wood on the meat was awesome and I could still taste the subtleties of the smoke flavor behind the heavy mask of the salt.   Possibly excellent food is ruined by sloppy execution
Wood fire beef arepa was delicious. Spring for the sour cream and avocado. We also got the yucca fries which were also yummy with the green sauce. Try this place you won't be disappointed

This place has great arepas, we always stop here when we go to Vegas. They have clearly labeled vegetarian options and their vegetarian arepa is actually vegan as there's no dairy in it. I believe most of the side dishes are vegan as well. I also got white rice and black beans, the beans are not only vegan but very flavorful! Their prices are also reasonable and perfect for people on a gluten free diet too since arepas are made from corn. They have two homemade sauces, if you are vegan you can have the green sauce instead of the guasacaca sauce which has dairy in it.
First time trying Venezuelan food and it was delicious. I got the Fire steak  and pork butt Arepas  with rice and beans.  I love the wood fire taste and the salsas were amazing.
Absolutely delicious! Made to ordered goodness everything was so fresh. Highly recommend the smoked chicken arepa and garlic shrimp!

Mmmmmmm Arepas..... My first experience with Arepas was here and I'm definitely a fan. Love the doughy flatbread the meat/shrimp/veggies comes in, it's crispy on the outside and soft and fluffy on the inside (yum!). My favorite filling is wood fired shredded chicken with avocado and garlic shrimp. Both are great. The also have a variety of other fillings and even a vegetarian version. You can add cheese, avocado, and now egg to any arepa.  The shredded chicken empanadas and guava and cheese pastelitos are great too. I tend to crave arepas and pastelitos now and then and always come here. I've never been disappointed.  The staff is very friendly and patient, even when I stare at the menu for 20 minutes thinking I'll order something new and still get what I was craving.

Viva Las Arepas is awesome! Arepas are life. I love the deliciously crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside bread. The best part is that they are stuffed with a variety of deliciousness.  My favorites are Wood Fired Shredded Chicken, Garlic Shrimp, and Pabellon - beef, beans, plantains, and cheese. Pabellon sounds like a weird combination, right? It is fantastic! Bursting in flavors. I also enjoy their empenadas and pastelitos. Specifically the shredded chicken empanada and guava and cheese pastelito. I've also tried the half chicken plate that was good but I missed the Arepas when I got it. Having one Arepa will fill you but if you're greedy like me, you probably wont settle on one. So?!

First time having an arepa, and oh my god it was like heaven in my mouth.   I got the wood fire chicken arepa with avacado added, although it was not really nessisary since the meat and bread that holds it are super moist and they give you such yummy sauces to add to it.  The flavors were bold and complex and I have a new favorite place. We also got the shredded beef empanadas, which were also very rich and satisfying. Way more filling than I thought they would be for the size.  I also got a side of plantains and they were yummy and carmalized from the cooking process. Everything I got tasted good in the sauces they gave me, even the plantains. God I want to take these sauces home!    The location is right next to art of flavors, which was our original destination.  However it wasn't open yet until 1, so when I realized one of my book marks was next door and smelled the amazingness that was coming from here, I had to try. I am so glad I did.  Just a heads up they have outside seating as well.

*3.5 stars*  We checked this little food stand out after our friend raved about it and mentioned that it was featured on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives.    I ordered the Chicken (Pollo Mechado) Arepas and the Beef Empanada.  I ate the empanada in the car and it was definitely fresh and hot (so hot I burned the roof of my mouth on it) ;(   We waited until getting back to the hotel to have the Arepas.  Tip: make sure you have wet wipes and a lot of extra napkins....there is no pretty way to eat this bad boy!  While it was definitely flavourful, and filled with meat (you definitely get your money's worth), I found it way too filling. Also, by the time we got back to the hotel, the arepa had sadly gone soggy.  But the accompanying sauces were great toppers.    Value wise - it's a great value. $4 for a whole lotta meat!  And only $2 for the empanada.    That said, I almost feel bad about giving Viva Las Arepas a 3.5 rating, after seeing all the great reviews here.  I will definitely give Viva Las Arepas a chance again upon my next Vegas visit, and this time, I will make sure to enjoy my arepas right away.

A friend of mine took me here, and it was so good! I got the #7, I think it was called the reina. You get full off one, & they are decent priced as well. I also tried one other item, it was like corn bread with cheese, also good! I didn't know what to expect but I was satisfied! I didn't catch his name but the guy working there was extremely friendly & valued the customers. Clean restaurant. On my next trip back to Vegas I will be going back!
Not much I can add that hasn't already been said. just dang good food and a nice clean place. been a few times already and will return a few more.

A regular haunt of Friday-nite Aruba Swings patrons a few doors down, Viva Las Arepas fueled dancers needs for good food and energy. Having been both to their old shack location, and their now storefront location, their arepas are wonderfully delicious and filling. The guy at the counter always laughed at (with) me when I ordered since I can't pronounce it right, but I get the veggie arepa and the cold arepa with chicken and avocado. The wait isn't long, and they make it when you order it. Better than fast food! Try their mango and passionfruit drinks too!

A small shack on the strip with about 5 tables on the sidewalk.  The arepas are about $4-5 each.  I got a hot beef and cheese and a cold chicken and avocado.  I loved the beef because it was hot/warm and the arepa bun was also hot and tasted good hot.  The cold one was meh.  The chicken and avocado was a good combo, but the arepa bun was like eating a corn tortilla right out of the plastic bag.  It needed some heat on the corn meal to make it softer.  I wouldn't get a cold one again, but the hot ones are really good and worth it.

I wish this place was closer to the strip. I would eat every meal of the weekend here if I could. It is definitely a must try if you are visiting Vegas especially since food gets so pricey on the strip with all these chef restaurants and what not. If you are looking for some messy but delectable eats, this is your stop.  I ordered the garlic shrimp and the shredded beef with cheese. I wouldn't get the garlic shrimp again because it didn't have enough flavor for me, even though it was still a great choice, I also needed to add alot of their green sauce and I felt like it wasn't worth it if I had to douse it in sauce. The shredded beef on the other hand... whole 'nother experience. The rich and succulent flavor of the beef paired with the perfect amount of cheese, a dab of their green sauce, and their hearty corn flour exterior... man oh man you are missing out if you haven't had this. The juice/oil from the meat was leaking from the arepa but I really wasn't mad because I just kept licking my hands (#shameless). Since it is made from corn flour it tends to be heavier and therefore I got filled faster so just a heads up that it might be excessive if you want two, unless you can handle that life then all power to you!   So glad I stopped by and can't wait to re-visit and try new arepas. Great service and ample seating, although I am sure it gets packed I was there at a fairly dull time (9:30PM). Must eat when in Vegas!

Ay dios mio!!  This place is amaze balls! Tiny little pouches of yummy greasy goodness.  Its the PERFECT hangover food or if you're just in the mood for something naughty but different.  This little hole in the wall is right across from the OG.  If the weather is nice, take a seat outside.  I've had the shredded beef, chicken, pork, and lengua arepas and they are delicious!  Most people order 2 or 3, but I find myself full with just one...and of course an empanada. Service is fantastic and this place is usually poppin so plan to wait a bit for this little taste of Venezuela.  Definitely worth the wait!!

Oh man, I was so excited to finally get a chance to try this place!  After several failed attempts (due to hangover induced comas), I finally struggled to get to I love Arepas (which is located next to a bar near the stratosphere casino/resort) to try as many of the arepas as possible on two consecutive trips (end of Sept 2011 and Halloween 2011).    I will start with the two sauces offered.  One is a tomatillo based, spicy salsa.  The other is a crema/avocado based sauce.  Both are freaking like crack and would go delicious on a shoe.  On to the main show.  I have had a chance to fully consume or try bites of the following (and remember, I am a fat ass at heart and am not ashamed):   1. Shredded Beef 2. Shredded Chicken 3. Beef Tongue 5. Roasted Pork Butt 7. Riena Pepiada 8. Garlic Shrimp  This place is legit and you really can't go wrong with anything on the menu, but my hands down favorites were the #1 Shredded Beef and the #7 Riena Pepiada (especially this one, it is addictively good).  In all honesty, if you are staying anywhere near the Las Vegas strip, order a cab and pay the $10 to get here and eat the delicious ass food.  One more note:  don't be fooled by the size of the arepas; they are really filling.  You can easily eat one, but two may make you explode.  I recommend coming with a group of 4-6, ordering a bunch of different arepas, and trying things family style.

The food here is delicious and reasonably priced. If you are in a hurry this is probably not the best choice for you. It's clean and the staff is friendly. I like the chicken thighs and of course the Arepas are always yummy.
The people are nice and friendly. The menu had everything I want arepas empanadas and they also had items off the grill. Really great food definitely the spot to go to !

Hands down the best Venezuelan food I've ever had in Las Vegas. Quality food made by quality people. The staff is great and food is to die for. This place is definitely on my top best places to eat in Las Vegas.   Recommendations: Everything!

Cheeeeeese empanada.  Yes the arepas are good, but I dream about the cheese empanada.  Crispy and hot and melty.  Yummmmm.  Also had the pork arepa, the chicarones, and the yuca fries.  All were good.

Friendly staff, great food!  The food is so good that I sometimes think about these arepas during random times of the day.  Everything is pretty fresh, hot and delicious!    One negative is eating out there in the heat.  It's hot.  If it is summertime try to come when the sun is down or you will fry.

Located behind the Stratosphere, Viva Las Arepas is worth visiting over and over.   Everything on their menu sounds delicious, but on my visit I was 'only' able to try the Wood Fired Chicken Arepa, Reina Pepiada Arepa, Guava and Coconut pastries.  The Reina Arepas was my fav and the sweet good were amazing.  Will have to return to try everything else.  Looking forward to additional locations opening up.  If I had to describe an arepa, it's like a dense english muffin pocket made from grits.  It is a lovely home for anything savory.

This popular downtown eats has been on my recent bookmarks to try. Arepas...a South American sandwich made of corn flatbread and various fillings. Located in the popular area of other Yelpdom heavy hitters like Art of Flavors and Goodwich, I figured Viva Las Arepas would be a no-brainer favorite. The restaurant inside is clean and warm, with more seating than parking available. If you haven't been, parking in the front is nearly non - existent. We ordered the Reina Pepiada, which is a featured review item and wood fired chicken arepas, plus an order of Yucca fries. In seeing the photos of the Reina Pepiada, I expected the sauce to be a light, creamy cilantro avocado type of dressing. What I actually experienced was very heavy and overly sauced chicken. With each bite, I kept thinking how the addition of a nice fresh slaw could cut some of that richness. The tortas were also heavy and chewy and again my expectations of a light, fluffy flatbread were dashed. I did like the peas, though. They provided additional sauces, which was unnecessary considering the meat was already drowning in it. The yucca fries were nothing special.  My daugter seemed to enjoy her wood fired chicken arepa. The Reina Pepiada didn't sit well with my wife as she was sick the rest of the night. Viva Las Arepas fell short of what I wanted to experience. I so wanted to love this place, but didn't. I will continue to search to hopefully find my ideal arepa.

My 5 stars says it all. Pictures others posted here did not tweek their photos. Their food whether you order soup, arepas, plantains, yucca, empinadas, etc...looks delicious and sure tastes delicious. You have got to try it!

Food is really good and of a reasonable price! The arepas may look small, but they are actually quite filling and PACKED with contents in each one. Ranges anywhere from $5-8 per arepas - two of them would make a very solid meal. I would highly recommend any of the ones indicated on the menu as "Chef's Recommendations", especially the one with fried plantains (#12, Pabellon). This place is located off the strip, but it has a convenient parking lot and it's easy to get to. Gets decently crowded during dinner hours, but luckily there are many tables to sit at! Service was good too, and thus had a great experience here!

I was really really really excited to try this place out because i never had Venezuelan food.  To make sure I tasted a little bit of everything, we ordered the Wood Fire Mix Grill(6) which came with enough rice for one person and fries for two. (not enough  What was most disappointing was how none of the meats were marinated nor had sauce, so all you could taste was how charred it came out.  The Arepas(10) on the other hand are freaking delicious! X) Had the carne one and i cant get enough! Probably the only dish that would give this place 5 star ratings.  I was also impressed with the whole interior color and pictures of their dishes framed on the walls, but there was only one problem... There was no air conditioning!!! I was sweating from the store rather than from the food. :[   Another cuisine down folks! Dont be afraid to try new things, because it just makes life that much more interesting. ;)
By far my most favorite place to eat when in Vegas the reina pepiada is awesome and the cachapas

I had never tried arepas before, but I can't imagine them being much better than those at Viva las Arepas. We tried the roasted pork butt arepa with cheese and another arepa with chicken breast and avocado (their most popular). The corn cakes they were served in were some of the best gluten-free concoctions my girlfriend and I have tried since identifying our respective gluten sensitivities. They were cooked throughout and crispy golden brown on the outside with soft fluffy insides. For sides, we shared the fried plantains, perfectly caramelized and cooked through with a little tangy acid to balance the sweet caramelly starch, and the rice with vegetables. The side sauces were great but not really necessary because the food was seasoned and prepared excellently already. As someone who appreciates value and feeling satisfied after a meal, I should add that our dinner was one of the best prepared meals for under $20 I've ever had if it wasn't the very best. Welll done!

This was a mixed bag, we went in to try venezuelan food. I hated the meat in chicken arepas, I couldn't take more than a bite of , but my wife loved the pork ribs. I think its safe to stick with the grilled food here.

It's a little permanent booth that's open late. There are always happy customers hanging around. The food is really yummy. The first time I ate there it was on a whim on the way home. The next time and every time after was with intent. We've ordered a bunch of different items and everything was tasty. AND you can watch them cook your food. It may be just a little booth, but I wasn't worried that I'd get sick or see the place closed due to a failed health inspection because you can see everything they are doing in the little cooking space. I recommend it for good fast, hot & fresh food.

Another must stop.  I've now tried 90% of the menu and have yet to find something I do not like.  Felix runs a really clean and delicious place, he will take excellent care of you.  Please listen to the staff and take their direction, as it will always turn out better this way, and while you are there forget coke / sprite and try a "local" flavor drink.  I look forward to seeing other Yelpers there soon!

What a treat! Having never had Venezuelan food, but very familiar with other Central and South American cuisines, I had no idea what I was in for. I ended up ordering two arepas because I was very hungry, but still really only needed one. All I know is that I wish there were more of these joints around the country. Not sure when I'll be back in Vegas, but this place will definitely be on my list of returns when I head back!!!

Second return trip and now at their new location across the street from their former food stand!  This time I met one of the owners, Felix and I  ordered the same shredded beef arepas and this time a Polar (Venezuelan) soda.  Great looking location and still wondering why it is not packed in here. This is truly Las Vegas' hidden gem.   Venezuelan food is one of my favorite cuisines and something that is lacking in Los Angeles -- or I just don't know where to get great arepas other than at Coupa Cafe in Beverly Hills. I've had Columbian arepas nearby my place, and it just didn't hit the spot.  My aunt ordered the Venezuelan empanadas this time, but were lacking flavor and bland.  Everything else about the empanada was great and wished the filling had more flavor. This empanada was unlike the many varieties I've tasted -- Filipino, Argentine, Bolvian (all each very unique).   My aunt tried the new wood fired beef arepa and she said that was also very bland -- hopefully they'll kick up the flavors in the empanadas and wood fired beef arepa.   Until then, this five-star review is for...  ... the shredded beef arepas!  This is just how I remember having it in Venezuela, along with the ham and cheese arepas I would have at the airports in Venezuela for breakfast.  Definitely go eat here while in Las Vegas and order the arepa de pabellon (shredded beef)!    Total comfort food here... we even brought a bunch of arepas back home to LA to share with the family.
The arepas are a bit oily with little to no flavor.

This was my first experience with Venezuelan cuisine and I was delighted when I stumbled upon this hole-in-the-wall restaurant. Apparently, an arepas is a flatbread made of maize, but I'd liken it to a fried English muffin. Then throw meat inside and you get a delicious snack. They range from 5-7 dollars, and I got Reina Pepiada (chicken breast, mayo, avocado, cilantro) and the Shredded Beef (with bell peppers, onions, tomato). I liked the shredded beef a lot more than the chicken breast, and both are excellent value.   I think this place would be perfect after spending a day at the North Outlets and I would definitely go again. I would really like to try the pork butt next time along with the shredded beef.

This was my first time trying arepas and I loved it!  We ordered their Reina Pepidas and it was delicious!  The sauce that came with the arepas was so delicious!     I haven't gone back since they've moved to a bigger location, so maybe next time,  I'll come back to try different arepas!  Mmmm... I want more of that sauce.....

No. No.... And no. No to the chicken arepa that is served cold, like a chicken salad full of mayo shoved inside two English muffin-esque buns. I made a very bad choice with that one.  Tried the plain cheese arepa as well. Meh. Seriously, it's English muffins stuffed with things! Sorry. I can't get on the band wagon of Yelpers that love this place.  Restaurant itself is clean and tidy. Service is great!   Food is obviously not my cup of tea. My friend had the beef arepa. I wish I had gotten that one... Hummmpphh.  Prices are kind of high IMO. Maybe I'll try it again. Time will tell.

Carne Asada arepa - 4 stars Haven't had good arepas in a while. Carne Asada Arepa is solid choice especially with avocado and cheese on top of it.  It was delicious and would definitely come back here for it.  Customer Service - 4 stars solid customer service and nice people.
what's an arepas? i dunno.   how do you pronounce it? i dunno.   is it a sandwich? kind of.   is it good? YES. how are there not more arepas places in the US.

Wow.wow.wow. Typical Vegas hangover cure, for SUREEEEEEE. Why go to a buffet to pay more and get l as quality food in a variety of mediocre presentations. Here they have taken something that could be simple as arepas and super charged it with different flavor that create a whole new twist on Venezuelen cuisine. I'm in love with this place, and can't wait share it with other friends on my next Vegas trip.   We had reina pepiada and wood fire beef arepas. To die for, and you can not go wrong with the chicken thighs plate! So much chicken with your plate PLUS delicious and homemade rice and beans.  Your hungry and in Vegas?! GO HERE!!!

I can't say enough good things about Viva Las Arepas. My boyfriend introduced me to this place about a year ago and I am so glad he did. The cheese arepas have the most glorious mixture of mozzarella and what I believe may be cotija cheese. The empanadas and tequeños are also delicious. They also offer two delicious sauces one mild green chile sauce and a creamy variety with cilantro and garlic. My boyfriend always orders the passion fruit juice.  My office is just down the street so now everyone at my job is also hooked. I love this place!  The only negatives is that soft drinks are served in cans. A soda fountain would be much more convenient. I also wish there was another location closer to my house.   Other than that, this place owns my heart. And stomach.

Even in San Francisco, you simply cannot find an authentic Venezuelan restaurant !!  The food  is not only good, it is delicious.  Forget American, Chinese, Mexican food, this is truly a change for the better.....you will not be dasapointed.

My coworker told me if we were going to be in Vegas, this spot is a must. I had the #7. Arepa Reina Pepiada and the #1. Arepa Wood Fire Beef. I put the sauce that was provided with it and not oh boy, I've never had anything like this! The location was a little bit sketchy as there was a bum going through the trash looking for food, but hey, it's Vegas! Love the food and will go there again when I'm back there.

Been meaning to try this spot for awhile. Never had an arepa prior to tonight. I'm hooked! Besides being fantastically good tasting the service was outstanding. Very friendly, at least three different staff members said hello from the kitchen behind the counter. Gentleman at the register explained what everything was without being too wordy or over the top. Will be back soon!

This place was so good. The place is a casual (but clean) fast food seating, but the food is absolutely delicious! I should start by saying that I have never had an arepas, so I had no idea what to expect.   I ordered the arepa wood fire beef, chicken empanadas, fried plantains, and a mango drink. Y'all it was DELICIOUS! I loved the arepa, although I did remove the lettuce. Such good food for a low price. I highly recommend stopping their for lunch or dinner.   Folks were extremely nice and worked extremely quickly to make the food. You can easily see into the kitchen. Viva Las Arepas works magic!

As a first timer at Viva Las Arepas in Las Vegas I was pretty impressed!  Cute little ground corn pocket breads with delicious meat fillings!   I had the chicken, avocado and coriander one. So delicious and different with peas throughout. Not as heavy as the pork butt Arepas but great none the less.   The pork butt Arepas was delicious & full of flavour. Definitely a favourite but would only have one as they are quite filling!  Great service & didn't have to wait long.

Great food! Located between downtown and the stratosphere. It was our first time going and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The prices are decent but can easily go up with the upgrades (adding avocado, cheese or egg) especially if you get all three. We had the mango water and it did not disappoint, each sip tasted like you were biting into a mango. Also, don't forget to try the fried plantains, a great choice to accompany your arepa or dessert. The only thing I didn't care for was the touch screen payment which gives you in big options to add a tip, especially since we were dining out. The girl was informative and nice so we gave her a tip but it's kinda like tipping at a fast food place. If they came and took your order at your table I would feel more comfortable tipping.   Overall, great choice!!

This place really does live up to the hype! The arepas are amazing! My favorite is the Wood Fire Chicken, shredded chicken with lettuce. I add on cheese and avocado. Then they have 'liquid delicious' in the form of two sauces they give you to add yourself. PLEASE do this! Add these sauces and it is DELICIOUS!!!!!! My second favorite is the Roasted Pork Butt it has tomato slices, and again...... you must add the sauces they give you... you MUST!!!! I have also tried the Garlic Shrimp..... it was good. The Wood Fire Beef was my least favorite so far.... it was very dry... even after adding the fabulous sauces.

I have been to the Las Vegas Boulevard location a few times, and have had the arepas there. This is my first visit to this location on Rainbow Blvd., but it won't be my last! I love the Arepas! Absolutely delicious! My husband loves the wood grilled chicken dinner. They serve two pieces, half of a chicken, or a whole chicken. All served with side dishes .... We both love the black beans!  My new favorite might  be the black bean and cheese empanada. Oh my gosh.... so good!!!  The only downside is the styrofoam containers.... even when dining in. The quality of the food justifies real dinner plates, in my opinion.
Amazing. Try the Cachapas for something different.

You have not fully lived until you have tried Venezuelan arepas! This place, in particular, not only makes the most delicious arepas in Vegas but is also clean as well. Hands down, a must visit for any local or tourist!

Pretty weird to get to I was going north on LV BLVD and turned left in Wyoming went around behind the restaurant then into the parking lot. I've been wanting to try this place for a while now, so one day before getting custard from Luv It i made we made a pit stop here.   I LOVE carne asada....I try it everywhere I go and I make it myself! So naturally what do I order???  A carne asada arepa! Now I wasn't too familiar with what arepa exactly is going into the restaurant, I had seen the pictures, meat stuffed in a bun looking thing! Well I was half right it's meat stuffed into a circle of masa. Think the filling of a tamale! I do not like masa! I only eat the meat from a tamal and pretty much did the same here....it's not their fault I dislike masa so that's not why they only got 3 stars. The carne asada had a funny flavor to it. I can't put my finger on it but it was, well funny. I was given 3 sauces and was never explained what the heck they were. The creamy white-ish one was delish so I covered my funny tasting meat with it and went on my way.   I took one star for the odd location and one star for the funny meat. I may go back to hit up the chicken.

So I have never had Venezuelan food but I am so glad I tried this place. First I think you have to have an arepa because that's what they're famous for.  Luckily I went with two friends so we were able to try a bunch of different things. We had the shredded beef arepa which is amazing.  We then shared the cheese empanada and the chicken empanada.  The cheese was my absolute favorite. Then we got the mixed Grill which had chicken beef sausage and pork ribs you get two sides with that. Let me tell you the sausage was the best I've ever had.   The proprietors are so friendly and the restaurant is really clean and I would definitely go there again and I would highly recommend it.

After reading a ton of reviews, studying the menu and looking through pictures, I went in knowing exactly what I wanted. And I was more than pleased with the result!  I ordered a cachapa (a corn pancake folded in half and filled with cheese) and added their Pulled pork butt with a side of yuca fries. All of this was just under $12 and provided enough food that I took half home (even after sharing the yuca with my hungry nine month old son).   I've never had a cachapa before and have nothing to compare it to. Nor have I had Venezuelan pork. But both were everything I was hoping they'd be and more! The corn Pancake was super moist and the flavor of corn came right through. The layer of cheese was very thick, very melted and very gooey - perfect! And the Pulled pork? Shredded, tender and covered in a sweet sauce (it reminded me of a BBQ sauce).   The yuca fries were thick and unevenly cut -crunchy on the outside and chewy on the inside. They were mildly salted and definitely needed their cilantro sauce. But they were quite nice!   I can't wait to go back and bring my husband and anyone else that visits us! I have to say that I'm so in love with what I ordered the first time that it will be hard to try something new...but maybe another meat or sweet plantains to share??

First time and won't be our last. Went with my husband we ordered the #7 Chicken Arepa and the #12 Beef Arepa. And chicken Empanadas. We shared all, the chicken and beef had a hint of a smoky flavor. Loved the plantains and cilantro mayo on the beef Arepa. The arepa dough that the sandwhich is in was perfect texture and nice and warm. Had a nutty corn taste. The chicken arepa was also very good combination with avocado.  As for the Empanadas they were perfect temperature and flavor.  Wonderful customer service hope to be back soon!

I came to this place awhile back and didn't review it on the spot.  I really enjoyed there dishes.  it was full of flavor and the price is pretty decent. The Arepa was very good and I enjoyed the  Wood Fire Beef and Carne Asada.  I will definitely come back again, when I am in the mood for something else.  The only complaint I have about this place is the location, I got lost trying to find it and when I found it parking wasn't that great.. But that won't stop me from going again when I am in the area.  I also Like the staff they are very friendly and will ask any questions you have.  Especially if your unfamiliar with the food or need a good recommendation.  So don't be shy, they really want you to ask, so that way you can order something you enjoy. The establishment is very clean and open.  They have plenty of seats.
Fantastic food,  great prices! Try the carne asada arepa and the passion fruit drink. Amazing!
The chicken arepas are a must try. They are full of flavors better than the carne asada which was dry. Empanadas was ok, would not order again. Need to try chicken next time.

This is my first Venezuelan food experience, and I think it's off to a great start! The food is very unique, and it's important to point out this restaurant is gluten free. I love the simplicity of ingredients focused on quality.   The meat is cooked with a traditional grill using wood which is a layer of flavor that is unmistakable! Arepas is a ground maize dough to make a variety of sandwiches. I recommend the wood fire beef with cheese, tomato, and avocado, reina pepiada, and garlic shrimp. There's also a pancake made of sweet corn and cheese called Cachapa.  Soo good!   The service has been excellent the last two times I've been there with friendliest chef taking orders and willing to explain everything!

I originally tried Viva Las Arepas from a food truck at a Yelp event and loved it! I was pleasantly surprised to stumble upon this location which is much closer to my house. My boyfriend and I stopped by for a quick dinner on a Friday evening.   The arepas themselves are sort of like a pita pocket with delicious toppings inside. I liked that they had a couple different vegetarian options and he loved the Wood Fire Beef. This most recent time I tried the Arepa Vegeterian and added cheese. It was definitely stuffed to the brim with toppings which was great, but the best part to me was the black beans. They were super flavorful! I also could not get enough of the green sauce, so good!  I'm sure we will be back again for a quick meal or maybe even delivery. It's definitely more of a grab and go type place since the inside is a bit small.

I had an irrational fear of shredded meats. They usually end up tasting without flavor accompanied by dry textures. This is why I've avoided this place for so long, but I regret that I did just that. What started as a fear ended up being a warm embrace. This Venezuelan establishment is a jewel above standard Latin and South American cuisine.   Located a few blocks north from The Stratosphere at the end of The Strip, lies a little strip mall where a small fast food joint looks to make a big punch with their specialty: the arepa.  Handcrafted and stuffed with flavorful and steaming shredded carne asada, the arepa is a pocket full of inspiring and familiar tastes. Along with the arepas are two sauces to accompany your meal. A spicy salsa-like sauce and a creamy, yet tangy sauce. You have to have one of these sauces at every bite, or you'll be missing out on this beautiful combination.   I ate this with a huge side of subtly tangy Basmati rice. A great combo if you ask me.   The service friendly, quick, and accommodating, you'll feel like you're king of the world during that five minute meal with this Venezuelan staple.

I've never had arepas before.  So I have nothing to compare. Arepas are okay in my book.  This place is apparently in the scary part of town.  As I mentioned I wanted to come here to 3 other people who frequent or lives near Las Vegas, they said, "ooohh it's on THAT part of town."  We ordered 4-5 different items and a couple of desserts.   Everyone liked the corn cachapa.  I was okay with it.  I did try it when it wasn't hot anymore.  And it's one of those food items you want while hot and the cheese is empty.    I had the asada arepa.  It was good. I think the texture of the arepa is very thick and maybe fried.  So after half an arepa, I was pretty much done.   I didn't think one would fill me up, but it did. After finishing my meal,  It definitely felt "heavy" from the fried, oily part.   Reina arepa was good too.  Tasty sauce.  Guava and cheese pastry and the coconut one was not good.  The pastry was not flakey like I'm used to.  I generally love Cuban's guava and cheese pastries and thought this would be a bit similar.    Location: apparently the scary side of town.   Service: okay, nothing special.  None of us had ever had arepas but we felt rushed from the man taking our order as if he expected us to know exactly what we want.   We sat outside and they brought out our food to us.    I would like to give arepas another try.  Maybe here, maybe somewhere else.

Arepas!   Located at the very end of Las Vegas Blvd. Parking lot is super small and tight.  Asada Arepa - $5.50 - Meat is cooked so soft and tender and really well seasoned. I could taste the grill in the meat. The lettuce and tomato keep the flavor from getting boring.   Pollo Arepa - $5 - Again meat was cooked perfectly and the grill flavor really comes through. The chicken was not dry at all. If this came with lettuce and tomato, it would have been perfect.  Carne Empanada - $3 - Meat was really good but it was more dough and no stuffing.  Green and white sauce are so good. I wish they gave more for to go orders then two small ass cups.   It really should be a 3-3.5 overall but the meat was cooked so well. I am just not a fan of the arepa bun. Arepa, torta, papusa, I still rather have my meat in a taco or burrito.

I love love this place!!! I paid $5 delivery, because I couldn't not have this delicious food! I had the pork arepa, plantains, and yuca fries. I enjoy all of them a ton! Plus those sauces were delectable.

Amazing authentic Venezuelan food! Was blown away to find this little gem on the strip! My tummy and my heart are both so happy right now! George was so sweet! Genuine delicious Venezuelan food made by real Venezuelans!! Yummmmmmmm

I just happened in Viva Las Arepas. I was out driving, and decided to stop in for lunch. I was extremely pleased I did, and even made a vlog review while I was in. This place has exceptional Venezuelan food!   Check out my full review here - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l5pVFms_8P4
This place is as authentic as  you can get for Venezuelan food! Never disappoints. Prices have gone up, but when we are in Vegas...we always pay Felix a visit!

This is Venezuelan soul food in my opinion because it's definitely made with love. Yum! Great ambiance and really up beat attitudes on the service end as well. I've been hearing people rave about this place so I finally gave it a shot. The yucca root fries are bomb with the creamy green sauce. Their shredded beef in definitely a winner and I love the combinations of black beans and meat, I'm a huge bean addict. . . I crave protein like no other and this place can give you a great protein filled gluten free meal or a vegetarian|vegan one at that! (something ridiculously hard to find in fast casual dining for whatever reason) No. . . I don't want to go out to eat and have a salad. Proteins + Good carbs here! I don't have celiacs but this place is definitely celiacs friendly! Craving a hearty meal. . .these arepas really do the trick! It can be a naughty or a nice meal and I love the option! Must try!

Love this place! I always frequent the one on the strip. But was in the area and REALLY wanted some arepas!!! Same high quality food and consistency! This place is great if you're looking for AWESOME food! Great place to meet up for lunch or dinner! The intoxicating and ohhh so delicious smell of wood fired meats hits you the second you walk in! And the customer service is beyond exceptional! Keep up the great work guys!!!!

The food was really good, but I thought it was way too expensive for what you get. Each item is pretty small and they say one person should order two, and they were not wrong.  I'm an athlete with a big appetite, so I ordered three for about $21. Way too expensive in my humble opinion but it was good food.

Went here a few days ago with my out-of-town peeps and I'm really glad I did!   Upon arriving, I noticed that the place was packed and the parking lot was completely FULL. The service is pretty fast and the line at one point was out the door.   I ordered the Garlic Shrimp Arepa (you can have it either hot or cold. I ordered it hot.) & the Pork Butt Arepa. Both were PACKED with flavor. They can be a little deceiving though. They're no bigger than a regular cheeseburger, but I found myself getting full fast! I ended up only eating half of both, then just picked at the insides. (the garlic shrimp was just too good to leave behind)  Even though the place is located in downtown LV, it was pretty clean and the bathrooms were well maintained.   I also noticed how friendly the associates were. Even though there was a pretty sizable line behind me while I was ordering, I never felt rushed and they were more than happy to make me something that was not on the menu. My little wanted rice with vegetables (thats on the menu) with a fried egg (not on the menu).   The restaurant itself is a waaaays away from my place, but I don't think that would stop us from popping in from time to time.

Super BOMB food! People were very friendly and service was really quick! My husband is Venezuelan and makes this type of food and we were honestly both in HEAVEN! So delicious we will be eating here again for sure before we leave Vegas!!!!

Damn this is one of my best finds in Vegas. Never had a bad Arepa here and I've tried many of them. Arepas are little sandwiches from Venezuela. The bread is made from corn meal (glutton free :) and Viva Arepas does a great job with them. I've had the #4, #12, #11, and #13. All were GREAT. #11 has scrambled eggs and hits the spot for breakfast. If you're really hungry or want to try a couple flavors, get 2, but even 1 is pretty darn filling for a meal.
Delicious, affordable food with an a la carte style menu.  The arepas are amazing and the empanadas are worth a try.  We always stop by for a quick bite whenever we are in Vegas.

Ok I am born and raised in Maracaibo Venezuela... I know a good Venezuelan meal and this is excellent. I was very well pleased with the food, the service,,, everything. by far the best surprise I had in Vegas... can't miss it if you are looking for latin food you gotta try this. I (my family) had an Arepa with shredded beef, Cachapa and tequenos, Best in the west,

I love food stands and this is a must try place.  The service was great.  It was freezing and windy the night I went, and the nice vendor told his clients to wait in their cars and that he would bring it to us.  You don't have to go to a fancy restaurant to get 5 star service. The food was interesting.  It was my first time having arepas and I got the hot Lengua Arepas (tongue)  and a cold Reina Pepiada (chicken avocado--**their most raved about arepas**).  Get the green chile sauces..it enhances the taste. They both come in the grainy textured corn bun (similar to an english muffin).  The Lengua Arepas is a little messy because of the oiliness of the sauce. I actually liked the Reina Pepiada more because of the fusion of the cilantro, mayo, and avocado marinating the shredded chicken.  You have to at least try it out once.

Delicious sandwiches. I've had the pork butt and the chicken and both were great. The service is nice too. Only thing is it's a little bit pricey for small-ish sandwiches but compared to other places in Vegas it's pretty reasonable.

Whenever my family wants to go to las vegas for a weekend getaway we ALWAYS eat at Viva Las Arepas as our last stop. My favorite is the Arepa con Desmechada (pulled pork). ALWAYS go with the wood fired arepas. They are the best stuff around and I can't get them anywhere else in united states! Compared to Colombian prices this is pricey, but, hey can't be choosy when it comes to finding the best exotic food!

Super yummy and gluten free!  In Vegas with a friend and looking for places to eat that accommodate my dairy and gluten free needs.  Had the fried plantains (no breading) try them with the cilantro sauce.  Yum.  For arepas we had shredded beef #3, shredded chicken #2, and reina pepiada #7.   #7 was cold (it's suppose to be) and really great.  The other two were fantastic too.  It's a total value, really flavorful and very filling!  Great little place casual all around.

Hmm. Do I love arepas? Thanks to this tiny food stand under the shadow of the Stratosphere Tower, I'd have to say a resounding YES!  I had never heard of this culinary item until I found out about this place. Some compare arepas (Venezuelan) to pupusas (Salvadoran). It's a fair comparison, but they're not quite the same. I say the only real way to find out is to try them for yourself. You won't regret it.  I've been here twice now. First, I tried the tripe, which was killer. The next time, I tried the tongue, which was similarly murderous. Now, if you don't like tripe or tongue, this place isn't going to change your mind. Don't worry, they also serve your basic fillings, like beef and chicken.  Currently, the only problem I have with this place is the slow service. Basically, it's like the chef has to do all the work because the hired help is incredibly incompetent. Fortunately, the last time I was there, I talked to the chef and he said he hired a new employee and she was starting the next day. Honestly, it hasn't been a huge inconvenience so far, but if there ever was a long line here, watch out. I'm hoping the new employee works out.  In any event, I'm a fan of this place. Arepas, I love thee.

It's like a Venezuelan In-n-Out, only it's 100x better! My go-to arepa is the roasted pork butt. So juicy! Add some of the hot sauce and green sauce with every bite. Balance this meal with a tangy passion fruit drink. Empanadas are also freshly made and delicious.

From the Foodie Snob:  This place is totally Legit! Great fast friendly service and a clean restaurant. Oh, BTW did I mention the arepas? Fresh ingredients and very tasty. I only wish this place was located in Henderson due to the headache of driving in traffic near downtown.

I can't wait to go back! I come up with reasons to go down there just so I can hit up this place. I didn't even know what an arepa was but my friend told me about this place and said I had to try it.  As soon as I walked in I could smell the woods smoking all those delicious meats, I was like a kid in a candy store! I wanted to try everything but I definitely didn't know where to start. Thank goodness for all the tasty looking pictures on the walls. The staff was very helpful and super patient with me. I've never had Venezuela food before, I can't wait to try more!   For my first visit, I figured it would be best to pick a column and work my way down so I went for the #1 Wood Fired Beef, my niece got the #8 Garlic Shrimp, and my Sister got a #12 Cachapa. They were all amazing! The cilantro mayo and the hot sauce mixed are killer. I also tried the soursop drink and it was so good, it tasted like strawberry, watermelon, kiwi, and passion fruit had a delicious baby juice in my cup.  I can't wait to go back and add more to this amazing experience. For now, I'm heading next door to the Art of Flavors for dessert.

Some of the best food ive ever had in my life !!!if u dont use yelp your a fool...this place is special ... thank God for yelp or i would have never probly found this gem.. this is one of them spots that if ur a local  and dont know about ... then ur missing out on vegas !

Bebida Parchita was a delicious treat to a hot summer day. My sister & I had to take our lunch to go since there is limited seating in shade.  We prefer to eat our hot food in cool places; I would love to enjoy the entire I LOVE AREPAS experience by eating outside after sundown. We each ordered the number 7 and empanada con frijoles negros y queso.  The number 7 was my first choice as I've seen my fellow yelpers say only good things.  I very much enjoyed this #7 and would order it again! The green salsa was spicy but the burning sensation was drowned out by my bebida parchita!   Ultimately I miss tapatio. He would have enjoyed being eaten with my meal.
Incredible chicken and salad.  Very casual (dive) and very inexpensive.   This place is great!
Best authentic Arepas! Has a large variety of Venezuelan food. Everything tasted so good! Can't wait to go back
Do yourself a favor and come here when you're in Vegas! We came around 1030 for brunch and left 100% satisfied. Don't expect amazing service, but expect hot, fresh, delicious food!

Great value vs food quality served. Tried the pig butt and pulled meat pie, first was so-so, but the pie was amazing.  Would totally like to try out more things if ever possible.  Also, superb service.

Wanted to try something new since I'm doing rotations in this area. So 4 words: melts-in-your-mouth!!! Iiterally had this yesterday #1 is good but today I had the Arepas #7 but mixed with #12 is so bomb !!! So the guy recommends Arepas #1, 7, and 12. Plus the addition of  plantain sides was so yummy. Try it

I have been here 4 times and this will be my last one. I can tell as a Venezuelan that the quality of the food has dropped by a lot. The Carne Mechada taste sour and does not even look like Carne mechada. The empanadas somehow shrank, to make a long story short, this is not authentic Venezuelan food at all. Never coming back again. For the people that travels and want to go to a good Venezuelan restauran, check Mil Jugos in Santa Ana, California. This place in vegas not worth the trip. Bu the way, the good reviews are probably from people that haven't even tried real Venezuelan food.
Love the roasted pork aprea. The food is reasonable prices as well and is very close to the strip. You will not be disappointed.

Really good arepas! I recommend trying the reina pepiada (chicken breast bites mixed with cilantro and avocado in a ground maize dough flat bread - the filling texture is similar to a creamy chicken salad). The interior is clean, the service is fast, and the price is great!

They make their bread out of corn and bake it fresh. The quality of their beef and chicken is great! Authentic food and great service.  It's great, however i'd say they are a bit pricey. Are they trying to be a  hole in the wall type spot or a clean casual, fast dining type eatery. That confuses the customer bit, because you end up paying a bit more than you'd anticipate at a spot like this.

My pork was salty and I love salt so was a bit of a bummer for me. The experience is just ok, downtown vibe but nothing to write home about food wise. I wanted to try the chicken and it was OK as were the Arepas. The beef was horrible and cheapest quality. The rice and beans were the high light and I'm not much into paper plates and cutlery so probably won't return. The price is high when you consider food is not top of the line.

These guys are a perfect late-night padding stop.  I have never had arepas before, so I can't compare to anyone else's, but these are great.  We've only tried a few of the fillings so far, and they are the ultimate late-night comfort food.  If anything, they're a smidge salty, but they will definitely cure your ills before calling it a night.

Amazing.  Authentic. Delicious. Friendly. Who needs to pay a fortune for Vegas food when just down a ways you have such delicious fare? Honestly, I wish I could shove even more food in my belly at this place but i stuffed myself! Try the sweet plantains. Heck. Try everything.... And unlike the rest of Vegas, you'll actually have money left in your pocket when you leave! You are welcome. :)

*Yelp 100 challenge complete!  As much as Vegas is founded on facades and paradoxes, I found it pleasantly appropriate that perhaps the best food I had in Vegas came from this hole-in-the-wall place in the corner of a sketchy looking strip mall far from the Strip as opposed even to the meal I had a L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon!  One of the benefits of Vegas is that can you drive a few miles and start your morning with some Hawaiian Poke, have some French for lunch, and finish with Venezuelan food. I'm glad we came here, saving this local gem for last.  The Arepas here were fantastic all served piping hot. To rank them in order:  1) Reina Peplada: Chicken Breast, Mayo, Avocado, Cilantro 2) Wood Fire Beef - think carne asada 3) Garlic Shrimp - big pieces of shrimp just not the best shrimp in quality  The corn meal bun is crisp and houses some incredibly tasty meat. They give you sauces but thats not necessary with all that is going on in the arepas.   Also the Yucca Root fries were good fat fries but I will go with their normal french fries next time.  And I know it is just rotisserie chicken but something about that actual hickory wood fire grill really brought out the flavor in the Wood Fire Chicken plate ($14.99). It was perfectly moist and tender and the skin was the right amount of char and crisp.  I thought the Passion Fruit juice edged the Mango juice and it is refreshing and the right complement to the arepas.  My advice to Vegas-goers is to take a slight detour to Viva Las Arepas for some very delicious comfort food. Then make it extra special by going right next door to Art of Flavors (one of the best gelatos I've had in the city).   Viva Las Arepas!  Tip: Ask to sample juice flavors

This casual restaurant serves Venezuelan fare including its signature arepas. Orders are taken at the counter and the food is delivered to the table along with 3 bottles containing different sauces. We each ordered the reina pepiada arepa - an interesting take on chicken salad made with shredded chicken breast, avocado, mayo, and cilantro. It is served between slices of flatbread that are made with precooked corn flour. We enjoyed the arepas, but I am not in a rush for a repeat.   A rating of 2.5 would seem to be most appropriate.

This place has great food.  The people working there are super nice and helpful.  I love the fact that we can find unique food like this.  We were in Vegas for a business trip and did not feel like going to a fancy dinner steak house, the location of this place is awesome as well, not in the middle of the chaos so the parking is easy.  the person who rang us up was VERY helpful in helping us choose what to eat.  I hope this place sticks!!!! its such a better alternative to that yucky taco spot just down the way.  A+ guys!

Had a number 7, it was delicious. Would give five stars for food alone but the service was curt and borderline rude from the order taker. Don't let that deter you however as the food is quite good, at least from my admittedly limited experience.

It's a shame, but after each visit, I've become less and less impressed. My first visit was phenomenal and my second visit was still pretty great (as evidenced in my previous review). The Wood-Fired Beef was a bit dry during my third visit, but I brushed it aside attributing it to a fluke or bad timing. However, my last visit has solidified my disappointment and necessity to write an updated review.  Since I've had five of their arepa options, I decided it was time for another one, so I chose the Vegetarian (avocado, black beans, tomato, peppers, onion) for $5. I was confused at first because all I saw were black beans with a little bit of avocado barely surfacing (reference photo). Maybe they got my order wrong? I searched for vegetables through the beans with no success. It wasn't until I took a few bites that I finally located a very sad tomato piece. I figured that was just how they made the "Vegetarian" arepa. The beans were nicely seasoned, but their overwhelming quantity made it incredibly difficult to eat in an arepa. The arepa itself was delicious, as always. I was already disappointed by my selection because of the lack of vegetables, then I saw photos of what the Vegetarian Arepa should look like or have looked like and now I'm upset. It costs the same as or more than their meat options and they can't include a heap of vegetables? Not cool!  Also, after four visits, it doesn't seem like a coincidence that my table is consistently ignored. No one ever checks on us (it's usually me and Ruben), while they seem more than happy to visit and chat with several other customers. It has made us feel unwelcome. I'm really sad to say this, but I will be getting my arepas elsewhere from now on.
can't put into words how i fell about this place.    Just get your ass here now!!!!
Always a crow pleaser. Fresh fruit juices. Best yam muleta arepas and super affordable.

Awesome gem of Las Vegas!   Yummmm. The Reina Pepiada Arepa is a must but it's alll good!   I love the authenticity of the food. Very very flavorful.   The guava and cheese Pastelito is like a delicious toaster-strudel dessert and all the juices are really tasty!  Minimal service but they are all very nice.    Not sure why it took me so long to come back to Las Arepas (like a yr) but it will definitely be a more frequent spot for me!
