I loved all the Arepas!! Their house sauce was excellent to go with any arepa, don't forget to grab one. The chicken salad arepa was their signature and I was hesitant to try it, but I'm so glad I did. There were so many items I didn't get to try, but it's just another great excuse to come back. Try the passion fruit juice too (thank you to all who recommend that) it was totally worth it.  I also really appreciate the cleanliness of the entire restaurant from the tables and chairs to the bathrooms- it makes a BIG difference! See you soon, viva las Arepas!
Love the cedar smoke they use for the meat. I had the carne asada arepa which was good, but I kinda wish it was jucier. The staff was very inviting and friendly.

I'm so glad I stumbled upon this place! I've never heard of arepas before & it makes me feel sad b/c I was missing out on such good food!!  I've only been here twice but got the same thing both times. Reina pepiada & wood fire beef. Both of them are so so good!  The filling is so flavorful & the bun (sorry i know it's not called that, its like made out of corn or something right?) is delicious! When you bite into it the bun part is a bit crispy & then the filling is juicy, meaty, & saucy!  Also, they gave you some sauces on the side to eat with it. I'm not exactly sure what kind of sauce it is but it seriously compliments the Arepa!  The green sauce is uh-mazing!   I wish it were a bit cheaper, but you can't beat the flavor & taste.   10/10 would recommend!! :-)

Came to this little gem on a late Saturday morning and I've been wanting to come back ever since! This is Venezuelan food done right, as you can taste the wood fire smoke and freshness in each pastry. This shop is located just a stone's throw away from The Stratosphere Hotel and definitely worth the drive from the strip. Parking lot in front and on the side of the building was easy enough. For 5 food items off the menu for 2 people (look below), our total came to about $24. -cup of black coffee (wasn't the best, wasn't absolutely horrible) -shredded chicken arepa (this was hands down THE BEST item, IMO on the menu) -beef arepa (the little beef chunks in this was pretty good, but the shredded chicken had much more flavor and punch) -beef and rice pastelito (this was also AMAZING and just perfection! ) -chicken empanada (I'm not sure how they get their pastry dough so perfect, but I want 10 more of these) -guava and cheese pastelito (Wasn't a huge fan of this one, probably won't order it again next time).   This place has something to please any one. They even  have gluten-sensitive items if you're into that stuff. Check it out if you're somewhere nearby, you won't regret it! I can't wait to come back to this delightful gem.

I can't get enough of this place. The arepa pabellon is amazing. I always get a side of platanos maduros. Moving here from Cleveland, it's awesome to finally have a real arepa. Either this location or the one on Rainbow, they are both great.
Viva las arepas! Great food great juices! Go and see ramon hes the best! I recommend the reina pepiada with cheese .
My fav arepa is the perrico! Tried the online order option & skipped the line. Didn't have to wait as they were ready right on time. Always such great customer service!
The arepas and the carne asada fries were so good! If you go during a busy time, there won't be enough parking.

I could of sworn I wrote a review for Viva Las Arepas a few years back, my apologies. I began coming and enjoying these delish arepas when this establishment was the humble little shack across the parking lot now replaced by an up and coming gourmet sandwich joint. My first time here the owners kid was out behind the shack and some drunk women was walking up and the down the street cursing and confronting customers so I called the cops and my mom went to go talk to the little girl and her mom so she wouldn't be scare. The chef was busy so as a thank you he gave us a few free orders of the cheese sticks. After that I became a regular.   The pork arepa is filled with really tender pulled pork but I always order without the tomato slice. The shrimp arepa is really yummy too, sautéed shrimp in a mild spicy condiment sauce served hot. The bean an cheese arepa, can nothing go wrong with those!!! Finally but not least, the Reina Pepiada is my absolute favorite!!! It is made with shredded chicken, mayo, avocado, peas and cilantro.   The arepas are served in rustic baskets which I hate because when people spill their arepa juice, how do they clean them? I eat mine over the paper they come in. The new locating is sooo nice and big too. Their menu is extensive, it contains other Venezuelan goodies like cachepas which are these sweet little pancakes. The parking lot is still limited but I never have a problem and I'd walk a few blocks to try these guys out, trust me!!!

I am sorry, but there is nothing wrong with this place. The workers are friendly. The food is great. It has outdoor seating (which may bother some, but not me personally). I got the food relatively quickly and I continue to come back because these people know how to make DELICIOUS FOOD. Honestly, you can order anything on the menu and you will be golden.
People are nice and the food taste great ( at least what I ordered). The pork butt and the Venezuelan soda was amazing.
Delicious!!! The green salsa/sauce is so good that they give you. We order from here all the time. Order the line gets crazy some times.

After reading the reviews here, and watching this place featured on a television show, I've been itching to try this place out.  I finally went here for lunch and wasn't disappointed.  I shared 3 arepas with a friend- carne asada, chicken asada, and the cold chicken salad.  There are menus in English and Spanish, and in English the asadas are called wood fire.  I ordered these three because they were identified on the menu with a small icon, which meant they were chef recommended.  There was a short wait because this is not fast food where meals are prepared ahead of time and placed under a heat lamp.  They appear to be made to order and you can taste the difference.  The cost of the arepas were $5.00 to $5.50 and cheese ($.50) and avocado ($.99) are extra.  I liked the beef the best.   What struck me was the size of the arepas.  They were larger than I thought and one was enough to satisfy me for lunch.  I had 1.5 arepas and was stuffed.  The breading used is gluten free and is not chewy.  I would describe it more similar to the crunchy outside of a buttermilk biscuit.    The cons were a very small parking lot and it isn't in a very safe area (right across from the Olympic Garden).  But overall I recommend this place and I'll be back to try the empenadas, which I was told were home made.

VIVA LAS AREPAS!!   Love this place. Great interior, it perfectly matches the vibe of the restaurant. Great staff, they are personable and greet you with a smile(I'm convinced the newer cashier guy doesn't like me though but it could never stop me from coming).  On to the food. I have tried nearly every single menu item, sides and sweets included, and not one single item has disappointed me. I've gotten to the point of trying things just to see if I can be disappointed with an offering and nope, not close. I have liked every item and this is impressive.  The location is situated on the edge of downtown and is perfect for a grab and go meal or a casual sit down experience. I only wish the best for Viva Las Arepas.

The food is very tasty and different from Mexican restaurants. It's Venezuelan. The Arepas are corn based but very good. The wrap is like a flatbread but made of maize. It's very good. I swear it tastes like potato inside which is much nicer than corn according to me.  We ordered the pork and beef and they were both delicious. The pork had avocado and the other one, the beef, had a slice of tomato. The flavoring reminds me of Brazilian meats which has a nice grilled citrusy flavor. It's got a tang to it too and you don't really need to add any sauce to it.  But it does come with 2 squirter Bottles of sauce. One spicy,  not really, it's as spicy as El Patio sauce. The mild is mild.

Have been wanting to try this place for a while because of the stars on yelp. Stopped  in for a quick lunch and had the pork butt Arepa, WOW!! Soo good, lots of flavor, I added cheese and avocado a must.  The salsa was very good and tasty with just the right heat.  Also had beef empanada, that was ok. Will go back to try other Arepas.

Arepas... wish we met earlier in life!  Smokey, salty, meaty, spicy.... so good.  Yelp led me here and I'm now going to seek out Arepas in LA when I get back!  Chicharron, mix grill, pabellon, cheese empanada, sugar cane and lime drink.  Deliciousness... can't wait to come back!

The arepas are delicious. I had the BBQ chicken which was a pulled chicken style sandwich. There was a lot of meat on the sandwich and it was tasty. I also got the cheese arepa which was just cheese on the arepa. I really liked this, simple yet delicious. The sauces that came with it were nice accompaniment. The darker yellow sauce was spicy so be careful if you don't like spicy foods. The lighter green sauce was a creamy cilantro style and was nice. Definitely will try their other menu items!

Great food.  And is true....authentic venezuelan cuisine. We got the Cachapa, Reina Pepiada, Arepa de Pabellon and Carne Asada.  If you like latin food and want to eat out of the Strip crowd...visit Viva Las Arepas!!!

I Love Arepas is a great Venezuelan food stand that is excellent in every way. Delicious arepas, friendly service, fast and inexpensive. My favorite thing to eat there is the #7 Reina Pepiada, which is a shredded chicken breast salad, made with avocado, mayo, cilantro and peas.It is definitely the star on the menu, but the carne mechada, pork butt (pernil) and the bean and cheese arepas are also great. I usually ask for cotija cheese on the arepas, it's yummy.  Make sure to try the juices too.They are refreshing, especially on a hot Vegas day. I like the Tamarindo and the Agua de Panela (sugar cane and lime). The staff is great, they really take pride in their service. This is hands down my favorite fast food in Vegas and everyone should check it out!

Ok. I took my mom here about a month ago.  I wanted to give it a try and was very excited!  It was very easy to find but there wasn't much parking in the front.  Therefore, I had to park on the back of the building, which I didn't like because this place is not on the greatest side of the Vegas strip.  This place has indoor and outdoor seating.  We decided to sit inside because it was way too hot!  We went on a Sat afternoon, 1p to be exact. Since this was my first time here, I wanted to take my time and look at the menu.  I was greeted by a gentleman but felt rushed since he was just standing at the register staring at us.  I asked, please give us a few minutes and he just stood there - staring!!!  We ordered the Shredded Beef Arepa, which was $6. I asked for him to tell me how big they were and based on his description and pricing, I'd figure that one would be enough.  We ordered two, one for each and platanos.  We sat down and that's when I noticed that there was only two people there. Found it quite odd, especially on a weekend.  Then the table we chose to sit at was wet and sticky, very nasty!  I had to get some napkins to dry it all off!! The window was nasty full of finger prints.  Then I noticed a bed of dead flies on the window sill.  This really really grossed me out. Then they called my name, my order was done!  I got my food on some baskets which were on a tray. Two squeeze bottles of hot sauce, one green and one red.  The arepas were the size of my palm. Very small!!  They were wrapped up in paper which i had to peel off and very sloppy.  The meat was very well seasoned  and the Arepa was very thin.  I was very very very disappointed!!! I just could not believe how small and over priced they were. This place was filthy filthy filthy!!!  Now I know why this place was completely empty!!  What a shame!!!  This was my first and last time I'll ever go to this place!!  If you want to have a really good Arepa - go to -  OIGA MIRE VEA!! Look them up!! You won't be disappointed!!!
I've loved this place for years! I recommend the Number 3 Arepa with Yuca fries. Delicious.

Maybe I had high expectations when I walked in here but the fried yuca was not properly cooked, the beef in the Arepa tasted boiled and lacking in flavor. I did enjoy the cheese empanada and the chicken was pretty tasty. I don't plan on coming back anytime soon, I found nothing about this meal to be memorable.
A great alternative to the fancy (expensive) food in the las vegas strip. Had the veggie arepa and the guava pastel with a side of tostones - flavorful, fresh food and filling!
Absolutely amazing arepas! Great customer service and great food! My favorite is the Cachapa! Been here 3 times and will continue to visit. Thank you and Viva la AREPAS!

So good, every time I go it is the same and just as good as the last time. The Arepas are super good and so is the fried yuca. The service is top notch and super friendly no matter what time of night you go. Great place!

Random food choice for lunch before we left Vegas. I saw this on yelp and the pictures had me like nom nom nom. Since arepas is pretty foreign to me, time to check this place out.  Parking was easy since they have a parking lot, even though it's on Las Vegas Blvd. It's a counter order establishment and the person who took our order was super nice and awesome. (If he had told me he owns that place, I wouldn't be surprised.) He greeted us when we walked in and after finding out it was our first time there, he made bunch of suggestions for us to try.  We got #1(wood fire steak), 7(chicken salad thing), 4(pork butt), 12(shredded beef, beans and plantain), and black bean & cheese empanada as he suggested. He did a great job on the suggestions because he made sure our food didn't have repeating ingredients. They were all great and tasty individually, but sadly, when we had all 4 in one setting, the chicken came in short on flavors. My favorite was the pork butt and slave girls' was shreed beef. Everything was well seasoned especially consumed with their house made spicy sauce.  They also serve entries other than arepas and based on the arepas we got, I can only imagine how amazing they will taste. Until next time, I will be drooling while dreaming.

BEST PLACE TO EAT ON LAS VEGAS BLVD!!! Their authentic Venenzuelan food is well prepared and incredibly savory...and their salsas...OMG be sure to get the creamy green salsa, but I mix them both. I have turned on countless friends to this gem and all are grateful for the tip. I have been coming here for years, every time  I am in Vegas. I watched them start at a food cart, as we stumbled upon them on drunk night.lol. From then forward I am required to bring home at least 2 dozen empanadas for family to enjoy. Was overjoyed the day I came to Vegas and saw they finally had their own building and were thriving because WOW IS THEIR FOOD DELICIOUS! Their prices are reasonable and their staff is not just friendly and helpful but they will accommodate you beyond expectations.   Easy to access when traveling between the strip and Freemont St "the old strip" (its not far from Stratosphere). They have both indoor and outdoor seating available.  I recommend the beef empanadas, the chicken empanadas a close second, and the favorite Arepas are the carne asada and the roasted pork. Be careful though the aArepas are large, 1-2 per person is good.
This is the best arepas place that I have been in Las Vegas, they have a great menú, and their prices are affordable which makes all the experience better, love it
One of the best places to eat in Vegas. Very affordable, too. I love the empanadas and the rice is to die for. I always order the fried plantains. I come here once a week now.

Superrrrr bombbbbb. The arepas itself were oily but hey, that's why it's so gooood. You could taste that the meats were cooked over wood. I tried the wood fired chicken arepa and the chicken was very soft and the sauce in it went well. I put a lot of that green hot sauce in there though. It gave it more flavor. The carne asada arepa was super juicy. The only downside is that the bread got soggy towards the end. The woodfired chicken plate was very juicy too. The French fries were really crispy just how I like it and the basmati rice was too buttery for my liking but that's what makes it tasty. Overall, I would definitely go again and again!
This is my second time here and the number 12 is amazing. I don't only what else to say but it's not damn good!

Hard not to repeat what most reviewers already wrote. I'll be honest I've never been a big fan of Arepas in general but maybe I've never been to place that knew how to make them. The vegetarian version is unbelievable glad the woman at the register recommended it to me. This is just another reason to venture beyond the strip when visit Las Vegas. I'll be back soon!!
Totally love this place. Excellent cachapas, arepas, and tequeños!!! Can't wait to come back.

YUM.  I tried arepas for the first time last night, and I'm sold.  These things are amazing.  I was swooning with every bite.  I had spoken with the owner earlier in the week and he told me that the arepa dough is made with milk, but that he would be happy to make me a special vegan one if I was willing to wait for it.  Well, Saturday night, drunk and hungry, I was more than willing to wait.  And I am so glad that I did! He made me a gorgeous arepa filled with black beans, and topped with freshly sliced avocado and tomato.  I have not stopped thinking about this food since I finished eating it, and I will definitely be going back soon.  The arepa dough was crispy from the grill on the outside (and btw, they cleaned the grill and made mine off to the side of all the other ones!) and almost fluffy on the inside.  The fillings were so fresh and tasty too! Every bite put a smile on my face.    As a regular at Dino's, I am so thrilled to have a late night, vegan friendly food option to help me soak up the booze! And I really appreciate how super friendly and accommodating the folks who run the place were.    My carnivorous friends went crazy over their non-vegan pork arepas too... and in fact everyone I saw get food there seemed pleased.  If you've never tried arepas you have been missing out!

I heard a lot about this place but didn't get to try it until recently. They used to serve food from a little small stand on the side of the road but they have now moved into a brick and mortar restaurant on the corner of Wyoming and Las Vegas Blvd.  The restaurant itself is nice and clean, but the location is easy to miss if you go there for the first time. By the time you see the restaurant, you probably will need to make a roundabout just to be able to get into the parking lot.  Anyway, I've only tried three things at this place: rib eye steak, pork butt arepas, and asada arepas. I know that it's strange that I go to an arapas place and ordered steak, but they had a special rib eye steak for $10.99 and I was craving for it (LOL). Even though the meat wasn't high quality, the fire grilling and seasoning brought out great flavor from the meat and their side dishes were delicious.   For the pork butt arepas, the meat was too salty for my taste. Also the corn shells/buns were too oily. The asada meat was alright also.   So what's my verdict? If you haven't tried arepas and want something different, I think you should come by and give it a try. For me, it wasn't bad but at the same time it wasn't that good for me to come back on a regular basis. I will probably stop by the next time I'm in the mood for steak during lunch or want to try something different.
Exactly like Venezuela. Delicious food. Great ambiance. Friendly staff. The spread are amazing. The fried plantains with crema delicious. Be sure to get juice! Great prices.

After reading the reviews, I decided to pick up a bunch of arepas for the road trip back to LA. My favorite was reina pepieda...it was moist, flavorful and really delicious. It is full of avocado, cilantro sauce and yummy chicken. I wish I had bought only this as the other arepas were lack luster.   The shredded beef one especially was dry and pretty chewy. Even after loading it up with the cilantro sauce, it was pretty blah. The chicken one was ok but the reina pepieda is the only one that warrants the 4 stars. Overall it's a pretty cheap and tasty alternative if you are looking for food in a hurry and if you order the right one.
Loved the arepas! Got 2 but I only needed one. I liked the diversity of the menu. Definitely will try other things on the menu including the empanadas. Loved the plantains!

I haven't reviewed Viva Las Arepas yet?! Best fix that.   Viva Las Arepas is worth a trip whether you're familiar with the Venezuelan wonder food or have never tried these meat-filled Joy Pockets. It's representative of the best the genre has to offer; the arepa itself is fluffy and moist, and the meat inside is fresh, flavorful, and sooooo juicy. The meat is all cooked over a wood fire, and the flavor they get out of the meat is just incredible. The woodfired beef, and the reina pepiada (chicken with peas and avocado and...um...stuff?)  have become my go-to favorites, and I've developed cravings for the reina. So good.   I'm pretty sure this place was the former occupant of the current Goodwich Cube outside of Dinos, but it has moved waaaaay up in the world, and now has a clean, classy restaurant with a great patio and a ton of seating just across the street, in a lot with a kitsch shop, a lingerie store, and a Bail Bondsman. Ahhhhhh Vegas.  Pros: - Holy cow the food is delicious. Get two; an old favorite and then try something new. I've never had anything bad there. - The arepas themselves are perfect. I've had arepas at other places that get this weird "cheap poorly made cornbread" texture to them that is not at all pleasant. That is not the case here. Something like a cross between a crumpet and a tortilla, I imagine the manna God sent from heaven was actually arepas. - Sauces. They come in two generous tubes; one's spicy, one's garlicky. Yellow bottle. Do yourself a favor and just slather that on. - This is fast lunch food that's not at all fast food. Takes about 5-10 minutes from order to eating, depending on how busy they are. Unless you order the All The Meats plate, which takes a while, and feeds 3.  - VERY affordable. You can eat a lunch that will make you full for dinner for about $12.  - Seating for 2-14 comfortably.  Cons: - The other businesses in the strip mall give me the giggles. - You will want to eat ALL THE AREPAS, all the time, which will make you very fat.

This guy has a lot of heart and I like how the place is improving.  They added tables and chairs, which is great for people watching.  They got rid of the bacon hot dog (wahh) but added empanadas.  I'm a fan of the cold chicken and the wine-stewed beef arepa.  Honestly, they're tasty when I'm in the neighborhood, but I won't make the trip that often (unlike my foodie friends who lost their minds over this place.)  One arepa can be enough for a light meal, but I tend to eat two.
Ordered the shredded chicken arepa.  It was packed with meat!  So good and fresh.  Don't forget the sauces!!!
Authentic, affordable and amazing. Chicken is so good and flavorful. The arepas are amazing. Plaintains, yum. Near stratosphere.
Heaven! Had wood fired shredded chicken and reina papiada with sugar cane and lime juice. Did I say it was heavenly?

Ok, so I read a couple of reviews where people say this is located in a scary neighborhood. Nope. Asides from a few drunks and homeless folks wandering around, It's pretty tame for Las Vegas. The dining area is pretty clean, and they just recently added an outdoor seating area in the front.  I go here at least a couple of times a month because:  - it's cheap - I don't have to think about what I'm gonna get, since I always get the same things - it's right next door to AOF  The arepas range in price from $4 for a cheese arepa to $7 for a garlic shrimp arepa. I usually stick to eating the Reina Pepiada, (chicken breast, avocado, mayo and cilantro), or the Perico, (scrambled egg, ham & cheese, onion and tomato). If I'm not mistaken, the Reina Pepiada is the only arepa served cold. Kind of reminds me of a cold chicken salad sandwich, but with a lot more chicken.   Nice to have places like this to dine at, especially if you are budget-conscious. Beats the hell out of going to a fast food chain. For $20, you and a date can grab an arepa here with a huge order of fries, then bounce over to AOF to grab dessert. After dessert, have some fun and browse the selection of lingerie and adult novelties in the boutique next door! Cheap and convenient date options!

A wonderful smell of mesquite envelopes you as.you enter.   So happy to have a permanent location and so close to home! The manager is super friendly and the food is the same amazing quality as the Strip location. It's so good. What is so good. Everything! The arepa is griddled to perfection and whatever you put inside of is going to be great.   I think the half chicken dinner is a couple dollars too cheap. We were the last customers tonight and even the last bird they served today was top notch.   The garlic cilantro mayo sauce is wonderful, especially when mixed with the hot sauce or the ketchup. Seriously. If you have fries, mix a bit with the ketchup.   The facility is sharp and they're connected to the banquet hall next door. It should seat up to 200 when it opens in December.   The drink selection includes Venezuelan sodas and some fresh drinks including a sugar cane juice and lime concoction.   Yes, Las Vegas, you can now sit down and enjoy arepas! So glad to have another great international joint in the neighborhood!

I hate writing bad reviews as I know how hard it is to run a restaurant however the meal I had here last night wasn't very exciting.  I've been to Venezuela and remember the amazing arepa bread sandwiches from my travels. How hot and delicious they were.   So when I saw this place I was so excited. Then disappointed. The breads were cold and the chicken, avocado, cilantro filling was just plain bland. The fried plantains were good.  I wanted an empanada but the deep fryer was down.   I hope I came at the wrong time and got an off meal as I love seeing ethnic restaurants succeed.   Please try them at least once and hopefully the results will be better than mine.

Got the #4 and #7 arepas with a side of rice and beans and two drinks for around $25.   I loved both. The texture of the arepa dough was fresh and smooth and both meats inside were so good!   First time trying Venezuelan rice and beans. The beans tasted almost like Cuban black beans. They were very well seasoned. The rice was so different from other Latin rice dishes. It was made with basmati (I think) I'm used to regular long grain rice but it was still yummy.   For drink, soursop (or guanabana) and passion fruit. I really liked how both had great, authentic fruit flavor but they were on the less sweet side.   Will come back for more lunch dates in the future.

Pretty good spot. First time with with the boyfriend having Venezuelan sandwiches. We tried the wood-fire chicken and the chicken arepa with avocado, and the yuca fries with chicharron. Pretty tasty eats with Venezuelan soda that tastes like bubble gum. Tasty inexpensive food and will try again.
Fist time here and Arepas were delicious!!! We try asada, reina pepiada arepas... but shirm arepa was out of this world.. a must try when you come to Vegas..!

The worse Venezuelan food I've ever tried. I'm  ashamed to call their food "Venezuelan". Starting with the cheese empanadas, the terrible taste and the disgusting type of cheese. The shredded beef arepas are even worst without mention the Cachapa made out of a corn flour from a packet. Hey Mr. owner!! If you're Venezuelan make sure you represent our country in a better way!  -- La peo comida Venezolana que he probado. Me da vergüenza llamar su comida "venezolana". Comenzando por las Empanadas de queso, el terrible saber, y el peor tipo de queso. Las Arepas de carne mechada son incluso peores, sin mencionar las Cachapas hechas de harina de maíz dulce sacadas de un paquete. Epa Sr. Dueño! Si usted es Venezolano, asegúrese de representar a nuestro país de una mejor manera!

4-stars for the food itself... though surprisingly small portions... It was very tasty tho... make sure to use the 'hot' sauce provided on the tables, very good alongside the arepas.  5-STARS for the Soursop drink... I had never ever heard of it beforehand and it was so delicious that I may just go back to this place just for that drink specifically.

Best arepas in the United States period. The beef aripa is my favorite with a smoky wood flavor to beef steak. Everything is good here you can't go wrong with the beef steak aripa or the chicken aripa with the green sauce. The guava drink is super fresh.

Best arepa I've ever had. We tried an assortment - veggie, black bean/cheese, shrimp - all delicious. The plantains were perfectly fried and sweet. The owner was so friendly and even threw in a side of yuca fries when we told him we were visiting from out of town. It's a short Uber ride away and definitely worth it. Only complaint is that it's a little warm inside, they need to crank up the AC. Everything else was perfect!

Arepa! Arepa!  Stopped by this highly recommended restaurant for some South American eats.  The black bean & cheese arepa is pretty delish but the yucca fries are my absolute fave. I can't really explain the texture but of your a potato girl like myself you'll understand. (My Pescatarian friendly diet limits my menu options)  Don't forget the cilantro salsa it's sooo good and fresh every visit.  The service is quick and the food is thus far has been great!  Be Aware: The parking lot is a little sketch and homeless men have walked up on me from behind twice "not cool". Secure your belongings because you can never be too sure.

Absolutely delicious! I was staying at the Stratosphere and wanted somewhere cheap to eat. I pulled this up on Yelp and it did not disappoint. It was an easy walk to the restaurant. I got the arepa de pabellon based on Yelp reviews, and it was incredible. The filling and the bread just melts in your mouth. Just one note - the arepas are very small (about the size of a slider), so if you are hungry definitely get at least 4.   This restaurant was the only redeeming thing about my stay at the Stratosphere and being this far up the strip. Eat here, it is worth it. Especially since there are not many Venezuelan arepa restaurants around.

This place is amazing. I always went to the one downtown and was so happy to find out there was one on Rainbow only a few blocks from me. Food is so flavorful and made to order. The restaurant is super clean and the staff is always helpful

LOVE the food.  I wish I could have some right now.  We had the pork butt, the slow cook beef and the chicken with creamy sauce, the friend yucca and the plantain.  The plantains were delicious.  The lady working the cash register was very nice and helpful, she recommended the chicken arepas and I'm glad I took her advise.
Never had arepa before.  This first experience was very nice.  The arepa was loaded and it was very filling.  Price is so reasonable.   Very friendly and clean place.

I'm a HUGE fan of this place. I've traveled to Colombia and this is the real deal folks. I've had arepas in Miami as well and was super duper excited when I heard that an arepas place opened up in Vegas. Beware...these little packages pack a big punch. I've tried the shredded beef, shredded chicken and roasted pork butt arepas. If you order one arepa, it's a nice snack but ordering two is like having a full meal. Everything on the menu is delicious and you can't go wrong. My mouth is salivating just thinking about it. I also had the sugar cane drink which transports me to a time when I was a small child chewing on fresh sugar cane stalks! If I lived closer, I would eat here more often. I really do love arepas.

Finally tried this place!! I've been lazy about getting here but now that I have I'm so happy. It was delicious!!  We ordered the garlic shrimp arepa and the chicken salad one. Fries covered in cilantro mayo.. Yes!!!   It's nothing fancy inside and it's in a old part of town but the food is worth the trip. It was $20 for 2 arepas 2 sodas and an order of fries. Will definitely go back !

Yelp was raving mad about Viva Las Are???.. so I jumped on the gun when I had the chance and ordered almost everything on the menu for myself and some hungery employees.  Honest to say, it was aight.. Meat to dough ratio was a little off.. there was hardly anything inside the empanadas.. and the person that was supposed to take my order just stared at me for a good 10 seconds.. and thats pretty long in staring time!  The Garlic Shrimp stood out from the rest in taste and quality but I just wasn't really a fan of the dough.  Just a little too.. doughish I guess?  I would much rather smother myself with one of 'em cheesy soft tacos at one of 'em spanish carts at one of 'em gasoline stations or one 'em tire repair shops.  Now that's a five star.. even with flies buzzn' and all!   ...not a totaltarian fan of Viva, but I can't deny that it still hit the spot.

A friend recommended me to visit here, and I'm glad I did! At first, I underestimated the size of the arepas here; though they're not huge, they pack huge content and are pretty heavy. Our arepas averaged about $5-6/each. We got a wood fired chicken, pork butt, wood fired beef, and an order of plantains. The wood fired beef was super tasty, while the pork and chicken were a bit salty.  I've never had arepas before, but I became a huge fan after trying these. The "bun" was made of a cornmeal that was grilled, and it was stuffed with a LOT of tasty meats/veggies. The Venezuelan hamburger was filling and also came with two sauces. The pork and chicken arepas got a little wet from the juices inside and started to fall apart towards the end, but were still good nonetheless. The plantains were spot on; warm, toasty, sweet, and delicious.   I'd definitely come back and recommend this restaurant to anyone in the area. It's worth a visit and you will want to try everything!

I had only tried Colombian Arepas before and of course there is no comparing they are both delicious. But I definitely fell in love with this spot and their oh so yummy food. The green sauce (not spicy just favorable) is a MIST on the Arepas. Besides the Arepas though the Cachapas were one of my favorite dishes on the menu. They kind of reminded me of Salvadorean Pie de Queso mixed with Mexican Corn tamales with a lotta delicious salty & sweet cheese in the middle. It's both salty and sweet. My sister ate her Cachapa with Hot Chocolate and I ate mine with the green sauce (which I can't remember the name of). After trying this spot out for the first time, it will immediately become one of this comfort foods you crave for a good filling and satisfies feeling.
Found this place as we were leaving LV. Coming from a Venezuelan, this place gets 5 stars from me.  The tequeños are huge, and reasonably priced.  Everything was fresh, made on the spot.

This is so amazing.  It is a little shop on Las Vegas Blvd.  There is no indoor seating, and you must sit outside.  The food is outstanding.  I always order the shredded beef arepa and the black bean and cheese  empanada when I come to vegas.  Their sauce, especially the green sauce is sooo good.  Would recommend you coming here.

Great prices and good food. Arepas can be tough to find! I've only had better in nyc so I'm happy this is in Vegas!  I even had some trouble finding it in LA. The area and surroundings seem a little sketchy but they keep in clean and well organized inside.   Their arepas are small but filling. It's great when they keep it simple.

At present, with over 1300 reviews averaging 4.5 stars, is an impressive feat. It's also enough to lure me away from my original plan of getting some BBQ nearby.    Viva Las Arepas is a Venezuelan food restaurant. It's located on the corner of a mostly industrial area that's also surrounded by fast food joints. There must be something amazing about these folks because the back wall has some media mentions on display.    Not knowing much about their cuisine, I saw that most Yelpers raved about the wood fire beef arepas. Just the name alone speaks mouth-watering meat. It seems to be a white corn shell grilled, and stuffed with chopped beef cooked over mesquite wood for that very noticeable smokiness. This is served with lettuce & tomato. It comes out blazing hot, I kid you not, so wait a minute before you burn your face.   Reina Pepeiada is the corn shell stuffed with chicken, but drenched in a cooking cilantro sauce.   Both were excellent but if I had the choose one, it'd be the wood fire beef.  Arepas come with 2 sauces. One is hotter than the other but both were great over the wood fire beef.   Fried plantains were decent, but very heavy. They come out blazing hot and stay that way for a while.   We also tried the 'drink of the day' strawberry juice.  Just the right amount of sweet and very refreshing. A refill for 2 bucks, and tried the passion fruit.  A bit tart so it's really not my fav.    Service was pleasant. The lady at the counter knew it was obviously our first time so she was patient in explaining things.   It's very casual here. Orders are placed at the counter and your name called when order is ready.  Photos of their menu items line the perimeter of the frame right below the ceiling and there are 4 TV's covering each corner of the dining area.  Stacks of mesquite wood can be seen towards the restroom.   I'm also giving Viva Las Arepas a 4.5, but can't justify rounding up to a 5, since it's not exactly perfect in every way.  But without a doubt, I'll be back for more of that smoky wood fire beef.

Let's just say this is not my favorite place. The arepas are really dense and is not all that good. I had the #7 Reina Pepiada (chicken breast mixed with avocado, mayo, and cliantro). I thought this one for the most part was alright and nothing spectacular, but it became a chore to eat after the 4th or 5th bite. I also had the #3 Shredded Beef which was mixed with bell peppers, onion and tomato. The #3 was my least favorite of the two. My first thought of this when I bit into it was that the meat tasted exactly like the meat you would get from Taco Bell. That is not a good sign. Now, I normally like Taco Bell as fast food if a real Mexican place isn't close to me. However, when you think of a Latino cuisine and you get Taco Bell as your first thought, there are issues. I came here on the recommendation of a friend and he has questionable tastes in food. I knew that about him before coming here. Coming here confirms it.

Amazing flavor!  The price is very good! 6$ arepas, empanadas 3$ The mango water is delicious.  Beef empanadas are amazing.  I love how the meat is cooked in front of you with 0 oil! BBQ with wood. Everything Tastes so good!!!

Wow, great food, fair price!    A good balance of both LV area locals (like me) & visitors from out of town who've found out about the place & are wanting to get good food without the pretentiousness & prices of touristy places  this is my second time here in less than a week, and even though my belly is full (I'm writing this review while still seated inside the restaurant), I'd be happy to come back again tomorrow.  As a vegetarian, I get the vegetarian arepa (adding cheese) as well as an avocado, tomato, onions, peppers & cheese arepa (minus peppers & tomatoes), but they do have plenty of options with meat.  Even the French fries are good here!  The neighborhood is... well, not the best, but the place is on the busy Las Vegas Blvd, a couple blocks N of the Stratosphere.     Ideally, you'll get here via vehicle.  Once inside, the place is very clean & friendly.

No longer a food stand, Viva Las Arepas is now a brick and mortar restaurant.  I'm glad for it.  It gets hot in Vegas and this food deserves to be eaten year round.  They've added a lot of things to the menu...most noteworthy being a variety of grilled meats and some fantastic side dishes.  Have had the pork ribs, rotisserie chicken, rice, and hand cut fries.  They're all fantastic.  The arepas continue to be amazing as well.   You really can't go wrong.  My quibble with the food stand was underseasoning.  This no longer seems to be an issue.  Everything is fantastic.
Great spot and now we no longer have to drip to the Strip for it. Chicken and avocado arepas are great as is their smoked chicken. Never had a bad meal there.

First time trying Venezuelan food, having read a lot of good reviews on yelp, I was not disappointed!   The place is very unassuming from the outside, i have actually passed by this area multiple times before and I never noticed it. Inside, I was surprised by how spacious it was.   I ordered the reina pepiada (chicken w mayo and avocado) and fries on the side, and it was delicious! It's like a burger, almost, except its made of thick flour bread (like tortilla, just a lot thicker and meatier). It was delicious and i will be back.

Stop what you are doing and go get an Arepa at Viva Las Arepas now, and thank me later.   I live 30 minutes away from this place, it's on the strip, and I have driven there three times in the past three weeks to sample more of their delicious Venezuelan morsels.   The food is out of control. If you've never had an Arepa, it is a Venezuelan take on the taco. The key here is that the shell is a pillowy flatbread. That bread wraps around some of the most flavorful, tender and mind-blowing meats I have ever sampled. My two favorites are the #1 (wood-fired beef) and the #7 (Reina pepiada... A chicken salad). The beef is cooked perfectly and the spices are just right. And in case they are not flavorful enough, you can Doctor them up with their spicy green pepper sauce or a creamy avocado sauce. Honestly, the #1 is just right for me but occasionally I'll take a bit of the sauces because they are really good.   I loved the ribs. They had a good crispy skin but they were falling off the bone. The empanadas are a great accompaniment to whatever arepa you choose. And don't skip dessert. They have pastelitos in two flavors. One is guava and cheese and the other is coconut. I'm not a huge guava fan but the coconut one was ridiculous.   So far, I have been with my wife on a date, once with our three kids and once with a few friends. It was a great spot for all three outings. It's casual, and you don't have to worry if your group is a little rowdy. It is on the strip but it's north of Sahara so it's not crazy busy and there is parking all around the building.

Still a total 5 stars in my book! Went back recently and had the pork spare ribs with 2 sides only $8.99! It was fall off the bone good. They give u 4 huge ribs. You barely have to bite the meat just falls off and is so tasty. The wood smoked flavor is excellent. As my sides I got a salad and black beans. I loved the salad. The house dressing was tangy and filled with cilantro flavor. I can't wait to go back and have the ribs again and of course try other items off their menu.
The the sweet corn and cheese as well as the guava and cheese were to die for!!! I did order a shredded chicken empanada but they gave me beef,  I had the woodfire beef and it was very tasty!

This is absolutely, by far, one of my most favorite places to eat. When I can't think of anything in particular I am craving, I always come here. I like the vegetarian arepa. Can't go wrong with that one! I've tried their guava desert too. It's also good. This place never fails. The management is always so nice. He recognizes me and welcomes me back every time. They have an app too! Buy 10 arepas, get one free. You know I got that! :)

I don't think I've tried authentic Venezuelan food before trying out this place. But I have to admit I don't know how much I'd like it after eating here! It made me fall in love with Venezuelan cuisine!   When I came it was just a food hut on the corner of Las Vegas Blvd and Wyoming, but now I hear it's actually branched out and opened as a restaurant just a walk away from it. I guess it has turned into a hot dog stand now.   Anyway, you can get both cold and hot arepas. They are decently priced, ranging from $2 - $5 so obviously you can't just have one! But before you go all crazy and order everything off the menu, let me tell you they can be quite filling! I would suggest two of them and an empanada constituting a full meal. I've tried the Roasted Pork Butt with tomato slices - FANTASTIC, beef tongue arepa - FANTASTIC times 2, and the Reina Pepiada which is chicken breast, avocado, mayonnaise, and cilantro - not as good as the beef arepas, but still tasty. I have also tried their empanadas. Really really good. Make sure to try the arepas with the special sauces they have for you to use.   This place overall is the best place to go before a night out downtown for a quick, inexpensive, and absolutely delicious meal.

I had the #2) Wood Fire chicken Arepa & #7)Reina Pepiada chicken Arepa both are good but my absolute favorite was #7 it had so much more flavor and I love the creamy cilantro dressing it comes with. The service was fantastic! I was ordering WAY too much when the guy helping me asked how many ppl it was for? when I told him 2 he gasped and said it was way too much food for 2 ppl! Thank goodness he told me because after taking a few things out of my original order I still had more than enough =) I also had the Kiwi Agua Fresca and that was very good as well. I will definitely be back!!
Great service. Reasonable prices. Delicious food. Plenty of seating. Plenty of parking. Patio seating available. Great location. Off the strip but not too far.

Never had Venezuelan food and now I'm a big fan! My boyfriend ordered the pork spareribs bbq which was amazing!  I was so excited to try this place out, I didn't take much notes but I'm definitely coming back!  Sorry not so helpful but you've gotta try this place out!  The staff, awesome! Keeping it short and sweet.

Delicious! Being Colombian, my family makes a lot of Arepas but never like this. They take Arepas and stuff them full of avocado, beans, meats, peppers, spices, and more. The quality is top notch and the staff are really friendly. They have the menu in both Spanish and English so you don't feel embarrassed ordering.  I had the Vegetarian Arepa and it was really good, fresh black beans, sliced avocado, tomatoes, and more. The sauce they provide you is also homemade.  The only reason for 4 stars, instead of 5 was the lack of a drink dispenser or I didn't see it. Either way it was incredible and I will surely be back to give them a hand full of money.

This post is after my second visit to Viva Las Arepas!  The food is so fresh! I ordered the vegetarian option. They also serve vegan options. The menu includes a wide range of fresh-made flour sandwiches, dishes, & desserts. Agua Fresca in passion fruit is super yummy and thirst quenching! The ambiance is wonderful. Warm and bright tones fill the room with orange and yellow. The staff is super helpful and knowledgeable about the menu. Restrooms are super clean and selfie worthy! Prices are amazingly affordable. The servings are extremely filling and proportionate. I'll definitely be coming here a lot more in the future. Two thumbs up for this awesome food spot (:

Love it.    3rd time here.  Delicious.  Menu is in English and Spanish.  Yes, it's a hole in a wall place, but they started off in a food cart/ stand.  So it's a matter of time before they have multiple locations in Vegas and elsewhere.   Must try when you are here  in Vegas.
Shrimp Arepas!!!!Delicious.  Got the usual shredded beef arepas.  Nice clean location.

Pretty impressed not only with the product, but also the knowledgable and friendly service. We tried the wood fire beef, pork and chicken items and all were very tasty.   Note that if you eat a lot you'd have a order a bunch, but the quality is good and the flavors are rich. In Vegas it's usually all about the quantity, but for this authentic Venezuelan cheap eats it's about taste.   The food comes out quick and it comes with a variety of sauces from mild to spicy. Parking lot is shared and small, but if you come during off hours there shouldn't be a problem. It's a place my wife really liked and they were very accommodating to her food allergies.   It's a place I'd go back to...just not on an empty stomach.

This was good experience for our first time trying arepas.  My kiddos both got chicken which seemed to not have a lot of good flavor, but the shredded beef I had was the favorite for everyone(each had to try a bite). I added cheese and avocado to mine.  The chachapas was really good and everyone loved it as a sweet savory shared side.

The BF and I were close and needed some snackies.   We ordered a pork arepa, 2 bean and cheese empanada and mango to drink.   The mango drink was really good. It was not too sweet, fresh and refreshing. I coulda had a few of those since it was a hot day.   When our order came it was the wrong order. We got one meat arepa and a bean and cheese arepa so we figured maybe she didn't hear the empanada part and perhaps got us a arepa instead? Oh well, we'll eat it anyways.   The bean and cheese was yummy with flavorful beans. The meat turned out to be beef (unless my taste buds are wonky) but it was so tender and fantastic. Normally shredded beef is somewhat stringy, but not this. I normally wouldn't order beef but here I would definitely consider it. The arepa was wonderfully crispy on the outside and had some chewiness inside that was addictive. I can eat those alone even. Don't skimp on the mustardy hot sauce and the creamy sauce as both make the arepas even better, I think!   Eventually I guess they realized it wasn't that they got our order wrong, we got someone elses order! The guy on the grill (I'm assuming is the owner) was apologetic about it and gave us 2 bean and cheese empanadas anyways which was cool of him. It was not what I expected at all. I was thinking more like pastry dough type empanadas, but the consistency was like the breading that is around corn dogs which lead the BF and I trying to figure out how they make it. These were tasty but since I'm a Hot Dog On the Stick fan, I'm definitely ordering just a plain cheese one next time.   Now that its hot, it's gonna suck to come visit but I definitely enjoyed that meal and want to come back again soon.

Every foodie has a checklist of things that they want to try.  Being from a smallish city there isn't a plethora of Venezuelan restaurants.  Thats why when i discovered Viva Las Arepas, i was excited.  I will admit that it can be overwhelming walking into a restaurant with a different culture than your own.  I was unfamiliar with many of the ingredients, however, the staff was very helpful.  I ordered the shrimp and my sister order the pork.  The texture of the bun was unlike anything i had tried in the past.  It somewhat resembled an english muffin, but the sides were griddled so they were super crispy, and the inside was supple.  I got mine spicy, and got it topped with avocado, just incase the heat was too overbearing.  The whole package was just wonderful.  Now anyone would fear eating something and then noticing a mystery ingredient suddenly appear, which happened to me.  After closer observation, there were two bonus chunks of lobster, which i will welcome anytime.   Overall, i loved my lunch, it was flavourful, authentic, and very inexpensive.

I walked into this place really hungry and all I could feel were my eyes burning almost tearing. Whatever they had cooking in the kitchen, perhaps onions made it unpleasant.  I ordered chicken thighs rice and beans, and a guava cheese pastry. I couldn't stand the burning eyes trauma any longer and waited outside by the patio area until my food was ready.   Very disappointing, I expected several whole chicken thighs and I got boneless skinless dry chicken. The flavor tasted like charred tasteless chicken and I had to request ketchup just to flavor it up a little. The rice and beans were ok, but not very tasty. Had it not been for the dessert, this place would have flopped! I truly did enjoy the guava cheese pastry. The moist and flaky pastry with guava and cheese filling was delicious and tasty.   Overall, the place had a nice ambiance and the service was excellent. The air quality and venting needs a makeover to ensure customers truly dine in, not outside.

Las Vegas best kept secret !!! Every time I go to Vegas, this is my first stop.   Directions are off on yelp, on account of address confusion.   Route yourself to 1616 Las Vegas blvd South and you will arrive there. Close to Stratosphere.  If you follow regular directions, it says it's on other side if town. If your directions say hour away no good.   Best food in Town ! City !  County ! State !

I literally dream about this place. If I lived in Vegas, I would be here weekly. On a 4 night Vegas stay, my girlfriends and I visited here twice!  I got the vegetarian with maduros added, the guava empanada and the passion fruit juice. Literally the perfect meal.  There is nothing bad to say about this place. Stop reading reviews and go already!!

Unique and delicious smoked food. Bathroom not so much, but super friendly. Even when I asked for a to-go box because I didn't realize one arepa is very filling per person, the guy added sauces and extras and bagged it up for me. Tried the pork, beef, and chicken versions and all very good.

My brother in law told me about this place and I just happened to have the time to come here before my flight leaves tiday. One word, BOMBBBBB! I love this place, got the ropa vieja arepas w avacado , tomato and lettuce. Super good! Also got the yucca fries, fried to perfection! Got some empenadas to go, yeeeehaaa!

This place was on our bookmarks and we're trying to get them checked off before 2015 but when I keep adding more it doesn't help! Haha. We came on a Friday night and I was surprised to only see a few people eating here. Maybe I thought they would be busier because it's a Friday and there Fairly close to downtown but I think everyone was next door at Art of flavors. The warm bright colors make you feel welcome instantly. I knew I wanted an arepa and my guy had never heard of the please do went with a chicken plate. The pork on the pork butt arepa was succulent and juicy. Paired well with the cilantro garlic sauce. The plantains themselves were slightly mushy and soft. I guess I was expecting more of a crispy exterior. They still were buttery warm and comforting. I didn't mind at all. The chicken plate he orders came with 3 pieces of chicken thighs with 2 sides. He went with rice and beans. The chicken itself had a good seasoning in the outside and a crispy char from the open fire. It was a little dark but I like my meat cooked that way anyway. To some it might seemed burnt. Overall the food was pretty good and the hot sauce they gave was really good. Paired well with all the flavors. I would definitely come back and try some more arepas.

Ate here about midnite on Sat/14 June: - $9.99 for the spare ribs + 2 sides platter.  Great deal and lots of food.   - $.99 for a can of Coke.  For Venezualan soda, coupla choices at $2 and $2.50. - All prices have taxes already included.
Love this place!! The food is Great and the people here are friendly. My favorite on the menu is the Arepa Reina Pepiada...so delicious.

I am sitting here waiting for my 2nd to go sandwich to be ready. I ordered a carne asada arepa not even 10 minutes ago. Being that it was my first time here, Ivan helped me and offered to let me taste the meat without me asking. I was sold! The beef was so tender and full of flavor. Instead of waiting for our food to be ready, we headed next door to Art of Flavors for some yummy gelato. When we got back, our order was ready. We literally devoured that sandwich in the parking lot and was left wanting more, so I decided to go back and get another one hahaha. So here I am again. I'm glad we finally tried this place out. If everything else on their menu is as good as that sandwich and service then unarguably this establishment deserves 5 stars. I guess my only complaint is that, it's kinda messy to eat the arepas especially if you're on the go. Can't wait to come back sooner rather than later!

The food wasn't that good at this location. I got carne asada arepa that was very, very greasy. I asked with avocado & only got two very small slices as to which they charge extra. I also got the shredded chicken empanada which was bland. I will not be coming back here again.

"Oh baby, it's not nice to tease.  You may be corny but you're so warm and smell so good  you got me yearning.  Now you're gonna get it!"  Wrapper  torn open, first giant mouthwatering bite.  Ahhh.  We're talking arepas and this new location on Rainbow continues to deliver, matching the quality of the LV Blvd location with even friendlier service.  Essentially a reconstituted milled sweet corn fried bread (masarepa flour, salt, water), split then stuffed with everything from wood fire grilled, well seasoned beef to a roasted pulled pork, to tender black beans and melting cheese.  All three by the way are very good.  Adding optional additional cheese, avocado, and squirts of their Venezuelan style salsa further kicks up the flavor.  Top props to the arepa pabellon, a right fine combo of the grilled beef, black beans, fried plantains, and cheese.  An order of fried tostones (pressed, fried  plantains) or fried yucca makes a perfect, starchy side.  While they may look small, don't be fooled, these babies are dense and stuffed.  Very reasonably priced, around $5.50 - $8.00 with all the possible additions.  Simple and solid.

For those of you needing delicious food that is also GLUTEN FREE, look no further!   The peina arepa was absolutely delicious and inexpensive!  The sauces they give on the side are also phenomenal! I am just ecstatic about it but only wish I had this place back home!

Yummy cheap street eats. It's a happening food truck without the wheels, no need to follow em' on twitter, they are here to stay. I am in no way shape or form an expert on the food of Venezuela, but I know delish when I taste it, and there are some mighty fine treats coming out of this window. I sampled strictly the Arepas. What the heck is an Arepa? Kind of a grilled corn shell, like a mash up of a sope and papusa, but hand sliced down the middle like a hamburger bun. After that just pick the  filling(s) you want and enjoy. I particularly like the black bean and cheese and the tongue. Perico is the kitchen sink and really good too. Don't forget that crazy good green sauce, don't worry, it's not hot, but does burst with flavor. Arepas run $2.75-$4.00 Empanadas are $1.99 Venezy drinks are $1.49-dude hooked me up with free refills, don't know if that's the norm though. I tried 2 beverages Parchita which is a very sweet fruit punch thing, and the star by far was the Guanabana drink, which comes from the native southern hemisphere fruit of the same name. Very light, clean and refreshing taste. Bonus, they claim only fresh ingredients and no MSG, no microwave, and no can openers.

We took a bus to come here to escape the busy downtown area on Monday evening, when it looked like every restaurant in the strip was swamped with people. And this place was such a pleasant surprise. So glad that we came here.

I've wanted to try arepas for a while and I finally got the chance to. I tried a few different flavors. I was a bit disappointed because the arepas are dry and flavorless. I wasn't impressed. What happened?! I have no idea... A few friends rave about this place. I also tried the empanadas and plantains. They were just okay. Nothing special.   I'm rarely in this area these days, so I'm less likely to give this place another chance. We'll see.  2017 Yelp Challenge Review #4

I love arepas and I've only had them at one place in LA. I was excited that my Venezuelan friends know about this place and actually recommend it. I came with my friend that has never had arepas and he loved it. If you don't know what arepas are... then Google it because I already explained what they are on my Amara review lol.  Reina Pepiada - Chicken Breast mixed with Avocado, Mayo & Cilantro. This was a lot different from the one I had in LA. The chicken breast is chopped and minced so finely that its almost like a paste - I prefer chicken cubes or chunks for a bite. Really good though.  Pabellón - Beef, Black Beans, Plantains & Cheese. This is my go to. I love the sweet plantains paired with the salty cheese. The beef was super tender and juicy.  Really good place for affordable and quick meal. Friendly staff too!
Food was awesome! Having family from Venezuela this place made you feel like you were back home. Cachapas were the best.

I love Arepas is an understatement and the name of the tastiest food establishment I have eaten at that serves South American-specifically Argentinian cuisine- since I left Texas. Made me homesick. I ordered the marinated roasted pork butt Arepas and the black bean and cheese Arepas along with a mango juice. Later on, Felix, the owner and chef (genius) made me a black bean and cheese Empenada that was the size of a banana. I was so stuffed. My mouth and my stomach have not been this happy all at once and for hours afterwards in a long time! I can't wait to eat there again. Which will be soon because I go to karaoke at Dino's and I Love Arepas is located in the same parking lot! How convenient for me! WOOO HOOO! My mouth is watering just thinking about it. Hmmm, I forgot to ask if he does breakfast!

This place is a hidden gem... full of construction out front when we went, but still open.  Smelled heavenly and tasted about the same. We had no idea what we were ordering so the pictures around the walls were helpful.  The last item on the list (#13 I believe) is different than the rest and bigger.... the corn and cheese was delicious!!  We also got pork and chicken.  Both great. Nice place for a quick meal, reasonable prices.

Great food at inexpensive prices...one of the best ways to fill up for under $10!  I've tried quite a bit of goodies here, but I will talk about my favorites!  Wood Fired Beef Arepas ($5). Love the smokey flavor in the meat...it's delicious! I think their wood fired chicken and beef are my favorites here...chicken is a dollar cheaper.  Chicharron and Yuca Frita ($5.99). Delicious! Well done fried pork, with very flavorful fried yuca...imagine a very flavorful starchy french fry! Yummy   And the Reina Pepiada ($5): Chicken Breast, Avocado, Mayo and Cilantro.  This is delicious and works so well together.  I love pouring their hot sauce all over this beast!  And I ALWAYS finish up with Art of Flavors next door for dessert!  Even if you can't eat fresh homemade gelato, order a Spiced Hot Cocoa and you WILL thank me later :P  I will be back...many more times!  Pics :

OK this place is amazing! This is our second time here when we visit Las Vegas. We have decided every time we visit we must always go. The people are friendly and the food is phenomenal. The arepas are full of flavor and there sauces are divine. I like the creamy one especially. My favorite arepa so far is #7 its a must and then the pernil arepa with avocado. The only thing is the tostones are okay they could be thinner and more crisp in my opinion. I'm puerto Rican and thats how I'm use to it. Aside from that Its perfect and we will always come back!

It's about 6:45 I came to eat at one of my all time favorite places to eat. I don't think I will be back after today. I saw a rodent three times in the 10 minutes I was there. I can't believe it. I have a picture that shows proof of my words. Be careful.

Umm.. yes please. If you're ever near downtown area and only have a few bucks in your pocket but want a warm filling meal, get over to Viva Las Arepas. They are super filling, I always order 2 cause I can't decide on 1, and end up being SO full. But yes, pretty much any option you choose is going to be made with love and flavor and affordable. So please enjoy! The actual restaurant is typical "fast food" style but with a patio, So I usually like to order to go and eat it in bed when I'm hungover ;P

Having never heard of an arepa before, Katrina M. quickly introduced me to one on a drunken night. Prior to going into the adjacent Dino's, I was ordered a Reina Pepiada - a masa cake stuffed with a cold combination of chicken, mayo, avocado, and peas. Even in sober retrospect, that was a damn great meal.   Another karaoke excursion brought a large group of us back to I Love Arepas. Ordering a myriad of arepas and empanadas, my favorites were the Roasted Pork Leg/Butt (moist, flavorful without unnecessary frills) and the Garlic Shrimp (showcasing the masa in its lightness). However, the sauces make the arepas infinitely better. There were two: a creamy green that was mild, and a more concentrated green that added spice in all the right ways. My only disappointment was in the codfish arepa - salty, fishy, and an added upset to the booze I just ingested.   The best part about this place, other than the arepas? The price! I swear, for under five bucks per arepa, I am not conscious of my broke college finances. The price and the amazing food make I Love Arepas the content of my dreams for the past week, with the only way to cease them is to visit again.

Stumbled in here after drinks at some bar downtown. Food is cheap and so delicious. Tried the empanadas, could've devoured about 20 of them and still dreaming about them a week later. Bad part is that it's in a sketchy area but it is what it is. Can't wait to come back!

The vegetarian arepa I had here was the best thing I ate in Vegas.  And it was only $5!!  My bus fare to get to Viva Las Arepas cost more than my lunch, but totally worth it.    After I finished my arepa, I considered getting another one to go, but knew that if I did I'd just end up eating it on the bus ride back to my hotel and given how crowded the bus is, that didn't seem like a good idea.  Go here.

I have been coming here, to this specific location, for a few years now and I'm sad to say that it is not what it once was. If I had reviewed this place 4 or 5 years ago, 5 stars all around. But now, obviously, not so much.   Some of the staff has moved to their second location, too. This includes Alex, who was always the cashier. She was always so sweet and smiling! And totally on top of things. I miss her! :(   The last time I went in, the new (to me) younger guy at the counter gave away my takeout order last time. $35+ worth of food. 3 arepas and an order of yucca with chicharron. He didn't realize it until 15 minutes later and I had to wait around longer for my order. Not even an apology (because I don't have a life or to go back to work or anything, right?) and the food was meh. He was pushy and borderline rude, but in that weird, polite way.   The wood fired beef was oily, the shredded beef was on point as usual, as was the pabellon with no cheese. However, the yucca fries with chicharron are usually a highlight for me but were a disappointment. They used to give you a medium sized, rectangular box full of big, juicy fried pieces of meat and yucca. Now, the box is half that size but the same price with the yucca and chicharron declining in size as well. For $6.99??? I felt ripped off when I cracked the box open only to find that it was my side and not my single arepa.. womp womp.  I'm gonna check out the second location and even though I don't really want to come back here, I probably will. Hopefully I will be able to bump this place up in stars again.
Friendly staff with deliciously prepared food! Enjoyable flavor and experience, definitely a must eat when in Vegas.

After 3 visits, this is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. It's not fancy, maybe it's not the place to celebrate a special occasion but the food is incredible. I visited last year as a non-meat eater and loved it. This trip, we are here for one night only and visited for both dinner and breakfast. There are no breakfast-y items on the menu...it's the same all day, but I knew I wouldn't be having it for a long time and doubled up.   I couldn't wait to visit as a carnivore. I asked the cashier what I might order and he gave me 2 amazing samples of beef. The wood fired beef is juicy and flavorful. We had it in an arepa and the flavors were muted. I'd suggest going for the plate of it where it can shine on its own.   Turns out my favorite 3 items are vegetarian. Surprise!  The corn and cheese arepa is a guilty please extraordinaire. It worked for dinner as well as breakfast and is equally fantastic alone or with a dab of the special mayo.   The fried plantains are sweet and mushy, cooked perfectly. The caramelization gives a nice bit of chew to offset the wonderful mushy texture. Mushy may be bad with most veggies, but in this case it's very appealing.   I don't remember the name of the cheesy bread stick that's off to the side of the menu. A little unassuming thing, it's like a doughnut with cheese and is 100 times better than my explanation.   For breakfast today we ordered the three items above and subbed in the chicken salad arepa for the beef. This was way too much food for the two of us for breakfast. My luck friend swears by it and my husband remembered loving it last year so I figured I needed to try it. Was it really good?  Indeed, it was. Just not AS good as my favorite 3 things. In all fairness, those would be pretty hard to beat.   Food is cooked to order and service has been good on every visit. There is plenty of seating and the restaurant has been very clean on each visit.   I love Viva las Arepas!!!

THIS PLACE IS SPECTACULAR! ! My goodness where to begin? Mom &Pop authentic Venezuelan cuisine.  Very clean, and prompt service. The empanadas (chicken and beef) were of the best ive had, careful they are super hot in tempature when served. The Arepas are to die for! The pork butt melts in your mouth and the chicken salad w cilantro mayo is bomb. Ill be back !
The staff was AMAZING! This was my 1st time having Venezuelan food and it did not disappoint! Go check it out! #yum

This place has some wonderful food! The Arepas are filled with crispy pork and the sauces that comes with them are delicious! I love the spicy sauce, I think it may have habaneros in it, it burned my lips in a good way! Then I was cooled off with the avocado cream sauce. The chicken was beyond delicious. Don't forget to try the ribs, I mean fall off the bone. Oh, I almost forgot the plantains were like little sweets fried pockets. I love the cheese Empanadas and the Tequenos (fried cheese sticks) my daughter said next time we need a dozen. I will be back for sure!

Delicious food and great service! I've been to the Vegas blvd location twice and enjoyed it.  Now my first visit to the new location was truly exceptional as well.  I love the empanadas and the Arepas.

Great spot!!!! The number 12 is awesome and the carne asada in the #1 is perfectly flavored with real mesquite wood.  Came here with the family, everyone ordered something different and everyone was very happy.  Restaurant is very clean and the staff really take pride in their work.  Definitely make a stop here!

Based on a recommendation from a coworker I was in the mood for something new and original yet tasty and fresh. Located in an innocuous spot 10 minutes from the strip in an older rundown area inside you'll find a cleanly decorated Venezuelan cafe. The decor is simple, lined with pictures that will impress you with the number of dishes you couldn't name. But in my opinion that's what makes it so exciting. Arepas is their signature food, "arepas" being a corn based flour that offers a huge variety of combinations of cheese and meats. Reina Pepiada is a mouthwatering blend of chicken and avocado and the corn based bread is such a great consistency and taste not overpowering and it's as soft as cornbread. They had freshly squeezed no sugar added juice as well as a desert of hot guava with cheese in a fried shell. For dessert right next door is a just as unique and tasty ice cream store with fresh and fun flavors using goat cheese and churros! All in all a great date spot that'll show how cultured and adventurous you are :)

So good. The bread wrap is tasty and whatever you choose to fill it with will be tasty. I got two because Im a hungry vegetarian and they filled me up. That white sauce is bomb if you get it to go make sure you get the two sauces, green sauce is hot but not really, good flavor and mild-med heat.

This place is good.   I have eaten here several times. I don't like this place when it's too busy, as it gets loud and crowded, and in my experiences the staff will not say a word to them about keeping the volume at a decent level. That alone prevents me from eating there as often as I'd like to.   It's definitely NOT a first date place- unless you're under 30 maybe.  And they only have 100% Venezuelan items on the menu.   That said, they are polite enough, and the prices are fair and the food is tasty. Nice outdoor patio dining. But ultimately, this place is all about the arepas. Which are awesome.

This place is very good. Solid diverse menu but not overwhelming. 2-3 will fill you up and give you a chance to try new things. Both sauces they bring to the table are also quite tasty. Make sure you don't forget the fries plantains for dessert!

The last time I had arepas was like 8 years ago when I lived in Utah, so I was excited to hit this joint up w/my man who grew up eating these things in Miami.  It was a short walk; but also in the blistering heat,so by the time we got there I was a bit of a cranky pants. Arepas couldn't be customized since the ingredients were already pre-mixed so I was ready to write-off getting one all together, but the man working the counter patiently led my onion-abhoring self to a couple options that did not include them. I went for the ground beef & cheese (not super exciting sounding) and my man the ham & cheese one. We also ordered beef & cheese and guava &cheese pepiadas, as well as a sugarcane and a passion fruit drink.   The drinks were delicious and ~ice~ cold -- making the hot yet quick stroll back to the stratosphere bearable, and dare I say even enjoyable? Once we got inside we dug into our food -- everything was awesome! The arepas were overflowing with filling, I would have preferred shredded beef to ground...but since Im a picky bitch I was at least happy with what I had. The pepiadas were amazing, so much so I didn't really want to share. All the sauces that come with  are tasty and add great extra flavor and kick as well.  I was super happy with this meal. It was cheap, fast, and tasty. Honestly -- I found a lot of food in Las Vegas mediocre, but Viva La Arepas was the first honest to goodness great meal I had while visiting the city. I would totally make it a point to come back if I am ever in town again.

Two words: Hot Pockets. Within one block you have dive bar karaoke, custard, a strip club, and now, Hot Pockets!! This has to be one of the greatest corners in Las Vegas. What more could you need?  Arepas are hot pockets of goodness, unless of course you go with the cold ingredients. They are a bit like a cornbread sandwich, as it is a corn dough. I have sampled the black bean and chicken, and I will say that I prefer the chicken. I have not perfected the right amount to order, as they make you really full quickly, but then shortly after you may find yourself snacky again, so my advice: overeat. I think that if you can you should do your best to eat at least 3. Or, just be content with a little snack and have one.  They are served up fresh and hot, and this is a food stand, so expect to sit outside and eat. The service is incredibly friendly and on top of customer service. Special orders do not upset them, and they actually gave my pal an extra empanada because one cracked!  I am a fan of their mango juice. It isn't too sweet and is the perfect refreshing treat to balance the heat of being on a corner in Las Vegas eating a hot pocket.   I Love Arepas should definitely be on your "must try" list of Vegas experiences and eats.
Heat areas here and the prices are good. I got the one with shredded beef in it and it took every ounce of will power that I had not to go back and order two or three more,LOL.

First time trying Venezuelan food and for me it was satisfying because most of the food was BBQ style and fresh. On top of that, I'm a fan of Latin American food and always willing to try different cuisines. I recommend their carne asada arepas.

This is one of my favorite places in Las Vegas to eat! The food here is AMAZING and it's a real hidden gem of Las Vegas. All of their foods from their empanadas to their arepas and even their wood fire chicken is spectacular. Their food is all full of flavor and every time I eat here it's a treat. Their prices are very good and the service is always wonderful. I've been eating here since they were a tiny sandwich shop with outdoor seating and now they are a full sit-down restaurant up the street. I look forward to eating here every time I go and I always tell friends about the place too.

One of my favorites in all of Las Vegas.  As a local, this place is exactly what I want.  Just unknown enough, hole in the wall enough, but on the strip so I can take out of towners.  Love everything here.  I order too much food every time.
So good! I had a cachapa, which is the sweet corn wrapper around a cheese filling and a wood fired chicken arepa.
Great find near the stratosphere along Las Vegas boulevard.  Excellent and authentic food.  Very inexpensive. A clean establishment with perfect service to match.  Highly recommended to all.

My husband and I came to Viva Las Arepas two days in a row while in Vegas! We got the pabellón arepa and a carne mechada empanada the first day and the Reina pepiada, tostones, and Chicharrones and fried yuca the second day. All with fresh strawberry juice, jugo de fresa! Deliciousness topped off with their homemade salsas. The salsa de ajo was the best. Btw, my husband is Venezuelan and said this was the most authentic food he's had in the states.

They were really friendly and helpful when we got there. We got the carne asada, shredded beef and garlic shrimp arepas. The shredded beef was the best one. We also tried the shredded beef empanadas which was really yummy. We got guava and cheese pastelitos for dessert which was ok. The soda was pricey though at $1.50 a can.

Absolutely delicious. Tried two kinds of arepas, both of them were good. Also had a shredded beef empanada.  The meat was to die for. Had a mango drink and plantains too. Everything was great. I never had Venezuelan food before. I can't wait to come back.
Mmmmm! they are so good and cheap, the best place to get good food in vegas is away from the strip . A definite must try if in Vegas you won't be disappointed.
