Service - Nice and fast.  Price - A bit expensive but good quality.  Location - Strip mall between downtown and North end of the strip.  Plenty of parking.  Very clean restaurant, plenty of seating and restroom.  Food - 1. Wood Fire Chicken Arepas- Very good, and filling.  2. Pulled Pork Arepas - Very good, and filling.  3. Guava Cheese Pastelitos - One small pastelitos pastry for $2.  A bit expensive.  Piping hot and lots of guava jam.  Only one small sliver of cheese. 4. Passion Fruit Juice - A tad tart but very refreshing.

I am so thrilled to see this restaurant has opened up a second location in the northwest! Same exact delicious menu as the original. For anyone who hasn't tried Venezuelan food, this is the place to start! Has lots of vegetarian options, as well as really good BBQ and gluten free items. Something for everyone! Food is so fresh and high quality, and the service is wonderful. Nice people! They deliver too, via Postmates.

I like it. We didn't know what to order so we asked the cashier what she recommended. She said we needed to try the Arepas number 3, 7, and 12. We also wanted to try the the cheese empanadas. Try at least one of each! They are fantastic. I included a pic of the cheese empanadas. Put some of those sauces on them and you have a winning situation!!

I guess i didn't order the right arepas, the ones i ordered were just okay...had the carne asada arepa and  the chicken with avocado salsa with plantains. The prices are decent, place is clean hard to park.. Overall, if you have not had an arepa.. a place to try.

If you live in Vegas and you haven't had the privilege to try this AUTHENTIC Venezuelan food, what are you waiting for?? The wood fired chicken is full of flavor, moist, tender DELICIOUS. Large portion of food with a side of rice and beans ( opted out on the beans and had a salad instead), the rice was sooooo good as was the salad. We also had the chicken arepa, which was very tasty as well. Will I go back? Absolutely. Great customer service, the woman taking the order was so gracious and happy to hear how much we enjoyed the food. Very clean establishment, not in the best neighborhood and the parking is for the birds, but worth the hassle.

This place is within walking distance where I work and I know that most places around are expensive. On a nice day like today I took a walk and yelp led me to this little shop and I'm very impressed. The place was very clean and the staff was courteous. Once I came back to work with my order in hand, I was amazed on how good the food was. I will definitely be stopping there more often.

Viva Las Arepas es mi ir a por su excelente comida Venezualan ! Este lugar está escondido en el barrio de Las Vegas , pero si usted tiene los cajones ir usted no será defraudado ! A pie de altura , cabeza en alto como un hombre blanco loco y que será tratado a algunos de los más sorprendentes de tacos que las cosas que usted puede imaginarse . Algunos de la mejor carne asada que he tenido y que he tener algún buen conocimiento de mierda en eso. Mi chica caliente y yo pedimos unas cuantas cositas diferentes harina de arepa y unos plátanos . Sabor a sabor a sabor !! Incluso me olvidé de mirar a su alrededor para los personajes oscuros que estaba tan en mis arepas !! Hugo Chávez puede ser un pene , pero sus tíos más puede hacer un poco de comida irreal !! Viva Las Arepas y pinatas !!!  Translation: Unreal f*king good and no grammar check needed!!!
So delicious! Reasonably priced and everything tasted fresh. The owner was super nice and inviting :)

FANATASTIC, INCREDIBLE, AMAZEBALLS, DELICIOUS! Had the ribs (tips to be exact), black beans and fried Yucca root. Wifey had the "Reina Pepiada" (Chicken Breast mixed with Avocado, Mayo & Cilantro) sandwich. Can't wait to go back. Every thing was so tasty. Wanna try EVERYTHING! Ivan was so nice...gave us sampleS. Clean and customer friendly place. FYI--Fried Yucca root bests French Fries...sooo good

I've never heard of an arepa before so I was glad this was my first experience of it. Food is soooooo fulfilling and delicious. You can honestly get full just off of one. Their side dishes there are also great too. We had empanadas, their pork rinds, and their drinks. Def coming back whenever I'm in Vegas again.

Let me just start this review with the fact that I am OBSESSED with arepas.  I first tried this glorious gift to mankind in Providence, Rhode Island, of all places. It was the little mom and pop where the owners obviously just moved from Venezuela. Anyway, fast forward 3 years and I've tried to find arepas wherever I go. I've tried Caracas Arepa bar in NY and was not impressed. Closer to home, I've had Coupa Cafe in Beverly Hills, which is okay and Cafe Bolivar in Santa Monica (which is really really good).   Now, for Viva Las Arepas. I saw it as I was driving to North Vegas and immediately pulled a U-turn to grab me some arepas. I ordered the pork arepa with cheese and it was really really good! Their guasacaca (green sauce) was really good.   On my last trip to Vegas I had to come back. They did a whole overhaul on this place. It looks much nicer than it used to. So I ordered the pork arepa again. This time, the sauce it came with was either the spicy sauce or some white "cilantro" sauce. It was not the same guasacaca I had become accustomed to. The spicy sauce was good, but I think that the white sauce was too creamy. Bring back your old sauce!!!!  Overall, it's still very good in terms of arepas. The meat is tender and well seasoned. The arepas are obviously freshly home made and they have a nice crust to them. I will have to come back on every pilgrimage to Vegas =)  Other things to note: There is a parking lot and outdoor seating. Prices are pretty good. One arepa will fill you up. I've also had the fried yucca and the plantains; both are good!

If you want some really tasty food with great sauces and wood fired meats this is the place. The Arepas are excellent and everything using the corn flour is amazing. The cilantro sauce is good on everything and anything.

What an amazing little gem in Vegas!  We tried the top 3 arepas: Reina Pepiadas, garlic shrimp, and roast pork butt.  We were slightly hesistant about the Reina Pepiadas first because of the mayo, but the mayo actually added an extra dimention of richness to each bite.  Each arepa was bursting with flavor.  I would recommend asking for your arepas to be grilled slightly longer to give the outer shell an extra crispy texture.  We arrived at 11AM and by the time we were done with our food at 11:30AM, there was already a decent line forming.  Good food is worth the wait...and the price is great!  Definitely recommend!

Why is there so much rave about this place? I stopped by here on the way home today and got myself a carne asada arepas. It tasted like the kind of food I'd get at a mexican food truck on the side of the road - delicious but the flavor is because of the fat and oil. I felt pretty gross about myself after eating my arepas. This isn't the type of food for me and I think I will pass on this from now until t = - infinity.

We ordered the Mesquite smoked chicken combo plate with sides of white rice and black beans.  We also ordered the smoked beef arepas.  The only thing that tasted exceptional was the chicken.  The chicken was seasoned and grilled perfectly, the smokey flavor really shined.  The sides of black beans and rice was just ok, we had better at many places.  The beef arepas was bad.  The beef was lacking in seasoning and smokey note.  The arepas itself was hard and chewy, too old maybe. Service at the walk up counter was friendly, helpful, and quick. We like to give another shot because the chicken was so good. We also like another shot at the arepas, maybe the pulled pork version.

I had my first arepa at Viva Las Arepas and was mighty impressed. I arrived around 10PM on a Saturday night with my brother-in-law and set my eyes on the vegetarian arepa ($5), although what I actually got was more of a Frankenstein creation. The man at the register (who I'm assuming to be the manager/owner) was super helpful in assisting me with my order.   CUSTOM AREPA ($6ish): My arepa had black beans, cheese, a fried egg, lettuce, tomato, and plantains in it! I topped off each bite with a dash of the cilantro sauce or the spicy red sauce. The fried egg and plantains were the best part. The employee talked me getting into plantains, and I'm glad I decided to try it out in my arepa. It was delicious! I was skeptical that one arepa would fill me up, but by meal's end I was good to go. :) 5/5  For my second visit I got a black bean and cheese arepa, which definitely lacked the creative spark of my Frankenstein creation, but was still yummy nonetheless. My husband got the wood fire beef plate ($10.99) and was happy. The white rice on the side was AMAZING. Soft, buttery, and full of flavor. I'm getting this as my own side on the next visit.   I wish Viva Las Arepas was closer to the locals, but I hear they're opening a second location so there's hope!  YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2016: #43

Be aware : Credit card surcharge $0.50                    (Under $10)  One order of chicken arepa came out $7.02 including tax and credit card surcharge. It is not worth the price. The smoked chicken tasted good but the bread was hard. I won't be back.

Items Selected: Fried Pork Rinds & Yucca Root Fried Plantains Wood Fire Chicken Arepa with Tomato, Lettuce, Onions Roasted Pork Butt Arepa with Tomato and Cheese Guava and Cheese Pastelito  Set beside Art of Flavors, where another star-studded sampling had just concluded in the best 'ice cream sandwich' ever to cross my lips, it was with long-held interest and a touch of gluttony that I finally entered Viva Las Arepas; my "some for now with the rest for later" order rooted not only in convenience but also in hopes of avoiding a later trip from home for dinner.  Ever popular amongst locals and tourists alike with a menu focused on the Venezuelan flatbread sandwich alongside additional items both grilled and fried the time was just past two on my arrival to the deceptively large space and greeted by a short line with the dining room 2/3 full it would not be long before I found myself standing at the counter, a friendly middle-aged man expediting orders and assigning me number #36, my five boxed selections delivered to the table a mere fifteen minutes thereafter.   Clearly a restaurant vested in its core with a menu infrequent to change it was in a duo of 'sides' that my meal began and although bland plantains dripping with excess grease quickly proved inedible the unlikely star of the show would in fact be the wood-grilled pigskins, a crispy exterior overlying supple fat with intense brine offset by tender chunks of fried yucca.  Moving next to a pair of arepas it was with the wood grilled chicken that I started yet with flavors no better than the frozen stuff from Roots sold at Walmart I quickly moved to the pork-butt, the flavor almost indistinguishable from the bird as a trickle of oil ran down my hand into the napkin below.  At this point tossing what was left of each sandwich to instead sample the rinds and root with accompanying sauces it was finally with the $2 Pastelito that I finished and although tasty enough to stand on its own I couldn't help but think that for a buck per bite I'd have been better off staying next door with another scoop of gelato.

3.5, I rounded up. Pros: good street food, not great. The arepas themselves (essentially the buns for the Venezuelan sandwich) didn't have any seasoning. I get it, it's authentic. But we are in America, authentic don't mean anything any mo'. Like my excellent grammar, when cooking a particular ethnic Cusine take some liberties, like GW and his guerrilla tactics on the Potomac...improvise mo-fo.   Order the #7. It was a chicken with cilantro and avocado. And #1 - chicken...and there is a beef one in there as well. The yuca was lame, not enough breading (if you are going to fry yuca, the fry the yuca).  The kids loved the chicken and cheese empanadas. I like the story of the chef. Really busted his ass to get a place going. That makes me like the place more. I want him to be a success. The lady at the POS was very nice, but if she was Venezuelan, I'm from Alpha Centauri. More like Mexizuelan. Worth the trip...yes (but it is halfway down the list of places to go in downtown LV). So much good food here (love that grammar).

My original review still stands! Except I was wrong about getting 2 arepas. 1 is enough! And my boyfriend finally agreed with me and loved the chicken one this time, and thought the pork was too salty. Oooh they've also raised prices since the last time I came, so there's that

I've always driven by this place and wondered what it was. Location wise, it's actually quite bad. Why? Well, it it's right in the middle of going towards downtown or going towards the strip. If you have an agenda, you'll always pass by this place. I think it's taken me over 5 years to finally try here. So this time while in Vegas, as I always try a local joint when I'm in town, Viva Las Arepas it was!   There is parking in the strip mall here. Depending what time you come here, it can be packed or not. We came at 7pm when it was packed and left at 8pm when it was not. The signage for the menu can be daunting at first. But when you look closer, it's really the same thing in English and the same thing in Spanish. They're not quite mirror perfect, but trust me it's the same.   I was a little hungry the day I was here, with some 4 other friends. We ordered almost $90 worth of food and drinks. No, I'm not kidding.  We got to try a lot of different things from here. So here it goes:  Wood Fire Beef-cut in thick 1/2 inch strips. Flavorful, not tender,slightly on the salty side,  great with the mojo sauce. They do give you quite a bit. Think of beef jerky but just a tad softer.  The side of beans and white rice were ok, nothing to be excited about and the portions were really small.   Fried Plantains-I have to say, this was the BEST fried plantains I have tasted anywhere. I've been to a lot of places and this place does it slightly crispy on the outside, soft and not overly sweet once you bite into it. MUST order.  Fried Yucca-So these are cut in one inch strips and fried. I thought they would be as good as the plantains. NO, they're not ! They tasted strange. It had a weird aftertaste on some of them I had. I do question the freshness of the Yucca.   Mango drink-Tasted like a watered down version of a mango lassi. Honestly, skip it.   Arepas-Now the arepas itself, they were quite good. They were airy that I couldn't taste any of the cornmeal. As for the fillings, there are plenty of choices but ugh, the line cook here put way too much salt into the shredded beef one.   Most of us liked this place but personally it's not one of those places I'm dying to go back. Prices here aren't quite cheap for cheap eats. They do open until 12am so if you want something different, I would definitely come here. 3.5 stars.

I have been wanting to come here for so long.  It's located north of the Vegas strip so it's a tad away from all the crowds.   I tried the pork butt arepa and chicharon & yuca frites.  I really liked the arepa.  It's different from anything I have tried before.  I enjoyed the food and I'd love to come back.
So delicious and the staff is friendly.  I had the reina pepiada... Chicken avocado mayo and cilantro....it was seriously the best thing I've eaten in a while.  And affordable!

We took 4 teenagers/young adults with us to viva las arepas and watched the 4 of them go from apprehensive to appreciative of the many foods we tried off the menu. We tried so much! Fresh mango juice ,guava pastelitos, the mixed grill, cachapas con queso and arepas, yuca and plantain .... All absolutely delicious! You have simply got to try this place!

I tried their roast pork butt arepas! It was a little dry for my taste, maybe I should add the avocado next time. I love the magic sauce and their service was great. Pretty attentive to their customers! Also tried the passion fruit juice, but it was sort of weird tasting, I will probably go with the guava next time if I ever go back.

I have eaten all types of food, all over the world and this place is great!  The service is awesome and they take pride in their food.   The arepas are out of this world.  I know the #7 is great!  The one with eggs, ham, tomatoes and onions is wonderful!  The #1 is great too.  So many great choices.  I had something with coconut and cheese in a fried like ravioli tepatilo maybe my God it was great!  YOU MUST TRY THIS PLACE!  The sauces they serve with their food are simply amazing.  The passion fruit juice is absolutely delicious.  I'll be back my next time in Vegas!

A different location but the same tasty and quality Venezuelan food.  A #9 & #5 are my recommendations.  Also the fruit juices are freaking awesome.  I love the passion fruit.  Definitely a staple when in Vegas!

I woke up this morning and all I could think of was AREPAS! I asked people where this place is at since all I know is that it's close to Olympic Garden. I used my GPS to help me find this place and brought me to Art of Flavors. Where is this place? Ah, it's right next door to Art of Flavors tucked in the corner.  After a yummy experience from an arepas foodtruck, we got garlic shrimp arepa, pork butt arepa with cheese, Reina Pepiada arepa, wood fire chicken arepa and fried plantains. They have more options here compared to the foodtruck which is not surprising. The prices are about the same. But the arepa itself is less toasted and is heavier than the foodtruck version. The cilantro sauce is equally as good, this place's spicy/red sauce is spicier. I had to try their guanabana juice to compare it to what I had when I was a kid.   Garlic Shrimp Arepa: No tomatoes or veggies, just straight up garlic shrimp. I liked this a lot especially with the cilantro sauce which elevates the garlic flavor of the shrimp.  5/5  Roasted Pork Butt: Comes with tomato slices. Add cheese. In case you didn't know, pork butt = pork shoulder and not the actual butt of a pig. Tasty pork. Both the spicy and cilantro sauce work well with this. 4/5  Reina Pepiada Arepa: Cold chicken with mayo, avocado and cilantro. Tastes just like the one from the arepas foodtruck. A much better version of a chicken salad. 5/5  Wood Fire Chicken Arepa: Really flavorful chicken with tomato, onions and lettuce. 4/5  Fried Plantains: I love this stuff. My mom would fry some plantains for me as a snack when I was a kid. So simple and easy to make yet it tastes so good. The natural sweetness of the plantains come out when you fry them in high temperatures. Eventhough they could have gotten rid of the excess oil, I still like these things. 5/5  Guanabana: AKA soursop juice and in Filipino, guyabano. This tastes like concentrate mixed with lots of sugar and water. I couldn't taste soursop. 3/5  After that meal, we headed next door for dessert. After dessert, I decided to come back here so I can try the chicharron with fried yucca. Shawn tapped out as I was enjoying chicharron and yucca. All he said to me was "I can't believe how you're still eating."  Chicharron with Fried Yucca: The chicharron wasn't the same crispy fatty pork I was excpeting. The yucca was good with the cilantro sauce though. It was as if I was eating garlic fries. Yum! 4/5
I got a grilled chicken arepa with avacado and cilantro. Staff was friendly, tables and dining area was clean and tidy and lots of tables to sit.

This is our  third time here.. Introduced to by great friends.. It's a must have when we come to Vegas.. If only we had one in LA! Great fresh made to order Arepas! Staff is friendly and place is super clean. You can see all the action in the kitchen as well!

Great find! Had the beef arepa, was pretty good, I also had the chicken salad one, wasn't great.. but what I really loved was there grilled chicken with rice and beans.. delicious!! I have to try the empanada next time, they looked great!

I went here on a Friday around 1:30 pm. I ordered the beef arepa and chicken empanada and waited 35 minutes for my food! Mind you there was no line!! They forgot to make my food!! I came to this place when they were just a little shack sitting on the corner about a year or so ago and absolutely loved the prices and food, so I figured I'd go there again for cheap eats and great customer service.. NOPE!!! On top of it all the prices have risen!! I guess they moved into a building and decided to raise the prices with the move.. I won't be going back here.. OH.. The food wasn't all that either!! I'm too done trying to find a good place to eat in vegas

Incredible!! We stumbled on this gem our first night here and are so glad we did. We tried a few different things, and all was great. I'd highly recommend you add this to your list during  your visit.

Absolutely love the food! As a venezuelan, totally recommend this place. The arepas are on the small side, but the fillings are delicious. Last time I went they even had papelón con limón (my favorite from when I was a kid). I can't ever miss this spot every time I go to Vegas now. Keep it up!

Never had an Arepa before and now i'm not sure if i can live without them! This place should be all over. Great spot, excellent management, super clean, stellar food quality and consistency. On my recommend list for anyone visiting Vegas... even picky eaters and those with non ethnic pallets. A++

After trying I love tapas, I figured out it was arepas. I had the shredded beef. The chicken and pork butt. Muy delicioso. I thought they were tiny hence why I ordered 3. Coming from a Guy who can eat it was hard to nom nom nom down the 3rd one. The meat was fresh with the right amount of seasoning. The corn bread thing it was in was lite and airy. I love the green mild sauce he gives on the side.  So good.

I was staying off the strip and walked almost two miles to this place after reading the reviews.  It was worth it.  I got the fried plantains and an arepa with pork.  Plantains are never bad.  The arepa was a little bland until I added one of the sauces, and then it was really good.  And filling.  After I left, I wished I had gotten another one for later.
This place was pretty fantastic.  The portions are massive and the food is delicious.  I'm a big fan.  It's definitely worth the trek if you're staying on the strip.

This is an office favorite, talk about packing a variety of flavors into a small flaky wonderful pocket of deliciousness. I come here often and it is a place where I order for a quick pick up and a quick cheat day lunch.  I typically order the one that has plantings beef in it- the everything Arepa.  Their service is great, this place is very clean, and it's always packed with happy patrons.  The tasty pockets called "arepas" remind me of the Mexican similarity to this called "sope".  Divine.

If you are in the mood to try something new, do yourself a favor and stop by I Love Arepas! This place has incredibly tasty Venezuelan food and refreshing drinks. My FAVORITE is the pork butt (Pernil) arepa and the sugar cane with lemon juice, or the pastelitos (meat pies) with passion fruit juice.   DEFINITELY RECOMMEND!

Fresh and delicious. Clean location and very courteous customer service. It's near the downtown area so it's easy to get to. Once you enter the location you walk up to the counter and order. All items are also translated in English.

This place rules. If you're staying at the Stratosphere, doubt be alarmed by the slightly sketchy two block walk to get there, it's totally worth it. My go-to order is the chicken thighs ($6.50 w/ rice and beans). Delicious wood-grilled chicken you can eat off the bone, just like ribs. The beans are even better... maybe the best thing they serve. The arepas are also amazing, as you'd expect, and the corn and cheese pancake thing... I have no words. Great service, too!
Omg this place is like heaven! It's too good to be true! So so so good! This people are the real deal. Authentic, fresh and awesome customer service!
This place is great value. The food was awesome and the price was even better. We'll definitely be back.

**Summary**        - Taste - Maybe it was an off day, but I just didn't like the flavor of arepas. The mix grill wasn't bad though. If I were to come back, I'd get the Pork Spare Rib meal. That was my favorite.        - Value - I think the price is a little high for what you're getting **Ordered**        - $22.99 Wood Fire Mix Grill w/ Fried Plantain & Fried Yucca Root - The pork spare ribs were delicous. Tender & tasty. The Beef was ok. However, the chicken was dry and the sausage wasn't very tasty.        - $4.50 Wood Fire Chicken Arepas - The chicken was dry. The arepas seemed to be more bun then anything else.        - $5.50 Wood Fire Beef Arepas - Bun, oil, and salty beef. Didn't really like the taste. **Recommendations**        - I'd wouldn't really recommend this place. There's a lot of other places you could get more bang for your buck.

Simply delicious!   We will be back. We had a little bit of everything and thoroughly enjoyed it all!    We got a three arepas (wood fired beef, wood fired chicken and roasted pork butt). All were delicious but I enjoyed the chicken the most. They serve everything with a mayo, cilantro, parsley sauce. It is amazing! The black beans are very flavorful I wish I could have fit them on my arepa.

Checked this place out today, while it was 110+ degrees out, and they had no A/C running! If they did, you definitely could not feel it because it was just as warm inside as it was outside.   On to the food - we ordered the #1 carne asada, #2 wood fired chicken, and #4 pork butt arepas. When you get your food, they provide 2 sauces - a creamy, cilantro-ish (similar to the creamy cilantro dressing from El Pollo Loco) and a salsa verde that has a little bit of a spicy kick to it. Both sauces had great flavor, and thank goodness they did because you'll need it. I've never had arepas before so I'm not sure if they're meant to be bland so it'll pick up flavors from the meat, but they were just that. Unfortunately, the meats didn't really help either because they were pretty flavorless, too. The carne asada arepa was so dry that I had to douse it in the green sauces just to get through it and still didn't finish it. The pork butt had some type of sweet tomato based sauce on it, sort of tasted like al pastor. It was just ok, definitely not as dry as the asada. I didn't try the chicken arepa but my BF said it was just ok.   We also ordered the 3 chicken thighs special that's posted on the window by the register and an order of yucca fries. I love yucca fries and these were just right. Crunchy on the outside, smooth inside. The chicken thighs special came with 3 pieces of grilled boneless, skinless thighs, black beans, and rice. I would come back here just for the beans and rice! Whatever flavor was lacking in the arepas was totally made up for in the rice and beans. Definitely worth a try.   Overall, I'm not completely in love with the place but they have a lot of other items on the menu that seemed interesting. Might give it another shot some day.

We went to Viva Las Arepas to try out Venenzuelan food. Since this restaurant has great reviews on yelp, we decided to give it a try.   The restaurant is very clean and welcoming. The person at the counter greeted us as we entered and also in our mother tongue as well :). We wanted to try out Arepas (vegetarian) and cachapas, so we ordered these.  The order was ready very quickly. The waiter was extremely polite. The Arepas were good. We specially loved the cachapas, which reminded us of an Indian corn bread dish. It was not too sweet but just enough sweet. We all shared it and enjoyed every bit of this dish. Highly recommend you to try it.  Overall great food and service. I will return here on my next visit on Vegas.

Didn't really know what to expect. Since I never had arrepas before. Surprisingly the arrepas were good, I ordered a wood fire beef with avocado it was packed with lightly seasoned beef and priced very well for only $5. I also ordered a 1/4 fired wood chicken with a side. The fire cooked chicken was ok, it lacked flavor unless you douse it with one of the chili sauce they give you.   When your in line you better know what you want since the line moves fast and people will be standing behind you. I definitely want to go back again to try some of the other arrepas.   Only drawback it's free refills on fountain drinks but you have to ask the counter person to get a refill since it's behind the counter. Plenty of tables inside to eat.   Parking is a hit and miss since it's a small plaza with limited amount of parking.

I do love these mini grilled pocket sandwiches. All are priced around $3.50-$4.00 and are jammed pack with great ingredients. Located right outside of Dino's, they are a must before, or after getting a little tipsy.  I had originally wanted to get the tongue, but they ran out. Instead, the chef suggested the leg meat and I have to bow down to the tender and flavorful meat. Cut off in thick gyro like pieces, this could be deadly. The rest of the group ordered and we had this meal family style. The garlic shrimp were tender and juicy. There is nothing worst than ordering shrimp and getting rubber instead. So good we order three. The pork butt was also delicious. The pulled chicken, mayo, and avocado arepa was so rich and decadent. The combination was perfection, but not for more than a few bites. I was glad to be able to pass it on after a bite. We had also ordered the cod and that was not a hit. For being a mild fish, it had an overbearing flavor. It was extremely salty and was the last to be finished.

first venezuelan food and it was really good! it was our first time so we asked for popular dish and he said it was #1 & #7 arepas. they were both good! :) chicken dish had too much mayo but still pretty tasty. price was pretty reasonable for the taste! :)

I've never had an Arepa before but heard lots of good things about this place so we had to try it! After scanning reviews and the menu we settled on the Garlic Shrimp (hot), Wood Fired Beef, and a couple of Tequenos (fried cheese sticks). I feel the food was pricey for the quantity. I liked the cheese sticks, but Doug thought they tasted too sweet. The Garlic Shrimp was ok (Like shrimp scampi on a maize bun) the shrimp was a little mushy and after a few bites was over it. The beef was ok too, just not a lot of flavor even with the sauces. I guess we just don't get the appeal. The service was good but... I would not go back. I rather save room for gelato.

This was great! Recommended by friends, small corner restaurant but very clean very friendly staff and delicious arepas. They gave arepas a great twist. I had the reina pepiada arepa, which is stuffed with pulled chicken in a creamy sauce of avocado, mayo & cilantro. Add a bit of their homemade hot salsa - just great! Also had agua de Panela with lime, refreshing! Definitely a stop to make on all my future Vegas trips.
It just doesn't get any better than this.  I had an empanada, arepa, and plantains.  For the price, you simply can't have a tastier meal than Viva Las Arepas.
Unless you live in a Venezuelan home, arepas are difficult to find. A menos que usted vive en un hogar venezolana , arepas son difíciles de encontrar. Viva Viva Lase Arepas!!  Muy, muy autentico!!

Second review for this place and once again an outstanding meal, I had the Pabellon this time, a little taste of home that always brings back great memories of living in Venezuela, I also had an arepa and Yuca fries, my wife thoroughly enjoyed the garlic shrimp arepa and washed it all down with agua de papelon, I will continue to support this establishment.

Blame it on the A-a-a-a-a-alcohol if you want, but the food this place puts out was like mana from heaven at midnight last Saturday night. We were leaving Dino's and a friend suggested we get Arepas, since I'd never tried them before. We got a beef arepa and a lingua arepa. When i tasted the yummy, cheesy, tender filling surrounded by the moist corn flour wrap I could barely put it down. I love that they leave the sauce on the side, so you can add it to your liking. The shredded beef was so tender and hearty. The lingua (beef tongue) tasted very similar to a slow cooked pot roast that had been shredded and sauteed with peppers and onions. It was spicy and the accompanying sauce made it even more so. It was delicious! It took some liquid courage to get me to try it, but now I'm hooked! I'm actually considering driving there on my lunch hour today (completely sober of course)! This place is a must try if you've never had an Arepa, or if you're close to downtown and hungry!
Best Latin American food in Vegas IMHO. I don't know what they put in that green sauce but I could drink it straight and die happy.

Nice little restaurant, they have tasty, and fresh authentic Venezuelan food. very clean restaurant. Food cooked on real wood fire.  Beef Arepas woodfire cooked were amazing went well with fresh fruit juice. Moderately priced, fast and friendly service. The restaurant located in Las Vegas Blvd and Oakey. They have decent parking. If you are downtown I suggest you give this place a try.

soooooooo......i came here with high hopes because of the ratings....i have had better arepas in NYC. i ordered the chicken avocado, the black bean vegetarian, and the pernil (pork butt), also ordered the white rice and beans mix....the ONLY thing that made me happy was the pernil arepa..... and it was the filling that was good .. the actual arepa was bland, stiff, and not impressive at all. but the customer service was good and the restaurant was clean. if you want  a quick meal that's descent ...this is the place.

A true hole in the wall off the strip that, according to the V-born hubster, is fine authentic Venezuelan fare; and cheap too.  Lots of arepas and even soda and drinks from abroad.   Everything is tasty from cachapa, sweet corn tortilla with white cheese, a reina pepiada, the tequeno, the empanadas, ERRYTHANG!  Fantastic find; patting myself on the back.

Amazing! The pabellon plate was delicious. The beef is so flavorful. The black beans are so creamy, and the plantains are the perfect level of sweet. The wood fired chicken arepa  was equally delicious. These delights were quickly devoured by my family and myself. The owner even came by to great us and brought my son some fries. What awesome service. This will be my go to spot when I'm downtown or heading near the strip. Viva Las Arepas!
My wife and I tried the vegetarian and reina pepiada arepa.  Both were delicious.  Just the right size and priced right.  Staff was friendly and the place was very clean and comfortable.

Wow! So good, and my wish is to have this place in LA near me so that I could eat there everyday.   We shared the beef and pork arepas and the beef and beans/cheese fried empanadas.  Everything was delicious, especially with the crack sauce.  Don't forget to pick up a bottle of the hot crack sauce and the cilantro crack sauce at the counter since they don't stock them at each table.    I also got coffee, which was hot and strong.  It comes with a vanilla creamer and sugar.  Read the English menu board, which is the one on the left, if you no comprende Espanol.   Arepas - the name sounds bad, but arepas are muy bueno.
If you don't like this place, you have no taste buds!!!! AMAZINGGGG
Clásico de la comida Venezolana, me la ha recomendado un amigo, es amante de las arepas, y por cierto, este lugar es genial. Muy recomendable.

Quite easily one of the most unexpectedly unique and savory dining experiences.  Try the 4 and the 7, though the shredded beef was also amazing.  We are definitely returning to sample some more!  Also, the service was great.

These are the best arepas in America. I always come here when I'm in Vegas and I recommend it to all of my friends. I get the #2 chicken arepa and it is always better than the last somehow...Five stars, this place is a MUST when in Vegas! If food were God then these arepas are what God would be.

We're not close to this locale, but if we're in the neighborhood, it's a refreshing change of pace for lunch!!  Not your typical sandwich.  Arepas are all amazing.  Try the #12 for sure - beef, beans, plantains & cheese.  It's the bomb.  Or order without plantains!!  Next time we're trying the ham & cheese & the shrimp.  The bean & cheese empanada was great as well as the cheese rollup stick thing.  Service was very friendly & food came out fast.  Both the sauces they delivered to the table were keepers.  Wanted to put one in my purse.  Hah  All the meats are very well cooked.  If you want tender shredded anything, this is your place.  We're fans & going back.
Let's just talk about the sides: the fried plantains are the best I've ever had; the fried yucca is ridiculous; and their black beans taste like chili.

This a food fast vs. fast food establishment. It has a great menu of foods and was fun trying out what was recommended to me. This is Latin American food, more Caribbean based than say Mexican. I had a Gordita like stuffed empanada that had carne asada, plantains, cheese and a really flavorful couple of sauces delivered with the food. Theyre very friendly, not a first date place unless you are super casual. They have Agua Frescas, pineapple, mango and a couple of others, also very good. I gave it a 5/5 because it different, foods fresh and should be visited by all

This place was awesome!!  It is located in such a unique building with many eating options, but this is by far my favorite!  The arepas are moist, stuffed with such yummy things.  My favorite has plantains and white cheese and just melts in your mouth!!  It is a great place for lunch!

All the menu items I got were delicious. Must try the chachapa dish it's generously filled with cheese and wrapped in a sweeter version of the arepa. The carne asada plate was awesome and seasoned perfectly with just simple salt and pepper and it was tender so no need for a knife. Just stay away from the side of salad. My go to is the Reina pepiada which is kinda like a better version of a chicken salad. Knocked off one star because the staff were kinda disorganized and unprofessional with the manager yelling at his staff. I've also been to the rainbow location which I prefer.

Everything here is awesome. My favorites would have to be the chachapa and the ham and cheese arepa. The chachapa is filled with so much gooey melts cheese and wrapped like a quesadilla with a sweeter thinner version of the arepa. The ham and cheese arepa is so simple but filled with so many flavors. It's overloaded with cheese and the ham is thick cut and layered just right in the arepa. Those two are a must try you won't regret it

This place is awesome! I've heard about Arepas before trying this place but this was my first time actually trying it. I was a total newbie but the lady was nice and recommended the #12 - Arepa Pabellon which is beef black beans plantain and cheese. Wow! It was soo good. Very filling. I've tried some other places in other city's since and idkif its just me but they were not as good.   I'm hungry now, think I'll head over!

For about 5 years, I'd driven by this place and thought "Hey, I should try that someday."  Someday finally came, and I'm very happy I finally hit the exact right combination of hunger and proximity so I could try it out.   I'd never had an Arepa before, and didn't really know what to expect. I don't actually know how to describe it either.  Like a sandwich but not on bread, and I chose to stuff mine with some delicious shredded beef.  They were very inexpensive, but also surprisingly filling, so I will have to go back and try different ones next time out.    Definitely worth checking out.

Totally starving after the opening night of the PollyGrind film festival and first Friday party down near that art district.  The gang of us wandered down the street and came upon I Love Arepas, and proceed to chow down on some fabulous black bean and cheese arepas, as well as camaron arepas!  So yummy, and we weren't even drunk!  Well, I wasn't.  Also good were the fried cheese bread sticks, and the meat lovers like the pork, beef, chicken arepas, too!  I hope to find this kind of dish back in Sacramento when I return!

Forgot about this place for a while until a visiting friend requested that we visit. So we did. The house specialty here are deceptively hearty sandwiches served in soft, creamy arepas - which are sort of like the love child of cornbread and bao. The meats grilled over wood - stacks of which are piled inside the restaurant - are imparted with a smoky flavor that perfectly complements the buns into which the meat is nestled. Be aware that these are pretty filling - the first time I was here I ordered two, with a side of rice and beans, and it was way too much food. These things are filling.
Delicious. Had the ribs, arepas with shredded chicken and cilantro sauce. Black beans and fried yucca. Everything was so delicious.  A great addition to the neighborhood. Will be back.
A place you must try in Las Vegas!! I went for the first time and it was amazing. I ordered the arepa con queso and it was so good. Reminded me of the arepas I've had in Colombia.

The food was not bad. I didn't like the bread that much though. I did like the pork butt sandwich the most, other ones i tried were just OK. I did expect something out of the ordinary but nothing like that here would prefer a carne asada sandwich instead of this any day.
I went here while I was passing through Vegas on my way home. I came here hungry and left with a belly full of deep fried goodness.

We came here with a bunch of Yelpers after the CMYE Baseball and Beers event.  I wasn't hungry but I just HAD to try this place after so many glowing reviews.  I got the pork butt and my wife ordered the shredded beef.  Both were really tasty and I can't wait to come back here with a complete appetite to try some other arepas.  Watching the staff of 2 do their magic while we were eating was pretty cool.  I have jury duty in a couple of weeks so I'm already planning on trying the tongue, shrimp and maaaaaaybe the tripe.

Delicious! Came at a slow time and spoke to the chef,  I speak Spanish and he has a very cute Venezuelan accent, anyway, the food was grilled perfectly and the flavors were unique and different. Love the natural fruit drinks.  The place is decorated in my favorite color: yellow. The place is clean, the portions are nice, and the service is friendly. Chef even sent us chicharron and yuca frita, never had it before but loved it. Will definitely come back.
Great delicious food, lovely staff and cozy spot. Pop by if you're nearby, you won't regret.
Si,si,si! Yes,yes,yes! Ay que bueno! Everything is good! Viva!!!
The best and most creative arepas I've ever had. Take it from a Colombian. Very delicious. Definitely would come back. price very convenient. Service, excellent.

This place is definitely in the sketchy part of town.  We had found this place on Yelp with great reviews and and decided to have a friend drive us out here.  It's truest a hole in the wall.   Our cashier Felix was helpful.  It was our first time eating arepas.  I'm not sure how Arepas should be but I can give my honest opinion on what I know.  I love the fact that the arepas are home made.  We ordered #9 Vegetarian, #12 Pabellon Arepa, #1 Asada Arepa, #7 Reina Pepiada and some deserts.    I really liked the arepas but there was sooooo much sauces in it.  The meats were practically soaked in sauces.  I would have liked to be able to get the meat for its flavor and not just drenched in sauces.    I did however, enjoy the #13 Cachapas.  It was sweet arepas with cheese.  It was delicious! I would totally order this item again as a snack!
The beef was the best in my opinion. What sells is the bread . The chicken arepa with the avocado was okay. If I'm in the area, yes I'll stop by and try it again.

I've been to this place twice and it's pretty good. The first time I had the chicken arepa and this time I had the black bean and cheese arepa. You would think these small arepas wouldn't be enough but I can't even finish one because it's so much and so rich. Their fries are always on point and the food is pretty cheap. This place is definitely a gem on the strip but they do close at midnight which is kind of a bummer. Would definitely recommend to anyone!
The staff was not helpful and the food was awful. The first time in a while that I have actually thrown away my meal after only eating a bite or two.

Very tasty! Had the chicken breast arepa with mayo and cilantro, cheese stick and fries. All very good. Decent price and the service was outstanding. The guy at the counter was super friendly and poked fun at my wife for her attempts at spanish and when I got up to throw away my trash someone was there at the table to do it.   We will definitely be back to try other arepas.

My husband and I were in search of eating something new and interesting that we can't find back home, so we ended up at Viva Las Arepas. We ordered a Reina Pepiada, carne asada arepa, plantains, side salad, mango juiceI and parchita. I'm not exagerrating when I say that all of the food was delicious and beyond our expectations! The Reina Pepiada was creamy and tangy as well as the salad.  The plantains were hot, crispy, and perfectly sweet.  And if you have to choose what to drink I highly suggest parchita, especially if you like tangy refreshing drinks.   On top of serving fabulous food,  the cashier was very helpful, attentive, and let us try their specialty drinks.  He even went out of his way to bring our food out to our table. The price of the food was very reasonable ($26 for all of the food mentioned above). This is great if you're in Vegas and trying to stay within budget because we all know how expensive Vegas can be.  Ultimately, the food and service were deserving of the 5 stars.  We will definitely be back before the weekend is over!

It's been a while since I had good Venezuelan food. Very authentic food and the atmosphere, while very simple, reminds one of what you would experience in Venezuela. This is not a fancy restaurant but if you want some great authentic venezuelan food, you should give it a try. !Bien sabroso! --Terrible(Terry)

At the recommendation of Yelp Talkers, I went here for lunch and was pleasantly surprised.  (NOTE TO YELP, please fix the address.)   I ordered some arepas, empanadas, and other goodies to sample with the office and took them back with me.  I loved the coating on the techenos (cheese sticks) and the empanadas.  The Arepas were overstuffed and packed with flavor.  Not a complaint but be aware the Arepas (corn pita) sometimes breaks apart and crumbles so dont try to eat in your car or on the run unless you are wearing something that can get dirty.  Also be aware that the menu on the website is not the same as when you get there so don't plan your order by number and call it in.  Mysty is right, the mango drink is superb and not to sweet.  The staff is friendly and Felix talks to everyone.  When it is busy, it isn't fast so be aware. It took me about 20 minutes to get my order.  I love me some Arepas

My heart sank down as it dawned on me that you are 6 hours away.. I miss you. You fry your plantains to perfection and I want more. For breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Your Reina Pepiada (chicken/mayo/avocado/and that cilantro dressing - add their house-made salsa on top) was heartwarming. The vegetarian arepa was just as delicious.. I freakin' ate it for breakfast with your house made cappuccino for Pete's sake. Even the bean and cheese empanada was amazing!   Okay, seriously though - from chatting with the guys that worked the late shift on Saturday I found out that this was a small food truck that proved its cute self to be delicious. Since it was that fantastic they were able to move into a place at the end of a little strip mall on the old Las Vegas strip... What more do you need? I will be back for you Viva Las Arepas, don't miss your Utahn fan too much ;)

The Arepas here are to die for. I've tried 3 different ones so far and all have been excellent. The mango juice is good too! If you are in Vegas and don't stop here for at least one meal, you are truly missing out.
i want to make sweet love to the cachapa con queso...  i want to lay on a bed between an arepa and a cachapa...

The cachapas were delicious. Great taste and the cheesse was really good. The Reina Pepiada was not my favorite because the chicken was grilled and tasted too much like grilled chicken and not like Reina Pepiada.

This was my first time trying Venezuelan food and my was it delicious! The service was great as the friendly guy behind the counter patiently explained the menu and its items to us. He mentioned that all the meat is wood fired so the meat has a mesquite tast to it. Arepa is a ground maize flatbread sandwich. I saw it as a tamale sandwich. My bf and I had the Reina Peplada #7 which consists of chicken breast, avocado, and cilantro. I added some of the creamy cilantro sauce and it was definitely a party in my mouth. It's a cold sandwich so it tasted great while we waited for my hot arepas to cool down. I ordered the Perico #11 which has scrambled eggs, tomato, onion, and ham.. cuz breakfast is good any time of the day!  We also tried the shredded beef empanada and coconut and cheese pastelito. The pastelito was pretty sweet and it was a lot better than I expected. We were pretty full after sharing these four items. I also had a mango juice to help wash down all the delicious goodness. A good part of all this food is that it's gluten free, fresh, and handmade to order.   The next time I decide to shop at the North Outlets I'm definitely going to come back here for more arepas!

What an absolutely fantastic place.  Yelp reviewers were correct.  This is a 4 1/2 rated place.    The meats are just perfect.  And the pastelitos are the best.    We will eat here again.   The prices were fantastic for Vegas!!!  It's at the south end of the shopping center.  Past it many times on other trips.  My mistake!!!

Passed this place several times in the strip area. Though I found it very interest for a Venezuelan food place. In my option this place is really tasty just wasn't feeling it too much. I give this place 7 out of 10.

Hubby and I stopped by one lazy Sunday night, our last night in town.  We were both still full from a late lunch so we ended up only ordering 1 arepas, the flame grilled beef, and a cachapas.    We took it back to our hotel room and chowed down.  The cachapas definitely would have been a lot better hot.  But then again...it was only a 10 minute drive back to our hotel - how quickly should I have to eat this thing to capitalize on maximum deliciousness?  I love how corn-y it tasted but with the hardened cheese in between, it became somewhat less palatable.  Also, it's sweet so prepare your mouth for that taste profile.  Hubby ordered the flame grilled beef arepa.  On first bite, I wasn't convinced it was better than our usual spot out here.  But when he gave up on it, I took the 1/3 he had left and nibbled.  I have to say the sauces and veggies inside were surprisingly good.  The arepas are definitely a good size and one will probably fill you up pretty well.  I'm glad we got to try it, at least.  The guy who took our order was very nice and gave us the delicious sauces which tasted better with the arepa than the cachapa.

Husband and I went here for the first time. The food was really authentic and delicious. The prices were reasonably low; and the place and bathroom were clean. The only downfall is the area in which it is located due to safety concerns. But overall, I will return for the food.

Last night, my hubby, 14 month old and some friends decided to try this place because we'd driven by it before. I'm glad to say the Arepas were amazing!!! Number 12 was fantastic! The guava and cheese pastelito was delicious! The mango drink was sooooooooooooo good! Number 13 was also amazing! We all were completely satisfied with our meal, including my 14 month old baby that ate a bit of everything! We'll definitely be back!!!!

So freakin good and delicious. I really like the sweet #13 and the #4 and #7 are my go to meat choices. The service is fast and friendly, and eating here will totally make your day. The taste is super authentic, and one of the big reasons I love this place so much is the amazing sugarcane juice and the plantains for dessert.

The arepas are great! Mango fruit drink quenched my thirst. And wasn't too sweet. I tried the pabellon and reina pepiada arepa. Very tasty and filling! Was a small walk from my hotel-SLS. Would definitely recommend to visitors.
Amazing food, great prices, very clean inside. The empenadas are the best!!! The arepas are super good too!

Blegh. My pork arepa was drenched in oil. That usually wouldn't turn me off, but the arepa was completely flavorless. I had to drown it in "spicy" salsa that was more mild than vanilla pudding. Never again.

Never had a arepa before until I tried this place..  And they are so good!!  To someone that doesn't know arepas imagine the masa for a sope/ pupusa and slice in half and stuffed with goodness.  And those yuca fries with fried pork!!  I'll be back!

Had a pupusa, a tamale, and tacos while in Vegas - - but the absolute joy was the #12 Pabellón Arepa here,  with beef, black beans, plantains & cheese.  $7 seems a lot for what is hardly more than a handful, but what makes it great, and still a real value,  is how concentrated, rich, and satisfying that handful is.    The arepa crust has a perfect crunch and rich corn flavor - - but it is not a starch bomb - - it is a svelte, light, super tasty vehicle for some outrageous goodness inside.  The full, complex, combination of earthy beans, toothy shredded beef, and a touch of sweet plaintain, accented by the crumbly cheese is massively satisfying.   Fantastic balance of flavors, textures, and fine, fine ingredients, deftly assembled.  Most 'sandwich' places give you a big glob of starch with some scant tasty ingredients buried within;  some taco places actually give you precious little food;  but this arepa is a full-on powerhouse of ingredient excellence, in a light and delicious frame.

Loved it!  Finally a food stand I can get behind!  This place is the real deal.  They cook the masa batter on a little flat top to order and fill 'em with your choice of meats and stuff.    Screw all of those hipster food trucks that are more about the twitter feed and the graphics on the truck than the food (yeah, you, sloppi jo's.  greasy, runny pork with no depth of flavor with an egg on top and an untoasted, stale, store-bought tortilla on the side?  no thank you).  Hey look at us!  We're a bunch of goofy 20 year olds who know nothing about food but check out our cool truck and tattoos and goofy dances and overpriced junkfood served in a parking lot!  To me the idea behind a truck is good, cheap food that's convenient.  If you have to DRIVE to the truck, then what's the point.  The truck should be where you are.  YOU shouldn't have to go to IT.    But I digress...  The masa pancake bread thing is crispy on the outside and creamy on the inside.  They split em and fill em with any of a dozen or so goodies, including tongue and tripe.  The fillings were yummy without exception.  I got a bean and cheese, a pork, and a beef.  All were delish.  Served with a chili sour cream sauce and a pureed hot sauce.  Also tried an empanada as well.  It was odd but good.  Very little filling in the deep-fried empanada and the masa shell blew up like a balloon from the steam created inside while in the fryer which actually made for a pillow-like chickeny pocket of love.  Bonus points for its location out front of Dino's, a great dive bar on LV Blvd.  Conveniently located right underneath a billboard for a bailbondsman, across the street from the OG.  Hit it.

I hate to drop my rating, but I seriously believe that once Viva Las Arepas moved to their permanent location, they should have had another listing put up. Why? They don't offer the same items!  I was talking to my sister about this, a place hooks you on certain items for a great price, blows up in popularity and then and goes and changes everything that made you love them in the first place, while upping the price.  I've been eating here for 3 years. I'm the one who gave the business owner a "You've been Yelped card" to claim their business page and I think they make a good product. What I hate is that they don't offer lengua or tripe anymore. Those two items are the only reason I ate here and it's the only reason I keep coming back - on the maybe misguided hope that they've brought those two dishes back.  Alas, I've been relegated to chicken or beef, which I'm none too impressed with. I can get chicken and beef anywhere. I can make them at home (which I've done - if you buy Maseca, you can make arepas.) Lengua and tripe aren't things I know how to cook for 1 person.   I've had their other dishes which are okay, and they have really great sauces, but I don't feel the need to keep coming back as they don't offer what I like anymore.

This is a yummy food stand  i had a shrimp and a chicken arepa and bf had pork and a beef one. It is basically a fried corn cake with the filling of your choice, yum the salsa is spicy the shrimp was done well and the chicken is juicy. The black bean empinada was dry and tasteless and kinda soggy. The shrimp arepa was supposed be cold but the one i had was warm and i don't think i would want it cold. It was 22$ for 4 Arepas and an empinada and Two drinks.

Amazing food here! We had the wood fire beef arepa and chicken empanada. I ordered a wood fire grill plate with a side of salad and plantains. SO DELICIOUS. We came for lunch and will probably be back for dinner!! Passion fruit agua fresca was also yummy!

1 - 5 scale Food 4 Service 4  Location 3 but clean and friendly  Get the wings! The ham an cheese was really good and the fries were huge.   I can't wait to try the roasted chicken after I noticed wood for the oven they have hidden in the back.   This is a great place if you need to experience new flavors and take in a little culture.

I have no idea why, but lately I've been obsessed with arepas. If I see it on a menu, I'm going to try it out. So when this place popped up on Yelp while we were in Vegas, I knew we were gonna make a stop here, even if it meant venturing off the strip!  Located downtown, we stopped by on our way home from Vegas, around noon on a Sunday. Just a small place, but when we got there, line was to the door.  I had planned to try a couple arepas thinking they would be small enough for me to try more than one. But their arepas are a decent size. So I got one and tried the Reina Pepiada - chicken mixed with mayo, avocado, and cilantro - their take on chicken salad I would think. It was good but after awhile, the mayo just overpowered the arepa. It seemed like there was too much filling for the arepa - which some will say is a good thing. But I really liked the arepa - crunchy crust on the outside, fluffy on the inside. So it would've been nice to have a balance of filling and arepa with every bite.   Got an order of plantains which was really good. Tried the beef and chicken empanadas, but I was not a fan.   Still... I can't wait to go back to Vegas and stop by to try a different arepa... or two!

Cost: $11  Finally decided to give the most reviewed place on Yelp in the neighbourhood a try.  Wasn't disappointed.  The Arepa was delicious (but only after adding the spicy sauce).  The empanada was a bit too thickly coated in flour for my taste, so I'd say it was okay.   Definitely recommended.
Love the arepas, only wish their sides were better. Rice and beans are a bit bland.
Great value for money and service. All their arepas are good but need a generous dashing off their house sauces to bring the flavors out. Definitely worth a visit.
¡Conchale vale! Tony y Pedro se sobraron con la comida y el servicio. Los tequeños son para chuparse los dedos. Vengo de Los Ángeles y son lo mejor. Recomendado

I've been there last week for the first time, I came just because they have nice reviews and I wanted to try something different. Unfortunately I didn't like it, it doesn't speak to my taste buds. Also, it was very annoying to order because the guy at the cashier wasn't speaking English, so it was hard to explain what I want. Anyway, for me, I wouldn't go there again but I can see other people like this place and I understand not everyone has the same taste, so if you're not sure, go there an try for yourself.

It's good...for what it is. I had the number 1, the number 7 and the Hallacas, (spelling)? The Hallacas (sp) was delicious, I'm not a fan of raisins and olives so that was my only complaint about it and that it came pre-made so I couldn't get them removed. However, despite my distaste for raisins and olives, it still came out pretty good. The breading they used for the Arepas though was outstanding, I actually could not get enough of that which is why I loved the #1 but also the #7. The #7 was a little more creamier than I thought but the breading had me finish the whole thing. The only real negative about the place as other people have mentioned is that if you go during the summer be prepared to sweat while you eat or at least wait for your food to be finished. However, it's a trade off since melting like Frosty the Snowman will always be tolerable if I can watch a priest, stripper, crackhead, retirees, and a man dressed as Catwoman walk by. (Yes, I typed that correctly, a man dressed as Catwoman, entertaining to say the least) This corner never fails to disappoint.

The arepas here are the best. Try the beef with plantains, chicken with guacamole or pork with cheese.  The corn meal bread is delicious.  This place has a full menu and the chicken and beef dishes are all good.  Fantastic empanadas!   If you're going to the OG have some of this Venezuelan food to soak up the beer.  Nice alternative to Boston Pizza in this neighborhood.  And if you park in the parking lot on the Strip nearby it's safe at night.
Sooooo good. My husband got the pork butt arepa and I got the pabellon and they were delicious. I can't wait to go again when we visit Vegas :)

I was trying to think of a dumb arepa joke and didn't have much success.   Knock, knock.  Who's there? Arepa.  Arepa who?  Arepa any man who brings me delicious venezuelan sammiches.  Womp womp womp.   I told you it was going to be dumb.   Went on Saturday 11-7-15 around 8pm to grab a quick bite.  $10.57 got me a chicken arepa with black beans and a beef empanada.  This is actually my second time here and I really like arepas.  Being from the south and eating lots of hominy and grits, an arepa is kind of like if you made a hamburger bun out of really thick, fine-ground grits and then stuffed it with lettuce, cheese, chicken, etc.  They are really tasty.  I think next time I'll just get the beans and cheese kind because their chicken is sooooo salty.

Viva Las Arepas' sandwiches with this arepa bread is unlike any other - Damn good.   I've first been to the Las Vegas Blvd location before coming here. They cook it with a wood-fire grill but I'm not sure if the same applies to this Rainbow location - I forgot to ask - but it's still delicious.   For five bucks I got the #4, roasted pork butt and when they asked if I wanted cheese and avocado, of course I said, "yes please!". There was a good portion of meat and this sandwich will definitely hit the spot for a quick meal.   Actually, like the Vegas Blvd location, it's not that quick. That's not a terrible thing because you know it's made to order, and it's worth the wait.
One of the best meals I've ever had!  The pictures don't do the food justice.  The fact that it's so cheap and the service is so good are an added bonus!

Just discovered the pollo here!! It's fantastic. We drive all the way across town just to come here. They remember us when we come in as well. Definitely a great stop no matter what time of day or night!!
This is my culture, definitely every time I come by to Vegas I'll make this my first and last place to be! Great food with great people.

My husband and I were catching a show at the Smith Center and didn't have time for a nice sit down lunch so we decided to mix it up and try out Viva. When you walk in you are transported to another country. The interior is orange and yellow with Spanish music on the radio. The man behind the counter is cordial but definitely gets down to business. I ordered the pork butt and my husband ordered the shredded beef. We decided to share an order of fried plantains and a mango drink. We chose a booth and waited for our number to be called. They were quick and everything is served on a tray with 2 squeeze bottles of condiments on the side. The Arepas were absolutely delicious! I loved the "bun" which is more like a thick and crumbly corn tortilla. It was delicate and delicious. The meat was melt in your mouth cooked to perfection. I even stole a few bites of my husband's and it was also absolutely perfect. The fried plantains were not my favorite, definitely going for the fries next time. The mango drink was not too sweet, but the perfect way to quench your thirst on a hot Vegas day. Overall, we loved the food and the price. We will definitely be back very soon!

Funky location, but yummy food! Tried the shredded beef and the shredded pork. I really liked the pork, my partner liked the beef. Both were yummy and each came with its own special sauce. Very tasty and a super deal. I can imagine this as a perfect hangover cure too. Luckily, that wasn't my experiece of it this time. I would like to go back and try more from their menu. Easy walk from the nearest Duece bus stop - North of the Stratosphere.

All I can say is 'DAMN" delicious! Not only is the half chicken amazing, but the side salad is so tasty! Also ordered a beef empanada, which I might say is like HEAVEN in my mouth Very authentic and juicy. Service was good and the restaurant is clean, which is very important to me. YES YES YES, I WILL BE BACK!!! HIGHLY RECOMMEND

The flavors here are not out of this world. But I like eating authentic anything.   First time I went I got a pork butt arepa w avocado(6.50$)and fried plantains (3$). Both were tasty. Surprisingly filling. First "venezuelan" experience, first arepa ever.  Second time I went I ordered a carne asada arepa w cheese(5.50$) and french fries(3$). Nothing special. My carne asada was watery and the cheese was not melted . The french fries were below my standard for good/great quality. Just decent.  I would come back and get the pork butt arepa w plantains again. Its decent food. It beats fast food. Its inexpensive. And I hate eating on the Las Vegas strip for reasons I wont mention.

Horrible food. Cream was sour. Fried plantains were soaked in wells of oil. Forks and spoons were available only upon request. Tables were never cleaned. Spicy sauce tasted like fire. Hot chocolate tasted like sugar syrup. Arepas were so hard that my mouth hurt. Overall, disappointed .

It's always a pleasure to find little treats like these off the main strip.   Although it's located in an area where you can tell the taxpayers money doesn't get used the business is very clean and the interior was designed on a fairly decent budget.   I phone ordered hoping to save time, which saved me some. No phone pick up system is in place so I still had to wait in a line that forced my food to lose some warmth.   Service  Friendly-ish, the man working the register had the swagger of an owner. He has answers to all your rookie arepa questions and will help you decide on what you want.   Las Arepas  Reina Pepiada: chicken breast, avocado, mayo and cilantro. The flavors are layered. The power of the chicken is smothered in the avocado which is hit with a hint of mayo and the mayo is hit with a dab of cilantro. 4.75/5  Pabellon: Beef, black beans, plantains and cheese. This was more of an obvious mixed taste rather than a subtle one.The beef and beans with the plantains with a cheesy start and finish. Good as well but not as chef d'oeuvre as the reina pepiada. 4/5  The masa: The texture and visual has a strong gordita resemblance. The taste is similar as well but cleaner, not as greasy oriented as a gordita. 4.2/5  Sides  Note: Getting fried foods to go will always take away from it's original texture so these will be rated on a +.75 curve.  Yucca Fries: Decent and made a good dip with the arepa sauce they provide for you. 3.75/5  Plantains: I've had better ones made inside my mom's kitchen. 3.25/5  Drinks  I had a Venezuelan soda "colita" that was far from special. Welches sodas are better than this. 2/5  Viva Las Arepas?  Si, viva. I loved the arepas. Tasty and something new I had not tried before and I am sure many of you have not either. You've got to try this place out when you're in Vegas. The prices are fair for those that aren't hoping to get by on MGM all day buffet passes. Just make sure to avoid the Venezuelan soda and go with their "aguas frescas."

*Thumbs up* I've tried my fair share of arepas from various places, and this place has one of the better corn meal bun. It was super airy, fluffy, and had just the right amount of flavor so that it didn't detract from the filling. I had the shredded beef arepa, and I thought it was great on its own. With one of the two sauces, especially the spicy one, it just took it up another notch  *Thumbs down* Location is away north of the Strip, so not really walkable. But if you have car and you're looking for off-Strip good eats, this place should be on your list.

Been on da fence bout this place. Really don't like location. It's in that transition area from strip to downtown. Also never having had this cuisine I was skeptical to say the least. Walked in at a great time. No line. I got what I gathered from yelp as the good and was not disappointed. That wood kissed beef if flavorful on it own but the give you sauce. I prefer hot.

Oh my I love this little place! When we ride bikes its a perfect stop for a snack. Perfect as well for when you are out drinking. I love that they have vegetarian options. I believe I have had a few different types, and i prefer the black bean and cheese stuffed empanada.   Sooo GooD! Need to try MoOAR!!

Another YELP score for me.  Had some pals in town and they wanted to do something light and different for dinner prior to heading down for the Fremont Street Experience.  I dug around a bit and came across Las Arepas.  The menu sounded great, the prices were great and the reviews were great.  With four cackling women in my car as I head north on Las Vegas Blvd I just about missed my opportunity to make an illegal u-turn into the correct parking lot.  The main sign is between a classic dive bar and a pizza joint.  Yelp indicated they were open on Sunday but the door was locked.  We walked around and then at the very last minute noticed the adjunct small structure right on the corner.  Almost like a stationary roach-coach.  As other people reviewed, the food was really great and the two young guys were super friendly.  Will post some photos later.  I would highly recommend.

First time in Las Vegas and I was pleasantly surprised to find this place. Fresh baked arepas and option to add extra toppings. Personally I went with the Reina Pepiada and a wood fire beef with extra fried egg avocado and cheese which was really good and fricking amazing. I will definitely come back again before leaving Las Vegas. Btw there is a coupon for 15 % off if you call ahead of time and show the coupon so make sure to grab one if you plan on returning.

This is out go to place when we can't decide on anything to eat! The added bonus is the gelato place next door. You can fill up on the best arepas I've ever had and head over for delicious gelato after. Incredible! The prices are relatively cheap and soooo delicious. I loooove the dessert empanadas also...I can't get enough of this place.

I actually found this place on a random fluke.  I was eating at a nearby restaurant and my constant companion remarked that he'd never eaten Venezuelan food before, so we should come back and try this place.  Since then I've been to Viva Las Arepas several times -- usually with visitors in tow.  It's one of my favorites and a nice find on the North end of the Strip.  My favorite is the chicken Arepa (with cheese, dripping in the creamy cilantro sauce).  It's my favorite because the chicken tastes of this fantastic smokey flavor I've not found elsewhere in Vegas.  I've also had their whole chicken (a favorite with my constant companion) and the meat just melts in your mouth.  Is it a healthy choice for your stay in Las Vegas?  Probably not.  However, it is likely one of the most delicious.  I once took my fabulously unadventurous younger brother here, and he and his friends absolutely loved it.  To address concerns raised by other visitors -- yes the restaurant itself is not in a particularly glitzy part of town; however, it is in an area that is in the process of being revitalized.  The restaurant is clean and well kept, and I've never had any problems in the neighborhood.  The food is worth it!  I have plans to go back in the near future.

This is one of my favorite places to eat. The pork spare ribs are simply amazing. The empanadas are what drew me in initially... and they are crazy good as well. Definitely a place worth the drive into downtown.

I must say!! They have not missed a beat!! Place is very clean the bathroom is very clean! The staff is extremely nice!! I love the location I love the corner I love the patio. There is no reason why anyone shouldn't stop by and try this place out!! Food tasted great!! The price is spot on!!

um, this place doesn't even need my review. i don't know why i'm bothering. probably because it's THAT DAMN GOOD.  there was one week i went 4 times. i think i ordered the cachapas every time. the pericos are good, too. the dude who works the counter and i are pals now. i got a cheese empanada today, and i don't want to get too graphic here, but maaaan... i will definitely be cheating on the cachapas with the empanada in my dreams tonight...  i wish this place wasn't a 3-4 minute bicycle ride from my house. but at least i get a little bit of exercise before i clog my arteries? ;)  THANK YOU FOR EXISTING!  many hearts from your #1 fan, Maegan

This place is A-ok. Their arepas are not the best I have had all around but it's pretty good.  I must say that I had trouble finding this place! They had recently moved across the street from their previous location, which is now a hot dog stand, when I first visited. I had to call and ask them where their new location is.  When we got there we ordered all the popular items listed on yelp. The food was decent but not amazing.  Their service is great though. So for that I give them 3 stars. My experience wasn't bad nor has it been amazing that I would want to go back for more.  If you've never had arepas, this is a perfect place to try them out!

Great find. We went to the more expensive restaurants and buffet's ($70 p/person!), and this restaurant was the only one we made a return visit.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  The Reina Pepiada arepa is awesome, as is the green sauce they bring to the table.  If you want an arepa, just be sure to specify "arepa" because some of the entrees have the same name.
La mejor comida Venezolana en Las Vegas!!!!! Volvere manaña porque no pude probar todo el menú. La arepa de mechada es alucinante, lo mismo las empanadas y el tequeño.
This place is Arepa's heaven!! Everything was so delicious that can't even explain. Perfect flavors, the cilantro salsa a must try. We definitely will be back.

I pulled some seriously dangerous driving maneuvers when I saw this little stand on the corner in Vegas.  Arepas outside of South America?  + from a little building that is just barely bigger than a hot dog cart? I'm in.  First off, I LOVE arepas. I go to South America a lot, + arepas are these little fried corn patties stuffed with all kinds of things, usually deep fried + heaven at 3am after a night of dancing that they sell on the streets of Colombia and Venezuela. They're like the drunk-munchies equivalent of seasoned curly fries here in the U.S.  The guy working there was also the owner, + he could not have been sweeter. This was my boyfriend's first arepa experience, + the owner asked him questions + made suggestions for what he might enjoy. We ordered our arepas, + he threw in a free empanada because my boyfriend had never tried one of those either.  The arepas here aren't the same greasy deep-fried ones I'm used to, but they are SUPER delicious.  the corn casings are really fresh, + the ingredients are fresh, warm, + delicious. He serves his food with sides of jalapeno and cilantro sauce to give them an extra kick if you like heat on your food.  There's also a big assortment of tropical juice that's really fresh + inexpensive (plus, refills are only $.99: such a bargain!).  It's always nice to see owners taking pride in their work, + the owner came out to deliver our food himself, + stayed to chat with us while we ate.  Really pleasant experience, + a nice cap to a weekend in The Vegas.

One star for service only.... Although arepas are always delicious here I must say my order was a huge disappointment.   After spending $40 on an large order for my family, the cashier guy taking our order clearly was not paying attention nor was he an  engaged employee- no attention to detail here. He appeared very distracted, (I should have known as this would be been my first clue our order was going to be completely wrong just by the way he was taking our order; he never made good eye contact (direct eye contact assures confidence vs. Looking over our heads or to the left or the right but not at us) instead he was looking at the TV & I couldn't believe he was actually watching it during & while I was ordering, *he handed the tv controls to somebody during order taking which also showed his mind was someplace else. Overall he messed up and one of the major mistakes he made didn't include a $4 sauce he said "ok" to at the time I ordered.   (At some point this error was rectified by management who gave us a complimentary sauce due to his employees lack of attention/error) but what is really making me upset enough to write this review was after all was said and done and my family got home to start eating arepas, our order was flipping WRONG!!  Ugghh! So frustrated & disappointed because I knew- I actually knew this guy was gonna mess this order up in which he did!!  Please re- train your cashier for better customer service skills, include the part where you must pay attention to what your customer is ordering, maby go a little further to repeat order back to the customer especially when its a large one, (This guy had black hair, glasses, tattoos, so if he takes your order make sure you ask him if he got it correct) Then maby you wouldn't receive a negative review from an upset patron....   P.S. due to the way Arepas were wrapped, it would have been difficult to unwrap & open each one to check the filling inside each arepa for correcting.
